en: Leader’s Office Urges Iranians to Aid People of Somalia - Khamenei.ir  Following the drought crisis and famine in the Horn of Africa, particularly in Somalia, the Leader's office issued a statement calling on all Iranians to aid the famine-stricken people of Somalia.
hau: Sakamakon tsanantan yanayin fari da kuma bayyanar bala'in yunwa a yankin kusurwar Afirka musamman a kasar Somaliya, ofishin Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci (Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei) ya fitar da wata sanarwa inda ya bukaci dukkanin al'ummar Iran a cikin wannan wata na rahama da albarkoki (watan Ramalana) da su taimaka wa ‘yan'uwansu musulmi na kasar Somaliyan da suke cikin mawuyacin hali.
mt0: <pad> Because of the worsening famine and the emergence of famine in the south of Africa, the office of the Leader of the Islamic Revolution (Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei) issued a statement asking all Iranians to help their Somali Muslim brothers who are in difficulty.</s>

en: The full text of the statement is as follows:
hau: Ga fassarar abin da sanarwar ta kumsa:
mt0: <pad> The announcement was made in the English language.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: These days the Horn of Africa and particularly tragedy-hit Somalia are witness to one of the most painful human crises in which drought and famine are threatening the lives of millions of Muslim people of Somalia, especially women and children, in the silence and indifference of international organizations.
hau: A cikin wadannan ranaku yankin kusurwar Afirka musamman kasar Somaliya da take cikin mawuyacin hali yana fuskantar mafi munin bala'in fari da yunwa mai sosa rai sakamakon bayyanar fari a yankin da kin tabuka wani abin a zo a gani da cibiyoyin kasa da kasa suka yi (wajen magance matsalar), hakan ya sanya rayukan miliyoyin musulman kasar Somaliya musamman mata da kananan yara cikin gagarumin hatsari da kuma fuskantar barazana.
mt0: <pad> In these days the Horn of Africa, especially Somalia, is facing the worst famine and starvation crisis in its history, as the region has been hit by the severe famine and the international community has not done anything to address the problem, which has put the lives of millions of Somali Muslims, especially women and children, in great danger and at risk.</s>

en: For this purpose and considering the Leader's special attention to helping the famine-stricken people of Somalia, the philanthropic and Muslim people of Iran are hereby invited to rush to the aid of the Muslim people of Somalia in this month of mercy and blessing and to send their monetary and non-monetary aid to the people of Somalia through the organizations in charge.
hau: A saboda haka sannan kuma sakamakon irin kulawa ta musamman da Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci ya ke bai wa lamarin taimakon mutanen da bala'in yunwa ta fadawa a kasar Somaliyan, ana kiran al'ummar musulmin Iran da su taimakawa al'ummar musulmin kasar Somaliya a cikin wannan wata na rahama da albarkoki sannan kuma suna iya isar da taimakon su na kudi da kayayyaki ga cibiyoyin da abin ya shafa don isar da su ga al'ummar Somaliyan.
mt0: <pad> For this reason and because of the special attention that the Leader of the Islamic Revolution gives to helping the people of Somalia affected by the famine, the Muslims of Iran are being urged to help the Somali Muslims in this month of blessings and grace and can send their aid of money and goods to the relevant organizations to be delivered to the Somali people.</s>

en: Leader’s Message on the Occasion of 20th National Conference on Prayers - Khamenei.ir
hau: A cikin wani sako da ya aike wa taron tsai da salla karo na ashirin, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei ya jaddada cewar Wajibi ne masallaci ya zamanto wani tushe na gine-gine a garuruwa da kauyuka da wajajen taron jama'a. Jagoran ya ci gaba da cewa: Matukar dai masallaci ya sami irin yanayin da ya dace, to kuwa nauyi mai yawa na abin duniya da kuma addini da ke wuyan al'umma, mutane da kuma jami'ai zai ragu.
mt0: <pad> In a message sent to the 20th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei stressed that mosques should be a basis for building in towns and villages and public places. He added: If mosques have the right conditions, then a great deal of the burden of worldly and religious things on the people, people and society will be reduced.</s>

en: The following is the full text of message.
hau: Abin da ke biye fassarar wannan sako na Jagoran ne:
mt0: <pad> The following is the translation of this message of the Leader.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: By their nature human beings, require and are eager to worship God and to show humility before Him, God who is the Creator of all goodness and beauties. And prayer fulfills this need.
hau: Dan'adam dai a dabi'arsa, (halitta ce) mai kauna da kuma bukatar addu'a da kuma kankan da kai a gaban Allah Madaukakin Sarki Wanda Shi ne Mahaliccin dukkanin abubuwa masu kyau; ita kuwa salla ita ce mai samarwa da kuma biyan wannan bukatar.
mt0: <pad> Humans are by nature inclined to and needy to pray and bow down to God the Most High, who is the Creator of all good things; and the prayer is the one that provides and fulfills this need.</s>

en: By making prayers obligatory, divine religions quench the thirst of human nature and save it from confusion and misguidance concerning the quenching of this thirst.
hau: Addinan Ubangiji, ta hanyar shar'anta salla, sun shayar da kishirwar da dan'adam yake fama da ita ne da kuma tseratar da shi daga gagarumar damuwa da kuma batar dake tattare da wannan kishirwa ta dabi'a.
mt0: <pad> The prophets of God, by prescribing the prayer, have suppressed the natural hunger of mankind and saved him from the greatest suffering and loss that comes with this natural hunger.</s>

en: Repeating prayers every day and night is an opportunity and a blessing which saves human beings from drowning in lack of vigilance. It gives human beings the opportunity to have a conscious presence of the heart before God.
hau: Nanata yin salla dare da rana, wata dama da kuma ni'ima ce da take ‘yantar da dan'adam daga fadawa cikin wannan tarko na gafala; da ba shi damar gabatowa da zuciyarsa cikin masaniya a gaban Allah; da goge masa ransa ta yadda badininsa zai yi haske.
mt0: <pad> However, praying night and day is a blessing and opportunity that frees the man from this trap of ignorance; it gives him the chance to approach God with his heart in full knowledge; it cleanses his soul so that his inner light will be illuminated.</s>

en: When divine remembrance, prayers and worship combine with the fabric of social life, they reveal the miracle of Islam in the constellation of divine commands.
hau: A yayin da zikiri da salla da addu'a suka hadu da tsari na rayuwa ta zamantakewa, to kuwa mu'ujizar Musulunci ya kan iya bayyana cikin hukumce-hukumcensa na ibada.
mt0: <pad> When zikir, salat and du'a are related to the social order, then the miracle of Islam can be seen in its rules of worship.</s>

en: The mosque is a manifestation of this combination.
hau: Masallaci dai wata alama ce da ke nuni da wannan haduwar.
mt0: <pad> The mosque is a symbol of this meeting.</s>

en: Congregational prayers in the mosque with other believers, is taking part in a divine celebration and this makes the rain of divine mercy heavier and more pleasing.
hau: Salla a masallaci sannan kuma cikin muminai, tamkar zama ne a taburmar bakunci ta Ubangiji, hakan kuma wani lamari ne da ke kara saukar da ruwan rahamar Ubangiji da yawa sannan kuma mai kwantar da hankali.
mt0: <pad> Serving in the mosque and among the believers is like being in the throne room of God, which is a thing that brings down many drops of God's blessing and is very comforting.</s>

en: The blessedness of prayers imbues and enlightens the atmosphere of mosques. And speaking righteous words and teaching religion, ethics and politics in that atmosphere pleases one's heart and soul more than any other atmosphere and it gives a divine orientation to the life of the individual and society.
hau: Albarkacin salla, yanayin masallaci ya kan kara haske da kuma kamshi, sannan kuma fadin gaskiya da koyar da addini da kyawawan halaye da lamurran da suka shafi siyasa su kan sami gindin zama cikin zuciya da kuma rai sama da kowane waje, sannan da kuma ba wa rayuwa ta daidaiku da kuma ta jama'a mahanga irin ta Ubangiji.
mt0: <pad> Thanks to the prayer, the atmosphere of the mosque will be brighter and more pleasant, and the truth and the teaching of religion and good morals and political issues will penetrate the heart and soul deeper than any other place, and give the individual and the community a view of God's life.</s>

en: This is how the mosque should be viewed.
hau: Da irin wannan mahangar ce ya kamata a dinga kallon masallaci.
mt0: <pad> This is the way we should look at mosques.</s>

en: The spirit of the mosque instills dynamism and motivation into the body of life.
hau: Ruhin masallaci yana kara wa tushen rayuwa nishadi da kuma karfin gwuiwa.
mt0: <pad> The spirit of the mosque adds to the core of life joy and strength.</s>

en: Wherever there is organized life, the mosque is the main center.
hau: A duk inda aka sami cibiyar rayuwa, to kuwa masallaci shi ne tushe na asali na hakan.
mt0: <pad> Wherever you find the center of life, the mosque is the original and fundamental basis of that.</s>

en: In the structure of cities and villages, in schools and universities and in other places - from marketplaces to airports, roads, terminals, nursing homes, hospitals, parks and holiday resorts - the mosque should be the pole and the pivot.
hau: Wajibi ne masallaci ya zamanto tushe na gine-gine a garuruwa da kauyuka, a makarantu da jami'oi, a wajajen taruwar al'umma kama daga kasuwanni da wajajen aiki har zuwa ga filayen jiragen sama da manyan hanyoyi da wajajen yada zango, har zuwa ga wajajen shakatawa da asibitoci, a dukkanin wajajen da ake da su.
mt0: <pad> The mosque should be the basis of construction in towns and villages, in schools and universities, in public gatherings from markets and workplaces to airports and major roads and parklands, to restrooms and hospitals, in all available spaces.</s>

en: Everywhere the mosque should be clean, beautiful and calming.
hau: Wajibi ne masallaci a ko ina yake ya zamanto mai tsafta, kyau da kuma kwantar da hankali.
mt0: <pad> Each mosque should be clean, beautiful and peaceful.</s>

en: The material and spiritual management of the mosque, which is shouldered by the clergy in charge of the mosque, should be wise, responsible and even affectionate.
hau: Wajibi ne jagorancin yadda ake gudanar da masallaci wanda yake wuyan malami (limamin) masallacin ya zamanto cikin hikima da jin yanayi na sauke nauyi haka nan kuma cikin so da kauna.
mt0: <pad> The responsibility of the management of the mosque is on the imam (the leader) of the mosque. It should be with wisdom and understanding, as well as in love and affection.</s>

en: If the mosque achieves the quality it deserves, a lot of material and spiritual burdens will be removed from the shoulders of society, the people and government officials.
hau: Matukar dai masallaci ya sami irin yanayin da ya dace, to kuwa nauyi mai yawa na abin duniya da kuma addini da ke wuyan al'umma, mutane da kuma jami'ai zai ragu.
mt0: <pad> When the mosque is in the proper condition, the burden of worldly and religious that weighs on the people, individuals and societies will be reduced.</s>

en: In the hope of reaching that day and greetings be upon the one remaining with Allah on earth (may our souls be sacrificed for his sake)
hau: Muna fatan ganin wannan ranar, sannan kuma da sallamar mu zuwa ga mai girma Bakiyatullah (Imam Mahdi) rayukanmu su zamanto fansa a gare shi.
mt0: <pad> We hope to see that day, and with our farewells to the great Bakiyatullah (Imam Mahdi) whose lives have become our hostages.</s>

en: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
hau: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
mt0: <pad> Sayyid Ali Khamenei</s>

en: October 11, 2011
hau: 11, Oktoba, 2011.
mt0: <pad> October 11, 2011</s>

en: Leader Meets with Lebanese Prime Minister - Khamenei.ir  His Eminence stressed that Iran will spare no effort to aid the progress and development of Lebanon.
hau: Ganawar Jagora Da Sa'ad Hariri Da ‘Yan Tawagarsa A safiyar yau litinin (29-11-2010) ne Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Khamenei ya gana da firayi ministan kasar Labanon Sa'ad Hariri tare da ‘yan tawagarsa wadanda suka kai masa ziyarar ban girma.
mt0: <pad> The Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Khamenei met with Prime Minister of Lebanon Sa'ad Hariri and his delegation on Monday morning (29-11-2010).</s>

en: The Leader of the Islamic Revolution referred to the negations conducted in Tehran and reiterated: "The ground is prepared for the strengthening of the relations between the two countries, and these relations should be further expanded, especially in trade, development and construction sectors."
hau: Har ila yau kuma yayin da yake ishara da tattaunawar da ta gudana tsakanin jami'an kasashen biyu da kuma yarjejeniyoyin da aka kulla a yayin wannan ziyarar, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci ya ce: Akwai fagage masu yawa da za a iya amfani da su wajen karfafa alakar da ke tsakanin kasashen biyu a bangarori daban-daban. A saboda haka wajibi ne a kara karfafa wannan alakar musamman ma wadanda suka shafi bangaren kasuwanci da sake gina kasa.
mt0: <pad> Also, referring to the discussions and agreements between the two countries and the visit, the Leader of the Islamic Revolution said: There are many areas that can be used to strengthen the relations between the two countries in different fields. Therefore it is necessary to strengthen these relations, especially those related to trade and reconstruction.</s>

en: Ayatollah Khamenei referred to the continuous attacks of the Zionist regime on Lebanon and added: "If it can, the Zionist regime will go beyond Beirut and even Tripoli in order to besiege Syria.
hau: Haka nan kuma yayin da yake ishara da wuce gona da iri da keta hurumin kasar Labanon da haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila take ci gaba da yi, Ayatullah Khamenei ya bayyana cewar: Idan har haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila za ta iya, tana iya keta birnin Beirut zuwa garin Tarabulus don ta killace kasar Siriya.
mt0: <pad> Ayatullah Khamenei also pointed out that Israel's illegal and invasion of Lebanon continues, saying: If Israel can, it can cross Beirut to Damascus to encircle Syria.</s>

en: But resistance is the only deterring factor against the usurping Zionist regime."
hau: To sai dai abin da kawai ya zama kafar ungulu ga haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila (wajen cimma wannan manufa da take da ita) ita ce gwagwarmaya.
mt0: <pad> But the only thing that stands in the way of Israel's illegal state (in achieving this goal) is the fight.</s>

en: His Eminence stressed that Lebanon is the only Arab country that has managed to defeat the Zionist regime and reiterated: "Resistance is the only factor that the enemies of Lebanon are unable to confront.
hau: Jagoran ya bayyana kasar Labanon a matsayin kasar Larabawa guda da ta iya samun nasara a kan haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila don haka sai ya ce: Gwagwarmaya ita ce kawai abin da makiya kasar Labanon suka gagara fuskanta.
mt0: <pad> The Leader described Lebanon as the only Arab country that could overcome Israel, and he said: "The struggle is the only thing that the enemies of Lebanon have been unable to face."</s>

en: Therefore, it is necessary to appreciate it."
hau: A saboda haka wajibi ne a fahimci irin girman da hakan take da ita.
mt0: <pad> So it is necessary to understand the magnitude of this.</s>

en: The Leader of the Islamic Revolution added: "As long as the Zionist regime exists, Lebanon will need resistance."
hau: Jagoran juyin juya halin Musuluncin ya ci gaba da cewa: Har zuwa lokacin da haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila ta ci gaba da wanzuwa to kuwa kasar Labanon tana bukatar gwagwarmaya.
mt0: <pad> The Leader of the Islamic Revolution continued: "Until the illegal state of Israel continues to exist, Lebanon will need to fight.</s>

en: Ayatollah Khamenei expressed his satisfaction with the good relationship between Saad Hariri and Sayyid Hassan Nasrallah as well as the officials of the Lebanese resistance forces. "These relationships should be strengthened more than before."
hau: Haka nan kuma Ayatullah Khamenei ya bayyana farin ciki da jin dadinsa dangane da kyakkyawar alakar da take tsakanin Sa'ad Hariri da Sayyid Hasan Nasrullah (shugaban kungiyar Hizbullah ta kasar Labanon din) da sauran jami'an kungiyar gwagwarmayar yana mai cewa: Wajibi ne a ci gaba da karfafa irin wannan alakar.
mt0: <pad> Ayatullah Khamenei also expressed his happiness and satisfaction with the good relations between Sa'ad Hariri and Sayyid Hasan Nasrullah (the leader of Hezbollah in Lebanon) and other members of the movement, saying: It is necessary to continue strengthening such ties.</s>

en: His Eminence stressed that the Islamic Republic of Iran supports the unity and independence of Lebanon. He added: "Lebanon is a multi-religious country, and the followers of different religions and sects have lived together peacefully for many years, but some people are after causing turmoil and religious conflicts.
hau: Har ila yau kuma yayin da yake jaddada cewar Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran tana goyon bayan tabbatar da hadin kai da ‘yancin kan kasar Labnon, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci ya ce: Kasar Labanon kasa ce ta mabiya mazhabobi daban-daban wanda tsawon shekara da shekaru mabiya wadannan addinai da mazhabobi suke rayuwa tare da junansu cikin kwanciyar hankali da fahimtar juna, to sai dai wadansu mutane suna son ganin an haifar da rikici da tashin hankali na mazhaba a wannan kasa wanda wajibi ne a tsaya kyam wajen fuskantar hakan.
mt0: <pad> The Leader of the Islamic Revolution also stressed that Iran supports the reunification and independence of Lebanon, adding: "Lebanon is a country of different religions and sectarian groups that have been living together for years in peace and understanding, but some people want to create a conflict and sectarian tension in this country, which we must stand firm to fight against."</s>

en: The Leader of the Islamic Revolution referred to his meeting with the former Lebanese Prime Minister the late Rafik Hariri and spoke about his efforts for the progress of Lebanon.
hau: Jagoran juyin juya halin Musuluncin dai ya yi ishara da ganawar da ya yi a shekarun baya da marigayi Rafik Hariri tsohon firayi ministan kasar Labanon, inda ya yi karin haske dangane da irin kokarin da ya yi wajen ciyar da kasar Labanon gaba.
mt0: <pad> The leader of the Islamic revolution also referenced his meeting with late Prime Minister Rafik Hariri in the past, where he explained how he tried to help Lebanon.</s>

en: In this meeting, Prime Minister Saad Hariri expressed his satisfaction over his meeting with the Leader of the Islamic Revolution and said: "We consider the Islamic Republic of Iran as a friend and brother of Lebanon. Iran has always helped the people of Lebanon during hard times."
hau: Shi ma a nasa bangaren, firayi ministan kasar Labanon din Sa'ad Hariri wanda mataimakin shugaban kasar Iran Malam Rahimi ya ke wa jagoranci ya bayyana farin cikinsa da wannan ganawar da ya yi da Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci yana mai cewa: Mu dai muna ganin Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran a matsayin abokiya kuma ‘yar'uwa ce ga kasar Labanon wacce ta kasance tare da kasar Labanon a lokacin da take cikin wahala da kuma taimaka mata.
mt0: <pad> The Lebanon Prime Minister, Sa'ad Hariri, who was accompanied by the deputy president of Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, expressed his satisfaction with the meeting with the Leader of the Islamic Revolution.</s>

en: He added that the Lebanese government wants to expand its relations with Iran in economic, political and cultural areas.
hau: Firayi ministan Labanon din ya ci gaba da cewa: Gwamnatin Labanon tana fatan ganin alakar da ke tsakanin kasashen biyun ta kara karfafa a dukkanin bangarori da suka hada da na tattalin arziki da siyasa da kuma al'adu.
mt0: <pad> The Lebanon Prime Minister continued: "The government of Lebanon hopes to strengthen the ties between the two countries in all areas, including economic, political and cultural."</s>

en: The most important goal of the Lebanese government is to preserve and strengthen national unity, movement within the framework of commonalities and resistance against invasion.
hau: Sa'ad Hariri ya ci gaba da cewa gwamnatin kasar Labanon gwamnati ce ta hadin kan kasa, yana mai cewa duk wani sabani da rarrabuwa tsakanin al'ummar Labanon lamari ne da zai amfani haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila.
mt0: <pad> Sa'ad Hariri continued that the government of Lebanon is a coalition government, and that any division or split between the people of Lebanon will serve the illegal Israel.</s>

en: An interview with Ayatollah Taskhiri, chairman of the International Forum for Proximity of Islamic Denominations, about the hajj messages issued by the Leader of the Islamic Revolution
hau: Tattaunawa da Ayatullah Taskhiri, shugaban majalisar hadin kai tsakanin mazhabobin Musulunci dangane da ma’anar sakon hajj na Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Interview with Ayatullah Taskhiri, the head of the Islamic Conference of All-Shia Faiths about the meaning of the Hajj message of the Leader of the Islamic Revolution</s>

en: After sending Iranian hajj pilgrims to Saudi Arabia after a long delay, in order to coordinate between Iran and Saudi Arabia, certain negotiations took place between the officials of the two countries.
hau: Bayan dakatarwa ta tsawon lokaci da kuma sake tura alhazan Iran zuwa kasar Saudiyya, sakamakon tattaunawa da yarjejeniyar da aka cimma tsakanin jami’an kasashen biyu, wato Iran da Saudiyya.
mt0: <pad> After a long-term suspension and repatriation of the Iranian ambassador to Saudi Arabia, after talks and an agreement reached between the two countries, Iran and Saudi Arabia, the Iranian ambassador was repatriated to Saudi Arabia.</s>

en: Ayatollah Taskhiri was a member of the Iranian delegation which was sent to Saudi Arabia to negotiate with Saudi officials.
hau: Ayatullah Taskhiri yana daga cikin tawagar Iran a wannan tattaunawa da kasar Saudiyya.
mt0: <pad> Ayatullah Taskhiri is part of the Iran delegation in this talks with Saudi Arabia.</s>

en: Every year the Leader of the Islamic Revolution issues a message to the great hajj congregation during the hajj season, which contains important points for Muslims of the world.
hau: - A kowace shekara a lokacin aikin hajji, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci ya kan aike da sako ga mahajjata wanda ya kumshi muhimman lamurran da suka shafi al’ummar musulmi na duniya.
mt0: <pad> Every year during the Hajj, the Leader of the Islamic Revolution sends a message to the pilgrims which includes important issues concerning the Muslim community and the world.</s>

en: In your opinion, what is the philosophy behind these messages?
hau: A ra’ayinka mene ne falsafar da ke cikin wannan sakon?
mt0: <pad> What is the philosophy of this message?</s>

en: There are a few points that I should mention before answering this question.
hau: Don amsa wannan tambaya, da farko dai wajibi ne a yi karin bayani kan wasu batutuwa.
mt0: <pad> To answer this question, it is necessary to clarify some points first.</s>

en: First of all, hajj â€“ which is an Islamic obligation â€“ pursues great goals.
hau: Da farko shi kansa aikin hajji wanda daya ne daga cikin ayyukan ibada na Musulunci, yana da wasu manyan manufofi da yake son cimmawa.
mt0: <pad> First of all, the Hajj itself, which is one of the major religious ceremonies of Islam, has some important objectives that it seeks to achieve.</s>

en: Based on the Holy Quran, maybe the biggest goal of hajj is the connection between the Islamic Ummah and the activities of the prophets throughout history. That is to say, according to Sura al-Baqara, it began with the creation of Adam and Eve when angels prostrated in front of them, their experiences in paradise, their banishment to earth and finally their use of their heavenly experiences, including committing sins, repenting and complete submission to divine commands.
hau: Mai yiyuwa ne mafi girman manufar da ke cikin aikin hajjin, kamar yadda muka samo hakan cikin Alkur’ani mai girma shi ne ‘alakanta al’ummar musulmi da ayyukan annabawa cikin tarihi’. Wato kamar yadda ya zo cikin Suratul Bakara – wanda mafarinsa daga halittan dan’adam da sujadar Mala’iku gare shi da irin abubuwan da (annabi) Adamu ya gani a cikin aljanna, sannan daga baya kuma da zuwansa bayan kasa da kuma amfani da irin kwarewar da ya samu a Aljanna wanda ya hada da saba wa doka da kuma tuba da komawa ga Allah Madaukakin Sarki.
mt0: <pad> Maybe the greatest purpose of Hajj, as we found it in the holy Quran, is to connect the Muslim community with the history of the Prophets. That is, as it comes in the Suratul Baqara - which begins with the creation of Adam and the worship of the angels to him and the things that Adam saw in paradise, and then afterwards with his return to earth and using the experiences he had in paradise which included transgressions and repentance and returning to God Most High.</s>

en: In order to describe each of these stages, the Holy Quran uses the phrase â€œand whenâ€ which recount the story of all prophets until Prophet Ibrahim when God says, â€œAnd when his Lord tried Ibrahim with certain words, he fulfilled them.
hau: Alkur’ani mai girma yayi bayanin kowane guda daga cikin wadannan lokuta yana mai cewa: ‘kuma a lokacin da’ ‘kuma a lokacin da’ ‘kuma a lokacin da’, dukkanin wadannan ‘kuma a lokacin da’din suna bin diddigin tafarkin annabawa ne har zuwa lokacin da aka zo ga annabi Ibrahim a nan ne ya ce: “Kuma a lokacin da Ubangijin Ibrahim Ya jarrabe shi da wasu kalmomi, sai ya cika masa su.
mt0: <pad> And when the Lord of Abraham tested him with some words, and he fulfilled them for him.</s>

en: He said: Surely I will make you an Imam of men.
hau: Ya ce: “Lalle ne Ni, Mai sanya ka shugaba domin mutane ne.”
mt0: <pad> He said: "I am the Lord, who made me chief for the people.</s>

en: My covenant does not include the unjust, said He.â€ [The Holy Quran, 2: 124] It refers to the leadership of God's righteous servants. â€œMy covenant does not include the unjust, said He.â€ This is where the issue of hajj is mentioned: â€œAnd when We made the House a pilgrimage for men and a (place of) security, and: Appoint for yourselves a place of prayer on the standing-place of Ibrahim.â€ God brings up the issue of hajj in the middle of the story about the path of His prophets and it appears that Prophet Ibrahim is considered the one who determines the path and the goals of hajj.
hau: Ya ce: “Kuma da zuriyata”, wato yayi bayanin shugabancin salihai ne.

hau: Danyen aikin da suke aikatawa da kuma batutuwa masu muhimmanci da suke faruwa a kasashen musulmi; da suka hada da batutuwan da (makiyan) suka gurbata su da kuma kokarin da suke yi na haifar da fitina ta kabilanci da yada fasadi da kisan gilla da kuma bakar farfagandar da suke yi a kan al'ummar musulmi.
mt0: <pad> The evil work they are doing and important issues in Muslim countries; including the things they have spoiled and the efforts they are making to create sectarian divisions, propagate corruption, kill people and spread false propaganda about the Muslim community.</s>

en: All these threats â€“ which have increased after 9/11 â€“ have been mentioned by the Leader in his messages.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan barazanar wadanda suka kunno kai bayan harin 11 ga watan Satumba, jagora yana bayani kansu.
mt0: <pad> All these other threats that have arose since the September 11th attacks, the leader is aware of.</s>

en: Because the plots of the enemies to occupy the world of Islam were foiled by the Revolution and Islamic Awakening, they started to divide the Islamic Ummah and spread corruption.
hau: Don kuwa albarkacin juyin juya halin Musulunci da kuma farkawa ta Musulunci an sami damar dushe kaifin makircin ma'abota girman kan duniya na mamaye kasashen musulmi; don haka a halin yanzu makiya sun fara wani shiri na kekketa al'ummar musulmi da kuma yada fasadi.
mt0: <pad> Because thanks to the revolution and the awakening of Islam, the world's imperialists have been able to defeat the plan of conquering the Muslim countries; so now the enemies have begun a campaign to discredit the Muslim community and spread corruption.</s>

en: Therefore, in his messages the Leader of the Islamic Revolution says that the arrogant powers are an enemy of oppressed people and human rights, a supporter of terrorism and a promoter of hegemony and hypocrisy in the world of Islam. Of course disclosing the role of the mercenary regimes in the region is another important theme. These regimes try to fulfill the goals of colonialism and take away the essence of hajj: these things have also been mentioned in the messages.
hau: A saboda haka a cikin sakonnin Jagoran akan bayyana girman kan duniya a matsayin makiyan raunanan mutane, masu take hakkokin bil'adama kana kuma masu goyon bayan ta'addanci da yada munafunci da mulkin mallaka a kasashen musulmi. Tabbas daya daga cikin batutuwa masu muhimmanci shi ne tona asirin irin rawar da gwamnatoci 'yan amshin shata na yankin nan suke takawa wadanda suke kokari wajen ganin sun tabbatar da manufar 'yan mulkin mallaka haka nan kuma da kawar da aikin hajji daga asalin manufarsa ta kololuwa.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, in the message of the Leader, the world's wealthy are described as enemies of the poor, those who take human rights, and supporters of terrorism and spreading corruption and imperialism in Muslim countries. One of the most important points is to expose the role of the coalition governments of the region that are trying to ensure the imperialist agenda and to derail the Hajj from its original purpose.</s>

en: Introducing the Islamic Republic as a successful model â€“ which has stood up against the arrogant powers, implemented Islam in all aspects of life, pioneered Muslim unity, promoted solidarity between the leadership and the people and represented religious democracy and support for the oppressed â€“ is another theme in these messages. Normally, all the messages which are issued by the Leader mention one or more of these themes.
hau: Batu na karshe shi ne 'gabatar da Jamhuriyar Musulunci a matsayin abin koyi da ya samu nasara wajen fada da ma'abota girman kai na duniya' sannan kuma abin koyi na aiwatar da Musulunci cikin dukkanin rayuwa da kuma kira zuwa ga hadin kai na Musulunci, abin koyi na hadin kai tsakanin jagora da al'umma, alama ta tsarin demokradiyya na addini da kuma nuna so da kauna da kuma taimakon raunana.
mt0: <pad> The last point is 'to welcome the Islamic Republic as a model of success in fight against world imperialism' and also a model of application of Islam in all aspects of life and calling for unity of Islam, a model of unity between leader and people, a symbol of religious democracy and showing love and affection and support for the weak.</s>

en: In what ways has stressing these themes affected other countries?
hau: - Mene ne tasirin wadannan abubuwa a sauran kasashe na daban?
mt0: <pad> What is the effect of these things on other countries?</s>

en: Has it received any feedback from the prominent figures and politicians of Muslim and Arab countries?
hau: Shin yana da wani matsayi a tsakanin masana da 'yan siyasa na kasashen musulmi ko kuma na larabawa?
mt0: <pad> Is there a position among the scientists and politicians of Muslim countries or Arab countries?</s>

en: Whenever we travel to other countries and take part in different conferences, everybody mentions these points and praises these messages. We travel to around 50 countries every year and we speak to different Muslim individuals, groups and leaders, particularly political leaders and activists of different Islamic countries.
hau: A dukkanin tafiya da kuma taron kara wa juna sani da muka halarta – a kowace shekara dai mu kan kai ziyara zuwa kimanin kasashen hamsin – mu kan gana da mutane da kungiyoyi da shugabanni na Musulunci musamman shugabannin kungiyoyi na siyasa na kasashe daban-daban da 'yan gwagwarmaya – dukkanin su suna ishara da wannan batu da kuma fadin maganganu masu kyau danagne da wadannan sakonni.
mt0: <pad> In all our trips and seminars - we visit about fifty countries every year - we meet people, groups and Muslim leaders, especially the leaders of different political organizations and activists - all of them refer to this issue and speak positively about these messages.</s>

en: That is to say, in spite of our weaknesses in making these messages publicly available, they have had an invigorating effect wherever they have been published.
hau: Wato duk da irin raunin da muke da shi wajen isar da wannan sakon, to amma a duk inda aka samu damar isar da wannan sakon, ya kan yi gagarumin tasiri.
mt0: <pad> However, despite our difficulty in delivering this message, wherever we can deliver it, it will have a great impact.</s>

en: Currently, public diplomacy is being discussed in the world. That is to say, leaders of countries are addressing the people rather than governments.
hau: - A halin yanzu dai batun diplomasiyya na gaba daya ne yake gudana a duniya; wato a halin yanzu jagororin kasashe suna magana ne da al'umma.
mt0: <pad> Nowadays, there is a global diplomacy in the world; that is, nowadays leaders of countries are speaking to the people.</s>

en: Can we think of these hajj messages as one of the pillars of public diplomacy of the Islamic Republic and as a means to export the Revolution?
hau: Shin ana iya daukan wannan sako na hajji a matsayin daya daga cikin rukunan irin wannan diplomasiyya na gaba daya na Jamhuriyar Musulunci sannan kuma wata hanya ta isar da juyin juya halin Musulunci?
mt0: <pad> Can we take this Hajj message as one of the pillars of this general diplomacy of the Islamic Republic and a way to convey the Islamic revolution?</s>

en: One of the beautiful ways of exporting the message of the Revolution is through the messages which have been issued by Imam Khomeini and the Leader.
hau: Ko shakka babu; daya daga cikin hanyoyi masu kyau na isar da sakon juyi juya hali shi ne wannan sako na Imam da Jagora ga mahajjata.
mt0: <pad> No doubt; one of the best ways to convey the message of change is this message of the Imam and Leader to the pilgrims.</s>

en: Issuing these messages is one way of invigorating the hajj congregation, responding to the efforts to take away the essence of hajj and highlighting the role of hajj in the life of Muslims. And I believe these messages have had their effects although â€“ as I said â€“ we have not made enough efforts to make them available to everybody.
hau: Daya daga cikin hanyoyin karfafa taron hajj da kuma mayar da martani ga kokarin da ake yi na kawar da irin matsayin da hajjin ya ke da shi da kuma irin rawar da ya ke takawa cikin rayuwar musulmi, shi ne da wadannan sakonni wanda a ra'ayina yana da tasirin gaske a tattare da shi. Duk kuwa da cewa kamar yadda na fadi muna da gazawa wajen isar da shi.
mt0: <pad> One of the ways to strengthen Hajj and respond to attempts to devalue Hajj's status and role in Muslim life is with these messages, which I think are very important, even though as I said we have a difficulty in delivering it.</s>

en: The problem is that many hajj pilgrims travel a long distance and take a lot of trouble, but they fail to understand the message of hajj.
hau: Gazawar ita ce cewa da dama daga cikin alhazai suna zuwa daga wajaje masu nisa, suna shan wahala masu yawa to amma ba sa iya fahimtar sakon da ke cikin hajji.
mt0: <pad> The problem is that many pilgrims come from very far away places, suffer great difficulties but fail to understand the meaning of Hajj.</s>

en: According to Islamic narrations, â€œThe light of hajj does not dim on the pilgrims unless they sin.â€ That is to say, hajj pilgrims return with the light of hajj and this light shows itself both in their human nature and their activities in society until they commit a sin, which gradually destroys the light.
hau: Muna da wata riwaya da take cewa: "Hasken aiki hajji zai ci gaba da kasancewa tare da alhaji matukar bai aikata zunubi ba', wato alhaji zai dawo ne da hasken da ke tattare da aikin hajji, sannan kuma wannan hasken zai ci gaba da zama tare da shi da kuma bayyana cikin ayyuka da al'ummarsa har zuwa lokacin da abin Allah ya kiyaye ya aikata zunubi, to a lokacin kan a hankali a hankali haske zai ci gaba da gushewa.
mt0: <pad> We have a Hadith that says: "The light of Hajj will continue to be with the pilgrim until he commits sin," meaning the pilgrim will return with the light of Hajj, and this light will continue to be with him and appear in his deeds and community until the pilgrim commits sin, then the light will gradually begin to dissipate.</s>

en: I hope hajj pilgrims will make efforts to receive the light of hajj and to preserve the message of hajj so that hajj can have its effect on educating the Islamic Ummah.
hau: Muna fatan alhazai za su yi kokari wajen samun wannan haske na hajji da kuma kokari wajen kiyaye sakon da ke tattare da hajji don aikin hajji ya sami damar taka rawar da yake da shi wajen tarbiyyar al'ummar musulmi.
mt0: <pad> We hope the haji will try to get this light of Hajj and try to keep the message of Hajj so that Hajj can play its role in educating the Muslim community.</s>

en: Leader’s Speech to Shia and Sunni Clergy in Kermanshah - Khamenei.ir
hau: Jawabin Jagora Yayin Ganawa Da Malaman Shi'a Da Ahlussunna Na Kermanshah
mt0: <pad> Answer of the President during a meeting with Shi'a and Ahlussunna scholars in Kermanshah</s>

en: The following is the full text of the speech delivered on October 12, 2011 by Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of the Islamic Revolution in a meeting with Shia and Sunni clergy in the city of Kermanshah.
hau: Shimfida: A ranar farko ta ziyarar da ya ke yi a lardin Kermanshah, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci ya gana da malaman Shi'a da Ahlussunna na lardin Kermanshah a ranar 12, Oktoban 2011. Abin da ke biye fassarar jawabin da Jagoran ya yi musu ne:
mt0: <pad> Summary: On the first day of his visit to Kermanshah, the Leader of the Islamic Revolution met with Shia and Ahlussunna scholars of the Kermanshah province on October 12, 2011. The following is a translation of the Leader's response to them.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds, and peace and greetings be upon our Master and Prophet, Ab-al-Qassem Muhammad, and upon his immaculate household and chosen companions, especially the one remaining with Allah on earth.
hau: Dukkan godiya ta tabbata ga Allah Ubangijin talikai.
mt0: <pad> All glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Universes.</s>

en: All-Wise Allah says in His Book: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Allah Madaukakin Sarki yana fadin cewa: "Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai.
mt0: <pad> Allah says: "In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful.</s>

en: Those who deliver the messages of Allah and fear Him, and do not fear anyone but Allah, and Allah is sufficient to take account. [The Holy Quran, 33: 39]
hau: Wadanda ke iyar da manzancin Allah, kuma suna tsoronSa, kuma ba su tsoron kowa face Allah. Kuma Allah Ya isa Ya zama Mai hisabi" (Suratul Ahzab 33:39).
mt0: <pad> They are those who fear Allah and do not fear anyone except Him. And Allah is the One Who will be responsible for everything."</s>

en: For me, one of the enjoyable and pleasant meetings during my trips is the meetings that I arrange with our honorable scholars and luminaries - who are rendering services in different provinces across the country - and young seminarians who are like saplings and buds in the area of religious education.
hau: A wajena daya daga cikin ganawa mai dadi da faranta rai ita ce ganawa da malamai masu girma wadanda suke gudanar da hidima a bangarori daban-daban na kasar nan da kuma dalibai matasa wadanda suka shagaltar da kansu a fagen tarbiyya ta addini da kuma neman ilimi na addini.
mt0: <pad> One of the most interesting and enjoyable interviews for me is with the senior imams who are serving in different parts of the country and young students who have engaged themselves in the field of religious education and religious studies.</s>

en: Thankfully, tonight you dear seminarians and religious scholars - both Shia and Sunni - are present in this meeting, which is an enjoyable and valuable opportunity for me, an opportunity that is accompanied by spiritual satisfaction.
hau: Alhamdu lillahi a daren yau ma 'yan'uwa maza da mata, dalibai da malamai masu girma na wannan lardin na Sunna da Shi'a, duk sun taru a wannan taron, lalle hakan a gare ni wata dama ce abar ayi amfani da ita.
mt0: <pad> Alhamdulilahi today brothers and sisters, students and teachers of this city of Sunna and Shia, all have come together in this meeting, which for me is a good opportunity to make use of it.</s>

en: I would like to make a few points in this meeting.
hau: Akwai wadansu batutuwa da nake son ishara da su, to amma kafin in fadi abubuwan da nake da su din, lalle ina ganin wajibi ne in jinjina wa babban malamin nan mai gudun duniya wanda bisa umurnin Ayatullah Burujerdi ya gudanar da rayuwarsa a wannan lardin sannan kuma ya sami ladar wannan kokari da ya yi ta hanyar yin shahada.
mt0: <pad> There are some things I want to point out, but before I do so, I feel it is necessary to pay tribute to the great scholar who lived his life in this region under the command of Ayatullah Burujerdi and ended his efforts by being martyred.</s>

en: I had the opportunity to meet him many times in his home in Kermanshah and exchange views with him.
hau: Ni dai na sami damar ganawa da shi a gidansa a Kermanshah a lokuta da dama; mu zauna mu biyu da shi mu tattauna a tsakaninmu.
mt0: <pad> I had the opportunity to meet him at his house in Kermanshah several times; we sat down alone and talked with each other.</s>

en: I had met him previously in a meeting that had been arranged for Friday prayer leaders of Kermanshah province in Islamabad, which was attended by the late Shahid Saduqi from Yazd as well as other people.
hau: Haka nan kuma mun hadu da shi a wasu tarurruka da aka gudanar; wato a taron limaman juma'a na lardin nan da aka gudanar a garin Islamabad, wanda marigayi Shahid Saduki ma ya zo daga Yazd.
mt0: <pad> We also met him at other meetings; such as the provincial imam's conference held in Islamabad, where Shahid Saduki, who came from Yazd, was also present.</s>

en: Friday prayer leaders of Kermanshah province held the meeting while the enemy was dropping bombs on the city.
hau: An gudanar da taron ne karkashin ruwan bama-bamai (na sojojin Iraki don lokacin ana cikin yaki ne), wanda mu din nan ma mun kasance a taron.
mt0: <pad> The meeting was held under heavy artillery fire (by the Iraqi troops, as it was a wartime), and we were there too.</s>

en: He used to do so with his actions as well. His humility, his piety, his inattention to many of the superficial things in life - these were among his characteristics.
hau: Tawali'unsa, gudun duniyarsa, rashin damuwa da abubuwa na zahiri, dukkanin wadannan abubuwa suna daga cikin siffofin da ya kebanta da su; lalle mutum ne mai girma.
mt0: <pad> His simplicity, his aloofness from the world, his uninterest in mundane things, all these things are of his distinctive qualities; he is a great man.</s>

en: At the end of his relatively long life, Allah the Exalted bestowed martyrdom on him instead of a natural death.
hau: Haka nan kuma Allah Madaukakin Sarki Ya ba shi lada; a karshen wata doguwar rayuwa, Allah ya arzurta shi da mutuwa ta shahada.
mt0: <pad> And Allah the Most High has rewarded him; at the end of a long life, Allah has blessed him with the death of shahada.</s>

en: I have repeatedly said that martyrdom is the death of merchants, the kind of death that is highly profitable.
hau: A lokuta da dama na sha fadin cewa shahada wata mutuwa ce ta kasuwanci, mutuwa ce da take da riba sosai.
mt0: <pad> I've often said that death is a business death, a very profitable death.</s>

en: Every soul shall have a taste of death.
hau: Ko shakka babu akwai wani lokaci da rayuwa za ta zo karshe "Kowane rai mai dandanar mutuwa ne" (Suratu Al Imrana 3:185).
mt0: <pad> No doubt there will be a time when life will end "Every soul is bound to die" (Suratu Al-Imrana 3:185).</s>

en: Dear God, we are eagerly waiting for this opportunity.
hau: Mu ma dai masu kaunar samun wannan dacewar ce - to kuwa mutum ya sayar wa Allah da wannan rayuwa ta sa ne, ya kuma sami gagarumar riba.
mt0: <pad> We are just those who want to have this righteousness - then the man has sold his life to God, and has made a great profit.</s>

en: Surely Allah has bought of the believers their lives. [The Holy Quran, 9: 111] God buys the lives of believers. This is a great opportunity which was provided for that great man.
hau: Lalle ne, Allah Ya saya daga muminai, rayukansu (Suratu Tauba 9:111), Allah Madaukakin Sarki yana sayen rai, wato Allah shi ne mai sayen. Lalle hakan babbar dacewa ce.
mt0: <pad> "For Allah has bought the lives of the believers (Suratu Tauba 9:111)," which means that Allah is the one who buys. Surely, this is a great error.</s>

en: My dear old friend, the late Hajj Agha Baha ed-Din Mohammadi Eraqi, was among the fortunate people in this province who found this opportunity.
hau: A wannan lardin ma, tsohon abokin mu marigayi Hajj Agha Baha'uddeen Muhammadi Araki, yana daga cikin mutanen da suka sami wannan dacewa ta shahada.
mt0: <pad> In this province, our former friend Hajj Agha Baha'uddeen Muhammadi Araki, was one of the people who had the opportunity to be martyred.</s>

en: He was one of Imam Khomeini's good students and he was a friend of mine in Qom.
hau: Marigayi Agha Hajj Baha yana daga cikin daliban marigayi Imam sannan kuma daga cikin abokan mu a Kum.
mt0: <pad> The late Agha Hajj Baha was one of the students of the late Imam and one of our friends in Kum.</s>

en: May God bestow His mercy and blessings on these two martyrs.
hau: Allah ya yi rahama ga wadannan shahidai guda biyu.
mt0: <pad> Allah may pardon these two martyrs.</s>

en: I would also like to commemorate our kind, humble, lovely and friendly scholar, the late Hajj Agha Mojtaba Hajj Akhund, who was one of my old friends in Hojjatiyyeh School in Qom. He was pious, sincere, virtuous and honest.
hau: Haka nan kuma wajibi ne in ambaci babban malamin nan na kyawawan halaye, mai tawali'u kuma abin kauna marigayi Hajj Agha Mujtaba Hajj Akhund, wanda shi ma ya kasance daga cikin tsoffin abokanmu a makarantar Hujjatiya ta Kum; mutum ne mumini, mai tsarkin zuciya, salihi sannan kuma mai gaskiya.
mt0: <pad> Also it is necessary to mention the great teacher of good morals, humble and beloved Hajj Agha Mujtaba Hajj Akhund, who was also one of our old friends at Kum Hujjatiya Madrasa; a man of faith, clean heart, righteous and honest.</s>

en: May God bestow His mercy and blessings on him.
hau: Allah ya yi masa rahama.
mt0: <pad> Allah makes him a blessing.</s>

en: After the Revolution and before my presidential terms, I met him in his home during one of my trips to Kermanshah and I had the opportunity to see his artistic works up close.
hau: Bayan nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci, kafin lokacin in zama shugaban kasa, a daya daga cikin ziyarar da na kawo garin Kermanshah, na tafi gidansa sannan kuma na ga ayyukansa na zane da yake yi.
mt0: <pad> After the Islamic Revolution, before I became president, on one of my visits to Kermanshah, I visited his house and saw his paintings.</s>

en: Later on, after Imam Khomeini (r.a.) had passed away, he sent me one of his works.
hau: Haka nan kuma bayan rasuwar Imam, ya aiko min da daya daga cikin ayyukan nasa.
mt0: <pad> And after the death of the Imam, he assigned me to one of his works.</s>

en: I asked him to write a hadith on a piece of paper so that I could put it up on the wall: "He who considers himself the leader of people should educate himself before educating others." We must not forget the responsibility to educate ourselves.
hau: Ni na bukace shi da ya rubuta min wannan hadisin da ke cewa: "Duk wanda ya nada kansa shugaba ga al'umma, to (wajibi ne) ya fara karantar da kansa kafin ya karantar da waninsa" don in sanya shi a gaban teburina; don kada mu mance da batun karantar da kanmu.
mt0: <pad> I asked him to write me this Hadith: "Whoever sets himself up as leader of the people, he must first teach himself before he teaches others" to put it on my desk; so that we don't forget to teach ourselves.</s>

en: He wrote the hadith in his exquisite handwriting and I had it framed and put it up in my room: "He who considers himself the leader of people should educate himself before educating others."
hau: Ya rubuta min hakan da rubutu mai kyau, sannan ni kuma na sanya shi cikin wani allo na sanya shi a gaba na.
mt0: <pad> He wrote it to me in a beautiful handwriting, and I put it in a separate sheet and placed it in front of me.</s>

en: This is the flaw of our work.
hau: Wannan ita ce matsalar da tare tattare da aikin mu.
mt0: <pad> This is the problem with our work.</s>

en: Dear people, dear brothers, my dear children, dear youth, dear male and female seminarians, if you want to imbue the atmosphere with our scent like a flower, if you want spirituality to freely flow out of you like a river to quench the thirst of those who are after spirituality, this is how you should do it: educate yourselves before educating others.
hau: Ya ku matasa! Ya ku dalibai maza da mata! Matukar dai muna son mu zamanto tamkar fure mai kamshi wanda ya ke sanya kamshi a waje, idan har kuna son ku zamanto tamkar idon ruwa wadanda mutane ba tare da tilasci ba za su kashe kishirwar da suke da ita, to kuwa hanyar cimma hakan ita ce: "ya fara karantar da kansa".
mt0: <pad> You young people! You students! If we want to be like a beautiful flower that smells good, if you want to be like a spring water that people will drink without permission, then the way to achieve that is: "He started teaching cancer."</s>

en: Those of His servants only who are possessed of knowledge fear Allah. [The Holy Quran, 35: 28] According to this holy ayah, which was recited at the beginning of this meeting, fear of God is a characteristic of learned people.
hau: Wannan aya mai girma da aka karanto da ke cewa: "Malami kawai ke tsoron Allah daga cikin bayinSa" (Suratu Fatir 35:28). Tsoron Allah daya ne daga cikin siffofin da malamai suka kebanta da su.
mt0: <pad> The great verse that was read is: "Only the imams fear God among His servants" (Suratu Fatir 35:28). To fear God is one of the distinctive qualities of imams.</s>

en: Well, learned people and ulama have many characteristics, but this holy ayah only refers to fear of God.
hau: Na'am malamai suna da wasu siffofin, to amma sai aka zabi tsoron Allah.
mt0: <pad> No, they have other qualities, but they were killed for fear of God.</s>

en: The characteristic of knowledge is that it strikes fear of God - this great blessing - into the hearts of those who possess it.
hau: Siffar ilimi ita ce cewa mutum ya kan sami wannan babbar ni'ima, wato sanya tsoron Allah cikin zuciyar mutum.
mt0: <pad> The characteristic of knowledge is that one can obtain this great blessing, that is, to put fear of God in the heart of one.</s>

en: Compared with people of my age, it is easier for you dear youth to develop fear of God in your hearts. When you reach my age, things will become difficult for you unless you take care of them during your youth.
hau: A saboda wajibi ne a samo wannan siffar. Ku din nan matasa cikin sauki sama da ni za ku iya yin wannan aikin. A lokacin da kuka kai ga shekarun mu, idan har wani mutum ya yi wani abu a lokacin samartakansa, to hakan zai amfane shi; idan kuwa ba haka to lamarin zai zamanto masa da wahala.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, it is necessary to find this form. You younger people can do this job easier than I can. When you reach our age, if a person has done something in his youth, it will benefit him; if not, it will be difficult for him.</s>

en: The difference is that some people reach old age and some others do not.
hau: Wannan rayuwar dai wacce za ta kare; wasu za su kai ga tsufa, wasu kuma ba za su kai ga hakan ba.
mt0: <pad> This life is going to end; some will get older, some will not.</s>

en: You should know that the difference between 20, 30 or 70 years of age is not that great. Time passes like a flash.
hau: Lalle ya kamata ku san cewa; tazarar da ke tsakanin shekaru ashirin da shekaru talatin har zuwa shekaru saba'in har zuwa sama da saba'in, wato irin shekarun da muke da shi, tazara ce karama; tamkar wutan lantarki haka za ta wuce.
mt0: <pad> You should know that the gap between 20 and 30 years and 70 and above is very small; it will pass like a lightning bolt.</s>

en: When people are twenty years old, they think that they have a long time before they reach the age of seventy.
hau: A lokacin da mutum ya ke shekaru ashirin-talatin yana zaton cewa ai akwai lokaci kafin kai wa ga shekaru saba'in.
mt0: <pad> When a person is thirty-five, he thinks there's time before he reaches the age of seventy.</s>

en: No, time passes like a flash and soon it will be time to leave this world. If you want to do something with this short life, you should prepare the way while you are young.
hau: Ina, cikin gaggawa za su wuce; daga nan kuma sai maganar tafiya. Idan har cikin dan wannan karamin lokaci an tsara mutum zai sami damar aikata wani abu, ya sami damar rike wani guzuri, to wajibi ne tun lokacin samartakansa ya samar da hakan.
mt0: <pad> Yes, they will pass quickly; then it's time to leave. If in this short period of time a person is supposed to do something, to hold a treasure, then he must already from his birth provide for that.</s>

en: I believe fear of God, divine remembrance, piety and closeness to God are more urgent and more advisable for seminarians than acquiring knowledge.
hau: A saboda haka ina kiran dalibai masu girma zuwa ga kankan da kai da ambaton Allah da tsoron Allah da kuma kokari wajen samun kusaci da Allah wanda ya ke a matsayin wajibi sama da kira zuwa ga ilimi, wanda tushe na asali na aikin su shi ne neman ilimi.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, I call on the noble students to be careful with the mention of Allah and fear of Allah and to strive to get closer to Allah which is a duty above the call for knowledge, whose original basis of their work is to seek knowledge.</s>

en: Knowledge that is not accompanied by piety is useless and sometimes harmful.
hau: Idan har ya zamana an sami ilimi amma ba tare da tsoron Allah ba, to wannan ilimi yana iya zama mara amfani, a wani lokacin ma mai cutarwa.
mt0: <pad> If knowledge is gained but without fear of God, then this knowledge may be useless, and in some cases even harmful.</s>

en: We had certain learned people - both religious and non-religious scholars - who not only failed to make use of their knowledge to benefit themselves and others, but their knowledge also became a burden and a problem.
hau: Muna da wani malami - wanda yake da ilimi na addini da wanda ba na addini ba - wanda ba wai kawai bai amfana da ilimin ba ne, face ma dai ya zamanto bala'i a gare shi.
mt0: <pad> We have a teacher - both religious and non-religious - who not only didn't benefit from the knowledge, but it became a curse to him.</s>

en: This spirituality is like a soul for knowledge and those who possess it.
hau: Lalle wannan ruhi na ababe masu kusata mutum da Ubangiji abubuwa ne da suka zama wajibi ga ilimi da malami.
mt0: <pad> This spirit of things that bring the man closer to God is a duty of knowledge and scholar.</s>

en: The city of Kermanshah is an important city.
hau: To garin Kermanshah gari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> Kermanshah is a city of great significance.</s>

en: As was pointed out by Mr. Olama, Kermanshah used to have great learned scholars in the distant past. And over the past 200, 250 years, there were great scholarly families in this city - such as the Al-e Agha family, the Jalili family and other scholarly families in which there were not just one, two or ten learned people: there were more of them.
hau: Kamar yadda Malam Ulama ya fadi a wani lokaci mai tsawo a baya, Kermanshah ya kasance yana da manyan malamai; irin su iyalan Al Agha, irin su iyalan Jalili, da sauran gidajen ilimi da ake samun manyan malamai a cikinsu, ba wai mutum guda ko mutane biyu ko mutanen goma ba - sama da haka - gidan ilimi ne.
mt0: <pad> As the Imam said a long time ago, Kermanshah had many great imams; such as the Al Agha family, the Jalili family, and other schools that have many great imams, not just one or two or ten - more than that - a school is a school of scholars.</s>

en: In this regard, another point about Kermanshah that attracts my attention is that the people of Kermanshah are hospitable and generous to everybody who visits their city and it appears that they are even more hospitable and generous to religious scholars who visit their city.
hau: Wani lamarin na daban a wannan babin wanda kuma mai jan hankali dangane da Kermanshah shi ne cewa kamar yadda mutanen Kermanshah mutane ne masu so da kuma girmama baki sannan kuma masu nuna rahama ga mutanen da suka zo, to lalle malamai ma suna da wannan siffar, a wani lokaci ma sama da hakan.
mt0: <pad> Another thing that is interesting about Kermanshah is that just as the people of Kermanshah are kind and generous and showing mercy to the visitors, so are the teachers, sometimes even more so.</s>

en: The late Agha Mohammad Ali - who was the son of the late Vahid Behbahani and one of his best students - decided to come to Kermanshah and stay.
hau: Marigayi Muhammad Ali (yardar Allah ta tabbata a gare shi) - dan marigayi Wahid Bahbahani wanda ya kasance daga cikin manyan daliban babansa - ya tashi ya zo Kermanshah ya ci gaba da rayuwa.
mt0: <pad> Muhammad Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) - son of the late Wahid Bahbahani who was one of his great students - moved to Kermanshah to continue his life.</s>

en: Although he did not have such an intention, Kermanshah convinced him to stay and he started the Al-e Agha family in Kermanshah.
hau: Duk kuwa da cewa ba shi da nufin zama, amma kuma ya ci gaba da zaman, sun rike shi, daga nan ya zamanto daga cikin Iyalan Al Agha.
mt0: <pad> Although he did not intend to stay, he stayed, and they took him in, and he became one of the family of Al Agha.</s>

en: He and many of his children and descendents are considered among the learned religious scholars of Kermanshah.
hau: Shi din nan da wasu daga cikin ‘ya'yansa mai yawa sun kasance daga cikin malamai.
mt0: <pad> She and many of her sons were teachers.</s>

en: This is one example.
hau: Wannan wani misali ne guda.
mt0: <pad> This is just one example.</s>

en: Another example is the late Aseyyed Hossein Haeri, who had travelled to Mashhad towards the end of his life.
hau: Wani misalin kuma shi ne marigayi Agha Sayyid Husain Ha'iri, wanda a karshen rayuwarsa ya zo Mashahad.
mt0: <pad> Another example is the late Agha Sayyid Husain Ha'iri, who ended his life in Mashahad.</s>

en: I remember certain things about him.
hau: Har ya zuwa yanzu dai ina iya tuna wasu abubuwa dangane da shi.
mt0: <pad> I can still remember some things about him.</s>

en: He was the son of Aseyyed Mohammad Esfahani's brother, and a student of Aseyyed Mohammad Esfahani and a great cleric from Iraq who stayed in Kermanshah for many years.
hau: Shi din nan dan dan'uwan marigayi Agha Sayyid Muhammad Isfahani sannan kuma dalibin Agha Sayyid Muhammad Isfahani sannan kuma dalibin Akhund da Mulla Bozorgi wanda ya zo daga Iraki sannan kuma shekara da shekaru ya zauna a Kermanshah.
mt0: <pad> He is the younger brother of late Agha Sayyid Muhammad Isfahani and a pupil of Agha Sayyid Muhammad Isfahani and Akhund and Mulla Bozorgi who came from Iraq and lived in Kermanshah for years.</s>

en: He used to carry out religious rulings in Isfahan.
hau: Ya kasance yana zartar da haddi a Isfahan.
mt0: <pad> He was a haddi in Isfahan.</s>

en: He was both a religious scholar and a spiritual figure.
hau: Shi din nan ya kasance ma'abocin sanin Allah da kuma lissafi.
mt0: <pad> He was a master of theology and mathematics.</s>

en: In terms of his knowledge, he was a student of the late Fathali Soltanabadi who used to live in Samara at that time.
hau: Sannan kuma yana daga cikin wadanda suka sami tarbiyya daga wajen marigayi Akhund Mulla Fat'ali Sultan Abadi wanda a wancan lokacin ya kasance a garin Samarra ne.
mt0: <pad> He was also one of the disciples of the late Akhund Mulla Fat'ali Sultan Abadi who was a resident of Samarra at that time.</s>

en: Another figure that I would like to mention is the late Sardar-e Kaboli, an outstanding scholar in different areas.
hau: Wani malamin kuma shi ne marigayi Sardar Kabuli, sanannen masanin bangarori daban-daban.
mt0: <pad> Another teacher was late Sardar Kabuli, a well-known scientist of different fields.</s>

en: The book that has been written about him is a very good book. I read the book several years ago.
hau: Wannan littafi da aka rubuta dangane da shi, littafi ne mai cike da abubuwa kuma mai kyau; shekaru da yawa da suka gabata na ga wannan littafin.
mt0: <pad> This book written about him is a full and good book; I saw this book many years ago.</s>

en: He lived in Kermanshah for around sixty years and luminaries benefited a lot from him.
hau: Yayi kimanin shekaru sittin a Kermanshah. Manyan malamai dai sun amfana da shi.
mt0: <pad> He lived in Kermanshah for about 60 years. He was well-appreciated by the teachers.</s>

en: I read in the book that the late Hajj Agha Hossein Qomi visits Kermanshah on a pilgrimage and meets with the late Sardar-e Kaboli. They debate about Kiblah or a similar issue and the late Sardar-e Kaboli speak about certain scholarly matters.
hau: Na karanta a cikin wannan littafin cewa marigayi Hajj Agha Husain Kummi (yardar Allah ta tabbata a gare shi) a tafiyar da ya yi zuwa wajaje masu tsarki ko kuma a hanyar dawowarsa, ya zo Kermanshah don ganawa da marigayi Sardar Kabuli.
mt0: <pad> I read in this book that Hajj Agha Husain Kummi (may Allah be pleased with him) on his trip to the holy sites or on his way back, came to Kermanshah to meet with the late Sardar Kabuli.</s>

en: The writer of the book says that he saw with his own eyes - I thinks he says he saw with his own eyes, but I am not sure because I read the book several years ago - that Hajj Agha Hossein Qomi would sit down with Sardar-e Kaboli to learn those scholarly matters from him while he was a marja taqlid and an outstanding scholar.
hau: Marubucin littafi yana cewa ni kai na na shaidu zama biyu - ina zaton ya ce ni da kaina; don kuwa shekara da shekaru kenan da karanta littafin - wato hajj Agha Husain Kummi, wanda ya kasance marja'i sannan kuma babban malami amma yana zama a gaban Sardar Kabuli shi kuma yana karantar da shi wannan bahasi na ilimi.
mt0: <pad> The author of the book says I was a witness to two things - I think he meant me; for I have read the book for years and years - that is Hajj Agha Husain Kummi, who was a marja'i and a great teacher, but he sat in front of Sardar Kabuli and taught him this scholarly discussion.</s>

en: And this is a lesson for us: the late Hajj Agha Hossein Qomi decided to learn something new at the age of eighty while he was a marja taqlid.
hau: Shi kansa wannan darasi ne; wato koyo a lokacin mutum yana dan sheakru saba'in (kamar yadda marigayi Hajj Agha Husain ya yi) sannan kuma a matsayi na marja'i.
mt0: <pad> It is the very same lesson; learning at the age of seventeen (as Hajj Agha Husain did) and as a marja'i.</s>

en: For a learned scholar, not only is this not a disgrace or a flaw, but it is a source of honor.
hau: Hakan ya zamanto ba wai abin kyama ko kuma aibi ba a wajen wani babban malami face ma dai abin alfahari.
mt0: <pad> That was not a sin or a disgrace for a senior teacher but rather a pride.</s>

en: We seminarians should learn from them. You dear youth should move forward on the basis of such principles.
hau: Wajibi ne mu dalibi mu koyi irin wadannan abubuwa. Wajibi ne ku din nan matasa ku bi wannan tafarkin da kuma ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> We must learn these things as students. We must follow this path and continue.</s>

en: This man was from Kabul and he had been raised in India and lived in Najaf. He decided to come to Kermanshah and the people of Kermanshah received him with open arms.
hau: Wannan mutumin, mutumin Kabul ne, ya girma a Indiya, daga nan kuma ya tafi Najaf daga can ne ya tafi Kermanshah kuma aka karbe shi a can da yin maraba da shi.
mt0: <pad> The man is a Kabul man, he grew up in India, then he went to Najaf, then he went to Kermanshah and he was welcomed there.</s>

en: The late Sardar-e Kaboli - who was an all-around scholar - stayed in Kermanshah for sixty years.
hau: Marigayi Sardar Kabuli shekaru sittin ya yi a Kermanshah.
mt0: <pad> Marigayi Sardar Kabuli was born in Kermanshah, Iran, on May 31, 1960.</s>

en: Shahid Ashrafi Esfahani was another religious scholar who had migrated to this city.
hau: Shi kansa marigayi Shahid Ashrafi Isfahani yana daga cikin malaman da suka yi hijira zuwa wannan garin.
mt0: <pad> The late Shahid Ashrafi Isfahani himself was one of the scholars who migrated to this city.</s>

en: This is the characteristic of this city: the people of this city love religious scholars.
hau: Lalle wannan gari yana da wannan siffa da ke nuna cewa zukatan mutane, zukata ne da suke maraba da malaman addini; suna kaunar malaman addini.
mt0: <pad> Because this city has this character that shows that the people's hearts are heart that welcomes the religious leaders; they love the religious leaders.</s>

en: When the people of Kermanshah meet somebody and become familiar with him, they become so friendly that he feels he is in his own homeland.
hau: A lokacin da suka sami wani mutum sannan kuma suka fahimci irin siffofin da yake da shi, to kuwa za su yi maraba da shi ta yadda ba ma zai zaci cewa ba a garinsu ya ke ba.
mt0: <pad> When they find someone and understand his personality, they will welcome him so that he will not think he is not from their village.</s>

en: The late Ashrafi Esfahani was from Isfahan, but he felt at home in Kermanshah and he considered himself a citizen of Kermanshah.
hau: Marigayi Ashrafi dai mutumin Isfahan ne, to amma yana jin kansa tamkar mutumin Kermanshah ne; ya zamanto mutumin Kermanshah.
mt0: <pad> Marigayi Ashrafi was a man from Isfahan, but he had cancer like a Kermanshah; he was a Kermanshah.</s>

en: What I said was a kind of introduction to my speech.
hau: To wadannan abubuwan da na fadi dai wani share fage ne.
mt0: <pad> These things I said are just a prelude.</s>

en: Now I would like to discuss a few points.
hau: Ina so in yi ishara da wasu batutuwa.
mt0: <pad> I can refer to other topics.</s>

en: Dear people, honorable scholars, esteemed luminaries and young seminarians, you should know that today the responsibility of the clergy is heavier.
hau: Malamai masu girma da dalibai matasa sannan kuma manyan gobe!
mt0: <pad> Madams and gentlemen, young students and the future leaders.</s>

en: There are two reasons.
hau: Saboda dalilai guda biyu: na farko shi ne cewa damar isar da sakon Musulunci a duniya - shin a kasashen musulmi ne ko kuma wadanda ba na musulmi ba - wanda a takaice zan yi karin bayani kan hakan.
mt0: <pad> For two reasons: the first is that it offers the opportunity to convey the message of Islam to the world - whether in Muslim countries or non-Muslim countries - which I will shortly explain in detail.</s>

en: Therefore, the responsibility has become heavier.
hau: A saboda haka nauyin zai karu.
mt0: <pad> So the weight will be higher.</s>

en: Today you are in such a situation.
hau: To a yau kuna cikin irin wannan yanayin ne.
mt0: <pad> Do you know if you are in the same situation today?</s>

en: But you must not be afraid. "Fear Him, and do not fear anyone but Allah."
hau: Bai kamata ku ji tsoro ba; "kuma suna tsoronSa, kuma ba su tsoron kowa face Allah".
mt0: <pad> They should not be afraid; "but they fear Him, and they do not fear anyone except Allah."</s>

en: [The Holy Quran, 33: 39] Do not be afraid of anything. Do not be afraid of the hardships that you will face on your path.
hau: Kada ku ji tsoron komai, kada ku ji tsoron wahalhalun da suke kan hanya.
mt0: <pad> Don't be afraid of anything, don't be afraid of the obstacles that may arise on your way.</s>

en: This is not to say that you should pretend your responsibility is easy.
hau: Ba wai kada ku ce akwai wahalhalu ba, saboda me, akwai wahalhalu; to amma kada ku ji tsoron wadannan wahalhalu.
mt0: <pad> No, not to say there are no difficulties, for me, there are difficulties; but not to be afraid of these difficulties.</s>

en: Try to do things that are considered impossible.
hau: Ku aikata abubuwan da ake zaton ba za su iya ba.
mt0: <pad> Doing things that are thought to be impossible</s>

en: After all, this was what happened in Iran.
hau: Shin hakan ba ta faru ba ne a Iran?
mt0: <pad> No, it didn't happen in Iran.</s>

en: The achievement that was made in Iran - all analysts of the world would sit down together for hours and days and nights to discuss it and all of them would reach a unanimous conclusion: that it was impossible.
hau: A Iran an aiwatar da wani abu wanda idan da dukkanin masu sharhi na duniya, za su zauna na tsawon sa'oi dare da rana su ba da lokacin su, babu wani sakamako da za su kai gare shi in ba cewa lalle hakan ba abu ne mai yiyuwa ba.
mt0: <pad> Iran has done something that even if all the world's commentators sat down for hours day and night to discuss it, they wouldn't have any effect on it except that it is impossible.</s>

en: All analysts were saying that this was impossible, but it happened in Iran.
hau: Kowane mai sharhi zai ce wannan aiki ba mai yiyuwa ba ne; amma sai ga shi ya yiyu.
mt0: <pad> Every critic would say that this work is impossible; but it was done.</s>

en: Even some of the revolutionaries were saying that it was impossible.
hau: Ina gaya muku cewa hatta wasu daga cikin ‘yan gwagwarmayar mu suna fadin cewa ba zai yiyu ba.
mt0: <pad> I tell you that even some of our own fighters say that it won't work.</s>

en: The late Mr. Taleghani told me, "Imam Khomeini (r.a.) says that the Shah must go, but obviously it is impossible for the Shah to go."
hau: Marigayi Ayatullah Talikani ya gaya min cewa Imam yana fadin cewa: ‘wajibi ne a kawar da Shah', to a fili yake cewa Shah dai ba zai tafi ba.
mt0: <pad> The late Ayatullah Talikani told me that the Imam said: "It is necessary to remove the Shah," and it is clear that the Shah will not go away.</s>

en: He could not believe that it was possible for the Shah to go.
hau: Bai yarda cewa za a iya kawar da Shah ba.
mt0: <pad> He did not believe that Shah could be overthrown.</s>

en: He told me that Imam Khomeini (r.a.) was saying strange things.
hau: Daga baya ne ya gaya min haka.
mt0: <pad> He told me that later.</s>

en: Imam Khomeini (r.a.) said that the Shah would have to go.
hau: Imam ya ce za a kawar da Shah, babu wani da ya yarda da hakan, amma an kawar da shi.
mt0: <pad> The Imam said that the Shah would be removed, no one agreed with it, but he was removed.</s>

en: Not only the Shah but also America, the west, the colonial powers and the arrogant powers had to leave.
hau: Ba wai kawai an kawar da Shah ba ne, Amurka ma ta tafi, kasashen yammaci sun tafi haka nan mulkin mallaka da kuma girman kai duk sun gushe.
mt0: <pad> Not only was Shah ousted, America was gone, the western countries were gone, and all of the imperialism and arrogance had been gone.</s>

en: Nobody could believe this, but it happened.
hau: Babu wani wanda ya yarda da hakan, amma kuma ya faru.
mt0: <pad> Nobody believed it, but it happened.</s>

en: Nobody could believe that among the Islamic countries, the biggest revolution would happen in Egypt: the Egypt of Camp David Accords, the Egypt of Hosni Mubarak.
hau: Babu wani da ya ke jin cewa babban juyin juya hali na wannan lokacin a kasashen musulmi zai faru a kasar Masar ne; kasar Masar din da ta kulla yarjejeniyar Camp Dabid, kasar Masar din Hosni Mubarak.
mt0: <pad> No one thought that the great revolution of this time in the Muslim world would be in Egypt; the Egypt that signed the Camp David agreement, the Egypt of Hosni Mubarak.</s>

en: There might have been certain people who considered such a revolution possible, but nobody thought it would happen in Egypt.
hau: Mai yiyuwa ne a yi zaton faruwar hakan a wani wajen na daban, to amma babu wanda ya ke tunanin Masar kan. To amma juyin juya hali ya faru a kasar Masar.
mt0: <pad> It might have been predicted elsewhere, but no one thought of Egypt. But a revolution happened in Egypt.</s>

en: This is what we must keep in mind.
hau: Wadannan suna daga cikin abubuwan da ya kamata mu sanya su cikin zukatan mu.
mt0: <pad> These are some of the things we should keep in our minds.</s>

en: Go after things that are considered impossible and try to make them happen.
hau: Mu kama hanya cimma ayyukan da ake zaton ba za su yiyu ba, don mu tabbatar da yiyuwarsu.
mt0: <pad> We take on tasks that are thought to be difficult, to ensure that they are done well.</s>

en: In order to do heavy tasks, tackle them in a determined way. "And fear Him, and do not fear anyone but Allah."
hau: Ku kuduri aniyar daukan kaya mai nauyi, don ku sami damar iyawa. "kuma ba su tsoron kowa face Allah".
mt0: <pad> He decided to take a heavy load, so that he could get the chance to try it.</s>

en: What are the difficulties? The answer is, "Allah is sufficient to take account."
hau: Amsar hakan dai shi ne cewa: "Kuma Allah Ya isa Ya zama Mai hisabi"; kada su mance da Allah, Allah yana da hisabi.
mt0: <pad> The answer to this is: "For Allah is sufficient to be a judge; do not forget Allah, Allah is a judge.</s>

en: Allah is sufficient to take account.
hau: Kuma Allah Ya isa Ya zama Mai hisabi.
mt0: <pad> Allah is the Most Accursed</s>

en: This is our path.
hau: Wannan shi ne tafarkin mu.
mt0: <pad> This is my journey.</s>

en: In one part of the Holy Quran, we religious scholars are advised to fear God and in another part, we are advised to "deliver the messages of Allah". The messages of Allah are the same messages that were delivered by His prophets.
hau: A nan ana yi mana wasicci da kankan da kai - a matsayin mu na malamai - a can kuma ana yi mana wasicci ne da "Wadanda ke iyar da manzancin Allah". To ‘manzancin Allah' dai shi ne ‘manzancin annabawan Allah'.
mt0: <pad> Here we are being advised by ourselves - as teachers - there we are being advised by "Those who preach the message of God". And "the message of God" is the message of the prophets of God.</s>

en: Allah the Exalted says, "And thus did We make for every prophet an enemy, the devils from among men and jinn, some of them suggesting to others varnished falsehood to deceive (them), and had your Lord pleased, they would not have done it, therefore leave them and that which they forge."
hau: Allah Madaukakin Sarki yana fadin cewa: "Kuma kamar wancan ne Muka sanya wa kowane annabi makiyi; shaidanun mutane da aljannu, sashensu yana yin ishara zuwa sashe da kawatacen zancen bisa ga rudi.
mt0: <pad> Allah says: "And so We have made enemies for every prophet, the devils of men and the angels, one of them pointing to the other with a brief sentence according to their knowledge."</s>

en: [The Holy Quran 6: 112] Divine prophets are surrounded by devils "from among men and jinn". They are attacked by devils from among mankind and jinn.
hau: Kuma da Ubangijinka Ya so, da ba su aikata shi ba, don haka ka bar su da abin da suke kirkirawa" (Suratul An'am 6:112).
mt0: <pad> And if your Lord had not wanted, they would not have done it. So let them do what they are doing."</s>

en: If we are supposed to promote the messages of God, we should expect being attacked by devils from among mankind and jinn.
hau: A saboda haka idan har an tsara cewa ni da ku din nan za mu isar da sakon Ubangiji, to kuwa mu zauna da shirin fuskantar shaidanu na aljannu da mutane.
mt0: <pad> So if it is planned that I and you will be going to deliver the message of God, then we should be prepared to face both the devils of the angels and the men.</s>

en: They will attack us, so we should prepare ourselves for their attacks.
hau: Za su dinga kawo mana hari, don haka mu zama cikin shiri.
mt0: <pad> They're going to attack us, so let's be prepared.</s>

en: We must build a spiritual wall against the enemies within ourselves - a wall of piety and reliance on God - so that we do not collapse from within.
hau: A bangare na ruhi, wajibi ne mu samar da wata karfafaffiyar garkuwa ga kanmu - wanda wannan garkuwar garkuwa ce ta imani da tawakkali - don kada a sami nasara a kan mu sannan kuma mu sha kashi.
mt0: <pad> In the spiritual realm, we must build a strong shield for ourselves - and this shield is the shield of faith and trust - so that we cannot be overrun and beaten.</s>

en: Physical retreat and defeat are the result of inner retreat and defeat.
hau: Gudu da kuma shan kashi na fili su kan samo asali ne daga gudu da kuma shan kashi na badinin mutum (abin da ke tattare da mu).
mt0: <pad> The physical running and jumping of the animal is often derived from the physical running and jumping of the human (that is, ourselves).</s>

en: It is the inner self of human beings that imposes a physical defeat on them.
hau: Shan kashi na badini na mutum shi ne ya ke sanya masa shan kashi na waje.
mt0: <pad> The inner climate of a person affects the external climate.</s>

en: If you are not defeated in your heart, nobody can defeat you.
hau: Idan har ba ku sha kashi a cikin zuciyar ku ba, to babu wani da ya isa ya sami nasara a kan ku.
mt0: <pad> If you don't have a battle in your heart, no one can win over you.</s>

en: The wall that must be built in your heart is the wall of piety and reliance on God. "And in Allah should the believers put their trust." [The Holy Quran, 3: 122] "In Allah let the trusting put their trust."
hau: Garkuwar da wajibi ne ku samar wa zuciyar ku, ita ce garkuwa ta imani da Allah da tawakkali da Allah; "Don haka, sai mumanai su dogara ga Allah" (Suratu Al Imrana 3:122) "kuma ga Allah sai masu dogaro su dogara" (Suratu Ibrahim 14:12) "Kuma wanda ya dogara ga Allah, to, Allah ne Ma'ishinsa" (Suratut Talak 65:3) "Ashe, Allah, bai zama Mai isa ga bawanSa ba?"
mt0: <pad> The shield you must provide for your heart is the shield of faith and trust in Allah; "For whoever trusts in Allah, Allah is his protector" (Suratu Al-Imran 3:122) "and to Allah only do they trust" (Suratu Ibrahim 14:12) "Whoever trusts in Allah, Allah is his protector" (Suratut Talak 65:3)</s>

en: [The Holy Quran, 39: 36] These are lessons for us.
hau: (Suratuz Zumar 39:36) dukkanin wadannan darasi ne a gare mu.
mt0: <pad> All these are lessons for us.</s>

en: We must recite the Holy Quran in a careful way. We should learn these lessons: they are guidelines for life.
hau: Mu karanta Alkur'ani da dukkanin tunani; mu dauki hakan a matsayin darasi da kuma sanya shi ya zamanto tsari na rayuwarmu.
