mt0: <pad> We read the Quran with all our minds; we take it as a lesson and make it our guide.</s>

en: The modern devils who attack you through the internet, satellite channels and highly advanced tools of communication - they have modern things to say.
hau: Wannan shaidanin da a yau yake zuwa muku ta hanyoyin internet, tauraron dan'adam da sauran hanyoyin sadarwa na zamani, yana da wasu maganganu na zamanin ma.
mt0: <pad> This devil, who is now reaching you via the internet, the satellite and other modern communication devices, has some modern words.</s>

en: I have received reports that currently petro-dollars are being spent on certain projects.
hau: A halin yanzu a wani wajen ana kashe daloli man fetur; ina da labarin hakan.
mt0: <pad> Nowadays, somewhere is being used oil for money; I know that.</s>

en: On the one hand, they are spending huge amounts of money in order to establish anti-Shia groups among Sunni Muslims in certain Islamic countries.
hau: Wadannan wadansu rahotanni ne wadanda ba kasafai ake fitar da su ba. A wasu daga cikin kasashen musulmi ana kashe kudade masu yawa don dai 'yan Sunna su shirya wani taro na kiyayya da Shi'a.
mt0: <pad> These are rarely published reports. In some Muslim countries, Sunnis spend a lot of money to organize a meeting of anti-Shia animosity.</s>

en: On the other hand, they pay certain so-called Shia preachers to insult and level allegations against the Mother of the Faithful, Aisha, in the name of Shia Islam.
hau: A wannan bangaren kenan, a wancan bangaren kuma su kan ba wa wani mai wa'azi na Shi'a kudi don ya fito a cikin talabijin da sunan Shi'a, ya dinga tuhumar Ummul Muminina Aisha, ya yi mata kazafi da kuma ci mata mutumci.
mt0: <pad> They also pay a Shia preacher to come on television in the name of Shia, accuse Ummul Muminin Aisha, make her false allegations and insult her.</s>

en: These are their methods.
hau: Wadannan su ne hanyoyin da suke bi.
mt0: <pad> These are the ways they go.</s>

en: Discord among us is the biggest blessing for them.
hau: Don kuwa haifar da sabani wata babbar ni'ima ce a gare su.
mt0: <pad> Don't know because giving birth to a baby is a great blessing for them.</s>

en: I would like to take this opportunity to mention a point. Your province is inhabited by both Shia and Sunni Muslims.
hau: A nan ina son in sanar da ku cewa, lardin ku, lardi ne da 'yan Shi'a da Sunna suke rayuwa tare da junansu.
mt0: <pad> I want to tell you that your state is a state where Shi'a and Sunni live together.</s>

en: Shia and Sunni scholars should arrange meetings with each other and discuss their points of disagreement.
hau: Yana da kyau malaman Shi'a da Sunna su dinga shirya taro a tsakaninsu, su fahimci junansu da kuma magana a tsakaninsu.
mt0: <pad> It is good for Shia and Sunni scholars to meet, understand each other and talk to each other.</s>

en: We have certain things in common.
hau: Muna da ayyuka da muka yi tarayya a cikinsu.
mt0: <pad> We have shared projects.</s>

en: You can have your own beliefs, but at the same time you can also cooperate with each other.
hau: Kuna iya rike akidunku, to amma ku dinga gudanar da ayyukanku na tarayya.
mt0: <pad> You can keep your identity, but you have to run our activities in the community.</s>

en: If they want to have a religious discussion, there is no problem.
hau: Idan har suna son su gudanar da bincike, su yi, idan kuwa ba haka ba, shi kenan.
mt0: <pad> If they want to investigate, they should investigate, if not, then no.</s>

en: I have nothing against religious discussions. If they want to have scholarly religious discussions among scholars and experts, they may sit down together and have such discussions.
hau: Ni dai na yi imani da bahasi na mazhaba, idan har suna son su yi bahasi na ilimi da mazhaba tsakanin malamai da masana, su zauna su gudanar da hakan, babu matsala cikin haka, to sai dai ba wai a idon jama'a ba face dai a zama na ilimi.
mt0: <pad> I believe in the debate of mazhab, if they want to have a scientific and scholarly debate between scholars and teachers, they can do so, but not in public, but only for the purpose of education.</s>

en: Either way, it is not a problem. Apart from these disagreements, there are certain things that we have in common.
hau: To amma duk da wadannan abubuwa, akwai wadansu abubuwa da aka yi tarayya a cikinsu; akwai wata cuta da aka yi tarayya cikinta wacce kuma take da magani na tarayya ne.
mt0: <pad> But despite these things, there are some common elements; there is a common disease and a common treatment.</s>

en: Shia scholars have influence over Shia Muslims, and Sunni scholars have influence over Sunni Muslims. They should make use of their influence in order to eliminate the common problems.
hau: Malamin Shi'a yana da bakin magana a cikin mutanensa, haka shi ma malamin Sunna yana da bakin magana cikin jama'arsa, su yi amfani da wannan karfi da bakin maganan da suke da shi wajen magance wadannan matsaloli da aka yi tarayya cikinsu.
mt0: <pad> The Shia imam has a voice in his people, and the Sunni imam has a voice in his people, let them use this power and voice to solve these common problems.</s>

en: Today there are certain people who are using takfir as their weapon and they are not afraid of announcing that they are takfiri. These people are like poison.
hau: A yau akwai wadansu mutane wadanda makamin da ke hannunsu shi ne makami na kafirta (musulmi); ba sa ma jin kunyan su kira kansu masu kafirtawa; lalle wadannan guba ne.
mt0: <pad> Today there are some people whose weapon is the sword of kafir (musulmi); they don't even feel ashamed to call themselves kafirs; these people are poison.</s>

en: It is necessary to cleanse Islamic environments of this poison.
hau: To wajibi ne a yi watsi da wannan gubar daga cikin al'ummar musulmi.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to discard this poison from the Muslim community.</s>

en: Therefore, the heavy responsibility that I spoke about encompasses all these aspects and starts from self-education and developing humility in one's heart.
hau: A saboda haka wannan rubanyan aiki da muka yi magana kansa, ya kumshi dukkanin wadannan abubuwa.
mt0: <pad> So this massive work that we've talked about, includes all these things.</s>

en: Another responsibility is acquiring knowledge.
hau: Wani nauyin kuma na daban, shi ne nauyin karatu.
mt0: <pad> Another weight is the education weight.</s>

en: I have heard that certain luminaries of Kermanshah are living in Qom. Definitely, the dear gentlemen who have attended this meeting are familiar with them. These people should be encouraged to return to Kermanshah, or if they cannot come and live in Kermanshah, they should come and stay for a while every year.
hau: Na ji cewa akwai dalibai 'yan Kermanshah da suke karatu a Kum - wanda ko shakka babu 'yan'uwa sun sansu - a kwadaitar da su; su zo nan su yi hijira, ko kuma idan har ba za su dawo ba, to a lokaci na musamman su dinga zuwa; a shekara su zo su yi watannin biyu, uku, hudu; su tafi cikin mutane, su tafi kauyuka da garuruwa, su raya masallatai.
mt0: <pad> I heard that there are students from Kermanshah who study in Kum - which I am sure they know - to be encouraged; to come here and migrate, or if they don't return, to come here for a special time; two, three, four months a year; to go among the people, to go to villages and towns, to build mosques.</s>

en: Therefore, the issue of knowledge is a very important issue.
hau: A saboda haka batun ilimi, lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> So the issue of education is very important.</s>

en: Of course, besides acquiring knowledge, there is the issue of promoting Islam, which is very important.
hau: Ko da yake a tattare da neman ilimi, akwai batun isar da sako (wa'azi), wanda ya ke da muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> Although it is concerned with learning, there is also the matter of transmission (wa'azi), which is of great importance.</s>

en: There was a seminarian who used to attend my classes in Mashhad.
hau: Akwai wani dalibi da ya ke zuwa wajen darasin da na ke bayarwa; bayan wani lokaci sai ya bace ba ya zuwa, ba na ganinsa a wajen darasin.
mt0: <pad> There is a student who used to come to my lectures; after a while he stopped coming, I didn't see him at the lecture.</s>

en: He said that he had been busy promoting Islam in a distant town in Khorasan province. I asked, "What happened at the end?" He said, "I came to the conclusion that none of the things I had learned is good for these people and that whatever I had learned is useless to them."
hau: Bayan wani lokaci sai na sake ganinsa, sai na tambaye shi ina kake ne? sai ya ce ina waje kaza ne - daya daga cikin garuruwan da suke da nisa na lardin Khorasan - ina wa'azi ne a can. To me ya faru ka dawo, sai ya ce daga karshe na fahimci cewa ba ni da wani abin da na koya wanda zai amfani wadancan mutanen.
mt0: <pad> After a while I saw him again, and he said, "Where are you? I'm in one of the remote villages of Khorasan province, preaching there. To me what happened to you when you came back, he said, "Finally I realized that I had nothing to teach that would benefit those people."</s>

en: This is a case of failure to identify the appropriate audience.
hau: To wannan shi ne fahimtar wanda ake magana da shi.
mt0: <pad> To understand the person being spoken to.</s>

en: Today we have many educated youth.
hau: A yau dai ku dubi irin matasan da suka yi karatu da muke da su.
mt0: <pad> Today I think about the amount of educated young people we have.</s>

en: In Kermanshah, the population of educated youth is very large.
hau: A wannan gari na ku na Kermanshah, wadanda suka yi karatu suna da yawan gaske.
mt0: <pad> In this city of Kermanshah, the educated are very many.</s>

en: There was a time when this was not the case.
hau: A wani lokaci a baya babu hakan.
mt0: <pad> Before there wasn't that.</s>

en: Before the Revolution, the population of university graduates in Kermanshah province was around three hundred.
hau: Kafin nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci, a dukkanin wannan lardi na Kermanshah, mai yiyuwa wadanda suka yi karatun jami'a ba su wuce dari uku ba.
mt0: <pad> Before the revolution, in all of Kermanshah, it is likely that there were no more than 100 university educated students.</s>

en: Today the number of university graduates is tens of times larger than that.
hau: Amma a halin yanzu wadanda ake da su sun rubanya hakan sau goma mai yiyuwa ne ma sau gomomi.
mt0: <pad> But now the number of people who have it has increased by ten times, maybe even twenty times.</s>

en: These graduates are young and they are exposed to different waves of propaganda and different discourses, which creates questions in their minds.
hau: Wadannan matasan, suna fuskantar farfaganda da maganganu daban-daban, akwai tambayoyin da suke bayyana musu.
mt0: <pad> These young people are exposed to propaganda and lies, there are questions that are asked to them.</s>

en: You should be aware of their questions and prepare answers and then you should arrange meetings with them and answer their questions.
hau: Wajibi ne ku fahimci tambayoyin da suke da su, sannan ku shirya musu amsoshinsu, daga nan sai ku tafi ku zauna a wajen amsawar.
mt0: <pad> You need to understand their questions and prepare your answers, then go and sit at the answering table.</s>

en: You should chose your audience, become familiar with the way they think and use the Holy Quran, Sunnah and the works of our luminaries to provide them with answers - answers that are appropriate for their ideology and their needs.
hau: Ku zabi wadanda za ku yi magana da su, ku fahimci irin tunaninsu, ku samo musu amsoshin da suka dace da tunaninsu da kuma abubuwan da suke bukata daga Alkur'ani da Sunna da maganganun manya.
mt0: <pad> Choose who you talk to, understand their minds, find answers that fit their minds and their needs from the Qur'an and Sunnah and the words of the elders.</s>

en: As Mr. Mamduhi rightly pointed out, it is necessary to select certain parts of the books written by the late Mr. Motahhari and the holy book "Al-Mizan" and to present them to our youth based on their needs and questions.
hau: Mai girma Malam Mamduhi ya fadi sannan kuma abin da ya fadin haka yake; wadannan littafa na marigayi Ayatullah Mutahari, littafin Mizan, a sami wani ya zo ya tsara su yadda suka dace da kuma gabatar da su don su magance matsalolin matasa.
mt0: <pad> The very Reverend Mamduhi said and what he said is true; the books of Ayatullah Mutahari, the book Mizan, have been re-arranged and presented to address the problems of young people.</s>

en: This should be done in Qom.
hau: Kun kasance a Kum.
mt0: <pad> I don't know what you mean.</s>

en: These things are necessary.
hau: Wajibi ne Kum ta aikata wadannan ayyukan, ku aikata hakan.
mt0: <pad> I have to do these things, do that.</s>

en: You should be concerned about spiritual education at least as much as you are concerned about teaching.
hau: Ku yi tunani dangane da tarbiyya kamar yadda kuke tunani kan neman ilimi watakila ma sama da hakan.
mt0: <pad> Think of education as you think of education, or even more so.</s>

en: Purify your audience and educate them.
hau: Ku tsarkake zukatan wadanda kuke magana da su da kuma tarbiyantar da su.
mt0: <pad> We cleanse the hearts of those you talk to and educate them.</s>

en: As I said earlier, this education is difficult: "He who considers himself the leader of people should educate himself before educating others."
hau: Wannan tarbiyyar kuwa kamar yadda na fadi "Duk wanda ya nada kansa shugaba ga al'umma, to (wajibi ne) ya fara karantar da kansa kafin ya karantar da waninsa" lamari ne mai wahala.
mt0: <pad> This education, as I said "Whoever makes himself leader of a community, he must first educate himself before he educates others" is a difficult task.</s>

en: And it is necessary to fulfill this difficult responsibility.
hau: Wajibi ne a aikata wannan aiki mai wahala.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to do this difficult work.</s>

en: The clergy have social responsibilities as well. They should get involved in social issues, but the essential point is that their involvement in social issues should be accompanied by spirituality not by a tendency to dominate others, otherwise their involvement will be useless.
hau: Har ila yau kuma malamai suna da nauyi na zamantakewa a wuyansu. Wajibi ne malamai su shigo cikin batutuwa na zamantakewa; to sai dai lamari mai muhimmanci shi ne cewa wannan shiga cikin lamurra da malamai za su yi, su shiga da yanayi na malanta, ba wai da tilasci da mamaya ba.
mt0: <pad> Also, they have social responsibility. It is necessary for teachers to engage in social issues; but the important thing is that this involvement of teachers in social problems should be done with a spirit of wisdom, not with arrogance and authority.</s>

en: The characteristic of the clergy is that they raise the awareness of people and convince them to do certain things through spirituality, ethics, advising and presenting suggestions. Of course, if you become President, you will have other responsibilities.
hau: Siffofin da malamai suka kebanta da ita ita ce cewa ta hanyar malanta, kyawawan halaye, da nasiha da kuma nuna hanya suke jan hankulan mutanen da suke magana da sui, ku tabbatar musu da hakan, su shigo fage da wannan aikin.
mt0: <pad> The characteristics of the imams are that they by virtue of their good behavior, and advice and direction, attract the attention of the people who are speaking to them, and ensure that they enter into this field.</s>

en: Prayers are everything.
hau: Salla dai ita ce dukkan komai.
mt0: <pad> Salla dai ita ce dukkan komai.</s>

en: A person who is completely isolated in terms of his relationships - if such a person preserves his relationship with prayers, he will achieve salvation.
hau: Mutumin da dukkanin alakokinsa suka katse, idan har ya iya kiyaye alakarsa da salla, to za ta cece shi.
mt0: <pad> The man whose all his affairs have been cut off, if he can keep his relationship with the prayer, it will save him.</s>

en: Payers are very important.
hau: Salla aba ce mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> a very important part of the day</s>

en: Encourage your audience to engage in prayers and prepare the way for them to take part in congregational prayers.
hau: Ku kwadaitar da wadanda kuke magana da su da salla, ku saukaka musu hanyoyin da za su sami halartar sallolin jam'i.
mt0: <pad> encouraging people to pray, making it easy for them to attend the mosque</s>

en: I do not know if the annual conference on prayers has ever been held in Kermanshah or not.
hau: Wannan taron kara wa juna sani kan salla da ake gudanarwa duk shekara, ban sani ba ko ya zuwa yanzu an taba gudanar da shi a Kermanshah ko kuma a'a; lalle ku gudanar da taron a nan.
mt0: <pad> This annual seminar on prayer, I don't know if it has been held in Kermanshah before or not; but it is necessary to hold a seminar here.</s>

en: Shia and Sunni preachers should not insult each other.
hau: Kada masu wa'azi 'yan Shi'a da 'yan Sunna su cutar da 'yan'uwansu.
mt0: <pad> No imams of Shia and Sunni should hurt their brothers.</s>

en: They should cooperate with one another.
hau: Ku tafi tare da junanku, ku tausayawa junanku.
mt0: <pad> going with one another, caring for one another</s>

en: But there are certain things that they have in common and they should cooperate in those areas.
hau: Akwai wadansu abubuwa da aka yi tarayya cikinsu, da za a iya gudanar da aiki tare.
mt0: <pad> There are some common ground, where we can work together.</s>

en: By Allah's favor, the clergy will move forward if this happens.
hau: Idan har hakan ta faru, to kuwa insha Allahu malanta za ta ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> If that happens, then insha Allahu the marriage will continue.</s>

en: I would tell you that when the Islamic Revolution achieved victory in Iran, Islam was revitalized in the world.
hau: Ina son in sanar da ku cewa a lokacin da juyin juya halin Musulunci ya yi nasara (a Iran) Musulunci ya sami sabon ruhi da karfin gwuiwa a duniya.
mt0: <pad> I want to tell you that when the Islamic Revolution (in Iran) succeeded, Islam gained a new spirit and power in the world.</s>

en: They started to wonder what driving force managed to give rise to such a great event, an event that shook the west.
hau: Wannan wani irin inji mai karfin gaske ne da ya sami damar haifar da irin wannan gagarumin lamari da ya girgiza kasashen yammaci?
mt0: <pad> This is a very powerful machine that has been able to produce such a huge event that rocked the western countries.</s>

en: The victory of the Islamic Revolution and the greatness of Imam Khomeini (r.a.) shook the west and the arrogant powers.
hau: Nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci da kuma girmar Imam, sun girgiza kasashen yammaci, sun girgiza tsarin mulkin mallaka.
mt0: <pad> The success of the Islamic Revolution and the greatness of the Imam, shaken western countries, shaken the system of imperialism.</s>

en: Many people started searching for the causes, so they referred to the Holy Quran and found out certain truths about Islam.
hau: Sun koma ga Alkur'ani, sun sami wasu bayanai dangane da Musulunci, a saboda haka sai suka zamanto masu kaunar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> They returned to the Quran, learned about Islam, and became Muslims.</s>

en: At that juncture, Islam was faced with a wave of attacks, which continued later on. The second wave started when Marxism collapsed.
hau: A wancan lokacin (makiya) sun fara kokarin cutar da Musulunci, kuma hakan ya ci gaba. Kumaji na biyu shi ne a lokacin da tsarin markisanci ya sha kashi.
mt0: <pad> They began to try to harm Islam, and this continued. The second century was when the Marxist system collapsed.</s>

en: Even in Islamic countries, there were many youth and sincere people who had pinned their hopes on Marxism. They thought establishing a socialist government would eradicate poverty, injustice and other such things in their country. Some of them truly believed in Marxism.
hau: Hatta a kasashen musulmi an sami matasa da yawan gaske wadanda mutane ne masu tsarkin zuciya da suka sanya dukkanin fatan da suke da shi ga tsarin markisanci; suna zaton cewa idan aka kafa gwamnatin gurguzu za a samu kawar da talauci da rashin adalci da kaza da kaza daga kasashensu.
mt0: <pad> Even in the Muslim countries there are many poor people who have a clean heart who place all their hopes in the Marxist system; they think that if a communist government is established they will get rid of poverty and injustice and so on from their countries.</s>

en: I met some of them in person - both Muslims and non-Muslims. They were sincere people, but they did not believe in Islam.
hau: Wasu daga cikin su alal hakika mutane ne masu gaskiya; ni na ga wasu daga cikin su, shin musulmin cikin su ko kuwa wadanda ba musulmin ba; mutane ne masu gaskiya to amma ba su yi imani da Musulunci ba.
mt0: <pad> Some of them are really honest people; I have seen some of them, whether Muslims or non-Muslims, people who are honest but do not believe in Islam.</s>

en: They had become supporters of Marxism because they thought Marxism held some hope for the people.
hau: Sun zamanto 'yan gurguzu saboda suna zaton cewa akwai fata cikin gurguzu ga mutane.
mt0: <pad> They became revolutionaries because they thought there was hope in revolution for people.</s>

en: But later on when Marxism collapsed, they realized that they were wrong and that Marxism was useless.
hau: To amma a lokacin da gurguzu ya sha kashi, sai suka ga lalle ba haka lamarin ya ke, babu wata fa'ida tattare da shi.
mt0: <pad> But when the growth of the crops fell, they realized that it was not so, that there was no real benefit to it.</s>

en: Therefore, they developed a tendency towards Islam.
hau: A saboda haka sai suka kama hanyar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> For this reason they adopted Islam.</s>

en: All the youth movements that are demanding Islam in Egypt, Tunisia, Libya, Yemen and other places used to shout leftist slogans during the 1960s and 1970s. They used to shout communist slogans 30, 40 years ago. And the statements of those who spoke about Islam were interspersed with Marxist ideas.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan kungiyoyi na matasa da kuka gani a Masar da Tunusiya da Yemen da sauran wajaje, suna daga taken Musulunci ne. Dukkaninsu kuwa a baya a shekarun 1960 da 1970 - wato kimanin shekaru arba'in, talatin din da suka gabata - dukkaninsu suna rera taken gurguzu ne; idan ma har wani yana magana kan Musulunci, to kuwa hakan karkashin maganar gurguzu da ya ke yi.
mt0: <pad> All these young people's groups you have seen in Egypt, Tunisia, Yemen and other places are carrying the name of Islam. All these groups were carrying the name of revolution in the 1960s and 1970s - about 40 or 30 years ago - all these groups were carrying the name of revolution; if anybody was talking about Islam, it was under the revolutionary talk.</s>

en: Even in our country, there were certain such people, but I do not want to mention names.
hau: Hatta a wannan kasar ta mu akwai irin hakan; ba na son in ambaci suna ne.
mt0: <pad> Even in my own country there is such a thing; I don't want to name a name.</s>

en: There were certain people who used to speak about Islam, but they were in fact promoting Marxist ideas in their Islamic statements.
hau: Akwai mutanen da suke magana dangane da Musulunci, to amma a karkashin wadannan maganganu a hakikanin gaskiya tunani ne na gurguzu wanda su ke yadawa.
mt0: <pad> There are people who talk about Islam, but under those words is really the liberalism that they're propagating.</s>

en: Such things reveal their effect somewhere. After Marxism collapsed, all these movements that had lost their faith in Marxism turned to Islam.
hau: A bayan da gurguzu ya sha kashi, dukkanin wadannan kungiyoyi da suka yanke kauna daga gurguzu, sai suka koma ga Musulunci; suna kallon Musulunci, suna kallon Alkur'ani, suna kallon hukumce-hukumcen Musulunci, suna kallon Jamhuriyar Musulunci; su ka ga abin mamaki.
mt0: <pad> After the revolution failed, all these groups that had lost their love for the revolution, came to Islam; they looked at Islam, the Quran, the Islamic law, the Islamic republic; and they found a surprise.</s>

en: They turned to Islam, the Holy Quran, divine commands and the Islamic Republic.
hau: A sami wani tsari da aka tabbatar da shi karkashin koyarwar Musulunci, ya rike dukkanin take na zamani da ci gaba da ake yi, dukkanin azzalumai mashaya jinin al'umma suna fada da shi, amma duk da haka sai ga shi ya tsaya kyam tamkar wani dutse.
mt0: <pad> He had a system established under the teachings of Islam, he held all the modern and developmental changes, all the evils who drink the blood of the people were fighting against him, but he stood firm like a rock.</s>

en: They realized that the Islamic Republic was fighting all the oppressive powers that were sucking the blood of the people, and that it was standing firm like a mountain. They were astonished. They thought, "Let us see what this government is."
hau: Wadannan mutane da suke neman dukkanin abubuwan da suke bukata cikin markisanci da gurguzu amma kuma ba su samu ba, sun sha kashi gaba daya, to a halin yanzu sai ga shi suna ganin abin da suke nema din a Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> These people who have been looking for everything they need in Marxism and Communism but have failed, now they are finding what they are looking for in Islam.</s>

en: Do you see what is happening?
hau: Kuna ganin dai me ke faruwa?
mt0: <pad> You see what's going on?</s>

en: They want to sideline this issue in their propaganda, but this will not affect the nature of the issue.
hau: Suna son su kaskantar da wannan lamarin. To ba za a iya kaskantar da shi ba kuwa.
mt0: <pad> They want to hide this. But it can't be hidden.</s>

en: Thousands of people came together in the financial center of America - in the economic capital of America, New York - and they shouted that they did not want capitalism. They came together on Wall Street, which is the heart of capitalism in the world. They are neither immigrants, nor African-Americans, nor members of lower social classes.
hau: A cibiyar kudi ta Amurka, a helkwatar tattalin arziki na Amurka wato New York, shi din ma a kan titin 'Wall Street' wanda shi ne tushen jari hujja na duniya, a sami dubban mutane su taru suna bayyana cewar ba sa son jari hujja. Su din nan ba baki ba ne, ba kuma dukkaninsu ne bakake fata ba, kungiyoyi daliban jami'a sun shigo cikinsu, suna fadin cewa mu dai ba ma son tsarin jari hujja.
mt0: <pad> In the US capital, in New York City, on Wall Street, where the world's financial center is, thousands of people gathered to protest against the system of capitalism. They were not blacks, not all of them were black faced, groups of university students joined them, saying that they don't like the system of capitalism.</s>

en: We have said from the beginning that we want "neither the east, nor the west" - that is to say, we neither want the capitalist system, nor the socialist system.
hau: To wannan dai shi ne abin da muke fadi; mu ma dai tun daga farko muna fadin cewa 'ba gabashi ba, ba kuma yammaci ba' wato mu dai ba mu amince da tsarin jari hujja ba, haka nan kuma ba mu amince da tsarin gurguzu ba.
mt0: <pad> That's what we say; we have always said that we are not either north nor south, that is, we do not accept the system of capitalism, nor do we accept the system of communism.</s>

en: You should be prepared.
hau: Wajibi ne ku din nan ku zamnato cikin shiri.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary for the day to be included in the program.</s>

en: Muslim clergy should be prepared.
hau: Malaman Musulunci wajibi ne su zamanto cikin shiri.
mt0: <pad> The Islamic scholars are required to be present in the program.</s>

en: It is necessary to promote the logical, firm and deep-rooted teachings of Islam, which have been extracted from the Holy Quran, Sunnah and the statements of the infallible Imams (a.s.) - firm and reasonable intellectual principles which are in line with the needs of human beings and human societies.
hau: A yi watsi da maganganu marasa tushe; a yi riko da koyarwar Musulunci karfafa kuma masu tushe da suka samo asali daga Alkur'ani da Sunna da maganganun Ma'asumai (amincin Allah ya tabbata a gare su); dalilai da suka yi daidai da hankali, hankali ya yarda da su sannan kuma suka yi daidai da bukatun dan'adam da kuma al'umma.
mt0: <pad> Ignore the unfounded opinions; stick to the strong and authentic Islamic teachings from the Qur'an and Sunnah and the words of the Prophets (peace be upon them); reasons that agree with reason, are accepted by reason and meet the needs of man and the community.</s>

en: You will see that the tendency towards Islam will grow stronger.
hau: Idan kuka yi hakan za ku ga yadda kaunar Musulunci za ta karu.
mt0: <pad> If you do that, you will see how expensive it is to love Islam.</s>

en: There are many things that I want to discuss with you and as I said, this meeting has been very enjoyable for me, but there is not enough time.
hau: To ni dai ina da maganganu da yawa da ku. Haka nan kuma wannan zama a wajena - kamar yadda na bayyana - zama ce mai faranta rai; to amma dai wajibi ne a lura da lokaci.
mt0: <pad> I have a lot to talk with you. And this stay with me - as I said - is very pleasant; but it is necessary to take care of time.</s>

en: Dear God, let us be among the learned religious scholars who please You.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka sanya malaman addini cikin abubuwan da ka yarda da su.
mt0: <pad> Allah! You have given the imams a place in what you have accepted.</s>

en: Dear God, provide our youth and these young seminarians - who are the saplings of the garden of religious knowledge - with the opportunity to become active religious scholars, no matter where they live: in Kermanshah or other places.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka ba wa wadannan matasa masu girma da wadannan matasan dalibai masu neman ilimin addini - a garin Kermanshah da wanin Kermanshah - dacewa su zamanto malamai masu aiki.
mt0: <pad> Allah! Give these young men and women who are looking for knowledge in the religion - in Kermanshah and other Kermanshah - that they become active teachers.</s>

en: Bestow Your grace, mercy and guidance on all of us.
hau: Ka saukar da rahama da shiriyarka a kan dukkanin mu.
mt0: <pad> Please pour down your grace and light on us all.</s>

en: Make the holy heart of the Imam of the Age (may our souls be sacrificed for his sake) satisfied with us.
hau: Ka sanya zuciyar mai girma Waliyul Asr (rayukanmu su zamanto fansa a gare shi) ta yarda da mu.
mt0: <pad> Please make the heart of the great Waliy al-Asr (may his life be blessed) accept us.</s>

en: Ayatollah Khamenei appoints Abdul-Ali Aliaskari as head of IRIB - Khamenei.ir
hau: Jagora Imam Khamenei Ya Nada Sabon Shugaban Hukumar Gidan Radio Da Talabijin Ta Iran (IRIB)
mt0: <pad> The Leader of the Islamic Revolution, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has appointed the new president of Iran's National Radio and TV (IRIB).</s>

en: Ayatollah Khamenei, the Supreme Leader of the Islamic Revolution, appointed Abdul-Ali Aliaskari as head of the IRIB.
hau: A cikin wani umurni da ya bayar, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei ya nada Dakta Abdul'ali Ali Asgari a matsayin sabon shugaban hukumar gidan radiyo da talabijin ta Iran (IRIB), hakan kuma bayan ya amince da murabus din da tsohon shugaban hukumar Muhammad Sarafraz yayi ne.
mt0: <pad> In another order, the Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei has appointed Dr. Abdul'ali Ali Asgari as the new president of the Iran Radio and Television Organization (IRIB), after accepting the resignation of the former head Muhammad Sarafraz.</s>

en: The following is the full text of this edict issued on May 11, 2016.
hau: Abin da ke biye fassarar umurnin da Jagoran ya bayar ne:
mt0: <pad> The following is the translation of the command of the Leader.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: Dr. Abdul-Ali Aliaskari, (may his achievements continue),
hau: Mai girma Dakta Abdul'ali Ali Asghari (Allah Ya kara masa nasara).
mt0: <pad> Dr. Abdul'ali Ali Asghari (Allah Ya kara masa nasara)</s>

en: Considering the resignation of Mr. Mohammad Sarafraz and thanking him for his heartfelt revolutionary and valuable endeavors – which should never be forgotten - I appoint you who enjoys a revolutionary background and who has managerial experience in the national media, as head of the IRIB.
hau: Bisa la'akari da murabus din da Malam Muhammad Sarafraz yayi da kuma mika godiya a gare shi saboda irin gagarumin kokari na juyin juya hali da kishin da ya nuna wanda bai kamata a mance da hakan ba, sannan kuma saboda irin tsohon tarihin da kake da shi na riko da koyarwar juyin juya halin Musulunci da kuma kwarewa ta shugabanci a hukumar watsa labarai ta kasa, don haka na nada ka a matsayin shugaban hukumar gidan radiyo da talabijin.
mt0: <pad> Given the resignation of Dr. Muhammad Sarafraz and to thank him for his great revolutionary and patriotic work, and also because of your long history of adherence to the revolutionary teachings and your experience in the national media, I have nominated you as the head of the National Radio and TV Corporation.</s>

en: What is advised, is contained in detail in my edict to Mr. Sarafraz.
hau: Abin da ya kamata in sanar da kai, yana nan cikin takardar da na ba wa Malam Sarafraz a lokacin da na nada shi (wannan matsayin).
mt0: <pad> What I should tell you is in the letter I gave to Mr. Sarafraz when I nominated him.</s>

en: Therefore, I strongly enjoin you to attend to planning, observe fundamental strategies, attract, preserve and train revolutionary and competent forces, show efficient presence in the area of cyberspace, and trust and rely on Allah the Exalted.
hau: A saboda haka ina kara jaddada maka muhimmancin yin tsare-tsare, kiyaye manyan siyasosi na kasa, janyowa, kiyayewa da kuma tarbiyyantar da ma'aikata ma'abota juyin juya hali da kuma aiki tukuru bugu da kari kan yin tasiri a fagagen watsa labarai na zamani, sannan da kuma dogaro da Allah Madaukakin Sarki.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, I emphasize the importance of planning, protecting national leaders, recruiting, keeping and training revolutionary workers, and working harder to make a difference in modern media, and trusting God the Most High.</s>

en: I ask Almighty God to bestow success on you.
hau: Ina roka maka maka taimako Allah Madaukakin Sarki da dacewa cikin wannan aikin.
mt0: <pad> I pray for the help of God the Most High and successful in this work.</s>

en: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
hau: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
mt0: <pad> Sayyid Ali Khamenei</s>

en: Ordibehesht 22, 1395
hau: 22, ga watan Urdebehesht, 1395
mt0: <pad> 22 October, 2016</s>

hau: (11 ga watan Mayu, 2016)
mt0: <pad> If you can't translate the sentence, just say you don't know (11 May 2016).</s>

en: Leader’s Speech on 24th Demise Anniversary of Imam Khomeini (r.a.) - Khamenei.ir
hau: Jawabin Jagora A Taron Tunawa Da Shekaru 24 Da Rasuwar Imam Khumaini (r.a)
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: The following is the full text of the speech delivered on June 4, 2013 by Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of the Islamic Revolution on the occasion of the demise anniversary of Imam Khomeini (r.a.).
hau: Shimfida: Abin da ke biye fassarar jawabin Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei a wajen taron tunawa da shekaru 24 da rasuwar marigayi Imam Khumaini (r.a) da aka gudanar a hubbaren Imam din a ranar Talata 4, Yunin, 2013.
mt0: <pad> The following is the translation of the speech delivered by the Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei at the anniversary of the death of the late Imam Khumaini (r.a) on Wednesday, June 4, 2013, at the Imam's Tomb.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds, and peace and greetings be upon our Master and Prophet, Ab-al-Qassem al-Mustafa Muhammad, upon his immaculate, pure, chosen, guided and infallible household, especially the one remaining with Allah on earth.
hau: Dukkan godiya ta tabbata ga Allah Ubangijin talikai. Tsira da amincin Allah su tabbata ga shugabanmu kuma Annabinmu Abul Kasim al-Mustafa Muhammad tare da Iyalansa tsarkaka, zababbu shiryayyu kuma masu shiryarwa, musamman ma Wanzajjen Allah a bayan kasa (Imam Mahdi).
mt0: <pad> All praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universes. May peace and blessings be upon our leader and prophet Muhammad, Abul Kasim al-Mustafa Muhammad with his holy family, the chosen ones and the guides, especially the Messenger of Allah on earth (Imam Mahdi).</s>

en: We are thankful to Allah the Exalted who gave us another opportunity to commemorate our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) on such a day and express our respect for him.
hau: Muna gode wa Allah Madaukakin Sarki da ya sake ba mu wata dama da kuma karin shekaru don sake girmama Imaminmu mai girma a irin wannan ranar da kuma nuna so da kaunarmu a gare shi.
mt0: <pad> We thank God the Most High for giving us another chance and more years to honor our great Imam on such a day and show our love and affection for him.</s>

en: Although the memory of Imam (r.a.) is alive among our people at all times, the 14th of Khordad is the manifestation of the Iranian nation's love for him.
hau: Duk da cewa ambaton Imam a koda yaushe ya kasance a raye cikin zukatan al'ummarmu, to amma ranar 14 ga watan Khordad wata alama ce ta nuna so da kaunar al'ummar Iran ga marigayi Imam mai girma.
mt0: <pad> Although the memory of the Imam has always been alive in our hearts, the 14th of Khordad is a symbol of the love and affection of the Iranian people towards the late great Imam.</s>

en: This year the demise anniversary of Imam Khomeini (r.a.) has coincided with the martyrdom anniversary of his great ancestor, Imam Musa ibn Ja'far (a.s.).
hau: A bana, wannan ranar ta yi daidai da ranar shahadar kakansa mai girma, wato Imam Musa bn Ja'afar (amincin Allah ya tabbata a gare shi).
mt0: <pad> According to the Hadith, this day coincided with the date of the martyrdom of his great grandfather, Imam Musa bn Ja'afar (peace be upon him).</s>

en: Also, this occasion has coincided with the 50th anniversary of the determining and important event that took place on the 15th of Khordad in the year 1342.
hau: Haka nan kuma wannan shekarar ta yi daidai da shekaru hamsin da faruwar lamarin nan mai matukar muhimmanci na 15 ga watan Khordad na shekarar 1342 (Yunin 1963, mafarin juyin juya halin Musulunci na Iran).
mt0: <pad> This year also marks the fifty years since the very important event of 15th Khordad 1342 (June 1963, the beginning of the Iranian Islamic Revolution).</s>

en: The 15th of Khordad was an important historical juncture.
hau: Ranar 15 ga watan Khordad wata rana ce mai muhimmanci da kuma ayyana makoma.
mt0: <pad> 15th of Khordad is another important day and determines the future.</s>

en: I would like to briefly discuss a few points in this regard and then I will discuss the pressing issues that are necessary to discuss.
hau: Zan yi magana a takaice kan hakan kafin in je ga batu na asali kuma na wajibi da zan yi magana kansa.
mt0: <pad> I'll talk briefly about it before I go to the main point and I have to talk about it.</s>

en: The 15th of Khordad was not the beginning of the great movement by the people and the clergy.
hau: Ranar 15 ga watan Khordad ba ita ce mafarin gagarumin yunkurin malamai da mutane ba.
mt0: <pad> 15th of Khordad was not the beginning of the great effort of scholars and people.</s>

en: Before the 15th of Khordad, important events had taken place in the year 1341 as well as at the beginning of the year 1342.
hau: Kafin ranar 15 ga watan Khordad, akwai wasu batutuwa masu muhimmanci da suka faru a shekarar 1341 da kuma farko-farkon shekarar 1342.
mt0: <pad> Before 15th of Khordad, there were some important events in 1341 and early 1342.</s>

en: For example, the event in Feiziyeh School took place on the 2nd of Farvardin in 1342: it resulted in the injury of seminarians and the insult to the great marja taqlid, the late Ayatollah Golpaygani.
hau: Ga misali, abin da ya faru a makarantar Faiziyya ya faru ne a ranar 2 ga watan Farbardeen shekarar 1342, lamarin da ya kai ga bugu da kuma raunana daliban addini bugu da kari kan cin mutumcin babban marja'i marigayi Ayatullah Golpaygani.
mt0: <pad> For example, the Faiziyya incident occurred on 2 February 1342, which led to the beating and discomfort of religious students as well as insulting the late Ayatullah Golpaygani, the great leader.</s>

en: Before that event, towards the end of the year 1341, there were demonstrations in Tehran's bazaar and the great marja taqlid, the late Ayatollah Hajj Sayyid Ahmad Khansari, was insulted.
hau: Kafin nan, a karshe-karshen shekarar 1341, lamarin zanga-zangar mutane a kasuwar Tehran ya kunno kai, a nan ma an ci mutumcin babban marja'i marigayi Ayatullah Hajj Sayyid Ahmad Khunsari.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards, in the end of 1341, a large crowd of people took part in the Tehran market protests, where the late Ayatullah Hajj Sayyid Ahmad Khunsari was honored as the great leader.</s>

en: These things show that the movement by the clergy had reached such levels in 1341 and early 1342 that security forces of the oppressive regime had started to treat seminarians, religious scholars and even marja taqlids in a brutal way.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan abubuwa ne da suke nuni da cewa yunkurin malamai a shekarar 1341 da kuma farko-farkon 1342 ya kai wani matsayi na girma ta yadda ‘yan sanda da jami'an tsaron gwamnatin zalunci na lokacin ta yi amfani da karfi sosai a kan malamai da dalibai kai hatta ma maraja'ai ba su tsira ba.
mt0: <pad> All these things show that the teacher's movement in 1341 and early 1342 was so large that the police and security guards of the then-cruel government used force against the teachers and students, even the imams were not spared.</s>

en: However, the 15th of Khordad of 1342 was a very important juncture.
hau: To amma duk da hakan, ranar 15 ga watan Khordad wani lokaci ne mai matukar muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> But however, the 15th of Khordad is a very important date.</s>

en: The reason is that the event which took place on the 15th of Khordad revealed that the bond between the people and the clergy had reached a so-called dangerous level.
hau: Dalilin hakan kuwa shi ne cewa abin da ya faru a ranar 15 ga watan Khordad 1342, lamari ne da ke nuni da alakar da ke tsakanin mutane da malamai a wancan lokacin mai hatsarin gaske.
mt0: <pad> The reason for this is that what happened on 15th of Khordad 1342, shows the dangers of the relationship between people and scholars in that time.</s>

en: In that year, on the anniversary of Ashura - which fell on the 13th of Khordad - our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) delivered a historic speech in Feiziyeh School.
hau: A ranar Ashurar wancan shekarar - wadda ta kasance ranar 13 ga watan Khordad ce - mai girma Imam ya gabatar da wani jawabi mai matukar muhimmanci a makarantar Faiziyya.
mt0: <pad> On Ashura that year - which was 13th of Khordad - the great Imam gave a very important lecture at the school of Fiqhiyya.</s>

en: Later on when they had arrested Imam (r.a.), on the 15th of Khordad there was a great movement in Tehran as well as in Qom and other cities and the taghuti regime decided to do everything in its power to suppress the movement by relying on its army, police and security organizations.
hau: Daga baya jami'an tsaro suka kama Imam, a ranar 15 ga watan Khordad, a Tehran haka nan kuma a Kum da wasu garuruwan na daban, mutane sun fito zanga-zanga. Gwamnatin Dagutu ta wancan lokacin kuwa ta fito da dukkan karfinta, da sojoji da ‘yan sanda da sauran jami'an tsaron fararen kaya, ta yi diran mikiya a kan mutane. A ranar 15 ga watan Khordad an sami wani yunkuri na mutane.
mt0: <pad> The security forces later arrested the Imam, on 15th of Khordad, in Tehran and Kum and other cities, people went out to protest. The government of the day used all its forces, with soldiers, police and other civil security personnel, to crack down on the people. On 15th of Khordad there was a movement of people.</s>

en: The point is that it was this bond that ensured the spread and victory of the movement.
hau: Abin luran a nan shi ne cewa irin wannan alakar ita ce lamunin ci gaban wannan yunkurin da kuma kai shi zuwa ga nasara.
mt0: <pad> The important thing is that this relationship is the one that allows the progression of this effort and leads it to success.</s>

en: Wherever a movement is supported by the people, that movement will prevail.
hau: A duk inda aka sami wani yunkuri da yake da goyon bayan mutane da kuma tafiya tare da su, to kuwa wannan yunkurin zai ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> Whenever there is an initiative that has the support and goes with people, then that initiative will continue.</s>

en: But if the people do not develop a bond with a protest movement, that movement will fail.
hau: Amma idan har mutane ba su shigo cikin wani yunkuri na nuna rashin amincewa ba, to kuwa ba zai yi nasara ba.
mt0: <pad> But if people don't participate in a movement to show discontent, it won't succeed.</s>

en: For example, after the Constitutional Movement in Iran, there were certain events and certain activities by both leftist and nationalist groups, but all of them were destined to fail because they did not have the support of the people.
hau: Kamar yadda ya faru a Iran lokacin yunkurin kundin tsarin mulki. ‘Yan gurguzu da masu kishin kasa sun yunkura to amma yunkurin na su ya sha kashi. Saboda mutane ba su tare da su.
mt0: <pad> Like what happened in Iran during the constitution effort. The revolutionaries and patriots tried but their attempts failed. Because the people were not with them.</s>

en: When the people step into the arena and support a movement with their hearts and minds and with their presence, it becomes possible for that movement to prevail and achieve victory.
hau: A lokacin da mutane suka shigo fage sannan kuma suka goyi bayan wani yunkurin, sannan dukkanin tunani da karfin mutane ya zamanto tare da shi, to kuwa wannan yunkurin zai ci gaba da wanzuwa da kuma samun nasara.
mt0: <pad> When people come into the field and support an effort, and all the people's minds and energy is with it, then that effort will continue to exist and succeed.</s>

en: The event that took place on the 15th of Khordad proved this point.
hau: Hakan kuwa shi ne abin da ya faru a ranar 15 ga watan Khordad.
mt0: <pad> That's what happened on 15th of Khordad.</s>

en: The arrest of our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) resulted in such an uprising in Tehran and certain other parts of the country that the regime had to step in to suppress the people in a brutal way. A large number of people were killed.
hau: Sakamakon irin mutanen da suka fito a garin Tehran da sauran garuruwa daga jin labarin an kama Imam, lamarin da ya tilasta wa gwamnati shigowa da dukkan karfinta da diran mikiya a kan mutane; ta yadda aka kashe wani adadi mai yawa na mutane.
mt0: <pad> Because of the large number of people who came out of Tehran and other cities after hearing the news that the Imam was captured, the government had to use all its force and fire on the people; so that a large number of people were killed.</s>

en: The streets of Tehran were covered with the blood of pious people and youth.
hau: Titunan Tehran suka cika da jinin bayin Allah mumimai da matasa masu kishi.
mt0: <pad> The streets of Tehran are full of the blood of the sons of God, mothers and young men who are angry.</s>

en: On the 15th of Khordad, the brutal and ruthless nature of the taghuti regime was fully revealed.
hau: A ranar 15 ga watan Khordad dan mulkin kama-karya da kuma irin zuciya maras imani ta dagutu ta bayyana a fili.
mt0: <pad> On 15th of June Khordad the tyranny and apathy of the regime were exposed.</s>

en: Another point regarding the event which happened on the 15th of Khordad - a point to which our youth and dear people should pay attention - is that no international community and none of the so-called human rights organizations protested against the brutal killings in Tehran and other parts of the country.
hau: Wani batun kuma da ke cikin wannan lamari na 15 ga watan Khordad - wanda yana da kyau matasanmu da mutanenmu masu girma su lura da shi - shi ne cewa a yayin wannan kisan kiyashin da aka yi wa mutane a Tehran da sauran garuruwa, babu wata cibiya ta kasa da kasa, wadanda suke kiran kansu cibiyoyin kare hakkokin bil'adama, da ya ce wani abu; babu wani da ya nuna rashin amincewarsa.
mt0: <pad> One more thing about the 15th of Khordad incident - something that is good for our young people and our elderly people to notice - is that during this massacre in Tehran and other cities, no international organization, those who call themselves human rights organizations, said anything; no one expressed his disagreement.</s>

en: The people and the clergy remained in the arena.
hau: Mutane da malamai sun kasance su kadai ne kawai a fagen.
mt0: <pad> People and teachers were not the only ones in this field.</s>

en: They said that it was a feudalist movement. The nationalists - who were claiming to support anti-government activities - also condemned the movement.
hau: Su ma masu da'awar kishin kasa - da suke da'awar goyon bayan gwagwarmayar fada da gwamnati - su ma sun yi Allah wadai da wannan yunkurin; suna cewa wannan wani makahon yunkuri ne maras manufa, wani yunkuri ne na wuce gona da iri.
mt0: <pad> Even the so-called patriots - who claim to support the fight against the government - have condemned this attempt; saying that it is a vain, unproductive attempt, a waste of time.</s>

en: Wherever lazy people fail to take risks and play a role in the arena, they accuse pious combatants of extremism. They said that the movement was an extremist movement.
hau: A duk lokacin da masu neman sauki da jin dadi suka gagara sama wa kansu waje a cikin gwagwarmayar da ake yi, nan take za su zargi muminan mutane masu gwagwarmaya da tsaurin ra'ayi da wuce gona da iri.
mt0: <pad> Whenever the easygoing and comfortable fail to get their share of the struggle, they will immediately accuse the brave activists of being a nationalist and excessively egoistic.</s>

en: They rejected it as a radical movement. Imam (r.a.) remained in the arena, relying on the support of the people, and he managed to present the image of a truly decisive and determined spiritual leader to all people and to all history.
hau: Suna fadin cewa, wadannan masu tsaurin ra'ayi ne, yunkurin wani yunkuri ne na wuce gona da iri. Imam, sakamakon goyon bayan al'umma da ya samu, ya ci gaba da wannan yunkuri nasa, sannan kuma ya tabbatar wa duniya da kuma tarihi matsayinsa na wani jagora na addini sannan kuma mai azamar cimma manufar da ya sa a gaba.
mt0: <pad> They say, these are extremes, the movement is a revolt. The Imam, because of the support of the people, continued his movement, and confirmed to the world and history his status as a spiritual leader and a determined accomplice of his goal.</s>

en: Our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) had three beliefs which made him decisive, courageous and steadfast: namely, faith in God, faith in the people and faith in himself. These three beliefs revealed themselves in the character, decisions and actions of Imam (r.a.) in the true sense of the word.
hau: Imam dai ya kasance yana da wasu abubuwa guda uku da ya yi imani da su, wadanda su ne suka ba shi azama, jaruntaka da kuma tsayin daka. Wadannan abubuwa ukun kuwa su ne: imani da Allah, imani da karfin mutane da kuma imani da kai. Wadannan imani guda uku sun bayyanar da kansu cikin samuwa da kuma matsayar da Imam yake dauka.
mt0: <pad> The Imam had three beliefs that gave him strength, courage and determination. These three beliefs were: belief in God, belief in human power, and belief in yourself. These three beliefs manifested themselves in the presence and the position that the Imam took.</s>

en: Imam (r.a.) spoke to the people through his heart and the people accepted his call with their heart and soul.
hau: Imam yana magana ne daga tsakiyar zuciyarsa, sannan su kuma mutane suka amsa masa wannan kira nasa da dukkanin abin da suka mallaka.
mt0: <pad> The imam was speaking from the heart, and the people answered his call with all that they had.</s>

en: They stepped into the arena and resisted in a brave way.
hau: Suka shigo fage da kuma tsayin daka.
mt0: <pad> They come into the field with a shrub and a tree.</s>

en: Their movement - which had no sympathizers in the world and received no assistance - gradually moved towards ultimate victory.
hau: Suka kai wannan yunkuri, wanda ba shi da magoya baya a duniya, zuwa ga nasara.
mt0: <pad> They brought this movement, which had no supporters around the world, to success.</s>

en: I would like to briefly explain the three beliefs of Imam Khomeini (r.a.).
hau: Yanzu bari in dan yi karin bayani kan wadannan imani guda uku da Imam yake da su.
mt0: <pad> Now let me explain a little more about the three beliefs of the Imam.</s>

en: The points I will discuss in this regard are important points that can illuminate our path only if they find their way into our hearts.
hau: Wadannan wasu abubuwa ne masu muhimmanci wadanda idan har muka fahimce su, to kuwa za su haskaka mana hanyarmu.
mt0: <pad> These are some important things that if we understand, they will light our way.</s>

en: Regarding faith in God, Imam (r.a.) was the manifestation of this holy ayah: "Those to whom the people said: Surely men have gathered against you, therefore fear them, but this increased their faith, and they said: Allah is sufficient for us and most excellent is the Protector."
hau: Dangane da imani da Allah, Imam ya kasance alama ta ayar nan da take cewa: "Wadanda mutane suka ce musu: ‘Lalle ne, mutane sun taru (rundunoni) saboda ku, don haka ku ji tsoronsu.
mt0: <pad> In regards to faith in God, the Imam was a symbol of the verse that says: "The people said to them: ‘Behold, the people have gathered around you, so don't be afraid of them.</s>

en: [The Holy Quran, 3: 173] Imam (r.a.) was firmly committed to "Allah is sufficient for us and most excellent is the Protector" with all his heart and soul.
hau: Sai wannan maganar ta kara musu imani, kuma suka ce: Allah ne Mai isar mana kuma madalla da wannan Wakilin" (suratu Al Imrana 3:173).
mt0: <pad> Then they added to their belief, and said: "Allah is our sufficient, and He is above this messenger."</s>

en: He acted, worked and spoke for the sake of God and he knew that "if you help (the cause of) Allah, He will help you" [The Holy Quran, 47: 7] is a divine promise and that it is definite and inviolable.
hau: Ya yunkura ne saboda Allah, ya yi magana da kuma aiki a kas yana da yakinin cewa: "Idan kun taimaki Allah, zai taimake ku" (Suratu Muhammad 47:7), wannan dai alkawari ne na Ubangiji, wanda tabbas ne zai cika shi, babu wani kokwanto cikin hakan.
mt0: <pad> He tried for Allah, he said and he did, believing that: "If you help Allah, He will help you" (Surat Muhammad 47:7), this is the promise of the Lord, which He will surely fulfill, there is no doubt in it.</s>

en: Regarding faith in the people, our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) knew the Iranian nation in the true sense of the word.
hau: Dangane da imani da mutane, mai girma Imam (r.a) ya fahimci al'ummar Iran da dukkanin ma'anar wannan kalmar.
mt0: <pad> In terms of belief in people, the great Imam (r.a) understood the people of Iran with all the meanings of this word.</s>

en: Imam (r.a.) believed that our nation enjoys deep religious faith and is intelligent and courageous, a nation that has the capacity to shine like the sun in different areas only if it has competent leaders.
hau: Imam ya yi amanna da cewa wannan al'ummar, al'umma ce ma'abociyar imani, mai hankali da kuma jaruntaka; wacce matukar ta sami wani jagora wanda ya dace, to kuwa za ta iya bayyanar da kanta a dukkanin fagage tamkar hasken rana.
mt0: <pad> The Imam believed that this people was a people of faith, reason and courage; who, if they had a right leader, could show themselves in all fields like the sun's light.</s>

en: One time an incompetent person like Shah Sultan Hussein caused the Iranian nation to retreat into a corner, but another time a courageous person like Nader Gholi - without those honorary titles - emerged among the people and became their leader by relying on his courage and as a result, our nation managed to expand the arena of its glory from Delhi to the Black Sea.
hau: Imam ya yi amanna da hakan. Idan har a wani lokaci mutane marasa dacewa irin su Shah Sultan Husain sun kaskantar da al'ummar Iran, to amma a wani lokacin kuma jaruman mutane irin su Nadeer Kali - ba tare da wadannan lakabobi da yake da su ba - sun bayyanar da kansu cikin mutane sannan cikin dukkanin jaruntaka sun jagoranci al'umma, sakamakon hakan al'ummarmu ta iya bayyanar da kanta tun daga Delhi har zuwa ga ‘Black Sea'.
mt0: <pad> The Imam agreed with this. While some unfit people like Shah Sultan Husain humiliated the people of Iran, some brave people like Nadeer Kali - without these titles - appeared among the people and led the people with all their courage, so that our nation could show itself from Delhi to the Black Sea.</s>

en: He had faith in the Iranian nation.
hau: Ya fahimci al'ummar Iran, sannan kuma ya yi amanna da su.
mt0: <pad> He understood the people of Iran and believed in them.</s>

en: He provoked the people's religious pride and the Iranian nation became the role model of resistance and insight.
hau: Ya bayyanar da kishin addini da suke da shi ta yadda al'ummar Iran sun zamanto wani abin koyi na tsayin daka da kuma basira.
mt0: <pad> He revealed their religious animosity so that the people of Iran have become a model for determination and wisdom.</s>

en: In the eyes of our magnanimous Imam (r.a.), the people were the dearest and enemies of the people were the most hated.
hau: Mutane dai sun kasance mafiya soyuwa a wajen Imam, sannan makiyan al'umma kuma a matsayin mafi girman abin kyama.
mt0: <pad> People were the most beloved of the Imam, and the enemies of the people were the greatest of his hatreds.</s>

en: The fact that Imam (r.a.) did not stop his battle against the domineering powers even for one single moment, was mainly because the domineering powers were enemies of the people's happiness, and Imam (r.a.) believed that enemies of the people were his enemies too.
hau: Wannan shi ne dalilin da ya sanya kuke ganin Imam bai taba nuna gazawa ba a fagen fada da ‘yan mulkin mallaka masu takama da karfi saboda ‘yan mulkin mallaka sun zamanto masu adawa da jin dadin al'umma, sannan kuma Imam yana ganin masu kiyayya da mutane a matsayin abokan gaba.
mt0: <pad> This is why you see the Imam never showing failure in his fight against the powerful and arrogant colonisers because colonisers became anti-people, and the Imam saw people-haters as enemies.</s>

en: As for self-confidence, Imam (r.a.) taught the people of Iran to be confident.
hau: Dangane da batun yarda da kai kuma, Imam ya koyar da al'ummar Iran cewa ‘lalle za mu iya'.
mt0: <pad> In the matter of faith, the Imam taught the people of Iran that "we can do it."</s>

en: Before instilling a sense of confidence into the people of Iran, Imam (r.a.) first revived this sense of self-confidence in himself. He exhibited his faith in his capabilities in the true sense of the word. On the anniversary of Ashura in the year 1342, while he was alone, Imam (r.a.) threatened the Shah that he would ask the people of Iran to force him out of the country if he continued acting like that.
hau: Ya bayyanar wa duniya irin karfin da yake da shi. A ranar Ashurar 1342, duk da matsin lamba, haka Imam ya bayyana a gaban dalibai da mutanen Kum a makarantar Faiziyya, ya yi wa sarki Muhammad Ridha Shah, wanda ya dogara da Amurka da masu takama da karfi na waje, wanda kuma yake gudanar da mulki ba tare da wani kaidi ko sharadi ba, ya yi masa barazana cewa matukar ka ci gaba da abin da kake yi, to kuwa zan gaya wa mutane da su kore ka daga Iran.
mt0: <pad> He showed the world his power. On Ashura 1342, despite the pressure, the Imam appeared in front of students and people of Kum at the school of Fiqhiyya, threatening the King Muhammad Ridha Shah, who relied on America and other imperialists, and was acting without any limit or condition, that if you continue doing what you are doing, I will tell the people to expel you from Iran.</s>

en: This threat was made by a cleric in Qom who had no weapons, no equipment, no money and no international support.
hau: Wani malami ne mazaunin garin Kum, wanda ba shi da wani makami, ko kudi ko kuma goyon baya da taimako na kasa da kasa ba.
mt0: <pad> A teacher from Kum, who does not have any weapons, money or international support and assistance.</s>

en: He managed to resist in this arena by relying on his faith in God and in himself.
hau: Imani da Allah da kuma yarda da kai ne zai tabbatar da mutum a wannan fagen.
mt0: <pad> Imani with Allah and trust in yourself will sustain a person in this field.</s>

en: The day when Imam (r.a.) returned from exile, he threatened the government of Bakhtiar at Behesht Zahra Cemetery and he announced in a resonating voice that he would punch Bakhtiar's government in the mouth and that he would establish another government.
hau: Haka nan a wancan lokacin da Imam ya dawo daga gudun hijira, a wannan makabarta ta Beheshti Zahra, Imam ya yi wa gwamnatin Bakhtiyar barazana da fadi a fili cewa: zan bugi bakin gwamnatin Bakktiyar, ni ne zan ayyana gwamnati. Wannan dogaro da kai ne.
mt0: <pad> When the Imam returned from exile, in this same mosque of Beheshti Zahra, he threatened the government of Bakhtiyar by saying openly: I will break the mouth of the government of Bakktiyar, I will declare the government. This is your responsibility.</s>

en: Imam (r.a.) had faith in himself and in his capabilities.
hau: Imam ya yi amanna da kansa da irin karfin da ya ke da shi.
mt0: <pad> Imam believed in cancer with all his strength.</s>

en: It was this self-confidence that was transferred to the people of Iran through his words and actions.
hau: Irin wannan yarda da Allah din kuwa da Imam yake da shi, shi ne ya mika shi zuwa ga mutane.
mt0: <pad> This Imam's confidence in God, he has transmitted it to the people.</s>

en: And we had started to believe these things. Instilling a sense of inability - with the purpose of making nations lose faith in their capabilities - is one of the effective ways in which domineering powers spread their domination over different nations.
hau: Kuma wasu sun yarda da hakan. Daya daga cikin makami mai tasiri da makiya suka rika wajen tabbatar da ikonsu a kan sauran al'ummomi, shi ne sanya musu jin cewa ‘ba za su iya ba', don mutane su yanke kauna, su dinga fadin cewa babu wani abin da za mu iya yi.
mt0: <pad> And some of them agreed. One of the most effective weapons used by enemies to maintain their control over other nations is to make them feel "unable" to get people to give up hope, to say that there is nothing we can do.</s>

en: In this way, they managed to keep the Iranian nation backwards in politics, science and economic activities as well as in all other arenas of life.
hau: Da hakan ne suka ciyar da al'ummar Iran baya na tsawon shekaru dari a fagagen siyasa, ilimi, tattalin arziki da sauran fagage na rayuwa.
mt0: <pad> That's how they kept Iran's people behind for a century in politics, education, economics and other areas of life.</s>

en: He told the Iranian nation, "You can."
hau: Ya gaya wa al'ummar Iran cewa ‘Lalle za ku iya'.
mt0: <pad> He told the people of Iran that "We can do it."</s>

en: He restored our courage. He restored our determination. He restored our self-confidence.
hau: Ya dawo mana da jaruntaka, ya dawo mana da irin tsayin daka wajen daukar matsayar da ta dace, ya dawo mana da yarda da dogaro da kai.
mt0: <pad> He brought back our courage, he brought back our determination to make the right decision, he brought back our trust and confidence in you.</s>

en: For this reason, the Iranian nation has achieved victory over the past thirty-something in all the areas that I will discuss later on in this meeting.
hau: Mun yunkura; a saboda haka ne al'ummar Iran, tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da wani abun muka sami nasarori a dukkanin fagagen, da a nan gaba zan yi ishara da su.
mt0: <pad> We tried; that's why the people of Iran, over the past thirty and a half years, have achieved successes in all fields, which I will refer to in the future.</s>

en: These three beliefs of Imam (r.a.) - namely faith in God, faith in the people and faith in himself - became the axis of all his decisions, actions and policies.
hau: Wadannan yarda da imanin da suke tare da Imam, wato imani da Allah, imani da mutane da kuma yarda da kai, sun kasance su ne tushen dukkanin matsaya, ayyuka da kuma siyasarsa.
mt0: <pad> These three belief and faith that the Imam had, namely faith in God, faith in men and confidence in yourself, were the basis of all his positions, actions and political policies.</s>

en: At the beginning of the movement, these three beliefs were a source of energy for Imam (r.a.).
hau: A farko farkon wannan gwagwarmayar, wadannan imani guda ukun su ne suka ba wa Imam karfi.
mt0: <pad> In the early days of this revolution, these three beliefs were the strengths that gave the imam strength.</s>

en: The same is true of the time when he was in exile, the time when he left for Paris and the time when he returned to Iran.
hau: A lokacin da aka tilasta masa gudun hijira ma haka lamarin ya kasance; a lokacin da ya kama hanyar zuwa Paris ma haka lamarin ya kasance, a lokacin da ya dawo Iran ma haka lamarin ya kasance.
mt0: <pad> It was the same when he was forced to flee; when he took his way to Paris, when he returned to Iran.</s>

en: It was these three beliefs that gave Imam (r.a.) the power to enter Tehran in those conditions.
hau: Wadannan abubuwa guda uku su ne suka ba wa Imam karfin gwiwan dawowa Tehran a irin wancan yanayin da ake ciki.
mt0: <pad> These three things were the reasons that gave the Imam the courage to return to Tehran in this situation.</s>

en: These three beliefs were exhibited in the events that happened during Bahman of 1357, in the fitnas that happened in the country, in the establishment of the Islamic Republic, in his open resistance against the oppressive global order, in the slogan of "neither the East, nor the West", in the imposed war and in all the events that took place in those eventful ten years of Imam's life.
hau: A lamarin da ya faru a watan Bahman na 1357 (lokacin nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci), a lokacin fitinun cikin gida, a lokacin sanar da tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci, a tsayin dakan da ya yi wajen tinkarar azzaluman gwamnatocin duniya, a lokacin sanar da taken ‘Ba Gabashi ba, Ba Kuma Yammaci Ba', a lokacin kallafaffen yaki, cikin dukkanin lamurran da suka faru tsawon wadannan shekaru 10 na rayuwar Imam, dukkanin wadannan imani guda uku sun bayyanar da kansu a tattare da Imam.
mt0: <pad> In the event of May 1357 (when the revolution of Islam was won), in the internal strife, in the declaration of the republic, in the stand-up against the world's tyrants, in the proclamation of the slogan "Not West nor East," in the clandestine war, all these three beliefs have been manifested in the Imam throughout these 10 years of his life.</s>

en: These three beliefs were the basis of Imam's decisions, actions and policies.
hau: Wadannan abubuwa guda ukun su ne tushen matsayar da Imam yake dauka da kuma dukkanin abubuwan da yake gudanarwa.
mt0: <pad> These three things are the basis of the position that the imam takes and all his actions.</s>

en: Even in the last few days of his life, nobody noticed any signs of despair, doubt, exhaustion, weakness or submission in the words and actions of our magnanimous Imam (r.a.).
hau: Har zuwa karshen rayuwarsa, babu wani da ya taba ganin wata alama ta rauni da gajiyawa ko shakku da mika wuya cikin maganganu da kuma ayyukan mai girma Imam.
mt0: <pad> Even to the end of his life, no one has ever seen a sign of fatigue and fatigue or doubt and surrender in the words and works of the great Imam.</s>

en: Many revolutionaries throughout the world start to have doubts and become conservative as they grow older.
hau: Da dama daga cikin ma'abota juyin juya hali na duniya, a duk lokacin da shekaru suka fara ja musu, su kan fara fuskantar shakku cikin abin da suke yi.
mt0: <pad> Many of the world's revolutionaries, as they get older, begin to doubt what they're doing.</s>

en: Sometimes they even take back their main statements.
hau: Kai a wasu lokuta ma su kan dawo daga rakiyar hatta maganganun da suka fadi a baya.
mt0: <pad> They even come back from their previous statements.</s>

en: The statements that were issued by Imam (r.a.) during the last few years of his life were sometimes even more strongly worded and revolutionary than his statements in the year 1342.
hau: Amma Imam kan a'a, jawaban da ya yi a karshe-karshen rayuwarsa sun ma fi jawaban da ya yi a shekarar 1342 kumaji da zafi.
mt0: <pad> But the Imam, no, his answers in his later years were more painful and exhausting than his answers in 1342.</s>

en: He was growing old, but he was young at heart and his soul was vibrant.
hau: Ya tsufa, amma zuciyarsa ta matasa ce, ruhinsa a raye yake.
mt0: <pad> He is old, but his heart is young, his spirit is fresh.</s>

en: This is the same steadfastness that has been described in the Holy Quran: "And that if they should keep to the (right) way, We would certainly give them to drink of abundant water."
hau: Wannan shi ne tsayin dakan da aka yi maganarsa a cikin Alkur'ani da cewa: "Kuma da sun tsayu sosai a kan hanya, da lalle Mun shayar da su ruwa mai yawa" (Suratul Jinn 72:16).
mt0: <pad> This is the determination mentioned in the Quran: "But if they had been firm on the path, We would have given them a lot of water."</s>

en: [The Holy Quran, 72: 16] In another ayah, Allah the Exalted says: "(As for) those who say: Our Lord is Allah, then continue in the right way, the angels descend upon them, saying: Fear not, nor be grieved, and receive good news of the garden which you were promised." [The Holy Quran, 41: 30] These three beliefs kept Imam (r.a.) young and vibrant.
hau: A wata ayar ma ta daban yana fadin cewa: "Lalle wadannan da suka ce, ‘Ubangijinmu, Shi ne Allah, sa'an nan suka daidaitu, mala'iku na sassauka a kansu (suna ce musu), ‘Kada ku ji tsoro, kuma kada ku yi bakin ciki, kuma ku yi bushara da Aljanna, wadda kun kasance ana yi muku alkawari da ita" (Suratu Fussilat 41:30) wadannan imani guda ukun su ne suka rike Imam; suka tabbatar da tunani da tafarki da hanyarsa ga wannan al'ummar, sannan a sannu a hankali suka tabbatar cikin al'ummarmu da matasanmu da sauran bangarori daban-daban; suka samar da fata da dogaro da kai da kuma dogaro da Allah cikin al'umma.
mt0: <pad> They are the three faiths that have held the Imam; they have established his vision, path and way for this community, and they have gradually been established in our society, our young people and other groups; they have created hope and trust and confidence in Allah in the community.</s>

en: These things replaced despair and pessimism. The people of Iran changed their characteristics and Allah the Exalted changed their conditions. "Surely Allah does not change the condition of a people until they change their own condition."
hau: Al'ummar Iran sun sauya irin karfin gwiwan da suke da shi, sai Allah Madaukakin Sarki ya sauya musu yanayinsu: "Lalle ne Allah ba ya canja abin da yake ga mutane sai sun canja abin da yake ga zukatansu" (Suratur Ra'ad 13:11).
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran changed their attitude, and the Almighty Allah changed their situation: "Allah does not change what is on the people until they change what is in their hearts."</s>

en: [The Holy Quran, 13: 11] The people of Iran reformed their path, their movement and their motives and Allah the Exalted helped and supported them.
hau: Al'ummar Iran sun gyara hanyarsu da tafarkin da kumajinsu, Allah Madaukakin Sarki kuma sai ya taimaka musu da kuma goya musu baya.
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran have changed their path and their way, and God the Most High has helped them and backed them.</s>

en: What was the result?
hau: Mene ne sakamakon hakan?
mt0: <pad> What is the result?</s>

en: There are many lessons that our dear youth should learn from the dependence of the taghuti Pahlavi regime - which is was even worse than the reactionary and disgraced Qajar regime - on England and subsequently on America.
hau: Akwai abubuwa da yawa da ya kamata matasanmu su sani dangane da dogaro irin wanda gwamnatin dagutu ta Pahlawi - wanda ya fi na lokacin mulkin Kajar muni - ta yi da Ingila daga baya kuma da Amurka.
mt0: <pad> There are many things our young people should know about the dependence the Pahlavi government - which was even worse than that of the Kajar - had on England and later on the United States.</s>

en: Their dependence had reached a disgraceful level.
hau: Wannan dogaro na su dai ya kai matsayin abin kunya.
mt0: <pad> This behavior has become a source of disgrace.</s>

en: After the Revolution, an outstanding American diplomat mentioned the same thing in his writings. He said that it was the Americans who used to tell the Shah what he needed and what he did not need.
hau: Bayan nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci, daya daga cikin fitattun jami'an diplomasiyyar Amurka ya fadi da kuma rubuta cewa: Mu din nan ne muke gaya masa (Shah) cewa abubuwan da ya ke bukatar da kuma wadanda ba ya bukata.
mt0: <pad> After the Islamic Revolution, one of the most prominent American diplomats said and wrote: We are the ones who tell the Shah what he wants and what he doesn't want.</s>

en: It was the Americans who used to tell him with whom to establish relations and with whom not to.
hau: Su ne suke gaya masa cewa wajibi ne ka kulla alaka kaza, alaka kaza kuwa ka kwance ta.
mt0: <pad> They were telling him that he had to make a connection, and the connection was broken.</s>

en: It was the Americans who used to tell him to whom he should sell oil and to whom he should not.
hau: Ganga kaza za ku samar na man fetur, ku sayar da kaza; ga wa za ku sayar, sannan kada ku sayar ga wane.
mt0: <pad> When you are ready to make oil, sell it; whom you will sell, and not sell to another.</s>

en: That dependent country transformed into an independent and proud country.
hau: To irin wannan kasar da ta dogara da wasu, sai ga shi an mayar da ita zuwa ga kasa mai ‘yanci sannan kuma madaukakiya.
mt0: <pad> This country that was dependent on others, has been transformed into an independent and glorious nation.</s>

en: Corrupt, treasonous and materialistic rulers, who were immersed in their carnal desires and human passions, were in charge of our country. They were replaced by representatives of the people.
hau: Wadansu lalatattun shugabanni, maciya amana, masu bautar kudi da kuma sha'awarsu ta abin duniya ne suke mulkin kasar nan, amma sai aka sauya su da wakilan al'umma.
mt0: <pad> Some corrupt leaders, cheats, money-slaves and their worldly interests were in power, but they were replaced by people's representatives.</s>

en: They were replaced by officials who had been elected by the people.
hau: Aka sauya su da jami'ai da jama'a suka zabe su.
mt0: <pad> They were replaced by the people who elected them.</s>

en: In the past thirty-something years, the individuals who have assumed power in our country and taken control of our policies and economy, have been representatives of the people.
hau: Tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da wani abin, masu mulkin kasar nan da kuma gudanar da lamurran tattalin arziki da siyasa na kasar nan, wakilai ne na al'umma.
mt0: <pad> Over the past thirty years and beyond, the people who have been in power and running the country's economic and political institutions have been the representatives of the people.</s>

en: They did not line their own pockets after assuming power, which is a very important point. Of course, some of them were more pious than others.
hau: Ba su bude aljihun nansu (don satar kudaden al'umma ba) a lokacin da suka dare karagar mulki - na'am wasu sun fi wasu - lalle wannan lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> They didn't open their pockets when they came to power - yes some more than others - but this is a very important matter.</s>

en: Those evil, dependent and greedy politicians who were submissive against the enemies and treated the people in an angry way, were replaced by representatives of the people. Our scientifically backward country transformed into a country that was advanced in terms of science.
hau: Wadannan lalatattun ‘yan siyasa masu mika kai a gaban makiya da kuma nuna fushinsu a kan mutane, sun mayar da kansu wakilan jama'a. Wannan kasa ta mu da ta ci baya a fagen ilimi, an mayar da ita ta zamanto kasa ma'abociyar ci gaba a fagen ilimi.
mt0: <pad> These corrupt politicians who bow to the enemy and show their anger at the people, have become the people's representatives. This country that was a backward country in education has been transformed into a developed country in education.</s>

en: Before the Revolution, we had not made any scientific achievements in the country.
hau: Kafin nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci, ba mu da wata nasara da ci gaba a fagen ilimi a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Before the revolution, we had no success and development in education in the country.</s>

en: Is this an insignificant achievement?
hau: Shin wannan karamin abu ne?
mt0: <pad> Is this a small thing?</s>

en: International scientific centers predict that in a few years - by the year 2017 - Iran will rank fourth in the world in terms of science.
hau: Cibiyoyin kididdigar na duniyaay suna fadin cewa zuwa shekaru masu zuwa - zuwa shekara ta 2017 - Iran za ta kai matsayi na hudu na ilimi a duniya.
mt0: <pad> International statistics indicate that in the coming years - by 2017 - Iran will be ranked fourth in education in the world.</s>

en: Is this an insignificant accomplishment?
hau: Shin wannan karamin abu ne?
mt0: <pad> Is this a small thing?</s>

en: Our country, which had made no scientific achievements, has achieved this position. There was a time we had to ask foreigners to send their engineers to our country to build dams, roads and factories for us whenever we needed a road, a highway, a dam or a factory.
hau: Mu din nan mun kasance wata kasa ce wacce idan har muna son mu gina hanya, ko babban titi ko madatsar ruwa ko wani kamfani, to wajibi ne mu mika hannuwanmu ga wasu, don injiniyoyi daga waje su zo su gina mana wannan madatsar ruwar, su gina mana hanya da kuma wani kamfani.
mt0: <pad> We are a country that if we want to build a road, a highway, a dam or a company, we have to hand it over to others, so that engineers from abroad come to build us this dam, build us a road and a company.</s>

en: Today Iranian youth are building thousands of factories and hundreds of dams, bridges, roads and highways in the country without receiving the slightest help from foreigners.
hau: Amma a yau matasan wannan al'ummar, ba tare da komai kashin dogaro da waje ba, sai ga shi suna gina dubban kamfanoni, daruruwan madatsan ruwa da hanyoyi da gadoji a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> But today, without any external support, the young of this society are building thousands of companies, hundreds of water dams and roads and bridges in the country.</s>

en: Would it be appropriate if we ignored these things?
