hau: Shin ya dace a ce mu rufe idanuwanmu kan dukkanin wadannan abubuwan?
mt0: <pad> Is it right for us to close our eyes to all these things?</s>

en: In areas relating to health and medicine, Iranian patients who had the money had to travel to Europe for slightly complicated operations, and those who did not have the money had to die.
hau: A fagen kiwon lafiya da magunguna, saboda dan wani karamin ciwo ko aikin tiyata, wajibi ne marasa lafiyanmu su tafi asibitocin kasashen Turai, idan suna da kudi kenan, idan kuwa ba su da shi, to sai dai su mutu.
mt0: <pad> In the field of medicine and drugs, for just a little pain or operation, our patients are obliged to go to European hospitals, if they have money, if they don't have it, they will die.</s>

en: Today the most complicated operations - liver transplants, lung transplants and important things in other medical areas - are being carried out in our country, not just in Tehran but in many distant cities across the country.
hau: Amma a yau a kasar mu ana gudanar da mafi rikitarwar ayyukan tiyata irin su dashen hanta ko huhu da sauran ayyukan tiyata masu muhimmanci da kuma girma. Ba wai kawai a Tehran ba, da dama daga cikin sauran garuruwa ma ana yi.
mt0: <pad> But nowadays in our country we have the most complicated surgeries such as liver transplants or kidney transplants and other important and large surgeries. Not only in Tehran, but in many other cities too.</s>

en: The Iranian nation does not need foreigners in this area.
hau: Al'ummar Iran dai ba ta bukatar wasu ‘yan waje a wannan fagen.
mt0: <pad> Iran does not need any outside help in this field.</s>

en: Our nation has achieved independence and self-sufficiency in this vital area.
hau: Mun kai matsayin dogaro da kanmu a wannan bangare mai matukar muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> We have reached the level of self-sufficiency in this very important area.</s>

en: Many parts of this country had been ignored.
hau: A wancan lokacin an yi watsi da da dama daga cikin yankunan kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> At that time many of the areas of the country were neglected.</s>

en: Before the Revolution, I used to travel to different places across the country.
hau: Kafin nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci na ziyarci garuruwa da kauyuka masu yawa na kasar nan, babu komai kashin kula da ake ba wa yankunan karkara.
mt0: <pad> Before the revolution, there was little attention given to rural areas.</s>

en: However, different services are being offered in different parts of the country, including remote towns and villages.
hau: To amma a yau din nan kan ana ci gaba da yin hidima daban-daban a duk fadin kasar nan, a garuruwan da suke nesa da kuma kauyuka daban-daban.
mt0: <pad> But today, there are still various services all over the country, in remote towns and villages.</s>

en: Today nobody can say that a particular area does not have electricity or roads and other such things.
hau: A yau babu wani da zai iya cewa waje kaza ba su da wutan lantarki ko kuma a matsayin misali hanyoyi da sauransu.
mt0: <pad> Today no one can say that some places don't have electric power or as an example roads and so on.</s>

en: Today the opposite is surprising. At that time, our population was 35 million and there were 150,000 university students in the country.
hau: A wancan lokacin kafin nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci adadin mutanen kasar mutane miliyan talatin da biyar ne, a lokacin daliban jami'a su dubu dari da hamsin ne.
mt0: <pad> The population of the country was 35 million people before the Islamic Revolution, at that time there were 150 university students.</s>

en: Today our population has increased a hundred percent, but the number of our university students has increased by 20, even 30 times.
hau: A yau adadin mutanen ya ninka sau biyu, amma adadin daliban jami'a ya ninka sau ashirin, kai zuwa sau talatin ma.
mt0: <pad> Today the population has doubled, but the number of university students has doubled twenty times, or even thirty times.</s>

en: The number of students, professors and universities in the country is remarkable.
hau: Yawan daliban jami'a yana nufin yawan malamai da jami'oi.
mt0: <pad> The number of university students does not mean the number of professors and universities.</s>

en: In every remote town, there are one, two, five and sometimes ten universities.
hau: A kowane gari da ke nesa a kan sami jami'a guda, a wani wajen ma biyu, biyar, kai wani wajen ma goma.
mt0: <pad> Every twenty miles there is a university, in some places two, five, and in some places ten.</s>

en: At that time, there were certain provinces in which the number of high schools was less than ten.
hau: A wancan lokacin akwai wata jihar ma da adadin makarantun sakandare ba su kai yawan yatsun hannu ba.
mt0: <pad> At that time there was a state with the number of high schools less than the number of fingers.</s>

en: Today in every city of the same provinces, there are several universities.
hau: Amma a yau a wannan jihar, a kowane birnin cikinta akan sami jami'oi a ciki.
mt0: <pad> But now in this state, every city in it has a university.</s>

en: This is a great movement by the people of Iran which is the result of the Revolution and selfless efforts of Iranian youth and government officials over the past thirty-something years.
hau: Wannan shi ne gagarumin yunkurin al'ummar Iran albarkacin wannan juyi da kuma himmar matasa da jami'anmu. Hakan abubuwa ne da suka faru tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da wani abu.
mt0: <pad> This is a great effort by the people of Iran thanks to this revolution and the courage of our young people and our soldiers. Those are things that have happened over the past thirty and a half years.</s>

en: These are important developments.
hau: Wadannan abubuwa ne masu muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> These things are important.</s>

en: Thanks to the Revolution, many infrastructure-related projects were carried out in the country. Thousands of factories were built. Many mother companies were built.
hau: Albarkacin wannan juyi, an gudanar da ayyuka masu muhimmanci kuma na asasi a kasar nan. An samar da dubban kamfanoni a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Under this framework, important and fundamental work has been done in the country. Thousands of companies have been created in the country.</s>

en: The products which we had to beg for and buy in small amounts from foreigners are being mass produced in the country today.
hau: Kayayyakin da a da cikin bara da kankan da kai muke sawo su daga kasashen waje, amma a yau sai ga shi ana kera su da yawa a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> The products that we used to import from abroad, but now they are being produced in our country.</s>

en: It is necessary to see these things.
hau: Wajibi ne a kalli wadannan abubuwan.
mt0: <pad> These things are important to look at.</s>

en: All of these things are the blessings of the three beliefs that Imam (r.a.) instilled into our nation: faith in God, faith in the people and faith in oneself.
hau: An samu wadannan abubuwan ne albarkacin wadannan yarda da kuma imani guda uku da Imam ya sanya su cikin zukatan al'ummar kasar, wato imani da Allah, imani da mutane da kuma yarda da kai.
mt0: <pad> These things were achieved thanks to the three trusts and faiths that the Imam put into the hearts of the people of the country, namely faith in God, faith in mankind and faith in yourself.</s>

en: I am not saying these things in order to create a false sense of pride and happiness.
hau: Ba wai muna fadin wadannan maganganu ne don jiji da kai na karya ya taso mana ba, mu ji dadi da farin ciki ba.
mt0: <pad> We are not saying these things to make us feel good and happy, to make us feel proud and accomplished.</s>

en: No, there is still a long way to go.
hau: A'a, har ya zuwa yanzu akwai babban aiki a gabanmu.
mt0: <pad> No, there is a great job to be done.</s>

en: I would say that if we compare our conditions with the era of taghut, these achievements will look remarkable, but we will realize that we have a long way to go if we compare our conditions with the conditions of an ideal Islamic Iran - namely, a country which Islam wants us to have, a society that Islam wants us to have, a society in which there is worldly pride and welfare as well as religious faith, ethics and spirituality, all in abundance.
hau: Ina son in sanar da ku cewa; idan har muka kwatanta kanmu da lokacin dagutu, to lalle za a iya ganin irin wannan nasarar a fili. To amma idan har muka kwatanta kanmu da irin abin da Musulunci yake son ganin, wato irin kasa da kuma al'ummar da Musulunci yake son gani; wato al'ummar da a cikinta akwai daukaka ta duniya, jin dadi na duniya, haka nan kuma da imani da kyawawan halaye da tsoron Allah; to lalle kan akwai tazara sosai a tsakaninmu.
mt0: <pad> I want to tell you that; if we compare ourselves to the past, we can see this success clearly. But if we compare ourselves to what Islam wants us to be, a country and society that has the dignity of this world, the enjoyment of this world, and also with faith and good qualities and fear of God; then there is a great distance between us.</s>

en: I am saying these things so that our dear youth and our courageous nation realize that they can continue this path by relying on the three beliefs that I spoke about.
hau: Ina fadin hakan ne saboda al'ummarmu masu girma da kuma jaruntaka su san cewa za a samu nasarar ci gaba da bin wannan tafarkin ne ta hanyar riko da wadannan imani guda ukun.
mt0: <pad> I say this so that our elderly and younger people know that we can only continue to follow this path by holding on to these three beliefs.</s>

en: You should know that there is a long way to go, but you have the capability.
hau: Su san cewa lalle akwai doguwar hanya a gaba; to amma za ku iya, kuna da karfin hakan da kuma damar hakan.
mt0: <pad> They know that there is a long way to go; but you can, you have the power and the ability to do it.</s>

en: You can continue traversing this long path at a high speed until you reach the peaks in a powerful way.
hau: Lalle za ku iya ci gaba da bin wannan doguwar hanyar har zuwa ga wannan kololuwar inda ake son isa gare shi.
mt0: <pad> You can certainly continue to follow this long way towards the end of the goal.</s>

en: I am saying these things so that you realize that the enemies who want to create despair in our hearts are acting out of spite.
hau: Ina fadin wadannan kalmomi ne saboda ku san cewa kokarin makiya na sanya yanke kauna a cikin zukatanmu, suna yin hakan ne saboda kiyayya.
mt0: <pad> I say these words so that you know that the efforts of our enemies have caused the breakdown of love in our hearts, they do it for hatred.</s>

en: The roadmap lies in front of our eyes.
hau: Taswirar hanyar dai tana a gabanmu.
mt0: <pad> The map of the route is before us.</s>

en: We have a roadmap.
hau: Muna da taswirar hanya.
mt0: <pad> We have a map of the route.</s>

en: What is this roadmap?
hau: Mece ce taswirar hanyarmu?
mt0: <pad> Please, can you please describe your route?</s>

en: Imam's principles are clear principles. Fortunately, his statements and writings have been made available to our people in the form of twenty-something volumes [of Imam Khomeini's speeches] and the main points have been presented in his testament.
hau: Wannan koyarwar, ita ce koyarwar da a ci gaba da tafiya za ta taimaka mana da kuma ci gaba da ayyana mana taswirar hanyarmu. Koyarwar Imam dai a fili take. Abin farin cikin shi ne cewa jawaban Imam da rubuce-rubucensa suna nan a tattare da mu cikin mujalladai ashirin da wani abu.
mt0: <pad> This teaching is the teaching that will help us and continue to define our path. The Imam's teaching is clear. We are happy that the Imam's words and writings are still with us in the twelve-volume Majallah.</s>

en: I believe it is not advisable to keep mentioning the name of Imam (r.a.) but let his principles sink into oblivion. This is wrong.
hau: Ni dai bana ganin wani amfani cikin mu yi riko da sunan Imam, amma kuma mu mance da koyarwarsa. Lalle wannan kuskure ne.
mt0: <pad> I don't see any benefit in holding the name of the imam, but forgetting his teachings. Surely this is a mistake.</s>

en: Imam (r.a.) gave this roadmap to us.
hau: Taswirar hanyar tana tare da Imam, sannan shi kuma ya gabatar mana da ita.
mt0: <pad> The map of the route is with the Imam, and he has presented it to us.</s>

en: As far as foreign policy is concerned, the principles of Imam (r.a.) require that we put up a resistance against interventionist and domineering policies, that we establish brotherly relations with other Muslim nations, that we develop relations with all countries except the ones that have drawn their swords against the Iranian nation and are being hostile, that we fight Zionism, that we resist in order to liberate Palestine, that we help oppressed people throughout the world and that we put up a resistance against oppressors.
hau: Dangane da siyasar waje kuwa, koyarwar Imam ita ce: tsayin daka wajen fada da siyasar tsoma baki na ‘yan mulkin mallaka; kulla ‘yan'uwantaka da al'ummomin musulmi; kulla alaka da dukkanin kasashen duniya, in ban da kasashen da suka zare takubbansu a kan al'ummar Iran da nuna musu kiyayya; fada da sahyoniyanci; gwagwarmaya wajen ‘yanto kasar Palastinu; taimakon wadanda aka zalunta na duniya da kuma tsayin daka a gaban azzalumai.
mt0: <pad> In terms of foreign policy, the Imam's teachings were: firmness in fighting imperialist policy; establishing friendship with Muslim nations; forming ties with all countries of the world, except those who have turned their backs on Iran and showed their hatred towards it; fight against Zionism; struggle for Palestine's liberation; support for the oppressed of the world and firmness in standing up against the oppressors.</s>

en: Imam's testament is available to us.
hau: Wasiyyar Imam dai tana tare da mu.
mt0: <pad> The Imam's wisdom is with us.</s>

en: His writings and statements have been recorded and are available in the form of books. Regarding culture, the principles of Imam (r.a.) require rejection of the permissive Western culture, rejection of rigidity and reactionary attitudes, rejection of hypocrisy in religion, decisive defense of ethics and Islamic commands, and fighting the spread of immorality and corruption in society.
hau: Hakan nan kuma jawabai da rubuce-rubucensa, wadanda aka tattara su cikin littafa, suna tare da mu. A fagen al'adu, koyarwar Imam ita ce: nesantar al'adu na lalata da shedanci na kasashen yammaci; kore daskarewa ta tunani da kuma kore aikata riya cikin riko da addini; goyon baya dari bisa dari ga kyawawan halaye da kuma hukunce-hukuncen Musulunci; da kuma fada da yada fasadi da alfasha cikin al'umma.
mt0: <pad> Also his speeches and writings, collected in books, are with us. In the field of culture, the Imam's teachings were: rejecting the Western culture of laity and sensuality; opposing decadence of mind and against riya in practice of religion; supporting all the way to good morals and Islamic principles; and fighting and propagating corruption and evil in the society.</s>

en: As for economic matters, the principles of Imam (r.a.) require relying on the national economy, relying on self-sufficiency, ensuring economic justice in production and distribution, defending underprivileged people and confronting the capitalist culture coupled with respect for ownership rights. Imam (r.a.) rejected the oppressive capitalist culture, but he also stressed the need for respecting ownership and property rights, capital and labor.
hau: A fagen tattalin arziki ma, koyarwar Imam ita ce: dogaro da tattalin arziki na kasa; dogaro da kai da abin da ake da shi a cikin gida; adalci na tattalin arziki cikin abubuwan da ake samarwa da kuma raba su; goyon bayan marasa abin hannu; fada da al'adar ‘yan jari hujja da kuma girmama mallaka - ta hada wadannan biyun ne - Imam ya yi watsi da al'adar zalunci da ‘yan jari hujja, to amma kuma yana mai girmama hakkin mallaka da zuba jari da kuma aiki.
mt0: <pad> In the field of economic teaching, the Imam's teachings were: dependance on the national economy; self-dependence on the domestic resources; economic justice in production and distribution; support for the poor; fight against the culture of capitalism and respect for property - it combines both - the Imam denounced the culture of tyranny and imperialism, but also respected the right to property and investment and labor.</s>

en: Also, the principles of Imam (r.a.) require that we resist melting into the global economy and that we preserve independence of our national economy.
hau: Haka nan kuma koyarwar Imam ta bukace mu da mu ki amincewa da narkewa cikin tattalin arzikin duniya; da kuma cewa wajibi ne mu kiyaye ‘yancin kai cikin tattalin arziki na kasa.
mt0: <pad> The Imam's teaching also requires us not to accept the merging in the world economic system; and that it is our duty to keep our national economic independence.</s>

en: The Iranian nation can bridge the gap between current conditions and those ideal conditions by following this roadmap, by relying on their firm religious faith, by remembering their Imam (r.a.).
hau: Al'ummar Iran za ta iya rage irin wannan tazarar da ake da ita ne ta hanyar riko da wannan taswirar hanyar da tsayayyen imani da kuma tunawa da Imaminta mai girma (r.a).
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran can only reduce this gap by holding on to this path with firm belief and remembering its great leader (r.a).</s>

en: The Iranian nation can move forward.
hau: Al'ummar Iran za ta iya ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran can continue to live.</s>

en: Considering its capabilities and talent and the outstanding individuals who are thankfully present among our people, the Iranian nation can continue the revolutionary path that we have been following over the past thirty-something years with more power and firmer determination. By Allah's favor, our nation will be able to become a genuine role model for other Muslim nations.
hau: Bisa la'akari da irin karfi da kuma kwarewar da take da ita, haka nan kuma da irin fitattun mutanen da muke da su, al'ummar Iran za ta iya ci gaba da bin tafarkin da aka riga da aka shata tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da wani abin na wannan juyi, sannan kuma insha Allahu ta zamanto abar koyi na hakika ga sauran al'ummomin musulmi.
mt0: <pad> Given its strength and capabilities, as well as the excellent people we have, the Iranian people can continue to follow the path that has been laid out for the past thirty-five years, and will insha Allah be a true example for other Muslim nations.</s>

en: Now let me speak about the elections, which is a sensitive and current issue these days.
hau: Amma dangane da batun zabe wanda shi ne zancen da ke yawo a halin yanzu.
mt0: <pad> But about the election which is the current topic of discussion.</s>

en: Dear brothers and sisters and dear people of Iran, elections are the manifestation of all the three beliefs of Imam Khomeini (r.a.) and we should have faith in the same things.
hau: Ya ku ‘yan'uwana maza da mata! Ya ku al'ummar Iran masu girma!
mt0: <pad> My brothers and sisters! Great people of Iran!</s>

en: Elections are the manifestation of faith in God, because taking part in elections is a religious obligation.
hau: Zabe alama ce ta dukkanin wadannan imani guda uku da suke tare da Imam wanda kuma wajibi ne su kasance tare da mu: wato alama ce ta imani da Allah, don kuwa wani taklifi ne.
mt0: <pad> Zabe is a symbol of all three faiths that are with the Imam and must be with us: it is a symbol of faith in God, for it is a taklifi.</s>

en: It is our responsibility to play a role in the destiny of our country.
hau: Nauyin da ke wuyanmu ne, takalifinmu mu tsoma baki cikin makomar kasarmu.
mt0: <pad> It is our duty, our responsibility to intervene in the future of our country.</s>

en: Everybody in our country has this responsibility.
hau: Daidaikun mutanen Iran suna da wannan nauyin a wuyansu.
mt0: <pad> Individual Iranians have this responsibility on their own.</s>

en: Elections are the manifestation of faith in the people, because the will of the people manifests itself in the form of elections: it is the people who choose government officials through elections.
hau: Haka nan kuma alama ce ta yarda da mutane, don kuwa zabe alama ce ta iradar mutane, don kuwa mutane ne suke zaban jami'an gwamnati ta hanyar zaben.
mt0: <pad> It is also a symbol of people's trust, because voting is a symbol of people's trust, because the people are choosing government officials through voting.</s>

en: Elections are the manifestation of having faith in oneself, because anybody who casts his vote into the ballot box feels that he is playing a role in the destiny of the country and that his role is determining in its own right.
hau: Har ila yau alama ce ta yarda da kai, don kuwa duk mutumin da ya jefa kuri'arsa cikin akwatin zabe, zai ji cewa lalle ya ba da tasa gudummawar wajen ayyana makomar kasar nan; ya taka tasa rawar.
mt0: <pad> It is also a sign of trust, for every person who casts his vote in the ballot box will feel that he has given his share of the contribution to determining the future of the country; he has played his part.</s>

en: This is a very important point.
hau: Hakan wani lamari ne mai matukar muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> This is a very important matter.</s>

en: Therefore, elections are the manifestation of faith in God, faith in the people and faith in oneself.
hau: A saboda haka zabe alama ce ta yarda da Allah, haka nan alama ce ta yarda da mutane, kamar yadda kuma alama ce ta yarda da kai.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, voting is a sign of acceptance of God, as well as a sign of acceptance of people, and also a sign of acceptance of you.</s>

en: Every vote that you cast into the ballot box for any of the eight honorable candidates is a vote for the Islamic Republic.
hau: Duk wata kuri'ar da za ku kada wa daya daga cikin ‘yan takaran nan - wato wadannan mutane takwas din da suke fage - kun kada ne ga Jamhuriyar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Every vote you cast for one of these candidates - those eight people in the field - is a vote for the Islamic Republic.</s>

en: A vote for any of the candidates is a vote for the Islamic Republic: it is a vote of confidence for the [political] system and its electoral mechanism.
hau: Kada kuri'a ga kowane guda daga cikin ‘yan takaran nan, kada kuri'a ce ga Jamhuriyar Musulunci; kuri'ar yarda da wannan tsari da kuma ayyukan zaben ne.
mt0: <pad> It is not a vote for any of these applicants, nor for the Islamic Republic; it is a vote to accept this system and the election process.</s>

en: When you enter the arena of elections - either as a voter or as a candidate - your mere presence in this arena means that you have confidence in the Islamic Republic and in our electoral mechanism.
hau: Shi kansa shiga fagen zaben, shin wadanda suka tsaya takaran shugaban kasar ne ko kuma wadanda suke zaben ne - wato ni da ku - , shi kansa yarda da Jamhuriyar Musulunci da kuma yadda ake gudanar da zaben ne.
mt0: <pad> He goes to the polls, whether he is a presidential candidate or a voting person - me and you -, he believes in the Islamic Republic and the election process.</s>

en: On a less important level, your presence results in a vote for the person whom you consider as more valuable for the future of the country than the other candidates.
hau: Sannan a mataki na biyu ne batun kada wa dan takaran da ko ku din nan ko kuma wannan dan'uwa ko wancan ‘yar'uwar ko kuma ni din nan zan zaba don ya zamanto mai amfani ga kasar nan sama da sauran ‘yan takaran.
mt0: <pad> And in the second step is to ensure that the candidate that I or my brother or my sister or I myself will vote for is more beneficial to the country than other applicants.</s>

en: Our helpless foreign enemies are thinking of a way to turn this election into a threat against the Islamic Republic. This is while an election is a great opportunity for the Islamic Republic.
hau: Makiyanmu a waje, wadannan marasa mafita, suna ta tunanin yadda za su sanya wannan zaben ya zamanto barazana ga wannan tsarin na Musulunci; alhali kuwa zabe wata gagarumar dama ce ga tsarin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Our enemies, these hopeless, are trying to make this election a threat to this Islamic system; while the election is a great opportunity for the Islamic system.</s>

en: They are hoping for a cold and lifeless election so that they can say the people are not interested in the Islamic Republic or they can create a fitna after the election, just as they did in the year 1388 after that enthusiastic election.
hau: Fatansu shi ne ko dai a gudanar da zaben ba tare da armashi ba, don su sami damar cewa mutane sun kosa da tsarin Musulunci; ko kuma su haifar da fitina a lokacin zaben, kamar yadda ya faru a shekara ta 2009.
mt0: <pad> Their plan is either to hold the election without security, to give them the opportunity to say that the people are not happy with the Muslim system; or to create violence during the election, as happened in 2009.</s>

en: These are what the enemies of our nation are after.
hau: Wannan shi ne abin da makiyan wannan al'umma suke fatan gani.
mt0: <pad> This is what the enemies of this nation want to see.</s>

en: They do not know our people. The enemies of our nation have forgotten the 9th of Dey. Those who think that in our country there is a silent majority who are opposed to the Islamic Republic, have forgotten that over the past thirty-four years massive numbers of people have taken to the streets every year on the 22nd of Bahman in different cities of our country in order to support the Islamic Republic and shout "death to America".
hau: To amma lalle kuskure suke yi, lalle ba su san al'ummarmu ba. makiyan wannan al'umma sun mance da ranar 9 ga watan Dey (30 Disambar 2009 - lokacin da al'ummar Iran suka fito don nuna goyon bayansu ga tsarin Musulunci bayan fitinar shekara ta 2009 bayan zaben shugaban kasa) ne. Mutanen da suke zaton cewa mafi yawan al'ummar kasar nan suna adawa da tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci, sun mance da cewa shekaru 34 kenan a kowace shekara a ranar 22 ga watan Bahman, miliyoyin mutane ne suke fitowa a garuruwa daban-daban don nuna goyon bayansu ga Jamhuriyar Musulunci sanann kuma suna fadin ‘Allah Ya La'anci Amurka'.
mt0: <pad> But they are wrong, they don't know our people. The enemies of this nation have forgotten the 9th of December (30 December 2009 - when Iranians went out to show their support for the Islamic republic after the 2009 political upheaval). Those who think that most of the country is against the Islamic republic, have forgotten that for 34 years every year on 22nd of May, millions of people go out in different towns to support the Islamic republic and say "Allah La'an the US."</s>

en: In order to make our elections lifeless, their think tanks constantly produce ideas and feed them to their media and their spokesmen.
hau: Don su rage kaifin wannan zaben, sun tsara wasu masanansu da za su ta maganganu ta hanyar wadannan kafafen watsa labaran.
mt0: <pad> To lessen the intensity of this campaign, they have arranged for some of their representatives to speak through these media.</s>

en: One day they say our elections have been engineered, another day they say our elections are not free, yet another day they say our elections are not legitimate in the eyes of the people.
hau: A wani lokaci su fadi cewa zaben ma dai an riga da an tsara shi, a wani lokacin su ce babu ‘yanci cikin zaben, a wani lokaci su ce zaben ba shi da halalci a idon jama'a.
mt0: <pad> They sometimes say that the election is already planned, sometimes they say that there is no freedom in the election, sometimes they say that the election is not halal in the eyes of the people.</s>

en: They do not know our people, neither do they know our elections and the Islamic Republic.
hau: A'a, ba su san mutanenmu ba ne, haka nan ba su san zabenmu ba, haka nan ba su fahimci tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci ba.
mt0: <pad> No, they don't know our people, nor our elections, nor the system of the Islamic Republic.</s>

en: Does it exist in capitalist countries?
hau: Akwai hakan a kasashen ‘yan jari hujja?
mt0: <pad> It's common in capitalist countries.</s>

en: In capitalist countries, if candidates are members of the existing two or three parties and enjoy the support of capitalists, company owners, wealthy people and mafias of wealth and power, they can campaign and if not, they cannot even campaign.
hau: A kasashen ‘yan jari hujja, idan har kai din nan ba dan daya daga cikin wadannan jam'iyyu biyu ko uku ba ne sannan kuma ba ka da goyon bayan ‘yan jari hujja da da kamfanoninsu da masu kudinsu da suka mamaye komai, ne kawai za ka iya yin yakin neman zabe.
mt0: <pad> In capitalist countries, if you are not a member of one of these two or three parties and don't have the support of the capitalists and their companies and money that has overtaken everything, you can only run for election.</s>

en: There were certain individuals who did not enjoy the support of the Zionists and blood-thirsty international capitalist networks, and they could not enter the arena of election no matter how hard they tried.
hau: Akwai wasu mutane wadanda ba su da goyon bayan sahyoniyawa, ba sa da goyon bayan ‘yan jari hujja masu shan jinin al'ummomin duniya, duk abin da suka yi, ba za su iya shiga fagen zabe ba.
mt0: <pad> There are some people who do not support the zionists, do not support the bloodthirsty globalist capitalists, and whatever they do, they cannot enter the election.</s>

en: They neither had access to a media outlet, nor were any TV channels available to them.
hau: Ba su da kafafen watsa labarai tare da su, haka nan ba su da gidajen talabijin din da za su watsa musu shirye-shiryensu.
mt0: <pad> They don't have any media, nor do they have television stations that will air their programs.</s>

en: For every second of campaigning, they had to spend huge amounts of money.
hau: Saboda haka wani irin kudi ne za su kashe wajen watsa shirye-shiryensu na dakika guda.
mt0: <pad> So how much money will they spend on their show for a minute?</s>

en: In our country, candidates are given equal opportunities to speak to the people for many hours through state media without having to spend one single rial.
hau: A kasarmu ‘yan takara ba tare da sun kashe ko sisi ba, za a ba su sa'oi masu yawa su isar da sakonnin da suke da shi ga mutane.
mt0: <pad> Our candidate will be able to spend hours without a dime to get their message to the people.</s>

en: In which part of the world do such things exist?
hau: A ina ne ake samun irin wannan yanayin a duk fadin duniya?
mt0: <pad> Where can you find this kind of situation all over the world?</s>

en: The only thing that controls entry into our elections is the law.
hau: Abin da ke da iko a fagen zabe shi ne kawai doka.
mt0: <pad> The only thing that has power in the electoral process is the law.</s>

en: According to the law, some people can run in our elections and some others cannot.
hau: Bisa doka ce wasu za su iya shigowa fagen zaben, wasu kuma ba za su iya shigowa ba.
mt0: <pad> While some can enter the classroom, others cannot.</s>

en: The law has specified what the conditions are, what the qualifications are and who are in charge of vetting.
hau: Doka ta ayyana sharuddan da ake son cikawa, wato su waye suka cancanci tsayawa.
mt0: <pad> The law defines the requirements for eligibility, that is, who can run.</s>

en: All of these things are being done on the basis of the law.
hau: Ana gudanar da dukkanin hakan ne bisa doka.
mt0: <pad> All this is done legally.</s>

en: Our foreign enemies close their eyes to these realities and say certain things, and as I have pointed out before, sadly there are impious people who repeat the same things.
hau: Wadannan makiyan suna zaune a wani gefe can su rufe idanuwansu kan dukkanin wadannan abubuwa. Suna ta fadin maganganu. Kamar yadda na sha fadi, abin bakin cikin shi ne sai a sami wasu mutane marasa tsoron Allah suna ci gaba da nanata wadannan maganganun da suke fadi.
mt0: <pad> These enemies are sitting somewhere and closing their eyes on all these things. They're talking. As I've said, the sad part is that there are some people who don't fear God who continue to repeat their words.</s>

en: But by Allah's favor and with their presence, resistance and firm determination, our people will respond to all these machinations and their response will be crushing and decisive.
hau: To amma al'ummar Iran cikin yardar Allah, za su mayar wa wadannan mutane da martani ta hanyar fitowarsu da kuma irin tsayin dakan da za su yi. Sannan kuma martanin da za su mayar din wani martani ne mai ruguzarwa.
mt0: <pad> But the people of Iran, with God's grace, will respond to these people by their coming out and their firmness. And the response they will give will be a disastrous response.</s>

en: Now I would like to give a piece of advice to the honorable candidates. The honorable candidates speak critically in the televised programs. This is their right.
hau: Bari in fadi wasu ‘yan jumloli ga ‘yan takara kuma. A yayin yakin neman zabe ‘yan takara masu girma sun yi suka kan wasu shirye-shirye na gwamnati, wannan hakkinsu ne.
mt0: <pad> Let me add a few sentences to the candidates. During the campaign, some of the senior candidates criticized government programs, this is their right.</s>

en: However, they should pay attention to the point that criticism should signify a determination to move towards a future that is full of hard work and glory.
hau: Suna iya yin suka kan dukkanin abubuwan da suka ga a ra'ayinsu bai yi daidai ba. To sai dai yana da kyau sukan na su ta zamanto da ma'anar yin azama da kuma niyyar gyara da kuma tabbatar da makoma mai kyau ne.
mt0: <pad> They can criticize whatever they see as wrong. But it is good that their criticism be a means of effort and a will to correct and ensure a better future.</s>

en: They should pay attention to this point. I do not favor anybody. From this moment onwards, foreign media will say with ulterior motives that I favor a particular candidate.
hau: Wajibi ne su yi la'akari da wannan lamarin. Ni dai ba ni da wani dan takara. Daga yanzu din nan kafafen watsa labaran ‘yan kasashen waje saboda adawa da kuma bakar aniya za su fadi cewa: Ni na fi fifita wane daga cikin ‘yan takaran.
mt0: <pad> They have to consider this. I don't have another candidate. From now on, the international press for political and personal bias will say: "I prefer which of the applicants."</s>

en: I advise the brothers who want to win the people's trust that their comments should be fair.
hau: Ina kiran ‘yan'uwan da suke son janyo hankulan al'umma zuwa ga re su, da su yi adalci wajen fadin maganganu.
mt0: <pad> I call on those who want to draw attention to themselves to be fair in their statements.</s>

en: They can make criticisms, but in doing so, they should not paint a bleak picture and deny the outstanding achievements that have been accomplished under the incumbent administration or previous administrations thanks to the constant efforts of individuals like themselves.
hau: Su yi suka, to amma suka ba wai da ma'anar bakanta wani ba. Kada sukar ta zamanto inkarin fitattun ayyukan da aka yi, shin a wannan gwamnatin ce ko kuma a gwamnatocin da suka gabata.
mt0: <pad> Critics should be critics, but not in the sense of insulting others. The criticism should not be critical of significant accomplishments, whether by this government or by previous governments.</s>

en: Criticism does not mean denying positive aspects.
hau: Kada sukar ta zamanto da ma'anar inkarin ayyuka masu kyau da aka yi a baya.
mt0: <pad> Don't always mean to criticize the good work done in the past.</s>

en: The next president will not have to start from zero: thousands of outstanding things have already been done.
hau: A halin yanzu duk wanda ya dare karagar mulki a kasar nan ba ya bukatar ya fara aiki daga farko, don kuwa an gudanar da dubban ayyuka masu girma.
mt0: <pad> Nowadays, any person who takes over the presidency of the country does not need to start from scratch, as thousands of large projects have been carried out.</s>

en: Over the course of many years, thousands of fundamental infrastructure-related projects have been carried out in the country under different administrations.
hau: Tsawon shekaru, a lokutan gwamnatocin daban-daban, an gudanar da ayyuka na gina kasa masu yawa.
mt0: <pad> Over the years, during different governments, many construction projects have been carried out.</s>

en: They should not disregard these things.
hau: Bai kamata a yi watsi da wadannan ba.
mt0: <pad> Don't forget that these people should not be ignored.</s>

en: We cannot afford to deny all this work under the pretext that we have economic problems, that we have the problem of rising prices and inflation. After all, this is not the right thing to do.
hau: Dukkanin irin wadannan ayyukan da aka yi bai kamata don kawai ana fuskantar matsala ta tattalin arziki da tsadar kayayyaki, shi kenan sai mu yi inkarin dukkanin wadancan ayyukan ba. Lalle hakan ba daidai ba ne.
mt0: <pad> All these things done should not be dismissed just because we are experiencing economic difficulties and high prices. That is certainly not right.</s>

en: However, this does not mean that we should deny everything that has been done in order to present a solution to the existing problems.
hau: To amma bai kamata idan har muna da wata mafita daga wadannan matsalolin, shi kenan sai mu yi inkarin dukkanin abubuwan da a yau din nan aka aikata su ba.
mt0: <pad> But we should not, if we have a solution to these problems, then reject all the things that have been done in the past.</s>

en: Also, the candidates should not make impossible promises.
hau: Haka nan kuma bai kamata a dinga yin alkawurran da ba za a iya cikawa ba.
mt0: <pad> Also, it is not good to make promises that you can't keep.</s>

en: You should speak in a way that if your recorded statements are replayed to you next year in Khordad, you do not feel ashamed.
hau: Ina kiran dukkanin ‘yan takara da su fadi abubuwan da idan a shekara mai zuwa a daidai wannan lokacin aka kawo musu kasetocin maganganun da suka yi, ba za su ji kunya ba.
mt0: <pad> I urge all candidates to say things that if next year at this time they were asked about their speeches, they wouldn't be ashamed.</s>

en: Make such promises that you would not have to blame other people under the pretext that they did not let you do what you wanted to do.
hau: Ku yi alkawurra da idan a nan gaba aka gabatar muku da su, ba za ku dinga kame-kame da kuma kokarin dora alhakin gazawar a wuyan wannan da wancan ba.
mt0: <pad> Make a commitment that if they come to you in the future, you will not be ashamed and try to blame others for your failures.</s>

en: Only make promises that you will be able to fulfill.
hau: Ku yi alkawurra ayyukan da za ku iya yi.
mt0: <pad> Promise the things you can do.</s>

en: In our country and according to our Constitution, the president has extraordinary powers.
hau: A kasarmu sannan kuma bisa ga kundin tsarin mulkinmu, shugaban kasa yana da iko mai girman gaske.
mt0: <pad> In our country and under our constitution, the president of the republic has a great deal of power.</s>

en: The Constitution has given vast powers to the president.
hau: Karfin da shugaban kasa yake da shi a cikin kundin tsarin mulkinmu karfi ne mai girma da fadin gaske.
mt0: <pad> The power of the president in our constitution is very large and wide.</s>

en: He has control over all executive pillars of the country. He has control over the implementation of the laws and regulations in the country. He has the power to utilize the capacities of all experts throughout the country.
hau: Shugaban kasa shi ne yake da kasafin kudin kasa a hannunsa, shi ne yake da dukkanin ayyukan gudanarwa a hannunsa, shi ne yake da karfin tsara gudanar da dokoki, yana da karfin amfani da dukkanin masanan da suke fadin kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> The President is the one who has the budget of the country, he is the one who has all executive functions in his hand, he is the one who has the power to draft and promulgate laws, he has the power to use all the officers that are deployed throughout the country.</s>

en: The president has room for maneuver in the case of different issues.
hau: Hannayen shugaban kasa a bude suke cikin lamurra daban-daban.
mt0: <pad> The president's hands are open in many situations.</s>

en: The only thing that restricts the president in our country is the law.
hau: Iyakan da kawai yake da ita, ita ce iyaka ta doka.
mt0: <pad> The only limit he has is the legal limit.</s>

en: His actions can only be restricted by the law, which is not in fact a restriction.
hau: Doka ce kawai za ta yi masa iyaka, wanda hakan ma ba kan iyaka ba ne.
mt0: <pad> The law will only limit him, which is not a limit.</s>

en: The law provides guidance: it does not restrict.
hau: Doka mai shiryarwa ce, ba mai takaitawa ba.
mt0: <pad> The law is a guide, not a boundary.</s>

en: Those who address the people today and say different things, should discuss what they are capable of doing and what the people need.
hau: Mutanen da a yau suke magana da mutane, su gaya musu irin abubuwan da za su iya wadanda kuma mutane suke bukatarsu.
mt0: <pad> The people who talk to people today, tell them what they can do and what they need.</s>

en: They should promise that they will act in a wise and prudent way.
hau: Idan har suna da wani shiri da kuma tsari to su gaya wa mutane, su yi musu alkawurrin yin iyakacin kokarinsu wajen gudanar da wadannan tsare-tsare da kuma yin alkawurrin amfani da dukkanin karfin da doka ta ba su wajen sauke wannan gagarumin nauyin da ke wuyansu.
mt0: <pad> If they have a plan and a program, tell the people, and make their best efforts to implement these plans and promise to use all the powers that the law gives them to fulfill this great responsibility.</s>

en: They should promise that they will make use of all the capacities of the Constitution in order to carry out their great responsibility.
hau: Wasu suna da tunanin na kuskure na cewa mu yi sassauci wa makiya don su rage irin fushin da suke yi da mu.
mt0: <pad> Some people have the wrong idea that we should be compassionate to our enemies to make them less angry.</s>

en: They should promise that they will not prefer the interests of foreigners over the interests of the Iranian nation under different pretexts.
hau: A aikace suna fifita manufofin wadancan mutane sama da manufofin kasa. Lalle wannan kuskure ne.
mt0: <pad> They actually prioritize the interests of individuals over the interests of the country. Of course, this is a mistake.</s>

en: Some people argue that we should make concessions to the enemies in order to appease them and in this way they effectively prefer the interests of the enemies over the interests of the Iranian nation. This is wrong. They are angry because you exist, because the Islamic Republic exists, because Imam (r.a.) is alive in the minds of the people and in our national plans, because the people show their feelings for Imam (r.a.) every year on his demise anniversary.
hau: Fushin makiyan ya samo asali ne saboda kasantuwarku, saboda kasantuwar Jamhuriyar Musulunci, saboda Imam ya kasance a raye a cikin zukata da kwakwalan al'ummar kasar nan da kuma abubuwan da ake gudanarwa; saboda ranar 14 ga watan Khordad, wato ranar rasuwar Imam, saboda al'ummar Iran daga duk fadin kasar nan suna fitowa (don nuna kaunar gare shi).
mt0: <pad> The anger of the enemies is because of your existence, the existence of the Islamic Republic, because the Imam is still alive in the hearts and minds of the people of this country and the activities that are carried out; because of the 14th of Khordad, the day of the death of the Imam, because the people of Iran from all over the country are coming out (to show their love for him).</s>

en: These are the causes of their anger.
hau: Wannan shi ne dalilin wannan fushi na su.
mt0: <pad> That's why she's so upset.</s>

en: If our nation becomes powerful and capable, if it reduces its needs, if it eliminates its problems, if it manages to improve the economy which is our main issue today, the enemy will be defenseless against the Iranian nation.
hau: Matukar dai al'ummarmu ta tsaya da kafafunta, ta zamanto mai karfi, ta rage irin bukatar da take da ita, ta magance matsalolinta, a yau da yake batun tattalin arziki shi ne a kan gaba, ta sami damar karfafa tattalin arzikinta, to kuwa makiya ba abin da za su iya a gaban al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> If our people stand up on their own, be strong, reduce their need, solve their problems, and now that economic issues are the top issue, have the ability to strengthen their economy, then the enemies will have no chance against the people of Iran.</s>

en: In any case, what is important is to have determination, faith in God, faith in the people and faith in ourselves, and this applies to both the presidential candidates and the people.
hau: Ala kulli hal, abin da ke da muhimmanci, shi ne tsayin daka da azama, imani da Allah da yarda da irin karfin da mutane suke da shi da kuma yarda da kai, shin a wajen ‘yan takaran ne ko kuma a wajen daidaikun al'umma.
mt0: <pad> In any case, what is important is determination and effort, faith in God and confidence in the power of people and your own self-esteem, whether it be among the players or among the individuals of the community.</s>

en: My dear brothers, my dear ones, there will a great test in ten days, and by Allah's favor we hope that in this great test Allah the Exalted will cause an auspicious instance of valor with brilliant outcomes for our nation.
hau: Ya ku ‘yan'uwana masu girma! Kwanaki goma masu zuwa wani fage ne na jarabawa mai girma, ina fatan insha Allahu, a yayin wannan jarabawar mai girma al'umma za su fito kwansu da kwarkwatansu sannan daga karshe ya zamanto an sami sakamako mai kyau.
mt0: <pad> My dear brothers! The next 10 days are another test, I hope insha Allahu, during this great test the people will come out with all their strength and at the end of it will be a good result.</s>

en: There is no power except with the permission of Great Almighty Allah.
hau: ‘Babu wata dabara ko karfi sai daga wajen Allah Mai girma da daukaka".
mt0: <pad> No power or might except from Allah, the Most High and Exalted.</s>

en: To the Youth in Europe and North America - Khamenei.ir
hau: Wasikar Jagora Imam Khamenei Ga Matasan Kasashen Turai Da Arewacin Amurka
mt0: <pad> The speech of the Leader of the Revolutionary Guards of Islam, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, to young European and North American youths</s>

en: In the name of God, the Beneficent the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: To the Youth in Europe and North America,
hau: Zuwa Ga Dukkanin Matasan Kasashen Turai Da Arewacin Amurka
mt0: <pad> To all European and North American youth</s>

en: The recent events in France and similar ones in some other Western countries have convinced me to directly talk to you about them.
hau: Lamurrann baya-bayan nan da suka faru a kasar Faransa da makamantansu a wasu kasashen Yammaci, su ne suka sanya ni ganin ya dace in yi magana da ku kai tsaye.
mt0: <pad> The recent events in France and similar ones in other Western countries have made me feel it is right to speak to you directly.</s>

en: I am addressing you, [the youth], not because I overlook your parents, rather it is because the future of your nations and countries will be in your hands; and also I find that the sense of quest for truth is more vigorous and attentive in your hearts.
hau: Ina magana da ku ne, Ya ku matasa; ba wai saboda na raina iyayenku ba, face dai sai saboda ku ne manyan gobe, wadanda makomar al'umma da kuma kasarku take hannunsu; sannan kuma saboda ina ganin zukatanku cike suke da neman sanin gaskiya.
mt0: <pad> I'm speaking to you, young people; not because I resent your parents, but because you are the future leaders of our nation and country, and because I see your hearts full of pursuit of truth.</s>

en: I don't address your politicians and statesmen either in this writing because I believe that they have consciously separated the route of politics from the path of righteousness and truth.
hau: Haka nan kuma ba wai ina magana ne da ‘yan siyasa da jami'an gwamnatocinku ba ne, don kuwa na yi amanna da cewa da gangan sannan kuma da saninsu suka kawar da siyasarsu daga tafarkin gaskiya da hakika.
mt0: <pad> I am not talking about your politicians and government officials, for I believe that they have deliberately and with knowledge derailed their politics from the path of right and justice.</s>

en: I would like to talk to you about Islam, particularly the image that is presented to you as Islam.
hau: Magana ta da ku kan Musulunci ne, musamman ma dangane irin abin da ake gabatar muku da shi a matsayin Musuluncin.
mt0: <pad> My talk is about Islam, especially about what is presented to you as Islam.</s>

en: Many attempts have been made over the past two decades, almost since the disintegration of the Soviet Union, to place this great religion in the seat of a horrifying enemy.
hau: Tsawon shekaru ashirin din da suka gabata zuwa sama - wato tun daga lokacin rugujewar Tarayyar Sobiyeti - an gudanar da gagarumin kokarin bayyanar da wannan addini mai girma a matsayin wani gagarumin abin tsoro.
mt0: <pad> Over the past 20 years or so - since the fall of the Soviet Union - a great effort has been made to present this great religion as a huge danger.</s>

en: The provocation of a feeling of horror and hatred and its utilization has unfortunately a long record in the political history of the West.
hau: Abin bakin cikin shi ne cewa irin wannan yanayi na sanya tsoro da kyamar (wannan addini) wani lamari ne mai tsoron tarihi cikin tarihin siyasar kasashen yammaci.
mt0: <pad> The sad thing is that this kind of fear and hatred is a very ugly historic episode in the history of Western politics.</s>

en: Here, I don't want to deal with the different phobias with which the Western nations have thus far been indoctrinated.
hau: Ni dai a nan ba ina so ne in yi magana dangane da ‘irin kyama da tsoratarwa' daban-daban da ya zuwa yanzu aka sanya cikin zukatan al'ummomin kasashen yammaci ba.
mt0: <pad> I don't want to talk about the various "kinds of fear and terror" that have been planted in the minds of Western peoples.</s>

en: A cursory review of recent critical studies of history would bring home to you the fact that the Western governments' insincere and hypocritical treatment of other nations and cultures has been censured in new historiographies.
hau: Idan kuka koma kadan cikin tarihi, za ku ga cewa sabbin marubuta tarihi, sun soki mu'amalar rashin adalci da gaskiya da gwamnatocin yammaci suka yi wa al'ummomi da al'adun duniya.
mt0: <pad> If you look back a little in history, you will see that new historians have criticized the unfair and unjust treatment of western governments towards the peoples and cultures of the world.</s>

en: The histories of the United States and Europe are ashamed of slavery, embarrassed by the colonial period and chagrined at the oppression of people of color and non-Christians.
hau: Tarihin Turai da Amurka ya rusunar da kansa cikin kunya saboda bautar da mutane, mulkin mallaka da kuma zaluntar wadanda ba fararen fata da kuma wadanda ba Kiristoci ba da suka yi.
mt0: <pad> Europe and America's history has been tainted with shame for slavery, imperialism and oppression of non-whites and non-Christians.</s>

en: Your researchers and historians are deeply ashamed of the bloodsheds wrought in the name of religion between the Catholics and Protestants or in the name of nationality and ethnicity during the First and Second World Wars.
hau: Masana da malaman tarihinku suna cikin kunyar irin zubar da jinin da aka yi da sunan addini tsakanin mabiya darikar Katolika da Protestant ko kuma da sunan ‘yan kasanci da kabilanci a yakukuwan duniya na daya da na biyu.
mt0: <pad> Your elders and your historians are ashamed of the bloodshed that was made in the name of religion between Catholics and Protestants or in the name of race and ethnicity in World War I and World War II.</s>

en: This approach is admirable. By mentioning a fraction of this long list, I don't want to reproach history; rather I would like you to ask your intellectuals as to why the public conscience in the West awakens and comes to its senses after a delay of several decades or centuries.
hau: Manufar bijiro da wani bangare na wannan doguwar fehrisa na abubuwan da suka faru, ba ita ce sukar tarihi ba, face dai abin da nake so shi ne ku tambayi masananku shin me ya sa a koda yaushe sai bayan jinkiri na gomomin shekaru ko kuma ma daruruwan shekaru ne lamirin al'ummomin yammaci ya ke farkawa da kuma dawowa cikin hayacinsa?
mt0: <pad> The purpose of introducing a part of this long list of events is not to criticize history, but to ask ourselves why it is always after hundreds or even thousands of years that the soul of Western societies wakes up and returns to its dormant state?</s>

en: Why should the revision of collective conscience apply to the distant past and not to the current problems?
hau: Me ya sa ake damfara lamirin mutane ga abubuwan da suka faru cikin tarihin shekaru aru aru ba batutuwan da suke faruwa a halin yanzu ba?
mt0: <pad> Why is the attention of people drawn to things that happened in the past, not to what is happening now?</s>

en: Why is it that attempts are made to prevent public awareness regarding an important issue such as the treatment of Islamic culture and thought?
hau: Me ya sa ake kange mutane daga fahimtar lamurra masu muhimmanci irin su hanyoyin mu'amala da al'adu da kuma tunani na Musulunci?
mt0: <pad> Why is it that people are prevented from understanding important issues such as the way of life, culture and thinking of Islam?</s>

en: You know well that humiliation and spreading hatred and illusionary fear of the â€œotherâ€ have been the common base of all those oppressive profiteers.
hau: Ku da kanku kun san cewa wulakanci da haifar da kiyayya da kirkirar tsoron sauran mutane na boge, suna a matsayin wani fage ne da aka yi tarayya cikinsa wajen haifar da dukkanin irin wadannan zalunci da mummunan amfani da mutane.
mt0: <pad> You yourself know that arrogance and hatred and the creation of fake fears of others are a common ground for all this oppression and misuse of people.</s>

en: Now, I would like you to ask yourself why the old policy of spreading â€œphobiaâ€ and hatred has targeted Islam and Muslims with an unprecedented intensity.
hau: A halin yanzu ina son tambayarku, shin me ya sa yanzu aka dawo da tsohuwar siyasar sanya tsoro da kyamar Musulunci da musulmi?
mt0: <pad> Now I want to ask you, why is the old policy of fear and hatred of Islam and Muslims now being reviled?</s>

en: Why does the power structure in the world want Islamic thought to be marginalized and remain latent?
hau: Me ya sa tsarin mulki na duniya a halin yanzu ya sanya tunani na Musulunci a gaba?
mt0: <pad> Me said that the current world order has put the Islamic thought ahead of the world.</s>

en: What concepts and values in Islam disturb the programs of the super powers and what interests are safeguarded in the shadow of distorting the image of Islam?
hau: Shin wasu abubuwa ne da suke cikin tunani da koyarwar Musulunci da har zai zamanto kafar ungulu ga tsare-tsare da siyasar manyan kasashen duniya, sannan kuma me za su samu wajen bakanta fuskar Musulunci?
mt0: <pad> What are the things in the Islamic thought and teaching that will be the basis for the world's major political and economic policies, and what will they gain by denigrating the face of Islam?</s>

en: Hence, my first request is: Study and research the incentives behind this widespread tarnishing of the image of Islam.
hau: A saboda haka, bukata ta ta farko ita ce ku yi tambaya da kuma binciko dalilin irin wannan gagarumin kokari na bata sunan Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> So, my first request is to ask and investigate why such a great effort is being made to defame the name of Islam.</s>

en: My second request is that in reaction to the flood of prejudgments and disinformation campaigns, try to gain a direct and firsthand knowledge of this religion.
hau: Bukata ta ta biyu, ita ce yayin mayar da martani ga irin wannan gagarumin bakar farfagandar bata sunan Musulunci (da ake yi), ku yi kokarin fahimtar wannan addini (Musulunci) da koyarwar ta hakika kai tsaye.
mt0: <pad> The second requirement is that while responding to such a massive and defamatory propaganda against Islam, you try to understand the true meaning of this religion and its teachings directly.</s>

en: The right logic requires that you understand the nature and essence of what they are frightening you about and want you to keep away from. I don't insist that you accept my reading or any other reading of Islam. What I want to say is: Don't allow this dynamic and effective reality in today's world to be introduced to you through resentments and prejudices.
hau: Lafiyayyen hankali yana hukumta wajibcin sanin hakikanin abin da ake tsoratar da ku shi da kuma nesanta ku daga gare shi. Ni dai ba ina cewa ne lalle sai kun yarda da fahimta ta ko fahimtar wani kan Musulunci ba, sai dai abin da nake cewa shi ne kada ku bari a kange ku daga wannan hakikar wacce take da tasiri cikin duniyar yau saboda cimma wata bakar manufa.
mt0: <pad> The wise mind dictates the necessity of knowing the truth of what is being feared and distance yourself from it. I am not saying you must accept my understanding of Islam, but I am saying you should not be distracted from this reality that has a profound effect in the modern world for one single purpose.</s>

en: Don't allow them to hypocritically introduce their own recruited terrorists as representatives of Islam.
hau: Kada ku bari cikin riya su gabatar muku da ‘yan ta'addan da suke karkashin ikonsu a matsayin wakilan Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Don't let them pretend to be representatives of Islam.</s>

en: Receive knowledge of Islam from its primary and original sources.
hau: Kamata yayi ku fahimci Musulunci daga tushensa na asali.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to understand Islam from its source and origin.</s>

en: Gain information about Islam through the Qur'an and the life of its great Prophet.
hau: Ku fahimci Musulunci ta hanyar Alkur'ani da rayuwar Annabin Musulunci (tsira da amincin Allah su tabbata a gare shi da Alayensa).
mt0: <pad> Understand Islam through the Quran and the life of Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him and his family).</s>

en: I would like to ask you whether you have directly read the Qur'an of the Muslims.
hau: A nan ina son in tambaye ku, shin ya zuwa yanzu kun taba karanta Alkur'anin musulmi kai tsaye?
mt0: <pad> I would like to ask you, have you ever read the Quran?</s>

en: Have you studied the teachings of the Prophet of Islam and his humane, ethical doctrines?
hau: Shin kun taba karantar koyarwar Annabin Musulunci (tsira da amincin Allah su tabbata a gare shi da Alayensa) da kyawawan halaye da ‘yan'adamtakarsa?
mt0: <pad> Do you know the teachings of Muhammad (peace be upon him and his family) and his good qualities and humanity?</s>

en: Have you ever received the message of Islam from any sources other than the media?
hau: Shin ya zuwa yanzu kun fahimci sakon Musulunci ta wata kafa ta daban, ba kafar watsa labarai ba?
mt0: <pad> Do you know the message of Islam through other means, not just media?</s>

en: Have you ever asked yourself how and on the basis of which values has Islam established the greatest scientific and intellectual civilization of the world and raised the most distinguished scientists and intellectuals throughout several centuries?
hau: Shin kun taba tambayar kanku ya ya aka yi wannan Musuluncin, sannan bisa wasu koyarwa ya samu daman zama mafi girman al'adu da ci gaban ilimi da tunani na duniya sannan kuma ya tarbiyyantar da mafi girma da kyawun masana da masu tunani na duniya?
mt0: <pad> Do you ever wonder how this Islam was created, and on what principles did it become the biggest culture and scientific and philosophical development of the world and educate the greatest and best scientists and thinkers of the world?</s>

en: I would like you not to allow the derogatory and offensive image-buildings to create an emotional gulf between you and the reality, taking away the possibility of an impartial judgment from you.
hau: Ina kiranku da kada ku bari a yi amfani da bakar siyasa da wauta wajen katange ku daga gaskiya, da kuma kawar da yiyuwar yin alkalanci cikin adalci daga gare ku.
mt0: <pad> I urge you not to allow political violence and stupidity to prevent you from the truth, and deprive you of the right to fair trial.</s>

en: Today, the communication media have removed the geographical borders. Hence, don't allow them to besiege you within fabricated and mental borders.
hau: A halin yanzu da kafafen sadarwa suka rusa ganuwar kan iyakokin kasashe, kada ku bari a kange ku cikin kirkirarrun kan iyakoki na boge.
mt0: <pad> Now that the media have broken down the barriers of national borders, don't let yourself be caught in fake borders.</s>

en: Although no one can individually fill the created gaps, each one of you can construct a bridge of thought and fairness over the gaps to illuminate yourself and your surrounding environment.
hau: Duk da cewa babu wani mutum, a kan kansa, da zai cike wannan gibin da aka samar, amma kowane guda daga cikinku zai iya samar da gadar tunani da adalci a kan wannan gibin da aka haifar.
mt0: <pad> Although no one person, on his own, can fill this gap, but each of you can build a bridge of thought and justice over this gap that was created.</s>

en: While this preplanned challenge between Islam and you, the youth, is undesirable, it can raise new questions in your curious and inquiring minds.
hau: Duk da cewa wannan kalubalen da aka kirkira tsakanin Musulunci da ku matasa wani kalubale ne mai sarkakiyar gaske, to amma hakan yana iya kirkiro sabbin tambayoyi cikin zukatanku da suke neman sanin hakika.
mt0: <pad> Although this challenge posed between Islam and you young people is a very complicated challenge, it can create new questions in our minds that are looking for the truth.</s>

en: Attempts to find answers to these questions will provide you with an appropriate opportunity to discover new truths.
hau: Kokari wajen samo amsoshin wadannan tambayoyi, zai samar muku da wata dama ta gano wasu sabbin gaskiyar.
mt0: <pad> Trying to answer these questions will give you the chance to discover new facts.</s>

en: Therefore, don't miss the opportunity to gain proper, correct and unbiased understanding of Islam so that hopefully, due to your sense of responsibility toward the truth, future generations would write the history of this current interaction between Islam and the West with a clearer conscience and lesser resentment.
hau: A saboda haka, kada ku bari wannan dama ta fahimtar gaskiyar Musulunci ta kubuce muku, don me yiyuwa ta hanyar wannan jin nauyi a jika da kuke da shi, al'ummomi masu zuwa za su rubuta tarihin irin wannan mu'amala da kasashen yammaci suka yi da Musulunci cikin sauki ba tare da wahala ba.
mt0: <pad> So, don't let this opportunity to understand the truth of Islam slip away from you, for perhaps through this sense of responsibility, future generations will write the history of such an encounter that Western countries had with Islam easily and without difficulty.</s>

en: Seyyed Ali Khamenei
hau: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
mt0: <pad> Sayyid Ali Khamenei</s>

en: Leader Appoints Dr. Ahmadinejad as Member of Expediency Council - Khamenei.ir
hau: Jagora Ya Nada Dr.Ahmadinejad A Matsayin Memba A Majalisar Fayyace Maslahar Tsarin Musulunci Ta Iran
mt0: <pad> Dr.Ahmadinejad was nominated by the president as a member of the Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Council.</s>

en: Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of the Islamic Revolution appointed Dr. Ahmadinejad as member of the Expediency Council.
hau: Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei, cikin wani umurni da ya bayar, ya nada tsohon shugaban kasar Iran Dakta Mahmud Ahmadinejad a matsayin memba a majalisar fayyace maslahar tsarin Musulunci ta Iran.
mt0: <pad> The Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei, in an order he issued, nominated the former president of Iran Dr. Mahmud Ahmadinejad as a member of the Islamic Council of Reforms.</s>

en: The following is the full text of this edict issued on August 5, 2013.
hau: Abin da ke biye fassarar umurnin da Jagoran juyin juya halin Musuluncin ya bayar ne na wannan nadin:
mt0: <pad> The following is the translation of the order given by the Leader of the Islamic Revolution.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai.
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin kai.</s>

en: Dr. Ahmadinejad (may his achievements continue),
hau: Mai Girma Dakta Mahmud Ahmadinejad (Allah Ya kara taimakonsa)
mt0: <pad> The Supreme Leader of Iran, Dr. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad (Allah Ya kara taimakonsa)</s>

en: Considering your valuable eight-year efforts in the crucial position of the presidency and the great experience that you gained in this position, I appoint you as member of the Expediency Council.
hau: Bisa la'akari da kokari da ayyuka masu kima da ka gudanar tsawon shekaru takwas a matsayin shugaban kasar Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran sannan da kuma irin kwarewar da ka samu a wannan bangaren.
mt0: <pad> Given your efforts and valuable work during the eight years as president of the Islamic Republic of Iran and your experience in this field, I am pleased to offer you the position of ambassador to the United States.</s>

en: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
hau: Sayyid Ali Khamenei
mt0: <pad> Sayyid Ali Khamenei</s>

en: Shrine - Khamenei.ir  The following is the full text of the speech delivered on March 20, 2012 by Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of the Islamic Revolution to a group of pilgrims at Imam Ridha's (a.s.) shrine in the holy city of Mashhad.
hau: Shimfida: Abin da ke biye fassarar jawabin da Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamene'i ya yi ne a ranar 20, Maris 2011 a lokacin ganawarsa da dubun dubatan mutane a haramin Imam Ridha (a.s) da ke birnin Mashhad a ranar farko ta sabuwar shekarar 1393 hijira shamsiyya
mt0: <pad> The following is the translation of the speech made by the Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei on 20th March 2011 at the meeting with hundreds of people in the holy Imam Ridha (a.s) mosque in Mashhad on the first day of the new year 1393 hijri shamsi.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds, and peace and greetings be upon our Master and Prophet, Ab-al-Qassem Mustafa Muhammad, and upon his immaculate, pure and chosen household, especially the one remaining with Allah on earth.
hau: Dukkan godiya ta tabbata ga Allah Ubangijin talikai. Tsira da amincin Allah su tabbata ga Shugabanmu kuma Annabinmu Abul Kasim al-Mustafa Muhammad tare da Alayensa tsarkaka musamman ma Wanzajjen Allah a bayan kasa.
mt0: <pad> All praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universes. May peace and blessings be upon our leader and prophet Muhammad with his holy family, especially the Messengers of Allah on earth.</s>

en: I am thankful to Allah the Exalted from the bottom of my heart who gave me another opportunity to meet you dear people and youth - including the honorable people of Mashhad and the surrounding areas as well as the esteemed pilgrims who have travelled from other cities - at the spiritual shrine of Ali ibn Musa ar-Ridha (a.s.) and to enjoy the spiritual blessings of sitting in the shade of Imam Ridha (a.s.) and his holy shrine.
hau: Ina gode wa Allah Madaukakin Sarki daga tsakiyar zuciyata da Ya sake ba ni wata dama ta daban ta ganawa da ku al'umma masu girma, matasa masu girma, shin mutanen Mashhad masu girma ne ko kuma wadanda suka kawo ziyara, 'yan'uwa maza da mata masu girma a wannan waje mai tsarki na hubbaren Abul Hasan Ali bn Musa al-Ridha (a.s) sannan kuma mu sami albarkacin sabuwar shekara ta hanya zama a karkashin inuwar haramin wannan Ma'abocin girman.
mt0: <pad> I thank God from the bottom of my heart for giving me another chance to meet you, the great people of Mashhad, the great visitors, the great men and women in this holy place of Abul Hasan Ali bn Musa al-Ridha (a.s) and to share the blessings of the new year by being under the shadow of this holy shrine.</s>

en: I extend my congratulations on Norouz and the arrival of the new year and I hope that for all the people of Iran, this new year will be full of happiness, blessings, joy, dynamism, activity and success in acquiring religious knowledge and achieving piety.
hau: Ina isar da sakon tayar murnar idin Nurouz da shigowar sabuwar shekara, ina fatan wannan shekarar da muka shigo za ta zamanto shekara mai cike da albarkoki da kuma farin ciki, nishadi da kuma ayyukan na kwarai ga dukkanin al'ummar Iran sannan kuma ta zamanto hanyar samun masaniya ta Ubnangiji da kuma tsoron Allah Madaukakin Sarki.
mt0: <pad> I am sending my wishes for the Eid al-Nirooz and the New Year, I hope this year will be full of blessings and joy, happiness and good deeds for all Iranians and a way to gain knowledge of God and fear of the Most High.</s>

en: I would like to discuss a few issues with you dear brothers and sisters in this meeting.
hau: Akwai wadansu batutuwa da nake son magana kansu a yayin wannan ganawa da ku 'yan'uwa maza da mata.
mt0: <pad> There are some things I want to talk about with you, brothers and sisters, during this meeting.</s>

en: The first part of my speech is a brief look at the events that happened in our country in the year 1390 and at the regional and global developments that were related to us.
hau: Batu na farko, dubi ne a gurguje cikin abubuwan da suka faru a gare mu, a kan al'ummarmu da kasarmu da kuma abubuwan da suka shafe mu a fagage na duniya da wannan yankin.
mt0: <pad> The first is a brief overview of what has happened to us, to our people and to our country and what has affected us in the world and this region.</s>

en: The reason why I want to discuss the developments of the year 1390 - and particularly the achievements that were made by the Iranian nation last year - is that our enemies and ill-wishers are making threats against our dear nation.
hau: Dalilin da ya sanya mu ke magana kan batutuwan da suka faru a shekarar 1390 (da ta gabata) musamman irin nasarorin da al'ummar Iran suka samu a wannan shekarar shi ne saboda irin makirce-makircen da makiya da masu bakar aniya suka ta kulla wa al'ummar Iran ne.
mt0: <pad> The reason we are talking about the events of 1390 (last year) and the successes of the Iranian people is because of the conspiracies and plots that the enemies and the wicked have been planning against the Iranian people.</s>

en: The leaders of the arrogant powers, those who have power and wealth and their followers in our region are doing everything in their power - their financial, propaganda and political power - to intimidate the Iranian people and to disappoint them.
hau: Shugabannin girman kai da masu tinkaho da kuma amfani da karfi da tursasawa da kuma 'yan amshin shatansu na wannan yanki na mu - sun yi amfani da dukkanin karfinsu, shin karfi ne na kudi, ko karfi na farfaganda da kuma na siyasa - wajen ganin sun razana al'ummar Iran da kuma sanya su yanke kauna.
mt0: <pad> The arrogants and the power-hungry leaders and their henchmen in our region have used all their power, whether it be money, propaganda or political, to make the people of Iran resentful and discouraged.</s>

en: Anybody who has followed the political propaganda of the ill-wishers of the Iranian nation realizes that all the activities, all the economic and political efforts and all the security and military threats are aimed at stopping, disappointing and intimidating the vibrant, living, dynamic, determined and capable Iranian nation, a nation that is standing firm in the middle of the arena in a totally courageous way, a nation that is moving forward.
hau: Duk wanda ya ke bi irin farfagandar da masu bakar aniya kan al'ummar Iran suke yi, a fili zai iya ganin irin wadannan kokari na aiki, kokari na tattalin arziki da kokari na siyasa, barazana ta soji da dai sauransu da suka yi wajen ganin sun dunkufar da tsayayyiyar al'ummar Iran daga fagen ci gaba da gudanar da ayyukanta da kuma samun ci gaba, su sanya ta yanke kauna da kuma razana ta daga irin wannan kasantuwa da take da ita a fage.
mt0: <pad> Whoever follows the propaganda of the wicked people of Iran can clearly see all these efforts, both work and economic and political, military and other threats that they have made to try to keep the stable Iranian people from carrying out their activities and progress, to make them lose their hope and desire from their existence in this field.</s>

en: In fact, aside from the slogan of "we can" which our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) taught us, the Revolution also gave us the courage to say, "We can". They want to convince us that we are incapable.
hau: A hakikanin gaskiya suna son su fitar da wannan akida ta cewa 'lalle za mu iya' wanda mai girma Imam (Khumaini) ne ya koya mana ita sannan kuma juyin juya halin Musulunci ya ba mu karfin gwuiwan cewa lalle 'za mu iya' din daga zuciyar al'umma da cusa musu cewa lalle ku din nan ba za ku iya wani abu ba.
mt0: <pad> In fact, they want to remove the 'we can' attitude that the great Imam (Khomeini) has taught us and the revolution of Islam has strengthened it from the heart of the people and instill in them that you are not capable of anything.</s>

en: They are doing everything in their power to achieve this goal and their activities reached full swing in the year 1390.
hau: Sun yi dukkanin kokarinsu wajen ganin sun cimma wannan manufar. Shekarar da ta gabatar ta kasance shekarar da suka kara kaimi ainun wajen cimma hakan.
mt0: <pad> They have done all they can to achieve this goal. Last year was a year when they were very determined to achieve it.</s>

en: I would like to stress that despite their will and much to their disappointment, in the year 1390 the Iranian nation once again convinced the enemies and the entire world - with its activities, advances and decisions - that it is capable.
hau: Ina son kowa ya fahimci cewa cewar sabanin abin da suke fatan gani al'ummar Iran ta hanyar ci gaba da tafiya a kan tafarkin da suka rika da kuma irin ci gaban da suka samu da kuma tsayin dakansu sun bada musu kasa a ido da kuma tabbatar wa dukkan duniya ciki kuwa har da makiya din cewa 'lalle za mu iya'.
mt0: <pad> I want everyone to understand that against what they hoped for, the people of Iran by continuing on their path and their progress and their determination have proved to the world including the enemies that "we can do it."</s>

en: The reason why we stress our strengths is to prove that the Iranian nation made use of its capabilities. The Iranian nation proved that it is capable in spite of the will of the ill-wishers who wanted to prove that the Iranian nation was incapable.
hau: Dalilin da ya sanya muke ta magana kan bangarorin karfi da nasarorin da aka samu shi ne don mu tabbatar wa (duniya) cewa al'ummar Iran ta yi amfani da irin wannan karfi da take da shi ne sannan kuma sabanin abin da masu bakar aniya suke son nunawa cewa al'ummar Iran ba za su iya ba, sun tabbatar da cewa lalle za su iya.
mt0: <pad> The reason we are talking about the strengths and the successes is to show the world that the people of Iran have used this power and that, contrary to what the arrogants want to show, they have proven that they can do it.</s>

en: We are aware of our weak points. We have our own weak points, but in general, our strengths are far more than our weak points.
hau: Ba wai ba mu da bangarori na rauni ba ne, lalle muna da bangarori na rauni; to amma a yanayi na gaba daya bangaren karfin da muke da shi da kuma irin nasarorin da muka samu sun fi bangarorin raunin yawa.
mt0: <pad> No, we don't have weaknesses, we do have them; but in the general context our strengths and our successes are far greater than our weaknesses.</s>

en: The year 1390 was named "The Year of Economic Jihad".
hau: Mun ba wa shekarar 1390 (da ta gabata) sunan 'Shekarar Kokarin Bunkasa Tattalin Arziki"; a saboda haka a wannan shekarar (zan fara maganata ne) daga batun tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> We named the year 1390 (last year) as the Year of Economic Expansion; so this year I will start my speech with the economic issue.</s>

en: What is noteworthy is the economic movement of our government officials which was accompanied by the exemplary and praiseworthy cooperation of the people throughout the year 1390.
hau: Lalle irin ayyukann da jami'an kasar nan suka gudanar a fagen tattalin arziki tare da kuma irin hadin kan da mutane suka ba su tsawon shekarar da ta gabatan wani lamari ne abin ambato da jinjinawa.
mt0: <pad> The efforts of the government in the field of economic development and the support of the people throughout the year is something to be praised and admired.</s>

en: Among the things that can be mentioned in this regard is the issue of redistributing state subsidies.
hau: Daga cikin abubuwan da za a iya ambato a wannan bangaren shi ne wannan siyasa ta manufantar da irin tallafin da gwamnati take bayarwa.
mt0: <pad> One of the examples of this policy is the concentration of government support.</s>

en: All economic experts - both the ones who served in the previous governments and those who serving in the current government - unanimously agree that redistributing state subsidies is a necessity for the country.
hau: Bakin dukkanin masanan tattalin arziki, shin a cikin gwamnatocin da suka gabata ne ko kuma cikin wannan gwamnatin ne sun hadu kan cewa aiwatar da wannan siyasar dai ta zama dole a kasar nan; kowa ya yarda da hakan.
mt0: <pad> All economic experts, whether in the previous governments or in this government, agreed that implementing this policy was necessary for the country; everyone agreed on that.</s>

en: In spite of the fact that everybody agreed on the necessity of taking action, nobody had done anything due to the complexities and hardships involved. In the year 1390, the executive and legislative branches of government made efforts and carried out important stages of this work while we were under sanctions and while the hardships and complexities were more than ever before.
hau: Duk kuwa da cewa wannan wani lamari ne da aka yi tarayya a kansa, to amma lamarin ya ci gaba da zama ba tare da an aiwatar da shi saboda irin matsaloli da wahalhalun da ke cikinsa. Amma gwamnati da majalisa a shekarar da ta gabatan, a irin wannan yanayi na takunkumi da ake ciki wanda matsala da wahalar da ke cikin lamari ya fi na koyaushe wahala, sun yi himma da fara aiwatar da wannan aiki, kuma ya zuwa yanzu an aiwatar da wani bangare mai muhimmanci na shirin.
mt0: <pad> Although this is a common goal, it has been unable to be implemented because of the difficulties and problems in it. But the government and the parliament last year, in the current economic sanctions situation where the difficulty and problem in it is more than ever, have taken the initiative to start implementing this work, and so far a significant part of the plan has been implemented.</s>
