en: The work is not finished yet, but what has been done so far by our government officials both in the executive branch and in the Majlis - which have been mostly successful due to the support and cooperation of the people - are very important and remarkable.
hau: Aikin dai ba mai karewa ba ne, to amma abin da ya zuwa yanzu jami'an gwamnati - shin a cikin gwamnatin ne ko kuma a majalisa - suka yi sannan kuma jama'a suka goyi bayansu lalle an samu nasarori kuma an aiwatar da aiki mai muhimmanci abin jinjinawa.
mt0: <pad> The work is not over yet, but what the government officials - whether in government or in the House of Commons - have done and the people have backed them is a success and a very important work done.</s>

en: All our honorable people are familiar with the objectives, but it is necessary to reflect on them. The work that has been done is great.
hau: Dukkanin al'ummarmu sun ji su, to amma wajibi ne a yi tunani sosai a kansu. Wannan aikin, aiki ne mai girma; aiki ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> Everyone in our community has heard them, but we must think carefully about them. This work is a great work; it is an important work.</s>

en: One of the objectives of this law is fair distribution of the state subsidies.
hau: Daya daga cikin manufofin wannan shirin shi ne raba irin tallafin da gwamnati take bayarwa ga al'umma cikin adalci.
mt0: <pad> One of the objectives of this program is to share the government's support to the people fairly.</s>

en: I explained in a speech that state subsidies have always been distributed among the people in an unfair way: this is the nature of general subsidies.
hau: A baya a wani jawabi na yi bayani kan hakan cewa a baya ana raba irin wannan tallafi tsakanin bangarori daban-daban na al'umma ne ta hanyar da babu adalci a cikinta; a dabi'ance dai haka aikin raba tallafi yake.
mt0: <pad> I have already explained in a previous speech that this aid was distributed among different groups of the community in an unfair way; in fact, that is the nature of the distribution of aid.</s>

en: I have received reliable reports from across the country that targeted subsidies have played a significant role in improving living standards of the lower social classes.
hau: Ina da ingantaccen labari daga bangarori daban-daban na kasar nan da ke nuni da cewa hakan yayi tasiri wajen kyautata rayuwar mutane marasa shi a tsakanin al'umma.
mt0: <pad> I have a good report from different parts of the country that it has had a positive impact on improving the lives of the poor in the community.</s>

en: This is one of the goals, which is also the most important objective of the subsidy law.
hau: Wannan daya ne daga cikin manufofin wannan shirin kuma shi ne mafi muhimmancin manufar aiwatar da wannan dokar.
mt0: <pad> This is one of the objectives of this program and is the most important purpose of implementing this law.</s>

en: Another goal is to reform the structure of production and the structure of our economy.
hau: Wata manufar kuma ta daban, ita ce gyara tsarin abubuwan da ake samarwa da kuma tsarin tattalin arziki na kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Another goal is to improve the production and economic system of the country.</s>

en: Economic experts unanimously agree that targeted subsidies can resolve this problem. They agree that wasteful and low-yield production can be remedied and a balance can be created between input and output.
hau: Bisa kididdigar masanan tattalin arziki - wanda dukkaninsu sun yi tarayya kan hakan - ana iya gyara hakan ta hanyar aiwatar da wannan shiri na manufantar da irin tallafin da ake bayarwa; hakan zai iya daidaita irin abubuwan da ake samarwa da kuma amfani da shi.
mt0: <pad> According to the estimates of economic experts - who all agree on this - this can be corrected by implementing this program of targeting subsidies; it can balance the production and use of resources.</s>

en: Another goal is to manage energy consumption.
hau: Wata manufar kuma ta daban ita ce amfani da makamashin da ake da shi yadda ya dace.
mt0: <pad> Another goal is to make the most of the available energy.</s>

en: Because we have been an oil-rich country, we have been in the habit of using gas, natural gas, diesel and kerosene in a wasteful way.
hau: Da yake mu din nan kasa ce da Allah ya albarkace ta da man fetur, don haka mun saba da yin almubazzaranci wajen amfani da man fetur, gas, kananzir ba tare da lura ba.
mt0: <pad> Since we are a country blessed with oil, we have been used to waste oil, gas and canned goods without care.</s>

en: Our consumption has been more wasteful than many countries - and in a sense, more wasteful than all countries in the world.
hau: Irin yadda muke amfani da wadannan albarkatu ya dara na da dama daga cikin kasashen duniya - mai yiyuwa ne ma ana iya cewa sama da dukkanin kasashen duniya.
mt0: <pad> Our use of these resources is better than that of many other countries in the world - perhaps even above all other countries in the world.</s>

en: Reliable statistics have been published which show that if the subsidy law had not been implemented, we would be consuming gas almost twice the amount we currently do.
hau: Kididdigar da aka fitar, kuma kididdiga ce abar yarda, tana nuna mana cewa idan da a ce har ya zuwa yanzu ba a fara aiwatar da wannan shiri ba, to da kuwa irin amfani da mai da ake yi a kasar nan ya ninka irin yadda ake amfani da shi a halin yanzu har sau biyu.
mt0: <pad> The statistics, and they are credible statistics, show that if this plan had not been implemented, the use of oil in the country would have doubled as much as it is now.</s>

en: When we do not produce sufficient gasoline to meet our domestic needs, what do we have to do?
hau: A lokacin da ya zamana ba ma samar da wadataccen man da ake bukata a cikin gida, to me ya wajaba mu aikata?
mt0: <pad> When we don't have enough oil to meet our needs in the house, what do we need to do?</s>

en: We would have to import it.
hau: Kenan wajibi ne mu shigo da mai daga waje; wato wajibi ne al'ummar Iran su zamanto masu mika kokon bara zuwa hannun makiya da masu bakar aniya.
mt0: <pad> Now we have to import oil from abroad; that is, the people of Iran must be dependent on the enemy and a coward.</s>

en: Today our domestic consumption of gasoline is approximately as much as our production. We do not need to import gasoline, which is a great advantage for the country.
hau: To amma sakamakon wannan aikin an samu nasarar yin tsumulmular mai din. A halin yanzu man da ake amfani da shi a cikin gida kusan ya yi daidai da abin da ake samarwa; saboda haka babu bukatar mu shigo da mai.
mt0: <pad> But as a result of this work, the oil was extracted. At present the domestic oil used is roughly equal to the production; so we do not need to import oil.</s>

en: This was done in the year 1390, exactly when our enemies increased their sanctions on us in order to bring our nation to its knees.
hau: Wannan aiki ne da aka yi shi a shekarar 1390 da ta gabata; a daidai lokacin da makiyanmu suka sanya mana takunkumi don su dunkufar da al'ummarmu.
mt0: <pad> This work was done in the year 1390; at the same time that our enemies imposed a ban on us to destroy our people.</s>

en: But our youth made efforts and foiled the plots of the enemy with their actions.
hau: To amma matasan cikin al'ummarmu sun yi himma, ta hanyar irin wannan aikin na su sun sami nasarar magance makircin makiya.
mt0: <pad> But our young people have been brave, through their work they have managed to overcome the plots of the enemies.</s>

en: Another important economic measure which was taken with the help of our people was in the arena of science and technology.
hau: Wani aiki mai muhimmancin gaske da aka aiwatar da shi a shekaar da ta gabatan, sakamakon himmar jama'a, shi ne abin da aka yi a fagen ilimi da fasaha.
mt0: <pad> Another important work that has been done in the past year, thanks to the people's determination, is what has been done in the field of education and technology.</s>

en: Science and technology is one of the pillars of a nation's economic power.
hau: Ilimi da fasaha daya ne daga cikin tushen tabbatar da tattalin arziki da sanya shi tsayawa da kafafunsa.
mt0: <pad> Education and technology is one of the pillars of economic development and making it stand on its own.</s>

en: A nation that enjoys advanced knowledge and technology will achieve wealth, political independence, honor and power.
hau: A lokacin da wata al'umma ta sami ilimi da ya ci gaba da fasaha ta zamani, to kuwa za ta sami dukiya haka nan kuma za ta sami karfi na siyasa, za ta zamanto mai mutumci da kuma samun karfi.
mt0: <pad> When a nation has developed modern technology, it will have wealth and political power, it will be respected and strong.</s>

en: I am sensitive to the issue of scientific and technological progress because of the key role it plays.
hau: Saboda irin muhimmancin da lamarin ci gaba na ilimi da fasaha yake da shi ne ya sanya nake ba wa wannan lamari muhimmanci na musamman.
mt0: <pad> For the importance of education and technology, I have given this matter special attention.</s>

en: I receive different reports from different channels on a regular basis and I can say with certainty that the level of our country's advances is much higher than what has been reported.
hau: Ina samun rahotanni daban-daban a kusan kullum daga bangarori daban-daban (kan irin ayyukan da ake gudanarwa) don haka ina iya sanar da ku cewa irin ci gaban da aka samu a kasar nan nesa ba kusa ba ya fi abubuwan da ya zuwa yanzu aka sanar.
mt0: <pad> I get reports from different departments almost every day, so I can tell you that the progress made in the country is far more than what has been announced so far.</s>

en: According to the reports prepared by reliable scientific centers of world - and not our own scientific centers - the fastest scientific growth is taking place in Iran.
hau: A bisa ga rahoton da cibiyoyin ilimi na duniya da aka yarda da su suka fitar - wanda ba wai cibiyoyin iliminmu ne suka fadi ba - a halin yanzu mafi saurin ci gaba na ilimi da ake samu a duniya shi ne wanda yake faruwa a Iran.
mt0: <pad> According to the report of internationally-recognized scientific institutions - not our own - at present the fastest scientific development in the world is that occurring in Iran.</s>

en: Reliable scientific centers of the world reported that in the year 2011 - which ended three months before the year 1390 - the scientific growth of the Iranian nation was 20 percent more than the year 2010. What is the meaning of this?
hau: A shekarar 1390 wadda ta yi kusan daidai da shekara ta 2011 miladiyya, rahoton da cibiyoyin ilimi na duniya suka fitar a shekara ta 2011 - wanda watanni uku kenan da karewarta - al'ummar Iran ta sami gagarumin ci gaba na ilimi sama da irin wadda ta samu a shekara ta 2010 miladiyya sannan kuma irin ci gaban da ta samu ya kai kashi ashirin cikin dari. Mece ce ma'anar hakan?
mt0: <pad> In 1390 which is roughly equivalent to 2011, the World Education Report 2011 - which was three months after its release - showed that Iran had made a substantial educational progress over the previous year 2010 and that the increase in the percentage was 20%. What does that mean?</s>

en: The Iranian nation acted like that in a situation in which the enemies of the Iranian nation were betting on our collapse and were describing their sanctions as crippling.
hau: An samu hakan ne a daidai lokacin da makiyan al'ummar Iran suka sha alwashin kawar da al'ummar Iran suna cewa mun sanya wa al'ummar Iran takunkumi mai ruguzarwa, to amma sai ga shi al'ummar Iran ta samu nasarar aiwatar da irin wannan aikin.
mt0: <pad> This happened at the same time that the enemies of Iran tried to eliminate Iran by saying that we have imposed a sanctions on Iran, but the Iranians managed to do just that.</s>

en: Reliable scientific centers of the world also report that Iran is the top country in the region in terms of its scientific level and that it ranks 17th in the world.
hau: Har ila yau a cikin rahotannin na su - shi din ma rahoton cibiyoyin ilimi da aka yarda da su a duniya - da ke cewa a wannan yanki Iran ita ce ta farko a fagen ci gaban ilimi, sannan kuma ta goma sha bakwai a dukkan duniya.
mt0: <pad> Also in their report - also a report by internationally recognized education institutions - that Iran is the first country in the region in terms of education development, and the seventeenth country in the world.</s>

en: These reports are prepared by those who would not refuse to present false reports against us if they could, yet they acknowledge our growth like this. In the year 1390 we made progress in biotechnology. We made progress in nanotechnology.
hau: Wannan rahoto ne da wasu mutane wadanda idan da a ce suna da damar fitar da wani rahoto sabanin hakan da sun yi; to amma sai ga shi suna fadin hakan. A shekarar 1390 mun sami ci gaba a fagen fasahar halittu, haka nan a fasahar Nano, a fagen fasahar ilimin sararin samaniya mun sami ci gaba - wanda a shekarar ce aka harba tauraron dan'adam na Nawid - mun sami ci gaba a fagen fasahar nukiliya, mun sami nasarar tace sinadarin uranium kashi ashirin cikin dari a shekarar 1390.
mt0: <pad> This is a report by some people who if they had the power to do otherwise, they would have done it. In 1390 we made progress in biotechnology, nanotechnology, space technology - which was the year that the first human satellite was launched - and nuclear technology, we were able to purify uranium by 20 percent in 1390.</s>

en: In the year 1389 the Americans and others proposed certain preconditions for this 20-percent uranium.
hau: Wannan tace uranium kashi ashirin cikin dari din, shi ne abin da a shekarar 1389 Amurka da sauransu suka ta kafa mana sharudda kafin su ba mu shi.
mt0: <pad> This means 20% uranium, which in 1389 the United States and others imposed conditions before they gave us it.</s>

en: We had to prepare it for our research reactor in Tehran, which has been built to produce radiopharmaceuticals: we had run out of 20-percent enriched uranium.
hau: Ya zama wajibi mu samar da makamashi (wato tacaccen uranium kashi ashirin cikin dari) ga cibiyar bincikenmu ta Tehran, saboda kuwa makashin da ake da shi din ya kusan karewa.
mt0: <pad> We have to provide energy (or 20 percent clean uranium) to our Tehran research center, because the energy available is almost running out.</s>

en: They proposed certain preconditions for providing this uranium. They said that we had to ship our uranium abroad to be enriched to 20-percent.
hau: Sun kafa mana wasu sharudda don ba mu uranium din suna cewa wajibi ne mu aike da uranium din da muka tace zuwa kasashen waje; to amma mun ki amincewa da hakan.
mt0: <pad> They imposed on us some conditions to get the uranium, which were that we had to export the purified uranium to other countries; but we refused to do that.</s>

en: The Americans used the Brazilian and Turkish governments as intermediaries in order to reach an agreement with us.
hau: Jami'an Brazil da na Turkiya sun zo nan suka zauna da shugaban kasarmu da yin bahasi sannan kuma suka sanya hannu kan wata yarjejeniya.
mt0: <pad> Brazil and Turkish officials came here to discuss with our president and sign a deal.</s>

en: After the agreement was signed, the Americans broke their promise: the agreement was not the kind of agreement they wanted. They wanted to win many concessions. They wanted to bully and blackmail us.
hau: To amma bayan da aka sanya hannu kan wannan yarjejeniyar sai Amurkawa suka yi watsi da shi. Ba sa so a sanya hannu kan wannan yarjejeniyar, suna so ne su sami karin wasu abubuwa, su yi amfani da karfi da tursasawa don a mika musu kai.
mt0: <pad> But after the agreement was signed, the Americans abandoned it. They didn't want to sign the agreement, they wanted to get more things, use force and pressure to make their way.</s>

en: Because the Americans broke their promise, the Brazilian and Turkish governments were embarrassed in front of us. This is the story of the 20-percent uranium.
hau: Sakamakon rashin cika alkawarin da Amurkawa suka yi, hakan ya sanya gwamnatocin Brazil da Turkiya cikin kunya. Wannan shi ne lamarin tace sinadarin uranium kashi ashirin cikin dari.
mt0: <pad> Because of the Americans' failure to fulfill their promises, it has left Brazil and Turkey in disgrace. This is the reason that they say they have 20 percent uranium oxide.</s>

en: In the year 1390, they produced 20-percent enriched uranium for the research reactor in Tehran and they announced their achievement to the world. Our enemies were astonished.
hau: A shekarar da ta gabatan sun samar da uranium da aka tace kashi ashirin cikin dari din don amfanin cibiyar nukiliyan Tehran sannan kuma suka sanar da hakan ga duniya; haka makiyanmu suka shiga cikin damuwa suka rasa abin yi.
mt0: <pad> Last year they produced 20 percent enriched uranium for Tehran's nuclear center and announced it to the world; so our enemies were in great distress and lost for words.</s>

en: Although they knew the nuclear reactor in Tehran only produces radiopharmaceuticals, they refused to provide the 20-percent uranium we needed. The reactor in Tehran fulfills the needs of our hospitals and laboratories across the country and thousands of patients need these radiopharmaceuticals, yet they proposed preconditions to blackmail us.
hau: Duk kuwa da cewa sun san cewa cibiyar ta Tehran saboda samar da magani ne - wato saboda biyan bukatar marasa lafiya da gudanar da bincike wanda kuma dubban marasa lafiya suna bukatar wannan cibiyar - to amma kuma duk da hakan suka hana (wannan makamashin), suka ki sayarwa, suna masu kafa sharadi da neman a mika muku kai.
mt0: <pad> Although they know that the Tehran Center is for medicine - for the need of patients and research - they have refused to sell, imposing conditions and demanding that you be brought up to the brink.</s>

en: Our youth produced the uranium we needed.
hau: Nan take matasanmu suka samar da shi.
mt0: <pad> When my father was a child, he would often make fun of him.</s>

en: The work was complicated and difficult, but our youth managed to do it. Currently various kinds of radiopharmaceuticals are being produced at the research center in Tehran with domestically produced uranium.
hau: Aiki ne mai wahala da rikitarwa, aiki ne mai wahala, amma haka aka aiwatar da shi sannan kuma a halin yanzu ana ci gaba da samar da magunguna daban-daban a wannan cibiya ta Tehran da wannan makamashi da aka samar da shi a cikin gida.
mt0: <pad> It was a difficult and complicated task, but it was done and now the Tehran center is continuing to produce different medicines with this domestically-produced energy.</s>

en: This was done in the year 1390.
hau: Wannan lamari ne da ya faru a shekara ta 1390 (da ta gabata).
mt0: <pad> This happened in the year 1390 (the previous year).</s>

en: In the year 1390 fuel plates were produced domestically in the nuclear industry.
hau: A takaice dai a lokacin da aka taso da maganar musayen uranium din da aka tace a cikin gida, suna cewa ne ku ba wa kasar Rasha uranium din da kuka tace kashi uku da rabi cikin dari, kasar Rasha ta tace shi zuwa kashi ashirin cikin dari; daga nan ta mika shi ga kasar Faransa, ita kuwa kasar Faransa ta mai she shi zuwa makamashi sai ta ba mu shi. Ina, sai masana da matasanmu suka ce mu da kanmu za mu iya samar da wannan makashin; inda suka yi himma da kokari sannan kuma suka samar da shi da kuma nuna shi ga duniya.
mt0: <pad> In short, when the matter of uranium fuel exchange was raised, they said you should give Russia three and a half percent of your uranium fuel, Russia will turn it into 20 percent; then Russia will give it to France, France will turn it into energy and give it to us. Well, our engineers and scientists said we can make this energy by ourselves; and they made it and showed it to the world.</s>

en: This was done in the year 1390.
hau: Wannan lamari ne da ya faru a shekara ta 1390.
mt0: <pad> This event took place in the year 1390.</s>

en: The sixfold increase in recombinant drugs and the increase in the export of knowledge-based products and services - these achievements were made in the year 1390.
hau: Karuwar adadin magungunan da ake hadawa ninkin baninkiya har sau shida, da kuma irin karuwar kayayyakin da ake fitarwa waje da kuma irin ayyukan hidima ga al'umma da aka yi, dukkanin hakan an samar da su ne a sheakar 1390.
mt0: <pad> The increase in the number of medicines produced by the Armenians by six times, and the increase in export and social services, all of these were achieved in the year 1390.</s>

en: These are part of achievements which were made in "The Year of Economic Jihad".
hau: Wadannan wani bangare ne na irin nasarorin da aka samu a shekarar 'Kokarin bunkasa tattalin arziki" (shekarar da ta gabata).
mt0: <pad> These are part of the successes achieved in the year of "economic reform" (last year).</s>

en: These are technological advances.
hau: Wadannan ci gaba ne na ilimi, ci gaba ne na fasaha, abubuwa ne da suke nuni da karfi na ilimi, to amma dukkaninsu suna da tasiri na kai tsaye cikin tattalin arzikin kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> These are scientific progress, scientific technology, things that show the strength of science, but all of them have a direct impact on the economic growth of the country.</s>

en: Last week at the end of the year 1390, I visited the Research Institute of Petroleum Industry.
hau: A karshen wannan shekara ta 1390 - wato a wannan makon da ya wuce - na kai rangadi cibiyar bincike na masana'antar mai.
mt0: <pad> In the end of this year - last week - I visited the research center of the oil industry.</s>

en: There were certain things in the institute which can be witnessed when touring different other research centers of the country as well: they convince one that these advances are the rule, not the exception. These important advances - which our people would not even dream about - have been made already and they have become the rule.
hau: A nan na ga abubuwa da yawa da kuma irin ci gaban da aka samu a fagage daban-daban na ilimi, wanda ana iya ganin makamancin hakan ma a wasu bangarorin. Don haka ne mutum yana iya cewa ba wai kawai a wannan wajen ne aka samu irin wannan ci gaban ba. Wadansu abubuwa ne wadanda a baya al'ummarmu ko a mafarki ma ba su taba ganin irin wadannan ci gaban ba, to amma an cimma su.
mt0: <pad> I have seen many things and a lot of progress in different fields of education, which can be seen similar to that in other areas. So one can say that this progress is not only here. It's things that our people have never dreamed of seeing in the past, but they have been achieved.</s>

en: First of all, jihad-like spirit and thought were predominant in the institute.
hau: A matakin farko shi ne ruhi da tunani na jihadi da ke cikin zukatan masu gudanar da wannan aikin.
mt0: <pad> The first level is the spirit and thinking of jihad in the heart of those who perform this work.</s>

en: The scientists were working with a jihad-like spirit. They were working as if they were involved in jihad, as if they were fighting in the battlefield in the way of God.
hau: Wadannan masana suna gudnar da ayyukansu ne da ruhi na jihadi; wato tamkar mutanen da suke yin jihadi, tamkar suna a fagen jihadi saboda Allah ne.
mt0: <pad> These scientists are carrying out their work with the spirit of jihad; that is, like people who are fighting, like they are in the field of jihad for Allah.</s>

en: There is a big difference between those who work for the sake of money, social position, fame or knowledge and those who work for the sake of jihad in the way of God.
hau: Akwai bambanci tsakanin mutanen da suke aiki saboda kudi, saboda matsayi, saboda shahara ko kuma saboda shi kansa ilimi din da kuma wadanda suke aiki a matsayin jihadi saboda Allah.
mt0: <pad> There is a difference between people who work for money, for status, for fame or for the very knowledge itself and those who work as jihad for Allah.</s>

en: This is very valuable.
hau: Lalle hakan lamari ne mai kima da muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> It is a very precious and important event.</s>

en: The second characteristic is that our scientists consider the sanctions that are imposed on our nation as opportunities.
hau: Siffa ta biyu ita ce na ga cewa masananmu sun mayar da wannan takunkumi da aka sanya wa al'ummarmu zuwa wata dama.
mt0: <pad> The second feature is that I see that our wise men have transformed this ban on our community into an opportunity.</s>

en: During the visit to the institute, which lasted a long time, a few people told me, "Thank God they imposed sanctions on us.
hau: A yayin wannan rangadi na sa'oi da na kai, wasu mutane sun bayyana min cewa lalle muna gode wa Allah da suka sanya mana takunkumin.
mt0: <pad> During this visit, some people told me that they were thankful to God for putting us on this ban.</s>

en: The feeling that the sanctions imposed by the enemies provide us with an opportunity is very valuable.
hau: Wannan ruhi na jin cewa takunkumin da makiya suka sanya mana a matsayin wata dama, lamari ne mai kima da kuma muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> This spirit of seeing the restrictions that our enemies have placed on us as a chance is a precious and important thing.</s>

en: The third characteristic that I noticed among the employees of the institute was their great self-confidence.
hau: Siffa ta uku wacce na ganta a wancan wajen, ita ce irin gagarumar yarda da kai da ake da ita.
mt0: <pad> The third thing I noticed there was the kind of great trust that people have in you.</s>

en: Certain parts of the oil industry have been monopolized by three, four countries in the world: they do not allow other countries to access their technologies.
hau: Wasu bangarori na masana'antun mai din wasu 'yan kasashe uku zuwa hudu ne kawai suke da su; ba sa taba bari wani ya sami irin wannan fasahar.
mt0: <pad> Some areas of the oil industry are only owned by three to four countries; I have never seen anyone else acquire such technology.</s>

en: Over these years, our country has always asked them to do such important and complex things for us and we have paid for their services.
hau: Tsawon shekaru kasar mu take bukatar a koya mata wannan fagen da wadannan ayyuka masu wahala da rikitarwa sun kashe kudade masu yawa.
mt0: <pad> Over the years our country has needed to learn this field and these difficult and complicated tasks have spent a lot of money.</s>

en: I realized that they were determined and they were saying, "We can. We will do this on our own.
hau: To amma da idanuwana na ga cewa (masananmu) sun yi himma suna fadin cewa lalle za mu iya.
mt0: <pad> But I saw with my own eyes that they made a promise and said, "We can do it."</s>

en: This self-confidence is very valuable for a nation, for the scientists of a nation, for the youth of a nation.
hau: Irin wannan yarda da kai a tsakanin wata al'umma da wasu masana da matasa na wata al'umma lamari ne mai kimar gaske.
mt0: <pad> This kind of cooperation between a community and some experts and young people of another community is very important.</s>

en: Another characteristic is the tendency to employ young people.
hau: Wata siffar kuma ta daban ita ce yarda da matasa.
mt0: <pad> Another feature is the ability to accept a challenge.</s>

en: The work is being done by the youth.
hau: Don kuwa aiki yana hannun matasa ne.
mt0: <pad> Don't know that the job is in the hands of a young man.</s>

en: The youth are a source of innovation and creativity.
hau: Matasa kuma tushe ne na haske da samar da sabbin abubuwa.
mt0: <pad> The young are also the source of light and innovation.</s>

en: Another characteristic is the relationship between industry and university, which has always been among my wishes.
hau: Wata siffar kuma ta daban ita ce alakar masana'antu da jami'oi; wanda hakan ya kasance fatan da na jima ina da shi.
mt0: <pad> Another feature is the link between industry and universities; which has been my long-standing dream.</s>

en: I used to advise the officials in charge of the relevant sectors in the previous governments that they should try to establish a relationship between industry and university.
hau: A ko da yaushe na kasance ina shawartar jami'an bangarori daban-daban da suke da alaka da gwamnatocin da suka gabata cewa su yi kokari wajen kulla alaka tsakanin masana'antu da jami'a.
mt0: <pad> I've always been advising the various ministries of the previous governments to try to link up the industry and the university.</s>

en: Fortunately I saw at the institute that the relationship has been established.
hau: Abin farin cikin shi ne cewa a wancan wajen na ga cewa an tabbatar da irin wannan alakar.
mt0: <pad> I was happy to see that this relationship was being established.</s>

en: Of course, the relationship should be prevalent and all our industries should be linked to our universities. Then both our knowledge and our industries will grow.
hau: Ko da yake tabbas ne hakan ya hada da ko ina, a hada dukkanin masana'antunmu da jami'oi, hakan zai sanya mu samun ci gaban ilimi haka nan kuma bangaren masana'antunmu.
mt0: <pad> Although it is certainly everywhere, connecting all our companies with the university, this will allow us to have a further education and business development.</s>

en: This was the situation of the economic sector in the year 1390, a year in which the enemies and ill-wishers of the Iranian nation were constantly trying to intimidate us. Sometimes they made threats. Other times they mounted political pressure on us.
hau: Wannan bangaren tattalin arziki kenan a shekarar 1390; shekarar da tun daga farkonta zuwa karshenta makiya suka ta tada jijiyoyin wuya; a wasu lokutan suna barazana, a wasu lokutan suna yin matsin lamba na siyasa, a wasu lokutan kuma suna sanya mana takunkumi.
mt0: <pad> This is the economic situation in 1390; a year that from the beginning to the end the enemies have been fighting hard; sometimes with threats, sometimes with political pressure, sometimes with sanctions.</s>

en: The agents of the US government are making efforts throughout the world to implement the sanctions, hoping that they will harm the Iranian nation and create a rift between the Iranian people and the Islamic Republic.
hau: A halin yanzu 'yan amshin shatan gwamnatin Amurka a duk fadin duniya suna nan suna ta kokari wajen ganin sun aiwatar da wannan takunkumin, a tunaninsu don su cutar da al'ummar Iran da kuma haifar da rikici tsakanin al'ummar Iran da tsarin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Nowadays, the American proxy governments around the world are working hard to implement this ban, in their view to hurt the people of Iran and create a conflict between the people of Iran and the Islamic system.</s>

en: In the year 1390 we made other great achievements as well, including the active diplomacy that we employed in case of the regional issues.
hau: Akwai wasu manyan nasarorin da aka samu na daban a shekara ta 1390; ciki kuwa har da irin ayyukan diplomasiyya da aka gudanar da suka shafi batutuwan da suke faruwa a wannan yankin a shekarar 1390.
mt0: <pad> There were other major successes in the year 1390; including diplomacy efforts regarding the issues of the region in the year 1390.</s>

en: The Conference on Islamic Awakening, the Conference on Palestinian Intifada, the Conference on Disarmament and Non-Proliferation, the World Without Terrorism Conference and the Islamic Awakening and Youth Conference were among the activities which were carried out in Tehran.
hau: Gudanar da tarurrukan farkawa ta Musulunci, taron Palastinu, taron kwance damarar makamai, taron kasa da kasa na duniya ba tare da ayyukan ta'addanci ba, taron matasa da farkawa ta Musulunci, dukkanin wadannan suna daga cikin ayyukan da aka gudanar a Tehran.
mt0: <pad> The holding of the Iranian Revolution Conferences, the Palestine Conference, the UN conference on non-terrorism, the International Conference on Non-Terrorism, the Iranian Young and Iranian Revolution Conference, all these are some of the events held in Tehran.</s>

en: The Islamic Republic became the center of attention in the world of Islam which has awakened today.
hau: Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran ta zamanto wata cibiyar da idanuwar duniyar musulmi suka koma gare su, wanda a yau sun farka.
mt0: <pad> The Islamic Republic of Iran has been a center of attention for the Muslim world, which has woken up today.</s>

en: In the area of economic services, tens of thousands of houses were built in the country and were made available to the people.
hau: A fagen hidima ta tattalin arziki, an gina dubban gidaje da mika su ga jama'a.
mt0: <pad> In the framework of economic activities, thousands of houses have been built and offered to the public.</s>

en: These statistics are great. They are important statistics. Houses were built in rural areas.
hau: Wannan dai wani adadi ne mai girman gaske da muhimmanci. An gina gidaje a kauyuka, an gina tituna da manyan hanyoyi.
mt0: <pad> This is a very large and important number. Houses have been built in the villages, roads and major roads have been built.</s>

en: These are the preliminary stages of "The Decade of Progress and Justice".
hau: Wadannan abubuwa ne da aka samar da su a wadannan shekaru na ci gaba da tabbatar da adalci.
mt0: <pad> These things that have been created over the years have continued to ensure justice.</s>

en: One great example of the praiseworthy movements which were carried out by the Iranian nation in the year 1390 was the parliamentary election that was held on the 12th of Esfand.
hau: Duk da irin wadannan makirce-makirce na makiya da masu mummunar aniya, amma wannan al'umma ta kasance a tsaye da kuma samar da irin wannan ci gaban da aka samu.
mt0: <pad> However, despite all these plots of enemies and bad intentions, this community has remained firm and created the progress that has been achieved.</s>

en: Of course, I would stress that the election is not over yet. Our people should show the same magnificence in the second round as well.
hau: Ko da yake ya kamata a fahimci cewa har ya zuwa yanzu ba a kammala zaben ba; ina fatan al'umma za su fito kwansu da kwarkwatansu a lokacin da za a gudanar da zagaye na biyu na zaben.
mt0: <pad> Although it should be understood that the election is not yet over; I hope the people will come out in full force when the second round of the election is held.</s>

en: The election was extremely important.
hau: Wannan zaben dai yana da muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> This election is very important.</s>

en: As I have pointed out before, the enemies did everything in their power for around six months in order to discourage the people from taking part in the election.
hau: Ina son in sanar da ku, a baya ma na taba fadi, kimanin watanni shida kenan (makiya) suke ta iyakacin kokarinsu wajen ganin sun kashe gwuiwan al'umma don kada su fito.
mt0: <pad> I want to tell you, as I have already said, for about six months (almost) they've been trying to kill the minds of the people so that they can't come out.</s>

en: Sometimes they said the election would be rigged. Other times they said if the people did not take part in the election, the enemies would become less hostile, and they broadcast various kinds of propaganda in order to drive the people away from the polling stations and ballot boxes.
hau: A wani lokaci suna cewa za a yi mgudi; a wani lokacin kuma suna cewa matukar dai mutane suka ki fitowa to irin adawar da makiya suke yi da al'ummar Iran za ta ragu; sun gudanar da nau'oi daban-daban na farfaganda wajen hana mutane fitowa zaben.
mt0: <pad> They sometimes say that they are preparing for a coup; sometimes they say that if people do not vote, the hatred of the enemies towards Iran will be reduced; they have used all kinds of propaganda to prevent people from voting.</s>

en: Yet other times they tried to intimidate, discourage and disappoint our people by assassinating our scientists. They carried out three assassinations in less than six months.
hau: A wani lokacin ta hanyar kashe masananmu - wanda cikin kasa da watanni shida, sun aiwatar da irin wannan aikin ta'addancin guda uku - manufarsu ita ce su razama mutanenmu, su kashe musu gwuiwa.
mt0: <pad> sometimes by killing our friends - who in less than six months, have carried out three such terrorist acts - their purpose is to intimidate our people, to debilitate them.</s>

en: Over the past ten years, the rate of voter turnout in the congressional elections - the Senate and the House of Representatives - has never reached forty percent.
hau: Tsawon shekaru goman da suka gabata irin adadin fitowar mutane a lokacin zabubbubakn majalisar dokoki da ta dattawa da ta wakilai (a Amurka) ba ta kai kashi 40 cikin dari ba.
mt0: <pad> For the last five years, the percentage of people who voted in the US House of Representatives and Senate elections did not even reach 40%.</s>

en: If you compare this with the turnout rate of the Iranian people and their dynamism and presence, then the significance of the matter will be revealed.
hau: To ku kwatanta hakan da al'ummar Iran - ku dubi irin wannan nishadi da fitowar da mutane suke yi - to a irin wannan lokacin ne muhimmancin lamarin zai fito fili.
mt0: <pad> Compare that to the people of Iran - see this joy and enthusiasm - then the importance of the matter will come out clear.</s>

en: Through those pressures, through that psychological warfare, through those threats, through those assassinations, they wanted to make the 12th of Esfand a day of disappointment for the Iranian people and the Islamic Republic, but despite their will and much to their disappointment, the 12th of Esfand became a day of honor and glory for the Islamic Republic and the people of Iran.
hau: Ta hanyar irin wannan matsin lambar, ta hanyar irin wannan wasa da hankali da irin wadannan barazana da wannan kisan gillan suna so ne wannan rana ta 12 ga watan Esfand (ranar da aka gudanar da zaben 'yan majalisa a Iran) ta zamanto ranar raba gari tsakanin al'umma da tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci. To amma sabanin abin da suke fatan gani, wannan ranar ta zamanto ranar daukaka ga tsarin Musulunci da kuma al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> By such pressure, by such manipulation, by such threats and by this massacre they want to make the 12th of Esfand (the day of the Iran parliamentary election) a day of splitting the people and the Islamic republic. But instead of what they hoped, this day has become a day of glory for the Islamic republic and the people of Iran.</s>

en: The parliamentary election acted as an honest and powerful media outlet.
hau: Lalle wannan zaben ya zamanto wata kafar watsa labarai mai gaskiya da kuma karfi.
mt0: <pad> This election has certainly been a credible and powerful medium of communication.</s>

en: They report events that have not happened in Iran and they do not report the events that have happened, but they cannot deny the election.
hau: Sun kasance suna gurbata labaran abubuwan da ke gudana a Iran, suna fadin labaran karya kan Iran, sannan kuma suna boye labarai na hakika, to amma babu yadda za a iya inkarin wannan zaben.
mt0: <pad> They have been defamatory about Iran, spreading lies about Iran, and hiding the truth, but there is no way to overturn this election.</s>

en: It happened in front of everybody's eyes.
hau: Lamari ne wanda ya faru a kan idanuwan mutane.
mt0: <pad> It's a story that happened in front of the people.</s>

en: The election presented an accurate picture of the Iranian nation to the world like a great and powerful media outlet.
hau: Wannan zaben ya zama tamkar wata kafar watsa labarai mai karfi da ta samu damar bayyanar da hakikanin al'ummar Iran da kuma tsarin Musulunci ga sauran al'ummomin duniya.
mt0: <pad> The election has been a powerful media platform that has allowed the opportunity to show the true face of Iran's people and the Islamic system to the rest of the world.</s>

en: These were the events that took place in the year 1390, a year in which the enemies made so many investments in order to harm the people of Iran and the Islamic Republic.
hau: To wadannan dai su ne abubuwan da suka faru a shekara ta 1390 din; shekarar da makiya suka sanya dukkanin karfinsu don su cutar da al'ummar Iran a cikinta.
mt0: <pad> So these are the events of the year 1390; a year when the enemies put all their power to harm the people of Iran.</s>

en: These things are only part of the achievements made in the year 1390.
hau: Wadannan wasu ne daga cikin irin nasarorin da al'ummar Iran ta samu a shekarar 1390 din.
mt0: <pad> These are some of the successes that Iran achieved in the year 1390.</s>

en: Since the time the nuclear issue was brought up, the pretext for their enmities has been the nuclear issue.
hau: Tun daga lokacin da aka gabatar da batun nukiliya, shi kenan sai makiya suka fake da shi.
mt0: <pad> From the moment the nuclear issue was introduced, the enemies have been making fun of it.</s>

en: Of course, they know and they acknowledge that Iran is not after nuclear weapons, which is true.
hau: Tabbas sun sani sannan kuma suna ma fadin cewa Iran dai ba tana son kera makaman nukiliya ba ne.
mt0: <pad> They know and they tell me that Iran is not planning to build nuclear weapons.</s>

en: We have not manufactured any nuclear weapons and we never will. They know this and the nuclear issue is just a pretext. One day their pretext is the nuclear issue, another day their pretext is human rights and yet another day their pretext is other domestic issues of our country, but they are all pretexts.
hau: Wannan shi ne hakikanin lamarin. Mu dai saboda dalilan da muke da su, ba zamu taba neman kera makaman nukiliya ba; ba mu kera ba sannan kuma ba za mu kera ba, su da kansu sun san hakan, sai dai kuma suna daukan hakan a matsayin wani abin da za su fake da shi ne. A wani lokacin suna amfani da hakan, a wani lokacin kuma suna fakewa da batun hakkokin bil'adama, a wani lokacin kuma wani lamarin na cikin gida; to amma dukkanin wadannan wasu abubuwa ne da suke fakewa da su.
mt0: <pad> That's the truth. We never want to build nukes, we don't build and we won't build, they themselves know that, but they use it as a disguise. Sometimes they use it, sometimes they pretend it's human rights, sometimes a domestic matter; but all these things are just disguises.</s>

en: What is the real problem?
hau: Mene ne asalin lamarin?
mt0: <pad> I don't know what you mean</s>

en: The real problem is that the Islamic Republic is safeguarding the great oil and gas resources of the country in a powerful way.
hau: Batu na asali shi ne irin tsayin dakan da tsarin Musulunci ya yi wajen kare arzikin mai da (iskar) gas da Allah ya yi wa wannan kasar.
mt0: <pad> The main issue is the determination of the Islamic system to protect the oil and gas resources that God has blessed this country with.</s>

en: As has always been the case, economic and political power - and the resultant scientific and military power - depend on energy sources, on oil.
hau: Yau da gobe - tamkar jiya- tsayin daka da karfi na tattalin arziki da siyasa bugu da kari kan karfi na ilimi da soji, sun damfara ne da makamashi da man fetur.
mt0: <pad> Today and tomorrow, as yesterday, they are based on economic and political power, in addition to scientific and military power, and are equipped with energy and oil.</s>

en: The world will need oil and gas for decades and this is an undeniable truth.
hau: Har zuwa shekaru aru-aru masu zuwa duniya za ta kasance tana bukatar mai da iskar gas; wannan wani lamari ne da kowa ya amince da shi.
mt0: <pad> For thousands of years the world will need oil and gas; this is a commonly agreed fact.</s>

en: The arrogant powers know that their survival depends on oil and gas.
hau: Ma'abota girman kan duniya sun san cewa rayuwarsu ta damfara ne da man fetur da iskar gas.
mt0: <pad> The world's richest people know that their lives are dependent on oil and natural gas.</s>

en: The day they fail to acquire oil at a cheap price, the day they are forced to make concessions and stop bullying for the sake of oil and gas - that day will be a tragic day for them. On the other hand, western countries have faced problems in terms of oil resources and their problems will increase on a daily basis.
hau: A lokacin da ya zamana sun rasa samun wannan mai din cikin farashi mai rahusa, to a irin wannan lokacin ne zai zamanto musu dole su mika kai kan wani abu, su yi watsi da tursasawar da suke yi don su sami biyan bukatarsu. Irin wannan rana za ta zamanto bala'i a gare su. A bangare guda kasashen yammaci suna fuskantar matsala a fagen albarkatun mai sannan kuma a kowace rana wannan matsala ta su sai karuwa take yi.
mt0: <pad> When they can't get this oil at a cheap price, then they will have to give up on something, abandon their push to meet their demands. That day will be a curse for them. On the other hand, the western countries are facing problems with oil resources and their problem is getting worse every day.</s>

en: Some of the European countries - and western countries in general - will run out of oil in four years. Some others will run out of oil in six years. Yet other western countries will run out of oil in nine years.
hau: Ajiyar man fetur din da wasu kasashen turai da na yammaci a yanayi na gaba daya ya zuwa shekaru hudu zai kare, wasu shekaru shida, wasu shekaru tara zai kare, a saboda haka wajibi ne su yi amfani da albarkatun da wasu kasashe suke da shi.
mt0: <pad> Some European and Western countries' oil reserves will be out for four years, some six years, some nine years, so they have to use other countries' resources.</s>

en: According to the calculations of our experts, which are based on the statistics presented by the Americans themselves, the US currently has oil reserves of thirty-something billion barrels and it will run out of oil by 2021.
hau: Kasar Amurka wacce ya zuwa yanzu ta ajiye kimanin ganga biliyan talatin da wani abu na mai, bisa lissafin da masananmu suka yi - wanda kuma hakan ya dogara ne da irin lissafi da adadin da Amurkawan suka fitar - ya zuwa shekara ta 2021, wato shekaru tara masu zuwa, man zai kare.
mt0: <pad> The United States, which has now stored about 30 billion barrels of oil, according to our experts - and this is based on the American estimates and numbers - by 2021, which is nine years away, the oil will be out of stock.</s>

en: Currently more than fifty percent of the world's oil flows out of the Persian Gulf and in the future the global flow of oil will depend on three oil-rich countries in the Persian Gulf region.
hau: A wancan lokacin za su dogara ne da man fetur din da yake fitowa daga yankin Tekun Fasha wanda sama da kashi hamsin cikin dari na man duniya yana fitowa ne daga wannan yankin.
mt0: <pad> At that time they would depend on oil from the Gulf of Persia, which is where over fifty percent of the world oil comes from.</s>

en: Of course, Iran is one of the three oil-rich countries and I will explain this point later.
hau: A wancan lokacin za su dogara ne da mabubbugar man fetur guda uku na wannan yanki na mu da kuma tekun fasha; wanda daya daga cikin wadannan mabubbugar ita ce kasar Iran, wanda zan yi karin bayani kan hakan.
mt0: <pad> They were dependent on three oil producers in our region and the Gulf; one of these producers was Iran, which I will be going to explain more about.</s>

en: Among all the countries of the world and not just the Persian Gulf region, the Islamic Republic of Iran has the greatest sources of oil and gas.
hau: A tsakanin dukkanin kasashen duniya - ba wai kawai kasashen Tekun Fasha ba - kasar da man fetur da iskar gas din ta suka fi yawa, ita ce Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran.
mt0: <pad> The country that has the most oil and natural gas is the Islamic Republic of Iran, not only in the Gulf countries.</s>

en: Some countries have more natural gas than we do and some others have more oil than us.
hau: Wasu kasashen gas dinsu ya fi namu yawa, wasu kuma man fetur dinsu ya fi na mu yawa.
mt0: <pad> Some countries have more gas than us, some have more oil than us.</s>

en: In terms of our oil reserves, we are the fourth country in the world. There are three countries in the world which have more oil than we do. However, in terms of total amount of oil and gas reserves, the Islamic Republic, your dear homeland, has more proven oil reserves than any other country in the world.
hau: A bangaren albarkar iskar gas mu ne kasa ta biyu a duniya - Rasha ita ce ta farko, daga ita sai mu - a fagen man fetur kuma mu ne kasa ta hudu; akwai kasashe uku wadanda suke a gabanmu wadanda albarkatun mai dinsu ya fi namu; to amma idan har aka hada albarkatun mai da iskar gas a waje guda, Jamhuriyar Musulunci, kasarmu mai girma, albarkatun da take da shi - gwargwadon abin da ya zuwa yanzu aka gano - abin da muke da shi ya fi na sauran kasashen duniya.
mt0: <pad> In terms of gas, we are the second country in the world - Russia is the first, then we - in terms of oil, we are the fourth country; there are three countries that have more oil than us; but if we add up all the oil and gas resources, the great Islamic Republic, our great country, has more resources than any other country in the world - as far as we know so far.</s>

en: This is very interesting for the consumers of oil in the world and for the arrogant powers whose survival depends on energy sources, on oil and gas.
hau: Lalle wannan lamari ne mai jan hankali ga kasashen da suke amfani da mai, ga cibiyoyin ma'abota girman kai wadanda dukkanin rayuwarsu ta damfara ne da makamashi, man fetur da iskar gas.
mt0: <pad> This is certainly a matter of concern for oil-consuming countries, for the arrogance centers whose life is dependent on energy, oil and natural gas.</s>

en: This is the wealth that Iran enjoys. They will run out of oil in four, ten, fifteen years, but considering the proven oil reserves, the Islamic Republic will have oil and gas for another eighty years.
hau: Ya zuwa shekaru goma zuwa shekaru sha biyar masu zuwa man da suke da shi zai kare, to amma Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran - bisa ga albarkatun da a yau aka gano - har zuwa shekaru saba'in zuwa tamanin tana da mai; lalle wannan lamari ne mai jan hankali.
mt0: <pad> They will have their oil out in 10 to 15 years, but the Islamic Republic of Iran - according to the current resources - will have oil for 70 to 80 years; this is a very interesting matter.</s>

en: A country that ranks first in terms of its oil and gas reserves is very interesting. What do the arrogant powers want?
hau: Kasar da take da man fetur da iskar gas irin wannan, to me ma'abota girman kai suke so?
mt0: <pad> The country that has such oil and gas, to me the arrogants want?</s>

en: They want our country to be ruled by a government whom they can easily control, just like certain countries in the region which have a lot of oil, yet they are like putty in the hands of the Americans. The Americans order them to produce certain amounts of oil and they say, "Yes, sir." The Americans order them to sell their oil at a particular price and they say, "Yes, sir."
hau: To suna so ne wannan kasar ta zamanto karkashin wata gwamnati da kuma wani tsari da zai zamanto tamkar wani boyi-boyi a hannunsu kamar yadda wasu kasashen wannan yankin suke. en: In our oil-rich country, which has the largest proven oil and gas reserves in the world, they will oppose any government that safeguards this national wealth in a proud way, does not allow other countries to plunder this wealth and does not follow the policies of the enemies.
hau: Idan har a kasar Iran, wacce mabubbuga ce ta man fetur da iskar gas, ya zamana an sami wani tsari da wata gwamnati mai kishin kasa wacce ta tsaya kyam wajen kare wannan arzikin, ta ki yarda a yi watandar wannan dukiyar sannan kuma ta ki amincewa ta mika wuya ga siyasar makiya, to kuwa za su yi kiyayya da wannan tsarin.
mt0: <pad> If in Iran, which is a source of oil and natural gas, a system with a patriotic government that stands firm to protect this wealth, refuses to share this property and refuses to bow to the enemy's policy, they will hate this system.</s>

en: Those who think that if we had backed down in the case of the nuclear issue, America would no longer be hostile - they are unaware of this truth.
hau: Mutanen da suke zaton cewa idan har mu ka ja da baya akan batun nukiliya, to Amurka za ta kawo karshen kiyayyar da take yi da mu, to lalle sun gafala daga wannan hakikar.
mt0: <pad> Whoever thinks that if we lose the nuclear issue, America will end its hostility toward us, is absolutely wrong.</s>

en: Their problem is not the nuclear issue.
hau: Matsalarsu ba batun nukiliya ba ne.
mt0: <pad> The nuclear scientists are concerned about the dangers of nuclear fusion.</s>

en: There are certain countries in our region that have nuclear weapons, but they do not care at all.
hau: Akwai kasashen da suke da makaman nukiliya, kuma ma suna nan a wannan yanki na mu, amma ba sa ma damuwa da su.
mt0: <pad> There are countries that have nuclear weapons, and they're even here in our region, but I don't care about them.</s>

en: The problem is the issue of nuclear weapons or nuclear industry. The problem is not the issue of human rights.
hau: A saboda haka lamarin ba wai batun makamin nukiliya ko kuma kera su ba ne, haka nan kuma ba batun hakkokin bil'adama ba ne.
mt0: <pad> So it is not about nuclear bombs or Korean War, nor about human rights.</s>

en: The problem is the Islamic Republic which is standing firm against them like a lion.
hau: Matsalar dai ita ce Jamhuriyar Musulunci wacce ta tsaya kyam a gabansu tamkar wani zaki.
mt0: <pad> The problem is the Islamic Republic of Iran which stands in front of them like a wolf.</s>

en: If the Islamic Republic had agreed to betray its own people like certain regional regimes, if the Islamic Republic had surrendered to them, they would not be bothering it.
hau: Idan da a ce Jamhuriyar Musulunci ma tamkar wasu kasashen wannan yankin ta kasance a shirye take ta ha'inci al'ummarta, ta mika musu wuya, to da babu ruwansu da ita.
mt0: <pad> If the Islamic Republic of Iran was also like other countries in this region willing to betray its people and bow to them, then they wouldn't have cared about it.</s>

en: The problem is their arrogant greed and this is the reason behind their enmity towards the Iranian nation.
hau: Lamarin shi ne irin son wuce gona da iri na girman kai da suke da shi; wannan shi ne dalilin irin adawar da suke yi da al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> The problem is their pride and arrogance; this is the reason for their hatred of the people of Iran.</s>

en: Of course, the Americans are making a mistake.
hau: Ko da yake tabbas Amurkawa kuskure suke yi.
mt0: <pad> Although it is clear that the Americans are wrong.</s>

en: It is a big and fatal mistake to think that they can force the Islamic Republic to retreat or back down through hostility, enmity and threats, and they will be punished for this mistake.
hau: Lalle babban kuskure ne su yi tunanin cewa ta hanyar nuna kiyayya da barazana za su iya tilasta wa Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran ja da baya, ko kuma za su sami damar kawar da Jamhuriyar Musulunci daga fage.
mt0: <pad> It is a great mistake to think that by showing hatred and threats they can force the Islamic Republic of Iran to back down, or even remove the Islamic Republic from the scene.</s>

en: Western countries do not allow their people to learn about the future oil tragedy.
hau: Kasashen yammaci ba sa barin al'ummominsu su fahimci irin bala'in da za su iya fadawa a fagen albarkatun mai dinsu.
mt0: <pad> Western countries are not letting their people know the dangers of their oil resources.</s>

en: They do not want their people to realize what is awaiting them in the case of oil and energy sources. They do not want to tell this to their people.
hau: Ba sa so al'ummominsu su fahimci abin da ya ke jiransu dangane da lamarin da ya shafi man fetur da makamashinsu; ba sa so su gaya wa al'ummominsu wadannan abubuwa.
mt0: <pad> They don't want their people to understand what they're doing with regard to oil and energy; they don't want to tell their people these things.</s>

en: They think that they can move things forward by being hostile to the Iranian people, but they will not succeed.
hau: Suna zaton cewa ta hanyar nuna kiyayya da gaba da al'ummar Iran za su iya ciyar da ayyukansu gaba. Ina ba za su iya ba.
mt0: <pad> They think that by showing their hatred and hostility towards the people of Iran they can continue their activities. I think they can't.</s>

en: Dear brothers and sisters, dear people of Iran, you should know that today the situation of America is precarious in spite of all its muscle-flexing, in spite of all the uproar it causes.
hau: Ina son in sanar da ku, Ya ku 'yan'uwa maza da mata masu girma, Ya ku al'ummar Iran! cewa Amurka da dukkanin irin nuna karfin da take yi, da dukkanin irin wadannan ihu bayan hari da rikice-rikicen da take haifarwa, a yau dai suna cikin yanayi na rauni da gazawa ne.
mt0: <pad> I want to tell you, my elderly brothers and sisters, the people of Iran! that America and all its show of power, all these screams after attacks and conflicts, today are in a state of weakness and failure.</s>

en: I do not want to use confidential reports or superficial things as evidence: what I am saying is simple mathematics.
hau: Ni dai ba wai ina so ne in kafa hujja da bayanai na sirri ko kuma wasu wadansu labarai na musamman ba ne; abin da zan fadi wani abu ne da yake a fili tamkar lissafin biyu a tara da biyu hudu ne.
mt0: <pad> I'm not going to be using any secrets or other special information; what I'm going to say is something that's as clear as two by nine and four.</s>

en: Notice that the American President came to power with the slogan of change.
hau: Ku duba ku gani shugaban Amurka na yanzu ya dare karagar mulki ne sakamakon taken 'sauyi' da ya daga.
mt0: <pad> The current US president took office on the basis of his "change" message.</s>

en: What does change mean?
hau: Me ake nufi da sauyi?
mt0: <pad> I'm going to be a martyr?</s>

en: It means that the existing situation is very bad and that we are determined to change it.
hau: Shi ne cewa mu a halin yanzu muna cikin wani irin yanayi ne mai munin gaske, to ina so in sauya wannan yanayin ne.
mt0: <pad> That's because we're in a very bad situation now, and I want to change that situation.</s>

en: He stepped in with this slogan and the people of America voted for him because of his slogan of change, otherwise racist people were not prepared to vote for a person from an African-American background. But they did, hoping that there would be change.
hau: To da irin wannan taken ne ya shigo fage, sannan kuma mutane suka kada masa kuri'a saboda wannan taken. Idan kuwa ba haka, al'ummar Amurka da aka sansu da nuna wariyar launin fata, ba a shirye suke su kada wa wani mutum bakin fata kuri'a ba. To amma dai sun kada masa kuri'ar saboda fatan sauyin da suke da shi.
mt0: <pad> But that's the reason he came to the forefront, and people voted for him for that reason. Otherwise, Americans, who are notorious for racial bias, wouldn't be willing to vote for a black person. But they did it because they hoped for change.</s>

en: The fact that the slogan of change affected the people like that shows that the situation was very bad. That is to say, on the admission of the American people, the situation of America was very bad when he decided to run for president.
hau: To irin tasirin da wannan take na sauyi ya yi cikin al'ummar (Amurka) lamari ne da ke nuni da irin munin halin da suke ciki ya yi. Wato yanayin Amurka a lokacin da wannan mutumin ya tsaya takara, kamar yadda su kansu mutanen Amurka suka tabbatar, wani yanayi ne mai muni sannan shi kuma ya yi musu alkawarin cewa zai kawo musu sauyi.
mt0: <pad> The effect of this change on the American people is a measure of how bad the situation was. The situation in America at the time of this man's campaign, as the American people themselves have confirmed, was very bad and he promised to change it.</s>

en: Therefore, it is an undeniable truth that the situation of America was very bad.
hau: A saboda haka dai an amince da cewa yanayi ne mai muni.
mt0: <pad> So it is believed that this is a bad situation.</s>

en: This is not what we say: it was the American people themselves who admitted that their situation was bad.
hau: Ni dai ba na so in fadi hakan, su kansu mutanen Amurkan su da kansu ne suka bayyana cewa yanayin da suke ciki ya yi muni.
mt0: <pad> I can't say that, the Americans themselves have said that the situation has gotten worse.</s>

en: Then he came to power, but did he bring about change?
hau: To shi kenan ga shi wannan mutumin ya dare karagar mulki, shin ya haifar da sauyin?
mt0: <pad> So now that this person has taken the throne, has he made a change?</s>

en: Did he manage to change the situation?
hau: Shin ya sami damar sauya wannan mummunan yanayin?
mt0: <pad> He was able to change this bad situation?</s>

en: This debt is equal to - or bigger than - their gross domestic product.
hau: Wannan bashin kuwa ya yi daidai ko kuma ya dara irin abubuwan da suke samarwa a cikin gida.
mt0: <pad> This debt is either equal to or higher than the domestically produced goods.</s>

en: This is a big problem for a country.
hau: Hakan babbar matsala ce ga wata kasa.
mt0: <pad> That's a big problem for any country.</s>

en: As for their political situation, they were forced to leave Iraq without any achievements and in Afghanistan their situation is becoming worse on a daily basis.
hau: Wannan shi ne yanayin siyasar da suke ciki: hakan ne ya tilasta musu barin kasar Iraki ba tare da sun cimma wani abu ba. A kasar Afghanistan ma a kusan kowace rana yanayinsu zai dada muni yake yi.
mt0: <pad> This is their political situation: it forced them out of Iraq without achieving anything. In Afghanistan, the situation worsens every day.</s>

en: In Muslim countries, in Egypt, in North Africa, in Tunisia, the Americans have completely lost their original awe.
hau: A kasashen musulmi, a Masar, a arewacin Afirka, a Tunusiya, mutumcin Amurka ya zube a idanuwansu.
mt0: <pad> In the Muslim countries, in Egypt, in northern Africa, in Tunisia, the American dignity fell in their eyes.</s>

en: Besides all these things, the Occupy Wall Street movement has started in the cities of America.
hau: Baya ga dukkanin wadannan abubuwan, sai kuma ga yunkurin Wall Street da ya kunno kai a cikin Amurkan.
mt0: <pad> Beyond all of these things, there was also the Wall Street crisis in America.</s>

en: Is this situation good?
hau: Shin wannan yanayi ne mai kyau?
mt0: <pad> Is this a good time?</s>

en: Therefore, America is in a dire situation.
hau: A saboda haka Amurka tana cikin tsaka mai wuya.
mt0: <pad> So America is in a difficult position.</s>

en: America might pose threats to other countries. It might do crazy things.
hau: Na'am mai yiyuwa ne Amurka ta yi barazana ga wasu kasashe; mai yiyuwa hauka ya debe ta.
mt0: <pad> Yes, America may have been a threat to other countries; that may have been the reason for its isolation.</s>

en: And I would like to take this opportunity to say that we do not have atomic weapons and that we will not build such weapons, but in case the enemies attack us - be it America or the Zionist regime - we will attack them on the same level that they attack us in order to defend ourselves.
hau: To a nan wajen ina son in sanar da cewa; mu dai ba mu da makaman nukiliya, ba za mu taba kera makaman nukiliya ba, to amma don kare kanmu daga duk wani harin makiya a kanmu- shin Amurka ce ko kuma haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila - lalle za mu mayar musu da martani da kai hari daidai wajen da makiya suka kawo mana harin.
mt0: <pad> But I want to declare here that we do not have nuclear weapons, and we will never build them, but to protect ourselves from any attack by our enemies - whether it be the United States or the illegal Israel - we will respond by launching a bomb at the same place where our enemies have launched the attack.</s>

en: The Holy Quran has promised us, "And if those who disbelieve fight with you, they would certainly turn (their) backs, then they would not find any protector or a helper.
hau: Alkur'ani mai girma ya yi mana alkawarin cewa: "Kuma da wadanda suka kafirta sun yake ku, da sun juyar da bayansu (domin gudu) sa'an nan ba za su sami majibinci ba, kuma ba za su sami mataimaki ba.
mt0: <pad> If they turned back, they will not have any protectors and no helpers.</s>

en: Such has been the law of Allah that has indeed run before, and you shall not find a change in Allah's law."
hau: Hanyar Allah wadda ta shude daga gabanin wannan, kuma ba za ka sami musanya ba ga hanyar Allah (ta taimakon muminai a kan mai zaluntarsu) (Suratul Fat'h 48:22-23).
mt0: <pad> The way of God that has gone before this, and you will not find a substitute for the way of God.</s>

en: [The Holy Quran, 48: 22-23] Nowhere in the Holy Quran is it said that if you start a war, you will definitely win it. You might win or lose the war you start, just as the Muslims did not always win the wars they started during the early years after the introduction of Islam: they were defeated in certain cases.
hau: Babu wani waje a cikin Alkur'ani da (Allah Madaukakin Sarki) Ya fadi cewa idan har kuka fara yaki, kuka kai hari, to lalle za ku yi nasara; mai yiyuwa ne ku yi nasara, mai yiyuwa ne ku sha kashi - kamar yadda ya faru a yakukuwan farkon Musulunci, a lokutan da musulmi suka kai hari, a wani wajen sun sha kashi a wani wajen kuma sun yi nasara.
mt0: <pad> Nowhere in the Quran does Allah say that if you start a war, attack, you will be sure to win; it is possible to win, it is possible to lose - as happened in the first wars of Islam, when the Muslims attacked, sometimes they lost and sometimes they won.</s>

en: But it has been promised that if the enemy attacks, he will definitely be defeated.
hau: To amma (Allah) ya yi alkawarin cewa a duk lokacin da makiya suka fara kawo muku hari, to ko shakka babu za su sha kashi.
mt0: <pad> But Allah has promised that whenever the enemies attack you, they will be defeated.</s>

en: You should not say that this is only true of the early years after the introduction of Islam. No, "Such has been the law of Allah that has indeed run before, and you shall not find a change in Allah's law."
hau: Bai kamata a yi zaton hakan lamari ne da ya shafi farkon Musulunci ba; a'a, "Hanyar Allah wadda ta shude daga gabanin wannan, kuma ba za ka sami musanya ba ga hanyar Allah (ta taimakon muminai a kan mai zaluntarsu)", wannan sunna ce ta Ubangiji.
mt0: <pad> It should not be thought that this is something related to the early days of Islam; no, "The way of God has passed before this, and you will not find a substitute for the way of God." This is the sunna of the Lord.</s>

en: This is a divine law. The Iranian people are determined and dynamic and they are not thinking of attacking other countries, but they are firmly attached to their identity, to their wealth, to their religion, to their Islamic Republic.
hau: Al'ummar Iran ta yi azama da dukkan nishadi sannan kuma ba ta da nufin kai hari da wuce gona da iri a kan wani; to amma tana da alaka da kuma kaunar mutumcinta, dukiyarta da matsayinta, da Musuluncinta, da Jamhuriyar Musuluncinta da dukkanin karfinta.
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran have tried with all the might and without any intention of attacking or overreaching on anyone; but they are connected and love their nationality, property and status, Islam, the Islamic Republic of Iran with all their strength.</s>

en: That is to say, when you consume domestically produced products, you help Iranian laborers, you create job opportunities, you contribute to Iranian investment, you give rise to growth and development.
hau: Wato a lokacin da kuka zamanto masu saye da amfani da kayayyakin da ake samarwa a cikin gida, to kuna taimakon leburan Iran ne, kuna samar da aikin yi ne, haka nan kuma kuna taimakon zuba jari na al'ummar Iran ne da kuma samar da ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> When you buy and use locally produced goods, you are supporting the industry of Iran, creating jobs, and also supporting the investment of the Iranian people and developing the country.</s>

en: Consuming foreign products is a wrong cultural norm, which has unfortunately become prevalent in certain portions of our society. Consuming foreign products will harm us. It will stand in the way of our progress.
hau: Wannan al'ada dake cike da kuskure - wadda abin bakin ciki ana iya ganinta tattare da wasu bangarori na al'ummarmu - na amfani da kayayyakin da aka kera a waje, lalle hakan cutarwa ce ga duniyarmu, cutarwa ce ga ci gabanmu da kuma makomarmu.
mt0: <pad> This very wrong culture - which is unfortunately still widespread in some parts of our society - of using imported goods is definitely harmful to our world, harmful to our development and future.</s>

en: The government is also responsible: it must support and strengthen national production.
hau: Kowanenmu yana da nauyi a wuyansa, wajibi ne mu goyi baya da karfafa kayayyakin da muke samarwa a cikin gida.
mt0: <pad> Everyone has a responsibility, we have to support and promote locally produced products.</s>

en: The Majlis should cooperate and the executive branch should make efforts in this regard so that they can boost national production.
hau: Don haka a yau jami'ai suna da wata ajiya a hannunsu, suna iya amfani da hakan wajen karfafa kayayyakin da ake samarwa a cikin gida.
mt0: <pad> So today organizations have a reserve in their hands, they can use it to strengthen locally produced products.</s>

en: And the people should also cooperate: both those who have capital and those who have the power to work.
hau: Haka nan su ma al'umma - shin wadanda masu jari ne ko kuma wadanda suke da karfin yin aiki - wajibi ne su hada kansu waje guda don gudanar da aiki.
mt0: <pad> As well, the people - whether rich or poor - must unite together to perform the work.</s>

en: You dear people should develop a tendency towards Iranian products.
hau: Wajibi ne ku zama masu nema da kuma amfani da kayayyakin da aka samar a cikin gida.
mt0: <pad> You have to be a consumer and use locally produced products.</s>

en: It is wrong to prefer foreign brands - in the case of clothes, utensils, furniture, foodstuffs and other things - to domestic brands while in many cases our domestic products might be far better than their foreign equivalents.
hau: Ba abin alfahari ba ne sannan kuma kuskure ne mu zamanto muna fifita kayayyakin kasashen waje, a cikin gidanmu, a cikin kujerunmu, cikin abubuwan da muke bukata na yau da kullum da kuma abubuwan da muke ci a kan wadanda ake samarwa a cikin gida, alhali kuwa a mafi yawa lokuta kayayyakin cikin gidan ma sun fi na wajen kyau.
mt0: <pad> It is not a pride and mistake to always prefer foreign goods, in our homes, in our chairs, in our daily necessities and in our food, when in most cases the locally produced goods are even better than the imported ones.</s>

en: I have heard that the clothes which are produced in certain cities across the country are taken abroad and foreign brand names are attached to them, and then they are shipped into the country to be sold as foreign products.
hau: Na ji cewa wasu daga cikin kayayyakin da ake samarwa a wasu garuruwan kasar nan, a kan tafi a sanya musu alamar kamfanonin waje sannan a dawo da su.
mt0: <pad> I heard that some of the products produced in other cities of the country are taken to be labeled by foreign companies and brought back.</s>

en: If these clothes do not go through this process, Iranian customers might not like to pay for them, but simply because the clothes bear French brand names, Iranian customers buy them. This is wrong.
hau: Mai yiyuwa ne idan har aka sayar da su a nan mai saye bairaniye ba zai so su ba, to amma da ya ke suna da alamar kamfanin Faransa a jikinsu, shi kenan sai ya je ya sayi wannan rigar ko wandon ko kuma wannan dinkin da aka yi a nan; hakan kuskure ne.
mt0: <pad> Maybe if they were sold here, the German buyer would not like them, but because they have the French company's mark on them, he went to buy this shirt or dress or that tie made here; that is a mistake.</s>

en: Domestic production is important.
hau: Kayayyakin da ake samarwa a cikin gida lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> Imported goods are an important issue.</s>

en: This is part of the effort to reform the norms of consumption, which I discussed with our people in this place two years ago. It is also part of economic jihad, which I discussed last year. National production is important and it must be the goal.
hau: A fagen amfani da kayayyakin da aka samar, mafi yawan aikin yana hannun mutane ne; wanda hakan wani bangare ne na gyara irin yadda ake amfani da albarkatun kasa da shekaru biyun da suka gabata a wannan wajen na kirayi al'ummar Iran zuwa gare shi sannan kuma wani bangare na jihadin karfafa tattalin arzikin da na yi magana a kansa a shekarar da ta gabata. Samar da kayayakin cikin gida lamari ne mai muhimmanci; wajibi ne mu sanya hakan ya zamanto ita ce munafarmu.
mt0: <pad> In the field of consumption, most of the work is done by people; this is part of the reform of the use of resources that I urged Iranians towards two years ago and part of the economic jihad that I talked about last year. The production of domestic goods is important; we must make it our main goal.</s>

en: Dear people, dear brothers and sisters, today we need unity and solidarity across the country.
hau: Ya ku abin kaunata! 'yan'uwa maza da mata a dukkanin kasar nan, lalle a yau din nan muna bukatar hadin kai da aiki tare.
mt0: <pad> 'Brothers and sisters of all the people of the country, we need to work together and unite today.</s>

en: There are many pretexts for discord.
hau: Akwai abubuwan da suke haifar da sabani da rarrabuwan kai da yawa.
mt0: <pad> There are many things that cause conflict and division.</s>

en: In the case of certain issues not even two people have the same opinion. This must not become a pretext for discord.
hau: A wasu lokuta a cikin lamari guda a kan sami cewa ra'ayi da yadda mutane biyu suke kallon lamari ya bambanta; to amma bai kamata hakan ya zamanto abin da zai haifar da sabani ba.
mt0: <pad> In some cases, two people may have different views on the same matter; but that should not be a reason to fight.</s>

en: Sometimes a person might have a certain tendency that might not be shared by other people, but this must not become a source of discord.
hau: A wani lokaci a kan sami wannan mutumin yana da wannan ra'ayi, wani kuma yana da wani ra'ayin na daban, bai kamata hakan ya zamanto abin da zai haifar da sabani ba.
mt0: <pad> sometimes you can find this person with this opinion, and another with another, it shouldn't be a reason to fight.</s>

en: The Holy Quran teaches us, "And do not quarrel for then you will be weak in hearts and your power will depart." [The Holy Quran, 8: 46] If we quarrel about different issues - political issues, economic issues, personal issues - if we fight with each other, our enemy will be encouraged.
hau: Alkur'ani mai girma ya karantar da mu cewa: "kuma kada ku yi jayayya har ku raunana kuma iskarku ta tafi" (Suratul Anfal 8:46), idan har muka yi jayayya cikin lamurra daban-daban - batutuwa na siyasa, na tattalin arziki da batutuwa na kashin kai - muka kama kwalar rigunan junanmu, to kuwa makiyanmu za su sami karfin gwuiwa.
mt0: <pad> The Holy Qur'an teaches us: "Do not fight until you are weak and your strength is lost." (Suratul Anfal 8:46), if we fight in different matters - political, economic and personal - and take the reins of each other, then our enemies will gain strength.</s>

en: Some of the courage that our enemy has found in the past years is due to our quarrels.
hau: Irin dan karfin gwuiwan da makiyanmu suka samu a shekarun da suka gabata, sakamakon sabanin da ya kunno kai ne a tsakaninmu.
mt0: <pad> The little strength that our enemies have gained in the past years is the result of the divisions that have developed among us.</s>

en: The Commander of the Faithful (a.s.) teaches us a lesson.
hau: Amirul Muminin (a.s) yana koyarwa da mu, yana fadin cewa: 'Wanda ya nemi gaskiya amma ya kuskure, bai yi daidai da wanda ya nemi karya kuma ya same ta ba".
mt0: <pad> The Imam of the believers (a.s) teaches us, saying: "Whoever seeks the truth but fails, is not like the one who seeks the lie and finds it."</s>

en: Opponents are of two kinds. One kind of opponent wants the truth, the Islamic Republic, the Revolution, Islam and God, but he might choose the wrong path.
hau: Wani dan adawan ya kasance yana neman gaskiya ne, yana son Jamhuriyar Musulunci, yana son juyin juya halin Musulunci yana kuma kaunar addini da kuma Allah Madaukakin Sarki, to amma ya kuskure hanya ne; bai kamata a yi gaba da shi ba.
mt0: <pad> A certain man was seeking the truth, he loved the Islamic Republic, the Islamic Revolution and he loved God the Most High, but he went wrong; he should not be taken advantage of.</s>

en: Such opponents are different from those who work against the Islamic system and pursue hostile objectives.
hau: Ya bambanta da mutumin da ya kama hanyar da ta saba wa tsarin Musulunci sannan kuma yana kiyayya da tsarin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> He is different from a person who has followed a path that is against the Islamic system and hates the Islamic system.</s>

en: Make hearts tender towards each other and treat each other with more kindness. Unfortunately these electronic and internet media outlets have prepared the ground for widespread slander.
hau: Ku tausasa zukata, mu'amalarku da juna ta zamanto cikin so da kauna. Abin bakin cikin shi ne cewa wadannan kafafen watsa labarai na zamani da hanyar sadarwa ta internet sun ba da damar mutane su dinga fadin munanan maganganu dangane da junansu.
mt0: <pad> When you soften your heart, your relationship will be full of love and affection. Unfortunately, these modern media and the internet have allowed people to speak negative things about each other.</s>

en: However, the most important factor is that we should feel committed to observing the Islamic rules of conduct. We should feel committed to observing the law.
hau: To sai dai tushen lamarin shi ne cewa mu da kanmu mu ji cewa wajibi ne mu misaltu da kyawawan halaye na Musulunci; mu dinga girmama doka.
mt0: <pad> But the root of the matter is that we believe it is our duty to follow the good morals of Islam; to respect the law.</s>

en: My statement must not be used as a pretext to criticize and persecute our revolutionary youth as extremists.
hau: To sai dai bai kamata a dauki wannan maganar tawa a matsayin wani abin da za a fake da shi wasu mutane su je su dinga zargi da fadin wasu maganganu marasa dadi kan matasanmu masu kishin juyi a matsayin masu tsaurin ra'ayi.
mt0: <pad> But I don't want to be accused of being a fascist.</s>

en: No, I consider all our proud youth and all our faithful and revolutionary youth as my own children and I support them. I support our revolutionary, faithful and proud youth, but I also advise everybody to observe the Islamic rules of conduct and the law in their behavior.
hau: A'a ni dai ina ganin dukkanin matasan kasar nan masu kishi, muminai masu riko da wannan juyin a matsayin 'ya'yana sannan kuma ina goyon bayansu; lalle ni ina goyon bayan matasa muminai masu kishin juyin juya halin Musulunci; to sai dai kuma ina kiran kowa da kowa zuwa misaltuwa da kyawawan halaye na Musulunci; su girmama doka.
mt0: <pad> No, I see all the youths of the country who are patriotic, religious and loyal to this revolution as my children and I support them; I do support Muslim youths who are loyal to the revolution; but I call on everyone to emulate the good qualities of Islam; respect the law.</s>

en: Everybody must observe the law.
