hau: Wajibi ne kowa ya girmama doka.
mt0: <pad> Everyone must respect the law.</s>

en: The Constitution of the Islamic Republic embodies the values of the Revolution.
hau: Riko da juyin juya halin Musulunci yana cikin kundin tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> The Islamic revolution is in the constitution of the Islamic republic.</s>

en: The same is true of our government officials.
hau: Haka lamarin yake dangane da jami'an Iran.
mt0: <pad> That's the same for Iran.</s>

en: The executive branch must not undermine the authority of the Majlis. Similarly the Majlis must not undermine the authority of the executive branch and the President.
hau: Gwamnati ta girmama hurumin majalisa, ita ma majalisa ta girmama hurumin gwamnati da shugaban kasa; su zamanto tare da juna da aiki kafada da kafada.
mt0: <pad> The government respects the power of the assembly, and the assembly respects the power of the government and the president; they work together and in cooperation with each other.</s>

en: They must work together and cooperate. This does not mean that everybody should think in the same way.
hau: Hakan ba yana nufin dukkaninsu su zamanto masu tunani da ra'ayi daya ba; ba kuma shi ne cewa idan har suka zamanto suna da ra'ayi mabambanta shi kenan sai kowa ya kama wuyan dan'uwansa ba.
mt0: <pad> That does not mean that they all have the same mind; nor does it mean that if they have different ideas, then everyone should grab his brother's shoulder.</s>

en: I hope the year 1391, which starts from today, will be full of dynamism, activity, success and happiness for the people of Iran.
hau: Ina fatan wannan shekarar ta 1391 wacce ta fara daga yau, za ta zamanto daga cikin shekaru masu cike da nishadi, aiki tukura, nasarori da kuma faranta rai ga al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> I hope that this year 1391 will be one of the most successful years for the people of Iran.</s>

en: Dear God, by the blessedness of Muhammad (s.w.a.) and his household, make our dear youth and people steadfast on the straight path.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Albarkacin Muhammadu da Alayen Muhammadu, ka tabbatar da matasanmu masu girma, al'ummarmu masu girma a kan mikakken tafarki.
mt0: <pad> Allah! For Muhammad and his family, establish our great men, our great people on the right path.</s>

en: Dear God, suppress and defeat the enemies of this nation.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka ruguza makiyan wannan al'umma.
mt0: <pad> Allah! Destroy the enemies of this community.</s>

en: Make the holy heart of the Imam of the Age (a.s.) satisfied and happy with us and help us benefit from his prayers.
hau: Ka isar da wannan al'umma mai girma da tsayin daka zuwa ga manufar da ta sa a gaba. Ka sanya zuciyar mai girma Waliyul Asr ta zamanto ta yarda da mu, sannan kuma ka sanya mu cikin addu'oinsa.
mt0: <pad> You don't know</s>

en: Shrine - Khamenei.ir  The following is the full text of the speech delivered on March 21, 2013 by Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of Islamic Revolution to a large gathering of pilgrims at Imam Ridha's (a.s.) shrine in the holy city of Mashhad.
hau: Shimfida: Abin da ke biye fassarar jawabin da Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamene'i ya yi ne a ranar 21, Maris 2013 a lokacin ganawarsa da dubun dubatan mutane a haramin Imam Ridha (a.s) da ke birnin Mashhad a ranar farko ta sabuwar shekarar 1392 hijira shamsiyya:
mt0: <pad> The following is the translation of the speech made by the Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei on 21 March 2013 at the meeting with hundreds of people in the holy Imam Ridha's (a.s) mosque in Mashhad on the first day of the new year of the Islamic calendar, which was the first day of the Islamic calendar.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds, and peace and greetings be upon our Master and Prophet and the love of our hearts, Ab-al-Qassem al-Mustafa Muhammad, upon his immaculate, pure, chosen and infallible household, especially the one remaining with Allah on earth.
hau: Dukkan godiya ta tabbata ga Allah Ubangijin talikai.
mt0: <pad> All glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Universes.</s>

en: Greetings be upon Seddiqah at-Tahirah Fatima, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah.
hau: Amincin Allah ya tabbata ga Siddikatut Tahira Fatima 'yar Manzon Allah, tsira da amincin Allah su tabbata a gare ta da Mahaifinta da Mijinta da 'ya'yanta.
mt0: <pad> Amin.</s>

en: I extend my greetings and congratulations to all the dear brothers and sisters who have attended this warm and enthusiastic meeting, and from the depth of my heart I am thankful to Allah the Exalted who gave me one more opportunity to be present at the holy shrine of Hazrat Abul-Hassan ar-Ridha (many greetings be upon him) on another Norouz and meet with you dear people of Mashhad and the esteemed pilgrims who have come here from different parts of the country.
hau: Ina isar da gaisuwa da kuma taya murna ga dukkanin 'yan'uwa maza da mata masu girma da suka halarci wannan taro mai girma.
mt0: <pad> I am sending my greetings and wishes to all the elderly men and women who have attended this great meeting.</s>

en: I ask Allah the Exalted to guide our hearts and tongues to accommodate and say whatever that satisfies Him.
hau: Ina rokon Allah Madaukakin Sarki da Ya shiryar da zukatanmu da harsunanmu zuwa ga abubuwan yardarsa.
mt0: <pad> I pray to Allah the Most High to guide our hearts and our tongues towards His will.</s>

en: And this is a great blessing that every year on Norouz I find the opportunity to see the joys and beauties that are inherent to Norouz and at the same time evaluate current issues and conditions of the country among you people, take a look at our past and future and have brief evaluation of our large-scale national conditions. It is necessary for us to evaluate ourselves in the case of our personal matters.
hau: Lalle wannan wata dacewa ce a gare na cewa a kowace shekara, a irin wannan rana ta idin Nourouz, cikin irin wannan farin ciki da annashuwa ta al'umma, in sami damar da kasantuwa a cikinku da kuma tattunawa kan batutuwan da suka shafi kasar nan, yanayin da ake ciki, sannan kuma mu yi dubi zuwa ga abubuwan da suka faru a baya da kuma wadanda za su faru nan gaba. A takaice dai mu yi dubi a yanayi na gaba daya cikin abubuwan da suka faru cikin shekara.
mt0: <pad> It is a blessing for me to be among you every year on this day of Nourouz, in such a joy and happiness of the people, to have the opportunity to talk about the country, the situation, and what has happened in the past and what will happen in the future. In short, we look at the whole picture of the events of the year.</s>

en: We should review everything that has happened to us and try to learn lessons for the future. The dear brothers and sisters should pay attention to the fact that we people of Iran are not the only ones who try to study, track and evaluate our issues.
hau: Yan'uwa maza da mata masu girma, ya kamata ku fahimci cewa, mu al'ummar Iran, ba mu kadai ne mu ke sanya ido kan lamurranmu da kuma yi musu hisabi ba, akwai wasu mutane na daban da suke sanya ido kan ayyukanmu, su yi hukumci da kuma bayyana ra'ayinsu kan batutuwan da suka shafe mu da kuma abubuwan da muke yi.
mt0: <pad> Gentlemen and women, you should understand that we the people of Iran are not ourselves who monitor our affairs and account for them, there are other people who watch over our actions, make judgments and express their opinion on issues affecting us and what we have done.</s>

en: There are certain nations that are making use of our experiences. There are also certain other nations that are studying the conditions of the Iranian nation: they become happy whenever we make advances and achievements.
hau: Akwai wadansu al'ummomin da suke amfanuwa da irin kwarewar da muka samu. Suna sanya ido kan yanayin al'ummar Iran, su kan yi farin ciki kan duk wata nasara da muka samu.
mt0: <pad> There are other people who benefit from our experience. They watch the situation in Iran and they celebrate every success we achieve.</s>

en: If we achieve a victory, they feel victorious and if we fail, they feel that they have failed as well.
hau: Idan har muka sami wata nasara, su kan ji cewa sun yi nasara, haka nan kuma idan wani abin bakin cikin ya same mu, su kan ji zafi da bakin ciki.
mt0: <pad> If we have achieved a success, they may feel that they have achieved success, and if something bad happens to us, they may feel pain and sadness.</s>

en: There are other people in the world who carefully study everything that we do: these people become happy whenever we make mistakes and they feel disappointed whenever we succeed.
hau: Haka nan kuma akwai wasu mutanen a duniya wadanda suke sa ido kan ayyukanmu, sai dai su sabanin wadancan na farkon ne.
mt0: <pad> Also there are other people in the world who are monitoring our lives, but they are different from the first.</s>

en: They are the ill-wishers of the Iranian nation.
hau: Su masu fatan sharri ne ga al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> Su masu fatan sharri ne ga al'ummar Iran.</s>

en: They too are carefully studying whatever we do. The majority of them are the same people who used to have full control over every affair of our country for many years.
hau: Su din nan a mafiya yawan lokuta su ne wadanda shekara da shekaru suka kasance suna rike da dukkanin lamurran da suka shafi kasar nan, su ne suke iko da dukkanin lamurran kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> They are the people who have been holding all the issues of the country for years and years, they are the people who are in control of all the issues of the country.</s>

en: The Revolution came and put an end to their domination.
hau: To sai juyin juya halin Musulunci ya zo ya gutsure hannayensu.
mt0: <pad> They were saved by the Islamist revolution.</s>

en: For this reason, they are opposed to the Revolution. They are opposed to revolutionary people.
hau: A saboda haka ne suke adawa da wannan juyin, suke adawa da gwamnatin da juyin ya samar da kuma wannan tsarin.
mt0: <pad> For that reason they are against this Jun, they are against the government that Jun has established and this system.</s>

en: Therefore, we are being watched carefully by a large number of people in the world.
hau: Don haka muna karkashin sanya idon wani adadi mai yawa na bil'adama ne.
mt0: <pad> So we are under the watchful eye of a large number of humans.</s>

en: Therefore, we should be realistic in our evaluation of our performance in the past and the plans we have for the future.
hau: A saboda haka a lokacin da muke kallon ayyuka da kuma tsare-tsarenmu na baya da kuma na nan gaba, wajibi ne mahangarmu ta zamanto ta hakika sannan kuma ingantacciya.
mt0: <pad> So when we look at our past and future activities and plans, it is necessary that our perspective be objective and positive.</s>

en: Some people in our country only see the weaknesses whenever they look at the conditions of the country.
hau: Wasu daga cikin mutanenmu a lokacin da suke kallon yanayin kasar nan, ba abin da suke kallo sai bangaren raunin da ake da shi.
mt0: <pad> Some of our people when they look at the state of the country, they only see the negative aspects.</s>

en: They only see the high prices. They only see the decrease in production in certain sectors.
hau: Ba abin da suke gani in ban da tsadar kayayyaki, raguwar kayayyakin da ake samarwa a cikin gida a wasu bangarori da kuma matsin lambar makiya.
mt0: <pad> They see nothing but the price of goods, the decline in locally produced goods in some areas and the pressure of the enemies.</s>

en: I have a different outlook.
hau: Ni dai ina da wata mahanga ta daban.
mt0: <pad> I have another perspective.</s>

en: When I look at the conditions of our country and our nation, I see a vast arena that is full of challenges, and the Iranian nation has been proud and victorious in this arena despite the will of the enemies.
hau: A lokacin da nake kallon yanayin kasar nan da yanayin al'ummarmu, ina kallon wani shararren fage ne da ke cike da kalubale, to sai kuma al'ummar Iran su ne suka sami nasara a wannan fagen duk kuwa da kiyayyar da makiya suke nunawa.
mt0: <pad> When I look at the state of our country and our people, I see a difficult field full of obstacles, but the people of Iran have succeeded in this field despite the hatred that the enemies show.</s>

en: There are certain weaknesses and problems. There have been certain bitter events among the things that have happened in our country. Certain materialistic powers did everything in their power to cripple the Iranian nation.
hau: Babu shakka akwai rauni da kuma matsalolin da ake da su; a cikin abubuwan da suke faruwa a kasar nan akwai abubuwa masu bakanta rai. Akwai wadansu mutane daga cikin masu takama da karfi na duniya da suke aiki ba dare ba rana wajen gurguntar da al'ummar Iran, su da kansu suke fadin hakan.
mt0: <pad> No doubt there are weaknesses and problems; there are things that are very sad. Some people from the world's powerful people are working day and night to defeat the people of Iran, they themselves say it.</s>

en: And they announced this. The incompetent lady who was responsible for America's foreign policy boldly announced that they wanted to impose certain sanctions on the Islamic Republic in order to cripple Iran.
hau: Wancan mace maras kwarewar, wacce a baya take rike da mukamin sakatariyar harkokin wajen Amurka, bugun kirji take yi tana fadin cewa mu muna son mu sanya wa Jamhuriyar Musulunci takunkumin da zai gurguntar da Iran ne.
mt0: <pad> The former U.S. secretary of state, who once held the position of Secretary of State, was absolutely certain that we were trying to impose sanctions on the Islamic Republic that would weaken Iran.</s>

en: Later on, I will explain what measures they adopted, what happened and what the result of their actions was.
hau: A fili suke fadin hakan. To a nan gaba zan yi bayanin irin abubuwan da suka yi sannan kuma a ina suka yi su din.
mt0: <pad> They are openly saying it. So I will explain what they have done and where they have done it.</s>

en: On the one hand, there are the enemies who are making efforts in this vast arena of confrontation between the Iranian nation and its enemies and on the other hand, there are the great achievements which show the capacity, power and intelligence of our great nation.
hau: A saboda haka a bangare guda akwai makirci da kiyayya ta makiya a wannan fage na kalubale na fadar da al'ummar Iran suke yi da makiya, a bangare guda kuma akwai gagarumar nasarorin da aka samu da ke nuni da irin karfi da kwarewar da al'ummar Iran masu girma suke da shi.
mt0: <pad> So while there is one side of the plot and hatred of the enemies in this field of challenge of the fight against the enemy, there is also a great success that has shown the strength and capability of the great people of Iran.</s>

en: This vast arena is like the arena of competition between powerful athletes, which involves efforts and exhaustion, but a true champion achieves victory in such arenas and makes everybody praise him.
hau: A lokacin da mutum ya kalli wannan fagen, tamkar fagen gasar wasanni ne inda ake kokari da nuna kwarewa, to amma zakara guda ne zai lashe gasar da samun nasara sannan sauran mutane kuma su dinga jinjina masa.
mt0: <pad> When one looks at this field, it's like a sporting field where people compete and show their skills, but only one champion will win the race and win the title and the rest of the people will have to respect him.</s>

en: In this great arena that lies in front of our eyes, the champion is the Iranian nation.
hau: To zakarar wannan gagarumin fage dai a gabannin idanuwanmu, su ne al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> The winners of this great field are the people of Iran.</s>

en: Anybody who studies this arena carefully and appropriately will praise the Iranian nation, just as we hear perceptive people throughout the world praising our nation today.
hau: Duk wanda ya kalli wannan fagen da kyau da kuma bincikensa da kyau, to kuwa zai jinjina wa al'ummar Iran, kamar yadda a halin yanzu muke jin sautin irin wannan jinjinawar daga al'ummomin duniya ciki kuwa har da daga wadannan kasashen da suke adawa da kuma kulla sharri ga al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> Whoever looks at this field with an open mind and a good research will be able to admire the Iranian people, just as we are now hearing such admiration from the world community including those who are opposed and plot against the Iranian people.</s>

en: Among the enemies and ill-wishers of the Iranian nation, there are certain political and academic elites and certain experienced individuals who are watching the conditions and are praising the Iranian nation.
hau: Akwai 'yan siyasa, masanan jami'oi da sauran mutanen da suka san inda duniya ta sa gaba sannan suna kallon yanayin, dukkaninsu suna jinjinawa al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> There are politicians, academics and other people who know where the world is headed and are observing the situation, all of them admire the people of Iran.</s>

en: It is necessary to see what results are produced by the efforts that are made throughout the country.
hau: Wajibi ne a kalli dukkanin irin wadannan kokari da aka yi a duk fadin kasar nan da kuma irin sakamakon da za a samu a cikinsu.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to look at all these efforts made across the country and what results will be achieved from them.</s>

en: Who are these people?
hau: To su wane ne wadannan mutanen?
mt0: <pad> To know who these people are.</s>

en: I will speak about this issue later on.
hau: Daga baya zan yi karin haske kan hakan.
mt0: <pad> I'll explain it later.</s>

en: The enemies who do not want to see the Iranian nation making comprehensive progress are pursuing two main goals. One of their goals is to create as many obstacles in the way of our nation as they can in order to prevent the Iranian nation from achieving progress and development.
hau: Makiyan da ba sa fatan ganin irin wadannan ci gaban da al'ummar Iran suka samu a dukkanin fagage, suna da wasu tsare-tsare guda biyu na asali: na farko shi ne cewa gwargwadon yadda za su iya, za su yi dukkanin abin da za su yi wajen ganin al'ummar Iran ba su sami irin wannan ci gaban ba.
mt0: <pad> The enemies who do not want to see the progress that Iran has made in all fields have two main strategies: the first is that they will do everything they can to prevent Iran from achieving this progress.</s>

en: They try to achieve this goal through sanctions, threats, keeping our managers busy with secondary issues and diverting the attention of the great Iranian nation and outstanding personalities of the country to issues that are not on the list of our priorities. The second goal is to deny our advances in their propaganda campaigns. Today there is a massive propaganda network in the world with thousands of different types of media outlets whose goal is to prove that there are no advances in Iran, to deny the victories that the Iranian has achieved, to magnify the existing weaknesses and attract everybody's attention to them, and to hide the strengths that exist in different parts of the country and are visible to just and impartial people.
hau: Za su yi hakan ne ta hanyar sanya takunkumi, ta hanyar barazana, ta hanyar shagaltar da jami'an gwamnati da wasu ayyuka na bayan fage, ta hanyar kawar da tunani da hankulan al'umma da masanan Iran daga manyan ayyuka masu muhimmanci; wato hana su gudanar da ayyuka masu amfani. Abu na biyu shi ne cewa su dinga inkari da musanta wadannan ci gaban da aka samu a kafafen watsa labaransu. A halin yanzu dai akwai dubban kafafen watsa labarai daban-daban a duniya da suka shagaltu da wannan aikin don su nuna wa duniya cewa babu wani ci gaban da al'ummar Iran suka samu.
mt0: <pad> They will do this by imposing sanctions, by intimidating, by distracting the people and scientists from important projects; that is, to derail them from important projects. The second thing is to deny and deny these progresses in their media. There are now thousands of different media outlets around the world that have been engaged in this work to show the world that there is no progress made by the Iranians.</s>

en: In his official addresses, the American president speaks about Iran's economic problems as if he is speaking about his victories.
hau: (A kwanakin baya) shugaban kasar Amurka, a cikin jawabin da ya yi, ya yi magana kan matsalolin tattalin arzikin da Iran take fuskanta; tamkar yana magana ne kan irin nasararorin da ya samu.
mt0: <pad> (Recently) the US president, in his speech, mentioned the economic problems facing Iran; as if he were talking about his own successes.</s>

en: He proudly says that for example, the value of Iran's currency has declined and that there are such and such economic problems in our country.
hau: Yana fadin cewa darajar kudin Iran ta fadi kasa, akwai matsalolin tattalin arziki a nan da can.
mt0: <pad> He says that the value of the Iranian currency has fallen, there are some economic problems here and there.</s>

en: Of course, he has not mentioned the strengths that our nation enjoys, the positive and constructive efforts that are being made in our country and the great victories that our nation has achieved. And he will never mention such things. We have been faced with this challenge for thirty years and I will present a brief evaluation of the past thirty years later on in my speech.
hau: To sai dai kuma bai yi ishara da irin ayyuka masu kyau da aka yi a kasar nan ba, da kuma irin manyan nasarorin da al'ummar Iran suka samu ba. Shekaru talatin kenan mu ke fuskantar irin wadannan kalubalen - wanda a nan gaba zan yi karin haske kan abubuwan da aka cimma tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin din - babu abin da ba su yi ba wajen hana kasar nan ci gaba karkashin inuwar tutar Musulunci da ake rayuwa a karkashinta.
mt0: <pad> But he did not mention the good work done in the country and the great successes of the people of Iran. For thirty years we have been facing these difficulties - which I will explain in the future - and they have done nothing to stop the country from progressing under the banner of Islam.</s>

en: In this regard, the year 1391, which has come to an end, was one the busiest years for our enemies.
hau: Wannan shekara ta 1391 da ta gabata, daya ce daga cikin shekarun da makiyanmu suka shagaltu ainun da ayyukansu na kiyayya.
mt0: <pad> The year 1391 was one of the years when our enemies were busy with their evil deeds.</s>

en: They said that they were determined to cripple the Iranian nation through sanctions.
hau: Suna fadin cewa muna son mu gurguntar da al'ummar Iran ta hanyar sanya musu takunkumi.
mt0: <pad> They say that we want to defeat the people of Iran by imposing sanctions on them.</s>

en: If the Islamic Republic stands firm, remains vibrant and continues making progress, they will lose credibility in the world.
hau: Don kuwa idan har Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta tsaya da kafafunta, ta kasance cikin nishadi da kuma samun ci gaba, to kuwa mutumcinsu zai zube.
mt0: <pad> For if the Islamic Republic stands on its own feet, is happy and prosperous, then its dignity will sink.</s>

en: For this reason, they do their best to stop us and if things get out of hand, they at least try to present a different story in their propaganda campaigns.
hau: A saboda haka idan har za su iya, to bai kamata su bari ba. Idan kuwa har ba za su iya yin hakan ba, to alal akalla su yi kokarin cimma hakan ta hanyar kafafen watsa labarai da farfagandarsu.
mt0: <pad> So if they can, they shouldn't let it go. If they can't, at least they should try to achieve it through their media and propaganda.</s>

en: They are pursuing these two goals more seriously than in the past: they are trying to create obstacles in our way - through pressure, threats, sanctions and other such things - and they are also launching propaganda campaigns to discount our strengths and to magnify our weaknesses.
hau: To a yau dai wadannan ayyuka guda biyu ne suke yinsu ba kama hannun yaro. Wato kokarin hanawa a aikace, ta hanyar matsin lamba, barazana, takunkumi da sauransu, haka nan kuma ta hanyar kafafen farfagandarsu, wajen kaskantar da irin nasarorin da aka samu da kuma kambama matsalolin da ake da su.
mt0: <pad> Today, they are doing these two things very well. The first is to try to stop it in practice, by pressure, threats, bans, etc., and the second is through their media, to exaggerate the successes and hide the problems.</s>

en: As I said, we have certain enemies.
hau: To mun fadi dai cewa akwai makiya.
mt0: <pad> We just said there were enemies.</s>

en: Who are these enemies?
hau: To su wane ne wadannan makiyan?
mt0: <pad> Who are these enemies?</s>

en: Where is the main den of designing machinations against the Iranian nation?
hau: Ina ne asalin cibiyar wadannan makirce-makirce da ake kulla wa al'ummar Iran take?
mt0: <pad> Where is the source of these conspiracies against the people of Iran?</s>

en: It is not difficult to answer this question.
hau: To amsa wannan tambayar dai ba abu ne mai wahala ba.
mt0: <pad> To answer this question is not very difficult.</s>

en: It is 34 years that whenever the word "enemy" is mentioned, the Iranian nation immediately thinks of the American government.
hau: A yau shekaru talatin da hudu kenan a duk lokacin da aka ambaci sunan ‘makiyi', nan take zukata da kwakwalan al'ummar Iran su kan koma ne ga gwamnatin Amurka.
mt0: <pad> Today for 34 years, whenever the word "enemy" is mentioned, the hearts and minds of the Iranian people are immediately drawn to the American government.</s>

en: It would be good if American officials paid attention to this point and tried to understand that over the past 34 years, the Iranian people have witnessed things and gone through stages that whenever the word "enemy" is mentioned, they immediately think of America.
hau: Yana da kyau jami'an Amurka su fahimci cewa tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da wani abun da suka gabatan, lalle al'ummar Iran sun ga wasu abubuwa ne wadanda su ka sanya su daga lokacin da aka ambaci sunan makiyi, nan take zukatansu suke komawa ga Amurka.
mt0: <pad> It is good for American officials to understand that over the past thirty years, the Iranian people have seen things that have made them from the time the name of enemy was mentioned, their hearts turn towards America.</s>

en: This is a very important issue for a government that wants to have pride in the world. This is an issue that deserves careful attention.
hau: Lalle wannan lamari ne mai muhimmanci da ya kamata kowace gwamnatin da take son rayuwa cikin mutumci a duniya, ta lura da wannan lamari da kuma yin darasi kansa.
mt0: <pad> This is a very important issue that every government that wants to live in dignity in the world should pay attention to and learn from this issue.</s>

en: America is the center of enmity and designing plots against the Iranian nation.
hau: Su ne cibiyar wadannan makirci da kuma kiyayya.
mt0: <pad> They are the center of these plots and hatred.</s>

en: Of course, there are certain other enemies, but we do not consider them among the first row of our enemies.
hau: Tabbas akwai wadansu makiyan na daban ma, to amma ba ma ganinsu a matsayin makiyan sahun farko.
mt0: <pad> There are certainly other enemies, but I didn't see them as enemies the first time.</s>

en: For example, there is the Zionist enemy, but the Zionist regime is too small to be considered among the first row of the Iranian nation's enemies.
hau: Yahudawan sahyoniyawa ma makiya ne, to sai dai gwamanatin sahyoniyawa ba su kai matsayin da za mu sanya su daga cikin makiyan al'ummar Iran ba.
mt0: <pad> The zionist Jews are already enemies, but the zionist government is not yet enough to be considered as one of the enemies of the people of Iran.</s>

en: They threaten us with a military invasion, but I believe even they themselves know - and if they do not, they should know - that if they make a wrong move, the Islamic Republic will raze Tel Aviv and Haifa to the ground.
hau: A wasu lokuta jami'an haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila su kan yi mana barazana, suna barazanar kawo mana harin soji; to amma a ra'ayina sannan kuma su ma sun sani, idan ma har ba su sani ba, to su sani cewa, matukar dai gigi ya debe su (suka kawo mana hari), to kuwa Jamhuriyar Musulunci za ta rusa "Tel Aviv" da "Haifa" da mai she su turbaya.
mt0: <pad> Some times the illegal Israeli government threatens us with military action; but in my opinion and if they don't know, they should know that if they do attack us, the Islamic Republic will destroy Tel Aviv and Haifa and make them a desert.</s>

en: The evil English government is also hostile towards the Iranian nation.
hau: Lalatacciyar gwamnatin Ingila ma tana kiyayya da al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> The British government has a hatred of the people of Iran.</s>

en: The English government is among the old enemies of the Iranian nation, but in this arena it plays a complementary role as the follower of America.
hau: Ingila daya ce daga cikin tsoffin makiyan al'ummar Iran; to sai dai gwamnatin Ingila ‘yar amshin shatan Amurka ce.
mt0: <pad> England is one of the former enemies of the people of Iran; however, the government of England is the American's slave.</s>

en: The English government is not independent, so one cannot consider them a separate enemy. It is a follower of America.
hau: Ita kanta gwamnati Ingila ba ta da ‘yancin kanta, ballantana mutum ya dauke ta a matsayin makiyi mai cin gashin kansa; ‘yar amshin shatar Amurka ce.
mt0: <pad> Even the English government is not independent, let alone to be regarded as a self-styled enemy; it is the American slave.</s>

en: There are certain other governments that are hostile towards Iran.
hau: Akwai wadansu gwamnatocin da suke nuna kiyayya.
mt0: <pad> There are some governments that show aggression.</s>

en: I would like to take this opportunity to point out that officials of the French government have been openly hostile towards the Iranian nation over the past few years and this is not a clever move by French government officials.
hau: A nan ina ga ya dace in sanar da cewa cikin shekarun baya-bayan nan jami'an gwamnatin Faransa suna bayyanar da kiyayyarsu ga al'ummar Iran. Hakan wauta ce da jami'an Faransar suke yi.
mt0: <pad> I think it is necessary to mention that in recent years French government officials have shown their hatred for the people of Iran. That is a stupidity by French officials.</s>

en: A wise human being, particularly a wise politician, should never have the motivation to turn a neutral country into an enemy.
hau: Mutum mai hankali, musamman dan siyasan da ya san abin da ya kamata, bai kamata ya mayar da mutumin da bai dauke shi a matsayin makiyi ba a matsayin makiyinsa ba.
mt0: <pad> A wise man, especially a politician who knows what he is doing, should not turn a person who does not see him as his enemy as his enemy.</s>

en: We have never had problems with France and the French government, neither in the past nor in the present era. However, since the time of Sarkozy, the French government has adopted a policy of opposing the Iranian nation and unfortunately the current French government is pursuing the same policy.
hau: Mu dai ba mu da wata matsala da gwamnati da kuma kasar Faransa, tsawon tarihi ba mu da wata matsala da su, haka nan a wannan lokacin ma. To amma wannan siyasa ta kuskure ta kiyayya da al'ummar Iran ta faro ne daga zamanin mulkin Sarkozy, ita ma gwamnati mai ci yanzu ta ci gaba da hakan.
mt0: <pad> We have never had any problems with the government and France, and now too. But this wrong policy of hatred against the people of Iran began under Sarkozy's rule, and the current government has continued it.</s>

en: In our opinion, this is a wrong move. It is ill-advised and unwise.
hau: A ra'ayinmu wannan kuskure ne, sannan kuma rashin tunani da kuma amfani da hankali ne.
mt0: <pad> In our opinion this is a mistake, and also lack of thought and use of reason.</s>

en: What they call "the global community" is a few countries, whose main leader is America, followed by the Zionists, the English government and certain other small governments.
hau: A lokacin da suke magana, Amurkawa suna fadin cewa ‘kasashen duniya'. Sun sanya sunan wasu ‘yan kasashe a matsayin ‘kasashen duniya'; wadanda su ne Amurka, da ‘yan amshin shatansu sahyoniyawa da gwamantin Ingila da sauran wasu gwamnatocin na daban.
mt0: <pad> When the Americans talk, they say "world countries". They put names of some countries as "world countries"; which are America, and its Jewish allies, the English government and other other governments.</s>

en: The global community is not at all determined to oppose Iran, Iranians and Islamic Iran. Now that we are supposed to have an evaluation of the year 1391, I should mention that the Americans started their new plans from the beginning of the year 1391.
hau: Kasashen duniya dai ba sa kiyayya da Iran da al'ummar kasar Musulunci ta Iran. A halin yanzu da mu ke son yin dubi cikin shekarar 1391 da ta gabata, ya kamata a san cewa tun a farkon shekarar 1391 Amurkawa suka fara gudanar da sabon makircinsu; duk kuwa da cewa a zahiri suna nuna abokanta da shimfidar fuska.
mt0: <pad> The world does not like Iran and the Islamic Republic of Iran. Now that we are looking at the year 1391, it should be known that the Americans have already begun their new plot; even though they appear to be friendly and cooperative on the surface.</s>

en: They imposed harsh sanctions from the beginning of the year 1391 - sanctions on oil and sanctions on banking and monetary transactions between the Islamic Republic and other countries. They did many other things in this regard.
hau: Tun daga farkon wannan shekarar ta 1391 suka fara sanya takunkumi mai tsanani kan al'ummar Iran; takunkumin man fetur, takunkumi kan bankuna da musayen kudade tsakanin bankuna tsakanin Jamhuriyar Musulunci da sauran kasashe - kai sun yi abubuwa da yawa a wannan fagen.
mt0: <pad> Since the beginning of this year 1391 they have been imposing severe sanctions on the people of Iran; oil sanctions, bank sanctions and money transfer restrictions between the Islamic Republic and other countries - and they have done a lot in this regard.</s>

en: They show malice and opposition, yet they expect the Iranian nation not to realize that they are hostile.
hau: Suuna nuna adawa da kiyayya, amma suna fatan cewa al'ummar Iran ba za su fahimci cewa su din nan makiya ne kuma suna kiyayya da su ba ne.
mt0: <pad> They are anti-Semitic and anti-Iranian, but they hope that the people of Iran will not realize that they are enemies and haters of them.</s>

en: A few years ago in my speech on the first day of Farvardin, I said here at Ali ibn Musa ar-Ridha's (a.s.) shrine that you [Americans] should be careful, that your proclaimed affection and friendship should not mean that you are wearing a velvet glove over an iron fist, pretending that you are our friends while being hostile in your hearts.
hau: A ‘yan shekarun da suka gabata a wannan wajen, a hubbaren Imam Ali bn Musa al-Ridha (a.s) a irin wannan jawabi na farkon shekara na fadi cewa ku yi taka tsantsan kada wannan nuna so da kauna da kuke yi ya zamanto kun boye wani gatari ne cikin tsumma, kuna son ku dinga nuna abokantaka, to amma a badini kuna cutarwa.
mt0: <pad> a few years ago here, in the holy mosque of Imam Ali bn Musa al-Ridha (a.s), I said that you should be careful not to hide a danger in your love and affection, you want to show friendship, but in reality you are hurting.</s>

en: The Americans sent special agents to prevent Iran from selling oil and transferring the money to the country. America chose certain outstanding and experienced agents to travel to different countries and even speak to heads of certain companies in order to encourage them to stop oil-related transactions with the Islamic Republic.
hau: Gwamnatin Amurka ta nada wasu mutane na musamman da za su yi magana da kasahen duniya, su tafi wadannan kasashe, su tattaunawa da shugabannin kamfanoni wajen ganin ba su kulla wata alaka ta tattalin arziki da cinikin mai da Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran ba.
mt0: <pad> The U.S. government has appointed special people to talk to other countries, travel to those countries, and talk to company leaders to see if they can't establish any economic or oil ties with the Islamic Republic of Iran.</s>

en: These agents were tasked with punishing those who had financial relationships or oil-related transactions with the Islamic Republic.
hau: Sannan kuma su hukunta su matukar suka kulla wata alaka ta kudi da kuma man fetur da Jamhuriyar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> They will be prosecuted if they establish a financial and oil relationship with the Islamic Republic of Iran.</s>

en: They started this work with full intensity from the beginning of the year 1391, particularly from Mordad.
hau: Sun fara wannan aikin ne tun daga farkon shekara ta 1391, musamman daga watan Mordad, inda suka tsananta abin sosai.
mt0: <pad> They began this work in the beginning of 1391, especially from Mordad, where they intensified it very much.</s>

en: Of course, as I said a few months ago, the Americans expressed joy and said that I have confessed to the effect of the sanctions. Yes, the sanctions have not been inconsequential. If they are happy about this, let them be happy.
hau: Lalle ya kamata in fadi - a ‘yan watannin da suka gabata ma na taba fadin hakan - cewa Amurkawa suna bayyana jin dadinsu suna cewa ni ma na tabbatar da cewa takunkumin ya yi tasiri. Na'am, ba za a ce takunkumin bai yi tasiri ba, idan suna son su yi farin ciki, su yi farin cikinsu.
mt0: <pad> I should say - I have said it a few months ago - that the Americans are showing their anger and saying that I too am sure that the sanctions have been effective. Yes, we will not say that the sanctions haven't been effective, if they want to be happy, let them be happy.</s>

en: The flaw that our economy is suffering from is that it is dependent on oil.
hau: Tattalin arzikinmu ya fuskanci matsalar cewa ya dogara ne da man fetur.
mt0: <pad> Our economy has the problem that it depends on oil.</s>

en: We need to distance our economy from oil. Our governments should include this among their basic plans.
hau: Wajibi ne mu raba tattalin arzikinmu da dogaro da man fetur; ya kamata gwamnatocinmu su sanya hakan cikin shirye-shiryensu.
mt0: <pad> We must decouple our economy from the oil industry; our governments must put that into their plans.</s>

en: Seventeen, eighteen years ago, I told the government of that time and its officials that they should act in a way that we could shut down our oil wells whenever we wanted to.
hau: Shekaru sha bakwai zuwa sha takwas din da suka gabata na gaya wa gwamnatin wancan lokacin cewa su yi wani tsarin da a duk lokacin da muke so za mu iya rufe rijiyoyin man mu.
mt0: <pad> Seventeen or eighteen years ago I told the government that we should have a system that we can shut down our oil wells at any time we want.</s>

en: The so-called "technocrats" smiled in disbelief, as if to say, "Is that even possible?"
hau: A wancan lokacin wasu da suke kiran kansu ‘kwararru' sun fashe da dariya suna cewa shin hakan abu ne mai yiyuwa?
mt0: <pad> At the time, some of those who call themselves "wise" burst into laughter and wondered if it was possible.</s>

en: Yes, it is possible. It is necessary to follow up the issue, take action and make plans.
hau: Na'am, mai yiyuwa ne, wajibi ne a kama hanyar hakan, wajibi ne a yi wani abu da kuma tsare-tsare.
mt0: <pad> Yes, it is possible, it must be taken up, something must be done and some measures must be taken.</s>

en: When economic plans of a country are built on a particular base, the enemies of that country will target that base.
hau: A duk lokacin da tattalin arzikin wata kasa ya damfara da wani waje na musamman, to kuwa makiya za su ba da himma kan wannan wajen ne.
mt0: <pad> Whenever the economic wealth of a country is concentrated in one area, the enemies will focus on that area.</s>

en: Yes, the sanctions have had an effect, but not the effect that the enemies wanted.
hau: Na'am takunkumi ya yi tasiri, to amma ba irin tasirin da makiya suke so ba.
mt0: <pad> Yes, the sanctions have had some effect, but not the kind of effect that the enemies are hoping for.</s>

en: I will explain this issue later on. This is all I wanted to say about the issue of economy. On the political front, throughout the year 1391 they tried to "isolate" Islamic Iran in the world.
hau: Zan yi a karin bayani kan hakan nan gaba. Wannan dangane da batun tattalin arziki kenan. A fagen ayyukan siyasa ma, tsawon shekarar barar (1391) makiyan sun yi dukkanin abin da za su iya wajen ganin sun mayar da kasar Musulunci ta Iran saniyar ware kamar yadda suke fadi.
mt0: <pad> I will explain it later. That's about the economic side. In the political side, during last year (1391) the enemies have done everything they can to make the Islamic Republic of Iran a dhimmis, as they say.</s>

en: That is to say, they tried to shake the faith of other governments in their relations with Iran and in the Islamic Republic. They tried to prevent the Islamic Republic from promoting and implementing its policies in the region, in the world and in the country.
hau: Gwamnatoci su dinga wani irin kallo kallo wa Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran, wato kada su bari Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran ta yi wani tasiri da kuma fadada siyasarta a wannan yanki da kuma sauran yankuna na duniya. To sun sha kashi a wannan fagen ma.
mt0: <pad> The governments need to be very careful with the Iranian Islamic Republic, that is not allowing Iran to have any influence and extend its political influence in this region and other parts of the world. But they have been very successful in this regard.</s>

en: What happened was the exact opposite of what they wanted.
hau: To sabanin abin da suke fatan gani shi ne ya faru.
mt0: <pad> The opposite of what they expected to see happened.</s>

en: Two thirds of the nations of the world are members of the Non-Aligned Movement. Heads of other countries took part in the Tehran summit.
hau: Kasashen kungiyar ‘yan ba ruwanmu sun kumshi kashi biyu cikin uku na dukkanin al'ummomin duniya ne. Shugabannin kasashe da manyan jami'an kasashen wannan kungiyar sun halarci taron na Tehran.
mt0: <pad> The countries of the Non-Aligned Movement represent two-thirds of the world's population. Presidents and senior officials of the non-aligned nations attended the Tehran Conference.</s>

en: Everybody felt that the Iranian nation was praiseworthy.
hau: Dukkaninsu sun kasance masu jinjinawa al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> They were all admirers of the people of Iran.</s>

en: They said this in their meetings with us and in the interviews they gave. They also said the same thing when they returned to their home countries.
hau: Sun gaya mana hakan, sannan kuma cikin hirar da suka yi da kafafen watsa labarai duk sun fadi hakan, haka nan kuma al'ummominsu duk sun gaskata hakan bayan da suka koma gida.
mt0: <pad> They told us that, and in all their interviews with the media they said that, and their people believed it after they returned home.</s>

en: What happened was the exact opposite of what the enemies of the Iranian nation wanted.
hau: Wato sabanin abin da makiyan al'ummar Iran suke fatan gani ya faru.
mt0: <pad> The opposite of what the enemies of the people of Iran wanted happened.</s>

en: They failed to do what they wanted.
hau: Sun gagara yin wani tasiri.
mt0: <pad> They failed to make any real impact.</s>

en: In the case of domestic policies, the purpose of their sanctions was to make the Iranian nation uncertain about their path, to distance the Iranian nation from the Islamic Republic and to make the people disappointed.
hau: A fagen siyasar cikin gida kuwa, manufarsu ta sanya wannan takunkumin ita ce su sanya shakku cikin zukatan al'ummar Iran dangane da tafarkin da suka rika; su haifar da sabani tsakanin al'umma da tsarin Musulunci; su kashe wa mutane gwiwa da sanya su yanke kauna.
mt0: <pad> In the field of domestic politics, their goal was to put doubt in the minds of the Iranian people about the path they have taken; to create divisions between the people and the Islamic system; to demoralize and discourage the people.</s>

en: On the 22nd of Bahman, the people of Iran gave them a powerful punch in the mouth with their massive presence, with their enthusiasm and with the affection that they expressed for Islam, the Islamic Revolution and the Islamic Republic.
hau: A ranar 22 ga watan Bahman, al'ummar Iran sun bada musu kasa a fuska ta hanyar irin fitowar da suka yi da kuma nuna so da kaunar da suka nunawa wannan tsari na Musulunci da kuma juyin juya halin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> On 22 October, the people of Iran showed them the door by their demonstrations and their love and support for this system of Islam and the Islamic Revolution.</s>

en: In the area relating to security, they tried to undermine our national security and the details have been explained to the people by our government officials in their interviews and speeches.
hau: A fagen tsaro ma sun yi dukkanin abin da za su iya wajen lalata zaman lafiyar kasar nan, wanda jami'an gwamnati sun yi karfin haske kan wadannan abubuwa a hirarrakin da suka yi da kafafen watsa labarai.
mt0: <pad> In the security field, they have done everything they can to destroy the peace of the country, which government officials have made a lot of light on in their interviews with the media.</s>

en: On the political front, they once again witnessed the power and influence of the Islamic Republic in the region.
hau: A fagen siyasa na wannan yankin ma, sun yi kokarin kawo karshen irin tasirin da Jamhuriyar Musulunci take da shi.
mt0: <pad> In the political field of this region, they have also tried to end the influence of the Islamic Republic.</s>

en: In the case of the regional issues, they even admitted that no major problem will be solved in the region in the absence of Iran and its vote.
hau: A fagen siyasar yankin nan su da kansu sun tabbatar da cewa babu wata matsala da ta shafi yankin nan da za a iya magance ta ba tare da kasantuwar Iran da kuma amincewar Iran ba.
mt0: <pad> In the field of regional politics, they themselves have confirmed that no problem in the region can be resolved without the consent and approval of Iran.</s>

en: In the case of the Zionist regime's invasion of Gaza, the powerful presence of the Islamic Republic behind the scenes caused them to admit that they had been defeated by Palestinian combatants.
hau: Dangane da harin da gwamnatin sahyoniyawa ta kai Gaza, irin kasantuwa ta bayan fage ta Iran ne ya sanya sahyoniyawan shan kashi a hannun ‘yan gwagwarmayar Palastinawa. Su da kansu suke fadin hakan.
mt0: <pad> In the Israeli attack on Gaza, the proxy presence of Iran has made the Israelis fall to the Palestinian resistance. They themselves say so.</s>

en: We did not announce this: it was they themselves who announced and insisted that if it had not been for the presence of the Islamic Republic and its show of power, Palestinian combatants could not have even put up a resistance against Israel, let alone bring Israel to its knees.
hau: Su ne dai suka fadi- ba wai mu ne muka fadi ba - cewa idan da ba don kasantuwar Jamhuriyar Musulunci da kuma karfinta ba, to da ‘yan gwagwarmayar Palastinawa ba su iya yin tsayin daka a gaban (haramtacciyar kasar) Isra'ila ba, ballantana ma a yi maganar durkusar da ita ba.
mt0: <pad> They say it, not us, that if not for the presence of the Islamic Republic and its power, the Palestinian resistance would not have been able to stand up to Israel, let alone talk of defeating it.</s>

en: In the 8-day war, the Palestinians managed to bring Israel to its knees, and this was the first time in the history of the fake and usurping Zionist regime.
hau: Don kuwa a lokacin yakin kwanaki takwas din Palastinawa sun sami nasarar dunkufar da haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila.
mt0: <pad> Because in the eight-day war, the Palestinians succeeded in toppling the illegal Israel state.</s>

en: As I said, their efforts were not completely inconsequential.
hau: Na fadi cewa kokarin da suka yi dai ba za a ce bai yi tasiri ba; na'am ya yi tasiri, to amma a gefe guda kuma ya haifar mana da wata gagarumar nasarar da daman muke fatan gani.
mt0: <pad> I said that their effort was not ineffective; yes it was, but it also brought us the great success that we all hoped to see.</s>

en: The sanctions caused the massive domestic capacities of the Iranian nation to become activated. The sanctions motivated us to start doing great things.
hau: Wato wannan takunkumin ya yunkurar da al'ummar Iran da kuma irin kwarewar da suke da ita, ta yadda suka gudanar da ayyuka masu girman gaske. Idan da ba don wannan takunkumin ba, da kuwa wadannan abubuwa ba su faru ba.
mt0: <pad> The sanctions have therefore motivated the people of Iran and their capabilities to perform such a large scale of work. Without the sanctions, these things would not have happened.</s>

en: Our youth made certain achievements that would have been impossible in the absence of the sanctions. In the area of infrastructure, in terms of the achievements that were made last year, the year 1391 stands out among the previous years.
hau: Matasanmu sun sami nasarorin da idan da ba don takunkumin ba, da kuwa ba mu sami wadannan nasarorin ba. A fagen ayyukan gina kasa, wanda a nan gaba zan yi karin bayani kai, a shekarar 1391 mun sami ci gaban da idan aka kwatanta da shekarun da suka gabata, lalle ana iya cewa shekarar 1391 shekara ce maras tamka.
mt0: <pad> Our young people have achieved achievements that, if not for the ban, we would not have achieved. In the field of construction, which I will be going to explain later, in 1391 we have seen a development that compared with previous years, really we can say that 1391 was a year without equal.</s>

en: A massive amount of work was done in the area of infrastructure, in the area of building roads, in the area of energy, in the area of discovering new oil reserves, in the area of discovering new sources of uranium, in the area of building and developing power plants and refineries, and in tens of other great industrial areas.
hau: An gudanar da ayyukan ci gaban kasa da yawa; a fagen gina hanyoyi, a fagen makamashi, a fagen gano sabbin albarkatun kasa na man fetur, a fagen ganon sabbin wajajen da ake da karfen uranium, a fagen kara fadada cibiyoyin samar da wutan lantarki da matatan mai da sauran ayyukan masana'antu manya; wadanda dukkaninsu abubuwan ne da za su karfafa bangaren tattalin arzikinmu a nan gaba.
mt0: <pad> Many development projects have been carried out; in the fields of road construction, energy, exploration of new oil reserves, exploration of new uranium deposits, the expansion of power and oil facilities and other major industrial projects; all of which will strengthen our economic future.</s>

en: One example is the great scientific advances that we made in the year 1391.
hau: Mun sami gagarumin ci gaba a fagen ilimi a shekara ta 1391.
mt0: <pad> I started my education in 1391.</s>

en: In the area of science and technology, certain things were done which were remarkable and a genuine source of joy for those who have faith in the future prospects of the country.
hau: A fagen ilimi da fasaha, a shekarar da ta gabatan an gudanar da ayyuka masu yawan gaske da za su faranta ran mutanen da suka yi imani da makoma mai kyau ga al'ummar nan.
mt0: <pad> In the field of education and technology, a lot of work has been done in the past year that will please the people who believe in a bright future for this community.</s>

en: That is to say, the year in which they were determined to be harsh towards the Iranian nation, our honorable youth and scientists launched the Nahid satellite into space. They launched the Pishgam explorer which was carrying a living creature.
hau: Wato a dai wannan shekarar da suke son kuntata wa al'ummar Iran, amma sai ga shi matasanmu da masananmu masu girma a wannan shekarar suka aika da tauraron dan'adam na Nahid zuwa sararin samaniya; aka aika halitta mai rai zuwa sararin samaniyya da ta hanyar na'urar Peshgam; sannan kuma aka kera jirgin saman yaki na zamani.
mt0: <pad> In the year that they wanted to intimidate the people of Iran, our great engineers and scientists sent Nahid the human-satellite into space; a living creature was sent into space by the Peshgam device; and we have built a modern warship.</s>

en: When this living creature was sent into space and was returned safely, international scientists and observers were so surprised that they first denied it.
hau: A lokacin da aka aika da wannan halitta mai rai zuwa sararrin samaniya sannan ya dawo da ransa kuma cikin koshin lafiya, da farko dai masana a duniya sun musanta hakan saboda yadda ya kasance babban abin mamaki a gare su.
mt0: <pad> When this living creature was sent into space and returned with life and health, the world's scientists initially denied it because it was such a great surprise to them.</s>

en: Then when they realized that they had no choice but to accept the truth and after witnessing reality and the evidence, they were forced to acknowledge it.
hau: To amma daga baya, bayan da gaskiya ta bayyana wa kowa, sai suka ga ba su da wata hanya face dai su yarda da hakan.
mt0: <pad> But after the truth was revealed to everyone, they realized that they had no other choice but to accept it.</s>

en: In the area of health and biomedical engineering, great achievements were made, achievements which are related to the health of the people.
hau: A bangaren lafiya da likitanci ma dai an gudanar da ayyuka masu girman gaske da suke da alaka da lafiyar mutane.
mt0: <pad> In the field of medicine and health, a great deal has been done to improve the health of people.</s>

en: We achieved the first rank in the region in the area of biotechnology.
hau: A fagen fasahar ilimin halitta, mun kasance na daya a yankin nan.
mt0: <pad> In the field of science and technology, we have been a strong force in this area.</s>

en: Outstanding technical achievements were made in this area which led to the production of different kinds of pharmaceuticals.
hau: An gudanar da manyan ayyuka, da kuma samar da wasu magunguna.
mt0: <pad> There have been major projects, and some drugs have been developed.</s>

en: All these achievements were made in a year in which the enemies were determined to be harsh towards the Iranian nation in order to deprive it from a good life and from all the products of human talent.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan abubuwan an yi su ne a wannan shekarar da aka takura wa al'ummar Iran, don a haramta musu rayuwa mai kyau da kuma dukkanin nasarori na dan'adam.
mt0: <pad> All these things were done in this year that the people of Iran were oppressed, to prevent them from living a good life and all human successes.</s>

en: In the same year, we were the first in the region in terms of production of knowledge in the area of several important scientific fields.
hau: A dai wannan shekarar, mun kasance a matakin farko a fagage daban-daban na ilimi masu muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> This year, we were in the top tier in various important education fields.</s>

en: In terms of achievements in science and technology competitions, our students' accomplishments were 31 percent more than the previous year.
hau: A fagen gasa ta ilimi da fasaha ta jami'a, kasar nan ta samu ci gaba da kashi talatin da daya cikin dari idan aka kwatanta da shekarar da ta gabata.
mt0: <pad> In the field of university education and technology, the country has seen a growth of 31 percent compared to last year.</s>

en: In the year 1391, the number of our university students increased so much that we had 25 times more students than the early years after the Revolution.
hau: A shekarar 1391 an sami karuwar daliban jami'a ninkin ba ninkiya har sau ashirin da biyar idan aka kwatanta da farkon nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> In 1391, the number of university students increased by 25 times as much as before the Islamic Revolution.</s>

en: The number of students who are studying in our universities is 25 times more than the early years of the Revolution.
hau: Wato adadin daliban jami'anmu ya karu da kashi ashirin da biyar cikin dari na daliban da suka shiga fagen karatun jami'a a shekarar da ta gabatan.
mt0: <pad> The number of students at our university has increased by twenty five percent over the last year.</s>

en: These are examples of the great achievements that the Iranian nation has made.
hau: Wannan nasarori ne masu girma da al'ummar Iran suka samu.
mt0: <pad> These are the greatest victories of the people of Iran.</s>

en: In the areas relating to water, in the areas relating to the natural environment, in the area of stem cell research, in the area of alternative energy, in the area of medicinal herbs and in the area of nuclear energy, our country managed to accomplish great achievements.
hau: A fagen ruwa, da kuma yanayi, a bangaren kwayoyin halitta, sabbin makamashi, a bangaren magunguna na tsirrai, a bangaren makashin nukiliya, kasar nan ta samu nasarori masu girma.
mt0: <pad> In the fields of water, and environment, in the field of biotechnology, new energy, in the field of plant medicine, in the field of nuclear power, the country has achieved great successes.</s>

en: All of these achievements were made in a year in which the enemies of the Iranian nation had focused all their efforts on stopping our nation.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan an same su ne a shekarar da makiyan al'ummar Iran suka yi dukkanin abin da za su iya wajen ganin sun dunkufar da al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> All these were discovered in the year when the enemies of the people of Iran did everything they could to see the people of Iran suffer.</s>

en: The events that happened in the year 1391 contain a big lesson for us. The lesson is that a vibrant nation will never be brought to its knees as a result of the enemies' threats, pressure and harsh measures.
hau: Akwai darussa masu girma cikin abubuwan da suka faru a shekara ta 1391 a gare mu; wannan darasin kuwa shi ne cewa duk wata al'ummar da take a raye, to barazana da matsin lamba da takuri na makiya ba za su taba dunkufar da ita ba.
mt0: <pad> There are great lessons in what happened in 1391 for us; the lesson is that any society that lives, threats, pressures and oppressions of enemies will never be able to destroy it.</s>

en: It became clear to us and to all those who follow up the issues of Iran that what is important for a nation is relying on its own capacities, trusting Allah the Exalted, having faith in itself and not relying on its enemies.
hau: Ta bayyana mana da kuma dukkanin wadanda suka sanya ido kan abubuwan da suka shafi Iran, cewa abin da ke da muhimmanci ga wata al'umma, shi ne dogaro da irin karfin da take da shi, dogaro da Allah Madaukakin Sarki, dogara da kanta da kuma rashin dogaro da makiya.
mt0: <pad> She explained to us and all those who have been watching the situation in Iran that what is important for a nation is to depend on its own power, on God Almighty, on its own self and not to depend on its enemies.</s>

en: This is what can help a nation move forward.
hau: Hakan shi ne abin da zai ciyar da ita gaba.
mt0: <pad> That's what will feed her.</s>

en: The year 1391 was like a war game for us.
hau: Shekara ta 1391 ta kasance wani fage ne na gwaji da atisaye.
mt0: <pad> The year 1391 was a period of experimentation and research.</s>

en: Of course, we identified our weaknesses as well. After all, this is the purpose of war games.
hau: Tabbas mun fahimci irin raunin da muke da su; wannan ita ce siffar atisaye.
mt0: <pad> We certainly understand our limitations; this is the form of research.</s>

en: In a military exercise, military units identify both their weaknesses and their strengths and they try to eliminate their weaknesses.
hau: A lokacin atisayen soji, sojojin su kan fahimci irin karfin da suke da shi, haka nan da kuma raunin da suke da shi don su magance shi.
mt0: <pad> During military training, soldiers learn their strengths and weaknesses to fight them.</s>

en: We identified our weaknesses.
hau: Mu mun fahimci irin raunin da muke da su.
mt0: <pad> We understand our weaknesses.</s>

en: Our economic weaknesses - which led to harsh conditions for certain groups of people - include dependence on oil, disregarding large-scale economic policies of the country and adopting policies and decisions on a day-to-day basis.
hau: Wannan raunin kuwa ya samo asali ne daga dogaro da mai da muka yi - wanda a baya na fadi cewa hakan daya ne daga cikin raunin da muke da shi - rashin kula da siyasa da tsare-tsare na tattalin arziki da irin matakan da ake dauka na yau da kullum cikin rayuwa.
mt0: <pad> This weakness is the result of our dependence on oil - which I have said is one of our weaknesses - the neglect of politics and economic policy and the daily decisions we take in life.</s>

en: Government officials of the country - the incumbent officials and officials who will be elected through this year's presidential elections - should pay attention to this point.
hau: Wajibi ne jami'an gwamnati - jami'an da a halin yanzu suke kan karagar mulki sannan kuma musamman jami'an da za su zo nan gaba bayan zaben shugaban kasa da za a yi a wannan shekarar - su lura da wannan lamarin.
mt0: <pad> The government - the current ones and especially the future ones - must take this issue seriously.</s>

en: Another great lesson that we learnt was that our country enjoys firm foundations.
hau: Wani babban darasin da muka dauka na daban shi ne cewa tushen ginin kasar nan tushe ne mai karfi.
mt0: <pad> Another big lesson we learned was that the foundation of the country is a strong foundation.</s>

en: When the foundations of a country become firm, the effect of the enemies' hostile actions is minimized.
hau: A lokacin da tushe ya zamanto mai karfi, to kuwa makircin makiya ba za su yi tasiri sosai ba.
mt0: <pad> When the base is strong, then the enemies' plots will not have much effect.</s>

en: In this great country which enjoys firm foundations, if government officials accept their responsibility and adopt wise measures, if managers stay together and cooperate - which is my constant advice to our government officials and managers - if our managers act in a wise and intelligent way, then we can turn every threat into an opportunity, just as we did in the year 1391 and managed to move forward.
hau: Idan har jami'an kasar nan mai girma da kuma irin wannan tushe mai karfi suka fahimci nauyin da ke wuyansu, suka gudanar da aikinsu yadda ya kamata, to a nan ne za su sami damar mayar da duk wata barazana zuwa ga wata dama; kamar yadda a shekarar 1391 muka mayar da barazanar makiya zuwa ga wata dama ta ciyar da kanmu gaba.
mt0: <pad> If our great nation and this strong base understand their responsibility and perform their work well, then they will be able to turn any danger into an opportunity; just as in 1391 we converted the enemy's danger into an opportunity to feed ourselves.</s>

en: What our government officials and dear people achieved in the year 1391 will hopefully reveal its effects in the life of the people in the future.
hau: Insha Allahu a nan gaba za a ga tasirin abubuwan da jami'ai da kuma al'ummar kasar nan suka aikata a shekarar 1391.
mt0: <pad> Insha Allahu we will see the effect of what officials and the people of the country did in 1391.</s>

en: Of course, the economy of the country is an important issue and I have constantly stressed its importance over the past few years, but it is not the only issue. Our national security is important too. Public health is important too.
hau: Tabbas tattalin arziki lamari ne mai muhimmanci wanda cikin 'yan shekarun nan na sha magana kan hakan, to amma tattalin arzikin ba shi ne kawai lamari mai muhimmanci ba; tsaron kasa ma yana da muhimmanci, lafiyar mutane tana da muhimmanci, ci gaba na ilimi yana da muhimmanci, shi ne ma tushe da asasin aiki.
mt0: <pad> Economic growth is certainly a very important issue that I have been talking about for the past years, but economic growth is not just a very important issue; national security is also important, people's health is important, education development is important, it is the basis and the foundation of all work.</s>

en: If our country makes progress in science, all the other things will become easy.
hau: Saboda idan har ilimi ya ci gaba a kasa, to kuwa dukkanin sauran ayyuka da za su zo daga baya za su yi sauki.
mt0: <pad> Because if education is developed in a country, then all the other work that comes after it will be easier.</s>

en: Regional influence and power of a nation is the support of its independence and national security, and it is important.
hau: Yanci da daukaka ta kasa ma suna da muhimmanci, rashin yin maula da mika wuyan wata al'umma lamari ne mai muhimmanci, tasir icikin lamurra na yanki a wajen wata al'umma da kuma wata kasa lamari ne da ke tabbatar da 'yanci da tsaro na wannan kasar, shi ma lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> Freedom and national pride are also important, not being dependent and submitting to another culture is also important, the influence of regional politics on other cultures and other countries is also important, which guarantees the freedom and security of that country, it is also important.</s>

en: We have made progress in all these areas.
hau: A dukkanin wadannan bangarorin mun sami ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> We have made progress in all these areas.</s>

en: We have made progress in the area of security, in the area of health, in the area of gaining international influence and in the area of controlling different events that happen in the country and in the region.
hau: A bangaren tsaro ne ko kuma a bangaren lafiya, haka nan a bangaren tasiri na kasa da kasa da kuma iko da magance matsaloli daban-daban da kasar nan ta fuskanta.
mt0: <pad> It could be security or health, as well as international influence and the ability to deal with different problems that the country has faced.</s>

en: Through its advances, our nation proved that refusing to live under the hegemony of America does not mean backwardness. This is an important point.
hau: Ta hanyar irin wadannan ci gaban, al'ummarmu ta tabbatar da cewa rashin zama karkashin ikon Amurka ba yana nufin koma baya ba ne; lalle wannan lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> By such developments, our community has ensured that not being under American control does not mean retreat; it is a very important matter.</s>

en: Powerful people of the world and colonialists - at a time when there was direct colonialism - tried to prove to nations of the world that if they wanted to have a good life and make progress, they had to live under their hegemony. And today America is doing the same thing.
hau: Masu takama da karfi na duniya da 'yan mulkin mallaka - a lokacin da ake mulkin mallaka kai tsaye - a yau kuma Amurka tana son ta nuna wa al'ummomin duniya cewa matukar dai kuna son rayuwa mai kyau da kuma samun ci gaba, to wajibi ne ku kasance karkashin ikon mu.
mt0: <pad> The world's powerhouses and colonisers - during the time of direct colonization - today America wants to show the world that if you want a good life and progress, you must be under our control.</s>

en: The Iranian nation proved that this is a lie.
hau: Al'ummar Iran ta tabbatar da cewa hakan karya ce.
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran have confirmed that it is a lie.</s>

en: Our nation proved that being independent of America and other superpowers not only will not cause backwardness, but it will also bring about progress.
hau: Al'ummarmu ta tabbatar da cewa rashin dogaro da Amurka da sauran manyan kasashen duniya ba wai kawai ba zai kawo ci baya ba ne, kai yana ma kawo ci gaba ne.
mt0: <pad> Our people have already proven that not only will not depend on the United States and other major countries of the world, but it will bring about development.</s>

en: There were certain countries that attached themselves to America's tail and followed it.
hau: Akwai irin wadannan kasashen da suka damfara kansu da Amurka.
mt0: <pad> There are such countries that have aligned themselves with the United States.</s>

en: Thirty years of experience lie in front of our eyes. Notice what has happened in the thirty years that the Islamic Republic has been in power. Notice where the Islamic Republic and the Iranian nation used to be and where they are now.
hau: Muna da irin wannan kwarewar ta shekaru talatin. Ku duba ku ga yadda shekaru talatin na Jamhuriyar Musulunci suka kasance sannan kuma wani irin matsayi Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta kai sannan su kuma wadancan kasashen ina suke.
mt0: <pad> We have such a 30 year experience. To look at the 30 years of the Islamic Republic and what position the Islamic Republic has achieved and where the other countries are.</s>

en: Anybody who studies this issue will realize that being independent of superpowers is an opportunity for a nation, not a threat.
hau: Duk wanda ya karanci hakan, zai fahimci cewa rashin dogaro da manyan kasashen duniya, wata dama ce ga wata al'umma, ba wai barazana ba.
mt0: <pad> Whoever reads this will understand that independence from the great powers of the world is a privilege for a people, not a danger.</s>

en: And thankfully the Iranian nation has achieved this opportunity by relying on its power, its courage and its intelligence.
hau: Alhamdu lillahi al'ummar Iran, albarkacin irin karfi da jaruntaka da kuma sanin ya kamatanta, ta yi amfani da wannan damar.
mt0: <pad> Thank God the people of Iran, through their strength and courage and intelligence, have used this opportunity.</s>

en: In certain cases, we acted like this and we witnesses the resulting success.
hau: A baya mun taba yin hakan a wani lokaci sannan kuma mun ga nasararsa.
mt0: <pad> We've already done it before and we saw the success.</s>

en: One example is the issue of producing twenty-percent enriched fuel for the research reactor in Tehran, which produces the important radiopharmaceuticals that our country needs.
hau: Misalin hakan shi ne batun samar da makamashin nukiliya kashi ashirin cikin dari da cibiyar bincike ta Tehran take bukata inda ake samar da magunguna masu muhimmanci da kasar nan take bukata.
mt0: <pad> An example of this is the nuclear energy that Tehran's research center needs to produce 20 percent of its nuclear power while producing important medicines that the country needs.</s>

en: This small power plant required twenty-percent enriched fuel.
hau: Wannan karamar cibiya tana bukatar makamashi kashi ashirin cikin dari, wanda a lokacin ba ma samar da wannan makashin, mu kan shigo da shi ne daga waje.
mt0: <pad> This small center needs 20% energy, which we can't provide at the time, we have to import it from outside.</s>

en: They decided to use this national need to force the Islamic Republic to give in to their imposition and hegemony.
hau: Su yi kafar ungulu ga wannan bukata ta kasa, don su tilasta wa Jamhuriyar Musulunci amincewa da abubuwan da suka gabatar da kuma bukatunsu.
mt0: <pad> They overstepped this national need, to force the Islamic Republic to accept their demands and proposals.</s>

en: Before the conditions became critical, our youth and scientists managed to produce twenty-percent enriched fuel and they turned it into fuel rods that were needed at the power plant.
hau: To amma kafin ma lamarin ya kai ga matsayin da zai iya zama mana matsala sai matasa da masananmu suka mike suka samar da makamashin da aka tace shi kashi ashirin cikin darin don lamunce abin da wannan cibiyar take bukata.
mt0: <pad> But before the matter could even be a problem, our young and scientists have worked hard to produce clean energy that is 20 percent purified to meet the requirements of this center.</s>

en: Our opponents could not guess that we would be able to do what we did.
hau: Masu adawa da mu ba su taba tsammanin za mu iya yin hakan ba.
mt0: <pad> Our opponents never thought we could do that.</s>

en: However, our government officials identified this need in time and started working.
hau: To amma a kan lokaci jami'an gwamnatinmu suka fahimci wannan bukata da ake da ita, don haka suka dukufa, aka karfafa irin wannan karewa ta al'ummar Iran sannan kuma muka sami nasarar yin hakan.
mt0: <pad> But over time our government officials realized this need, so they worked hard, strengthened the desire of the Iranian people and we managed to do it.</s>

en: While they expected that the Islamic Republic would beg them for twenty-percent enriched fuel, the Islamic Republic announced that it had produced twenty-percent enriched uranium inside the country and that it did not need the enemies.
hau: A daidai lokacin da suke zaton Jamhuriyar Musulunci za ta zo gabansu tana maula da kaskantar da kai su ba ta makashin da aka tace kashi ashirin cikin dari, nan take Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta sanar da cewa mu mun samar da wannan makamshin don haka ba ma bukatarku.
mt0: <pad> When they thought the Islamic Republic would come to them with a settlement and humiliate them by offering them 20% of the purified sugar, the Islamic Republic announced that we have already produced this sugar so we don't need you.</s>

en: If our scientists and youth had not done what they did, today we would have to go to those who are not our friends and ask them for either twenty-percent enriched uranium or radiopharmaceuticals.
hau: Idan da a ce masana da matasanmu ba su yi wannan aikin ba, to da a yau cikin kaskantar da kai da maula da kashe kudade masu tsada da mun tafi wajen mutanen da suke adawa da mu, mu gabatar musu da bukatar su sayar mana da makamashin ko kuma mu dinga bukatar magunguna da abubuwan da ake bukatan.
mt0: <pad> If our scientists and engineers hadn't done this, then today we would have to go to our enemies with disgrace and waste of precious money to ask them to sell us energy or to buy medicines and other necessities.</s>

en: Our government officials identified this need in time and they did what they had to do.
hau: Jami'an kasar nan sun gano hakan, kuma cikin lokaci suka fahimci hakan, sai suka yi abin da ya kamata su yi.
mt0: <pad> The national authorities discovered it, and in time they realized it, and they did what they had to do.</s>

en: For this reason, we achieved a victory. This should be the general plan in the case of all our national issues and needs. Administrations, industrialists, farmers, capitalists, entrepreneurs, researchers and designers of scientific and industrial projects should all carry out this great responsibility, which is a rational and moral responsibility.
hau: A saboda haka muka yi nasara. Wajibi ne hakan ya zamanto shi ne tsarin gwamnati cikin dukkanin lamurran da suka shafi kasar nan. Wajibi ne gwamnatoci na Iran, masu masana'antu, manoma, 'yan kasuwa da 'yan kwangila, masana da masu tsara tsare-tsare na ilimi da masana'antu, su sauke wannan nauyi mai girma wanda kuma ya yi daidai da hankali, na cewa kafin ma bukata ta taso su shirya da kuma wuce gaban makiya cikin makirce-makircensu.
mt0: <pad> That's why we won. This must be the government policy in all matters of the country. The governments of Iran, industry, farmers, business and contracting, engineers and planners of science and industry, must take this great and righteous responsibility, to prepare and overtake the enemy in his plans.</s>

en: If they want to write scholarly articles, they should adopt this orientation. If they want to do research, they should adopt this orientation.
hau: Makalolin da za su rubuta, su kasance a wannan bangaren ne; idan za su yi bincike na ilimi su zamanto ta wannan bangaren ne.
mt0: <pad> The articles they write are on the other hand; when they do research, they are on the other hand.</s>

en: If they want to engage in industrial, technical or scientific work, they should adopt this orientation.
hau: Idan za su gudanar da ayyuka na masana'antu ko ayyuka na ilimi ne, dukkaninsu su zamanto ta wannan bangaren.
mt0: <pad> If they are engaged in industrial or educational activities, they are all part of one sector.</s>

en: All of us have a responsibility to make efforts to keep our country impervious and resistant to the enemies.
hau: Nauyin da ke wuyan dukkaninmu shi ne mu yi kokari wajen gina kasar nan ta yadda ba za a iya kutsa ta da kuma yin tasiri na makiya ba.
mt0: <pad> The responsibility that we all have is to try to build our country so that it cannot be invaded and influenced by enemies.</s>

en: This is one of the requirements of the idea of "economy of resistance" which I put forward.
hau: Mu kiyaye ta. Wannan daya ne daga cikin laziman tattalin arziki na gwagwarmaya da muka gabatar.
mt0: <pad> We will keep it. This is one of the economic and political demands we have presented.</s>

en: In an economy of resistance, one fundamental pillar is resistance of the economy.
hau: A tattalin arziki na gwagwarmaya, daya daga cikin rukuni na asasi mai muhimmanci shi ne sanya tattalin arzikin ya zamanto mai tinkarar duk wata barazana.
mt0: <pad> In a war-economy, one of the most important fundamentals is to make the economy prepared to meet any threat.</s>

en: The economy must be resistant. It must be able to withstand the enemies' machinations.
hau: Wajibi ne tattalin arziki ya zamanto mai tinkarar barazana; wajibi ne ya zamanto zai iya tinkarar duk wani abin za a iya fuskanta na daga makircin makiya.
mt0: <pad> The economy must be resilient; it must be able to resist any attack from the enemy's plots.</s>

en: This is the first point that I wanted to discuss in this meeting.
hau: Wannan batu ne na farko da wajibi ne in sanar da ku.
mt0: <pad> This is the first thing I have to tell you.</s>

en: The second point is that the Americans send messages to us through different channels, asking us to negotiate with them regarding the nuclear issue. They both send messages to us and discuss the proposal in their global propaganda.
hau: Batu na biyu: shi ne cewa a kai a kai Amurkawa suna aiko mana da sako ta hanyoyi daban-daban, suna cewa ku zo mu tattauna kan batun nukiliya. Suna aiko mana da sakonni, haka nan kuma suna gabatar da hakan ta kafafen watsa labaransu.
mt0: <pad> Second: The Americans are sending us messages in different ways, asking us to come and talk about the nuke issue. They send us messages, and they present it through their media.</s>

en: High- and middle-ranking officials of America repeatedly say that alongside the P5+1 talks regarding the nuclear issue, America and the Islamic Republic should hold one-on-one negotiations over the issue. I am not optimistic about such negotiations.
hau: Manyan jami'ai da na tsaka-tsaki na Amurka, a lokuta daban-daban, suna gaya mana cewa ku zo a bayan fagen tattaunawar 5+1 da ake yi kan batun nukiliya, Amurka da Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran ma su zauna teburin tattaunawa kan shirin nukiliyan Iran. Ni dai ba ni da wani kyakkyawan fata kan wannan tattaunawar.
mt0: <pad> Many senior American officials and negotiators have told us that after the 5+1 nuclear talks, the United States and the Islamic Republic of Iran will sit down at a table to discuss the Iran's nuclear program. I don't have a good view of this negotiation.</s>

en: Why?
hau: Me ya sa?
mt0: <pad> You don't know me ya sa?</s>

en: Because our past experiences show that in the logic of the American gentlemen, negotiation does not mean sitting down together to try to reach a rational solution. This is not what they mean by negotiation.
