hau: Don kuwa kwarewar da muke da ita tana nuni da cewa tattaunawa a mahangar Amurka ba ita ce mu zauna don mu gano hanya da mafitar da ta dace da hankali, to wannan ba shi ne abin da suke nufi da tattaunawa ba.
mt0: <pad> Because our experience shows that the American view of dialogue is not to sit down and find a reasonable solution, then that is not what they mean by dialogue.</s>

en: What they mean is that we should sit down together and talk so that Iran accepts their views.
hau: Abin da suke nufi da tattaunawa, ita ce mu zauna, mu tattauna don ku yarda da abin da muke fadi!
mt0: <pad> What they mean by talking is that we sit down and talk to you so you agree with what we're saying.</s>

en: The goal has been announced in advance: Iran must accept their view. For this reason, we have always announced that this is not negotiation.
hau: A saboda haka ne a koda yaushe muka sanar da kuma cewa wannan ba tattaunawa ba ce; wannan tilasci ne, Iran kuwa ba za ta taba mika wuya ba.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, we have always said and we will always say that this is not a negotiation; this is a release, Iran which will never surrender.</s>

en: I am not optimistic about these statements, but I am not opposed either.
hau: Ni dai ba ni da wani kyakkyawan fata kan irin wadannan abubuwan da suke fadi, to amma ba wai ina hanawa ba ne.
mt0: <pad> I don't have a good feeling about what they say, but it's not that I'm upset.</s>

en: In this regard, there are a few things that I should clarify.
hau: To sai dai akwai wasu batutuwa da wajibi ne in fayyace su:
mt0: <pad> But there are some things I have to explain.</s>

en: The first point is that the Americans constantly send messages - sometimes in writing - that they are not after regime change in Iran. This is what they are telling us.
hau: Batu na farko shi ne cewa Amurkawa a kai a kai suna aiko mana da sako, a wani lokaci a rubuce, wani lokacin kuma sako suke aikowa, suna cewa mu dai ba mu da nufin kifar da gwamnatin Musulunci (ta Iran); haka suke gaya mana.
mt0: <pad> The first thing is that the Americans often send us messages, sometimes in writing, sometimes by phone, saying that we don't want to topple the Islamic government (of Iran); that's what they tell us.</s>

en: The answer is that we are not concerned about whether or not you have intentions of overthrowing the Islamic Republic although you constantly insist that you do not have such intentions.
hau: Amsarmu ita ce cewa mu dai ba mu damu ko kuna da nufin kifar da tsarin Musulunci ko kuma a'a ba, ballantana ma ku dinga fadi a halin yanzu cewa ku ba ku da niyyar sauya wannan tsari na Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Our answer is that we don't care whether you want to overthrow the Islamic system or not, and even less if you say now that you don't want to change this Islamic system.</s>

en: Even the day when you had intentions of overthrowing the Islamic Republic and you announced this openly, you could not do anything, and you will not be able to do anything in the future either.
hau: A wancan lokacin da kuka kasance kuna da niyyar kifar da tsarin Musuluncin, sannan kuma a fili kuke fadin hakan, kun gagara yin wani abu, a nan gaba ma ba za ku iya yin wani abu ba.
mt0: <pad> When you were trying to overthrow the system of Islam, and you were openly saying it, you failed to do anything, and you will never be able to do anything in the future.</s>

en: The second point is that the Americans constantly send us messages, telling us that they are sincere in their offers of rational negotiation.
hau: Batu na biyu: shi ne cewa Amurkawa suna ta aiko da sakonni cewa mu da gaske muke yi cikin batun tattaunawar.
mt0: <pad> Second: The Americans are sending messages that we are serious about the discussion.</s>

en: They claim that they sincerely want to have rational negotiations with Iran - that is to say, they claim that they do not want imposition.
hau: Wato da gaske muna son tattaunawa da ku sannan kuma tattaunawar da ta yi daidai da hankali; wato ba tattaunawa ta tilasci ba.
mt0: <pad> We really want to talk with you and a fair and reasonable conversation; not a free-for-all conversation.</s>

en: In response, I would say, we have told you many times that we are not after nuclear weapons and you say that you do not believe us.
hau: To ina gaya musu cewa: A lokuta da dama mun sha gaya muku cewa mu dai ba ma nufin kera makaman kare dangi, amma kuna fadin cewa ba ku yarda ba.
mt0: <pad> I told them: We have already told you many times that we don't want to build nuclear weapons, but you say you don't agree.</s>

en: Why would we believe your statements then?
hau: To da wani dalilin ne mu ma za mu yarda da abin da kuke fadi?
mt0: <pad> For some reason we don't agree with what you say.</s>

en: When you are not prepared to accept a rational and sincere statement, why would we accept your statements which have been disproved many times?
hau: A lokacin da ya zamana ku din nan ba a shirye kuke ku amince da wata magana ta gaskiya wacce ta yi daidai da hankali ba, da wani dalilin ne za mu yarda da abin da kuke fadi wadanda a lokuta da dama kun tabbatar da sabanin hakan?
mt0: <pad> When you're not willing to accept the truth that is right and reasonable, for what reason do we believe what you say that you often prove the opposite of it?</s>

en: Our interpretation is that offers of negotiation are an American tactic to mislead public opinion in the world and in our country.
hau: Fahimtarmu cikin wannan shawara ta tattaunawa da Amurkawa suke gabatarwa, wata dabara ce ta yaudara da kuma wasa da hankulan mutane; mutanen duniya da kuma mutanen kasar mu.
mt0: <pad> Our understanding of the American offer of dialogue is a trick to deceive and manipulate the people; the people of the world and our people.</s>

en: You should prove that this is not the case.
hau: Wajibi ne ku tabbatar da cewa ba haka ba ne.
mt0: <pad> You have to make sure that it isn't true.</s>

en: Can you prove this?
hau: Shin za ku iya tabbatarwa?
mt0: <pad> Can you confirm?</s>

en: I would like to take this opportunity to say that one of their propaganda techniques is that they sometimes start rumors that certain people have negotiated with the Americans on behalf of the Leader.
hau: A wannan wajen ina son in sanar da cewa daya daga cikin dabarunsu shi ne cewa a wani lokaci su kan yada jita-jitan cewa wasu mutane daga wajen Jagora, sun tafi sun tattauna da Amurkawa.
mt0: <pad> At this point I want to tell you that one of their tricks was that they sometimes spread rumors that some people from the President's office had gone and talked with the Americans.</s>

en: This is another propaganda tactic and a downright lie.
hau: Wannan wata dabara ce ta farfaganda, sannan kuma karya ce tsagoronta.
mt0: <pad> This is a propaganda trick, and a very big lie.</s>

en: So far nobody has negotiated with them on behalf of the Leader.
hau: Ya zuwa yanzu babu wani daga bangaren Jagora da ya tattauna da su.
mt0: <pad> No one from the leadership has yet talked to him.</s>

en: The third point is that on the basis of our experiences and careful analysis of the existing conditions, our interpretation is that the Americans do not want the nuclear negotiations to end.
hau: Batu na uku: shi ne cewa abin da muka fahimta, sakamakon kwarewa da kuma sanya ido kan fage da muke yi, shi ne cewa Amurka dai ba ta son a kawo karshen wannan tattaunawa ta nukiliya.
mt0: <pad> The third point: what we understand, from our experience and our monitoring of the field, is that the United States does not want to end this nuke negotiation.</s>

en: The Americans do not want the nuclear conflict to be resolved, otherwise if they wanted these negotiations to reach a solution, the solution would be very close by and easy to reach.
hau: Amurkawa ba sa son a gama wannan tattaunawa ta nukiliya da kuma magance wannan matsalar. Idan kuwa ba haka ba, idan da suna son a kawo karshenta da kuma magance matsalar, to hanyar magancewar, hanya ce da take a fili kuma mai sauki.
mt0: <pad> The Americans don't want to end this nuclear talks and solve the problem. If not, if they want to end it and solve the problem, then the solution is clear and simple.</s>

en: In the nuclear issue, Iran only wants the world to recognize its right to enrichment, which is Iran's natural right.
hau: Abin da Iran take so dangane da batun nukiliyan, shi ne kawai duniya ta amince da hakkin da take da shi na tace sinadarin uranium, wanda hakan wani hakkin ta ne.
mt0: <pad> What Iran is doing with its nuclear program is only trying to get the world to accept its right to produce uranium, which is also a right of Iran.</s>

en: Government officials of the countries that are claiming to be after a solution should admit that the Iranian nation has a right to domestic nuclear enrichment for peaceful purposes.
hau: Kasashen da suke takama da karfi na duniya su amince da cewa al'ummar Iran tana da hakkin tace sinadarin uranium don manufa ta zaman lafiya a cikin kasarta sannan kuma da kanta.
mt0: <pad> The world's powers agree that the people of Iran have the right to enrich uranium for peace purposes in their country and for their own use.</s>

en: Is this too much to expect? This is what we have always demanded, and it is exactly what they do not want [us to have].
hau: Shin wannan wani fata ne mai girma? Wannan shi ne abin da a koda yaushe muke fadi. To hakan ne ba sa so.
mt0: <pad> Is this a great hope? That's what we always say. But that's not true.</s>

en: They say they are concerned that we might go after producing nuclear weapons.
hau: Suna fadin cewa mu dai muna cikin damuwar cewa ku din nan za ku kama hanyar kera makaman nukiliya.
mt0: <pad> They said that we are worried that they will start building nuclear weapons.</s>

en: The ones who are saying this are no more than a few countries whose names I mentioned earlier, and they call themselves "the global community".
hau: Su din nan kuwa 'yan wasu kasashe ne wadanda na ambaci sunayensu a baya. Suna kiran kansu da sunan 'kasashen duniya'.
mt0: <pad> They are the people of other countries that I mentioned above. They call themselves the "world nations."</s>

en: They say that the global community is concerned.
hau: Suna fadin cewa 'kasashen duniya' suna cikin damuwa.
mt0: <pad> They say that the "world" is in a state of concern.</s>

en: No, the global community is not at all concerned.
hau: A'a, kasashen duniya dai ba sa cikin wata damuwa.
mt0: <pad> No, the world is not in a rush.</s>

en: The majority of the countries in the world are on the Islamic Republic's side and they support our demand because it is a legitimate demand.
hau: Mafi yawa daga cikin kasashen duniya suna goyon bayan Jamhuriyar Musulunci da kuma bukatarmu, sun yi hakan ne saboda wannan bukata ta al'ummar Iran wata bukace ta gaskiya.
mt0: <pad> Most of the world's countries support the Islamic Republic and our demand, they do so because this demand of the Iranian people is a legitimate demand.</s>

en: We were never opposed to the supervision and regulations of the International Atomic Energy Agency.
hau: Su amince da hakkin da Iran take da shi na tace sinadarin urnium, sannan kuma don kawar da wannan damuwar, suna iya aiwatar da dokokin hukumar kula da makamashin nukiliya ta duniya.
mt0: <pad> They agree with the right of Iran to enrich uranium, and to ease this concern, they can implement the rules of the International Atomic Energy Agency.</s>

en: Whenever we are close to a solution, the Americans cause a problem in order to prevent reaching a solution.
hau: A duk lokacin da muka kusan kai wa ga hanyar magance matsalar, nan take Amurkawa za su sanya wata katanka da hana kai wa ga wannan hanya ta magance matsalar.
mt0: <pad> Every time we approached a solution, the Americans would put a hurdle and prevent us from reaching that solution.</s>

en: My assumption and interpretation is that their goal is to keep the issue unresolved so that they can have a pretext for exerting pressure on us.
hau: Manufarsu kamar yadda muke iya fahimta ita ce suna son wannan lamarin ya ci gaba ne don su sami abin da za su dinga yin matsin lamba.
mt0: <pad> Their purpose, as we can understand, is to keep this situation going so that they can continue to pressure on it.</s>

en: And as they themselves said, the purpose of the pressure is to cripple the Iranian nation. Of course, much to the dismay of the enemy, the Iranian nation will not be crippled.
hau: Wadannan matsin lamba kuwa, kamar yadda su da kansu suke fadi mai gurguntarwa ga al'ummar Iran. Koda yaushe tabbas ba za su iya gurguntar da al'ummar Iran ba.
mt0: <pad> These pressures, as they say, are debilitating to the people of Iran. However, they will never be able to debilitate the people of Iran.</s>

en: The fourth point regarding this issue is that if the Americans sincerely want to reach a solution, I will give them the solution.
hau: Batu na hudu kuma na karshe dangane da wannan lamarin shi ne cewa idan har Amurkawa da gaske suna son a kawo karshen wannan lamarin, to zan gabatar musu da wata mafita.
mt0: <pad> The fourth and final point about this matter is that if the Americans really want to end this situation, they should offer a solution.</s>

en: The solution is that the Americans should stop being hostile towards the Islamic Republic and the Iranian nation.
hau: Wannan hanya kuwa ita ce: Amurkawa su kawo karshen kiyayyar da suke nunawa Jamhuriyar Musulunci da kuma al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> The only way is: the Americans end their hostility towards the Islamic Republic and the people of Iran.</s>

en: This is the right solution: they should stop being hostile if they want to put an end to the problems that exist between us - and they announce that they really want to resolve the problems that exist between Iran and America.
hau: Idan har suna son a kawo karshen matsalolin da suke a tsakaninmu - kamar yadda suke fadin cewa muna son ya zamanto babu wata matsala tsakanin Iran da Amurka - to su kawo karshen wannan kiyayyar da suke nuna mana.
mt0: <pad> If they really want to end the problems between us - as they say that they want no problem between Iran and the US - then they should end this hatred they show us.</s>

en: It is thirty-four years that different American administrations have designed various kinds of hostilities towards us based on a wrong understanding of Iran and the Iranians.
hau: Shekaru talatin da hudu kenan gwamnatocin daban-daban na Amurka, sakamakon mummunar fahimtar Iran da al'ummar kasar da suka yi, suke ta tsara makirce-makircen cutar da al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> For 34 years, the US governments have been planning tactics to harm the people of Iran.</s>

en: Since the first year after the victory of the Islamic Revolution and the establishment of the Islamic Republic, they have been hostile towards us.
hau: Tun daga shekarar farko ta nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci da kuma kafa gwamnatin Musulunci, suke nuna mana kiyayya.
mt0: <pad> From the first year of the Islamic Revolution and the formation of the Islamic government, they have shown us their hatred.</s>

en: They have worked against our economy.
hau: A fagen tsaro, sun tsara shirye-shiryen cutar da tsaronmu; sun gudanar da ayyuka na kiyayya, sun keta mana hurumin kasar mu; sun goyi bayan manya da kananan makiyanmu shekaru aru-aru; sun gudanar da tsare-tsare na cutar da tattalin arzikinmu; sun yi amfani da dukkanin karfin da suke da shi wajen cutar da al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> In the field of security, they have designed plans to undermine our security; they have conducted activities of hatred, violated our sovereignty; they have supported our great and small enemies for centuries; they have developed plans to undermine our economic economy; they have used all their power to harm the people of Iran.</s>

en: Therefore, I would like to give a piece of advice to American officials: if they are after a rational solution, the rational solution is that they should rectify their policies. They should rectify the way they act and they should stop being hostile towards the Iranian nation.
hau: A saboda haka ina kiran jami'an Amurka; idan har suna neman hanyar da ta dace da hankali ne, to kuwa hanyar da ta dace da hankalin ita ce su gyara siyasarsu, su gyara ayyukansu sannan kuma su kawo karshen kiyayyar da suke yi da al'ummar Iran. To wannan shi ne karshen wannan bahasin.
mt0: <pad> So I call on the American officials; if they are looking for a reasonable way, then the reasonable way is to correct their policy, correct their behavior and end their hostility towards the people of Iran. That's the end of this discussion.</s>

en: I would like to briefly discuss another issue: the crucial issue of elections.
hau: Akwai wani bahasin na daban wanda ko da a takaice ne wajibi ne in yi ishara da shi, shi ne kuwa batun zabe mai matukar muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> There is another topic that I must mention, even in a brief way, and it is the matter of very important elections.</s>

en: In our country, elections are the manifestation of "political valor".
hau: Zabe a kasarmu wata alama ce ta kumaji na siyasa.
mt0: <pad> Elections are a symbol of political and social change.</s>

en: Elections are the manifestation of political valor, the manifestation of the power of the Islamic Republic, the manifestation of the pride and credibility of the Islamic system. The credibility of the Islamic Republic depends on elections, the presence of the people at polling stations and their votes that elect managers of the country.
hau: Zabe kuwa, alama ce ta kumaji na siyasa; wata alama ce dake tabbatar da tsayin dakan tsarin Musulunci; alama ce ta mutumcin tsarin. Mutumcin Jamhuriyar Musulunci yana cikin zabe da fitowar mutane a lokacin zabe da kuma tasirin daidaikun mutane cikin zaben jami'an kasa.
mt0: <pad> The election is also a symbol of political culture; a symbol that confirms the stability of the Islamic system; a symbol of the system's dignity. The dignity of the Islamic Republic is in the election and the turnout at the time of the election and the influence of individuals in the national assembly election.</s>

en: Elections are the manifestation of our national willpower, the manifestation of Islamic democracy.
hau: Zabe alama ce ta irada ta kasa, alama ce ta tsarin demokradiyya ta Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> Voting is a symbol of the will of the nation, a symbol of the system of Islamic democracy.</s>

en: Therefore, because of the importance that our elections enjoy, the enemies of the Iranian nation have always tried to take enthusiasm and excitement out of the elections.
hau: A saboda haka bisa la'akari da muhimmancin da zabe yake da shi ne ya sanya makiyan al'ummar Iran a koda yaushe suke kokarin haifar da fitina cikin zaben Iran.
mt0: <pad> So because of the importance of the election, the enemies of the people of Iran have always tried to create a crisis in the Iranian election.</s>

en: They have designed plots to prevent the people from going to the ballot boxes.
hau: Sun tsara tsare-tsaren da za su hana mutane fitowa zaben, su kashe musu gwuiwa da kuma sanya su yanke kauna.
mt0: <pad> They have designed strategies to prevent people from voting, demoralize them and make them feel abandoned.</s>

en: Over the years that we have held many elections - including parliamentary and presidential elections - our enemies have always tried to decrease voter turnout and make our elections less enthusiastic, and this is because of the significant role that elections play in the affairs of our country.
hau: Tsawon shekarun da muka yi muna gudanar da zabe - shin zaben majalisa ne ko kuma zaben shugaban kasa - a koda yaushe makiyanmu sun yi kokari wajen ganin zaben bai yi armashi ba. Hakan kuwa saboda irin muhimmancin da zabe yake da shi ne a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Over the years we have been holding elections - whether it be parliamentary or presidential - our enemies have always tried to see that the election does not go well. This is because of the importance of the election in this country.</s>

en: Now I would like to discuss a few points regarding the elections. Of course, the elections are more than two months away.
hau: Bari in fadi wasu abubuwa a babin zaben. Koda yake akwai watanni biyu da wani abu da suka saura.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to say some things about the election. Although there are two and a half months left.</s>

en: For the time being, there are a few points that I would like to discuss.
hau: Amma a halin yanzu dai zan yi ishara da wasu abubuwa.
mt0: <pad> But for now I'll just be making a reference to some things.</s>

en: The first point is that what is most important is massive presence of the people in the elections.
hau: A matakin farko, batu na farko a babin zabe shi ne cewa fitowar jama'a kwansu da kwarkwatansu a lokacin zaben lamari ne mai muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> First of all, the first point in the election chapter is that the participation of the people in the election is very important.</s>

en: Enthusiastic elections in the country and the presence of the people at the polling stations can neutralize the threats by the enemies. It can disappoint the enemy. It can ensure the security of the country.
hau: Fitowar jama'a a lokacin zabe yana iya rage tasirin barazanar makiya; tana iya sanya makiya yanke kauna da kuma lamunce tsaron kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> The participation of the people in the election can reduce the effect of enemy threats; it can make the enemy lose hope and compromise the security of the country.</s>

en: Our dear people in all parts of the country should know this. Their massive presence at the polling stations plays a role in the future of the country, in our national security, in our independence, in our national wealth, in our economy and in all other important issues of the country.
hau: Ya kamata al'ummarmu a duk inda suke a fadin kasar nan su san cewa, gagarumar fitowarsu a lokacin zabe, za ta yi tasiri cikin makomar kasar nan; haka nan cikin tsaro, ‘yanci, kiyaye arzikin kasa, tattalin arziki, haka nan cikin dukkanin batutuwa masu muhimmanci na kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Our people should know that their large turnout in the election will affect the future of our country; as well as security, freedom, protection of national resources, economic growth, and all important issues of our country.</s>

en: Therefore, the first point is that with Allah's assistance and with the determined efforts of the Iranian nation, there should be a massive voter turnout in the elections.
hau: Wannan shi ne batu na farko; wato cikin yardar Allah da taimakon Ubangiji da kuma himmar al'ummar Iran, zaben ya zamanto gagarumin zabe da mutane za su fito.
mt0: <pad> This is the first point; that with God's grace and the help of God and the will of the people of Iran, the election became a largely popular election.</s>

en: The second point is that all political orientations and currents that have faith in the Islamic Republic should take part in the elections.
hau: Batu na biyu: shi ne cewa wajibi ne dukkanin jam'iyyu da kungiyoyi da suka yi imani da Jamhuriyar Musulunci su shigo cikin wannan zaben.
mt0: <pad> Second: It is necessary for all the parties and organizations that believe in the Islamic Republic of Iran to participate in this election.</s>

en: This is both a right and a responsibility that lies on the shoulders of everybody.
hau: Hakan wani hakki ne na kowa da kowa, haka nan kuma wani nauyi ne da ke wuyan kowa.
mt0: <pad> That is a right of everyone, and a responsibility that everyone has.</s>

en: Elections do not belong to a particular political orientation or a particular intellectual and political current.
hau: Zabe ba na wata kungiya guda ko kuma wata jam'iyya mai ra'ayi guda na siyasa ba ne.
mt0: <pad> The election is not a matter of one organization or one political party.</s>

en: All those who believe in the Islamic Republic and in the independence of the country, all those who care about the future of the country, all those who care about our national interests should take part in the elections.
hau: Wajibi ne dukkanin wadanda suka yi imani da tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci da kuma ‘yancin wannan kasar, sannan kuma suke ba da muhimmanci ga makomar wannan kasar da kuma kishin ci gaban al'umma, su shigo cikin wannan zaben.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary for all those who believe in the system of the Islamic Republic and its freedom, and who care about the future of this country and the progress of the people, to participate in this election.</s>

en: Turning away from the elections is appropriate for those who are opposed to the Islamic Republic.
hau: Juya baya ga zaben, lamari ne da ya dace da wadanda suke adawa da wannan tsarin.
mt0: <pad> The withdrawal of the vote is a good option for those who oppose this system.</s>

en: The third point is that it is the votes of the people that determine everything.
hau: Batu na uku: shi ne cewa ra'ayi da kuri'ar mutane ita ce mai ayyana sakamakon zaben.
mt0: <pad> The third point: is that the people's opinion and vote is the only one that determines the result of the election.</s>

en: You should research, observe carefully and consult those you trust so that you can identify and vote for the most qualified candidate.
hau: Ku da kanku ne zaku gudanar da bincike kan ‘yan takaran da suka tsaya zaben, ku yi shawara da mutanen da kuka yarda da su don ku sami damar gano mutumin da ya fi dacewa don ku zabe shi.
mt0: <pad> You will do your own research on the applicants, talk to trusted people to find the best person to vote for.</s>

en: The Leader has only one vote.
hau: Ni dai ba ni da kuri'ar da ta wuce guda daya.
mt0: <pad> I don't have more than one vote.</s>

en: Just like the rest of our people, I have only one vote and until the time I cast my vote into the ballot box, nobody will know what my vote is.
hau: Ni din nan, kamar sauran mutane, kuri'a guda nake da ita, sannan kuma wannan kuri'ar kafin in jefa ta a akwatin zabe babu wani mutum da ya san ga waye zan kada ta.
mt0: <pad> I, like all others, have only one vote, and before I put it in the ballot box no one knows who I'm going to vote for.</s>

en: The people at the polling station might decide to open the ballot box, identify my handwriting and find out who I have voted for.
hau: Na'am mai yiyuwa ne mutanen da suke kula da akwatin zaben, a lokacin da suka bude, su gane rubutuna don haka su fahimci wanda na kada wa kuri'a.
mt0: <pad> No, it is probably possible that the people who are watching over the ballot box, when they open it, will read the writing so that they can understand who I've voted for.</s>

en: If such a claim is made, it is false.
hau: Idan har wani ya fadi haka, to lalle ba gaskiya ba ne.
mt0: <pad> If anyone says that, it's not true.</s>

en: Of course, unfortunately these days different statements are commonly attributed to different people through the use of the new means of communication - short message services and other such things.
hau: Tabbas a wadannan ranaku da kuma irin wadannan kafafen watsa labarai masu ban mamaki da ake da su - irin wadannan sakonnin na wayar salula da ake aikawa da sauransu - a ta yadawa da kuma jingina maganganu ga wasu mutane na daban.
mt0: <pad> These days and with all the amazing media - these text messages and so on - people are spreading and attributing things to others.</s>

en: A person might send thousands of text messages.
hau: Mai yiyuwa ne mutum guda ya aika da dubban sakonni.
mt0: <pad> It is possible that one person sent thousands of messages.</s>

en: I have reports that during the elections, several hundreds of millions of text messages might be sent and received every day.
hau: An kawo min rahoton cewa mai yiyuwa ne a ranakun zabe, a aika daruruwan miliyoyin irin wadannan sakonni.
mt0: <pad> I was told that it is likely that on the day of the election, hundreds of millions of these messages will be sent.</s>

en: Take care not be influenced by such things.
hau: To ku lura sosai, kada ku tasirantu da irin wadannan abubuwa da ake aikowa.
mt0: <pad> Be careful, don't be fooled by such things.</s>

en: Of course, every citizen or political activist may try to encourage others to vote for a particular candidate. Nothing is wrong with this. However, in this regard nobody will hear anything from me.
hau: Na'am ko wane mutum ko kuma wata jam'iyya ta siyasa tana iya janyo hankulan sauran mutane zuwa gare ta - babu matsala cikin hakan - to amma dangane da hakan, babu wani da zai ji wani abu daga gare ni.
mt0: <pad> No, any individual or political party can attract others to it - no problem with that - but regarding that, no one will hear anything from me.</s>

en: In the meantime, the people can speak to one another, give advice, try to change each other's opinion and help one another to identify the most qualified candidate.
hau: Ala kulli hal mutane suna iya shawara da kuma taimakawa juna wajen gano mutumin da ya fi dacewa.
mt0: <pad> However, people can advise and help each other to find the best person.</s>

en: In any case, the criterion is the votes of the people.
hau: Tabbas mizanin dai shi ne ra'ayi da kuma kuri'ar mutane.
mt0: <pad> The Tabbas metric is the opinion and vote of people.</s>

en: The fourth point is that everybody should accept the rule of law, be it elections or anything else.
hau: Batu na hudu shi ne cewa cikin lamurran da suka shafi zabe da wadanda ba na zabe ba, wajibi ne kowa ya mika kai ga doka; a girmama doka.
mt0: <pad> The fourth point is that in all matters of election and non-election, it is necessary for everyone to submit to the law; to respect the law.</s>

en: The events of the year 1388 - which inflicted losses on the country - took place because certain people decided not to accept the law. They decided not to accept the votes of the people.
hau: Abin da ya faru a shekarar 1388 (2009 bayan zaben shugaban kasa) - wanda ya cutar da kuma haifar da hasarori ga kasar nan - ya samo asali ne daga rashin girmama dokar da wasu suka yi. Ba sa so su girmama ra'ayin mutane.
mt0: <pad> The crisis of 1388 (2009 after the presidential election) - which was painful and costly to the country - began with some people not respecting the law. They didn't want to respect the opinion of others.</s>

en: For example, the people might vote against what I want, but I must accept their vote.
hau: Mai yiyuwa ne ra'ayin mutane ya saba wa abin da nake so; to amma wajibi ne in girmama hakan.
mt0: <pad> People's opinion may not agree with mine, but I have to respect it.</s>

en: Everybody must accept what the majority of the people vote for.
hau: Wajibi ne a girmama abin da mafi yawan al'umma suka zaba.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to respect what the majority of the people have chosen.</s>

en: It is necessary to use these legal channels.
hau: Wajibi ne a yi amfani da wadannan hanyoyi na doka.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to use these legal means.</s>

en: When what has happened goes against what we want, it is an irreversible mistake to call on the people to protest in the streets, and this was what happened in the year 1388.
hau: Mu kira mutane zuwa ga bore na kan titi saboda kawai abin da ya faru ya saba wa abin da muke so - kamar yadda ya faru a shekarar 1388 din - lalle hakan daya ne daga cikin kura-kuran da ba za a iya cike gurbin hasarar da suka haifar ba.
mt0: <pad> We call people to street protests because just what happens is not what we want - as it happened in 1388 - that's one of the conflicts that can't be overcome for the losses they caused.</s>

en: This was an experience for our nation, and our nation will always stand up against such events.
hau: Lalle hakan ya zamanto darasi ga al'ummar Iran, kuma al'ummar Iran za su tsaya kyam wajen tinkarar sake faruwar hakan.
mt0: <pad> That has certainly been a lesson to the people of Iran, and the people of Iran will stand firm to fight against the repetition of that.</s>

en: The last point is that everybody should know that the characteristics that are needed in the next president include the existing advantages [of previous presidents] minus the weaknesses.
hau: Batu na karshe shi ne cewa ya kamata kowa ya san cewa abin da muke bukata daga wajen shugaban kasa mai zuwa shi ne abubuwa masu kyau da (shugabannin da suka gabata) suke da su ba tare da irin raunin da ake da shi ba.
mt0: <pad> The last thing is that everyone should know that what we want from the next president is the good things that (previous) leaders have without the negatives.</s>

en: Every incoming president should enjoy the advantages that his predecessors had and should not suffer from the weaknesses that the previous presidents had.
hau: Ya kamata kowa ya san cewa wajibi ne shugaban kasa na kowane zamani ya zamanto yana da kyawawan abubuwan da shugaban kasar da ya tafi yake da su, amma ba tare da raunin da ya ke da su ba.
mt0: <pad> Everyone should know that the president of every time must have the good qualities of the president who was before him, but not the negatives.</s>

en: After all, every person has his own strengths and weaknesses.
hau: Kowa dai yana da bangaren karfinsa da kuma bangaren da ya ke da rauni.
mt0: <pad> Everyone has their strengths and weaknesses.</s>

en: Presidents too have their own strengths and weakness.
hau: Shugabannin kasa - shin na yanzu ne ko kuma wanda zai zo nan gaba - suna da bangarori na karfi da kuma rauni.
mt0: <pad> Leaders - whether they are current or future - have strengths and weaknesses.</s>

en: The strengths that the incumbent government and President enjoy should exist in the next president as well.
hau: Wajibi ne shugaba mai zuwa ya zamanto yana da abubuwan da ake kirga su a yau a matsayin bangaren karfi na gwamnati da kuma shugaban kasa na yanzu.
mt0: <pad> The next president must have the same strengths that are now considered to be the strong points of the government and the current president.</s>

en: That is to say, the governments that come to power one after the other should help us move towards improvement and perfection and gradually we should move towards choosing the best among us.
hau: Wato wajibi ne a cikin gwamnatocin da muke da su, wadanda suke zuwa su tafi, wajibi ne su zamanto sun kama hanyar ci gaba da kuma kammala junansu.
mt0: <pad> The ones that are going to go, the ones that are coming, they have to be on the path of progress and finishing each other.</s>

en: Those who prepare themselves to enter this arena should move forward with full power and confidence while relying on God.
hau: Mutanen da suke a shirye su shigo wannan fagen, wajibi ne su shigo da dukkan karfi da dogaro da Allah da kuma dogaro da irin karfin da wannan al'ummar ta ke da shi.
mt0: <pad> People who are ready to enter this field, must enter with all their strength and depend on God and on the power of this community.</s>

en: Dear God, ordain what is in the interest of this country and this nation.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka ba wa wannan al'ummar abin da zai zamanto mai amfani da kuma alheri a gare ta.
mt0: <pad> Allah! Give this people what is useful and good for them.</s>

en: Dear God, make the holy heart of the Imam of the Age (may our souls be sacrificed for his sake) satisfied with all of us.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka sanya ran mai girma Waliyul Asr ta yi farin ciki da da dukkaninmu.
mt0: <pad> Allah! May the soul of the great Waliy al-Asr be happy with us all.</s>

en: Dear God, make the immaculate soul of our magnanimous Imam (r.a.) and the pure souls of our martyrs satisfied and happy with us.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka faranta ran mai girma Imam Khumaini da ruhin shahidanmu da mu.
mt0: <pad> Allah! May the soul of the great Imam Khomeini and the souls of our martyrs be blessed.</s>

en: Make what we said serve Your cause and accept it from us out of Your generosity.
hau: Ka sanya abubuwan da muka fadi su zamanto saboda da kai da kuma tafarkinka, sannan kuma ka amince da hakan albakarcin karimcinka.
mt0: <pad> You have made what we said true for you and your way, and you have accepted it as a sign of your mercy.</s>

en: Leader’s Address to People Active in Economic Sector - Khamenei.ir  The following is the full text of the speech delivered on August 18, 2011 by Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of the Islamic Revolution in a meeting with a number of people from economic sectors of the country.
hau: Jawabin Jagora Yayin Ganawa Da Masu Gudanar Da Ayyuka A Bangaren Tattalin Arziki Shimfida: A ranar laraba 17, Augustan 2011 wacce ta yi daidai da ranar 16 ga watan Ramalana mai alfarma ne, Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei ya gana da wasu daga cikin masu gudanar da ayyukansu a bangaren tattalin arziki, jami'an gwamnati da sauran ‘yan kasuwa inda suka tattauna kan yanayin tattalin arzikin kasar Iran.
mt0: <pad> The Leader's Speech at the Meeting with Economic Leaders</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: First of all, I would like to welcome you dear friends who are active in different economic sectors of the country.
hau: Da farko dai ina yi wa ‘yan'uwa masu girma, masu gudanar da ayyukansu a bangarori daban-daban na tattalin arzikin kasar nan, barka da zuwa.
mt0: <pad> First of all, I wish my elderly friends who are working in different sectors of the economy of the country a warm welcome.</s>

en: The meeting is the symbol of the government's serious attention to the issue of economy in the current sensitive conditions of the world, the region and the country.
hau: A wani bangare taron mu na yau taro ne da ke nuni da wani lamari, wato alamar irin muhimmancin da wannan tsarin ya ke ba wa lamarin tattalin arziki a irin wannan yanayi mai tsananin muhimmanci na duniya, wannan yanki da kuma kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> In another part of our meeting, we are showing a sign, that this system is giving priority to the economic issue in such a crucial situation for the world, this region and our country.</s>

en: This was my primary purpose for holding this meeting. I wanted to arrange a meeting in the month of Ramadan with those who are active in public and private economic sectors. I wanted to spend a few hours listening to them and I wanted the meeting to be reflected by our domestic media as a sign that the Islamic Republic should pay serious attention to the issue of economy, economic activities and economic progress and that the government and the people should cooperate and make efforts in this regard for reasons which I will speak about later on.
hau: Mu muna son ne a sami wata rana daga cikin ranakun watan Ramalana ya zamana gungun masu gudanar da ayyukansu a bangaren tattalin arziki na gwamnati, na ‘yan kasuwa da sauran bangarori daban-daban su zo wannan waje, mu zauna, mu saurari abubuwan da suke da shi na wasu sa'oi sannan kuma a watsa shi a cikin kasar nan, don tabbatar da cewa wajibi ne wannan tsari ya ba wa lamarin tattalin arziki da ci gaban tattalin arziki irin wannan muhimmanci, sannan ita kuma gwamnati - a yanayi na gaba daya wato hukuma - da sauran mutane su yi aiki tare da kuma kokari a wannan fagen saboda dalilan da zan yi ishara da su nan gaba.
mt0: <pad> We want to find a day in Ramadan when the economic leaders of government, business and other sectors come here, sit down, listen to others' ideas and disseminate them throughout the country, to ensure that this system must give the matter of economic development and economic progress the same importance, and that the government - in a general sense - and others should work together and strive in this field for the reasons I will mention later.</s>

en: This was the first purpose and it has already been fulfilled because the meeting will be reflected in the media.
hau: To wannan shi ne lamari na farko; an kuma tabbatar da shi sannan kuma za a gabatar da abin da ya gudana a wannan taron.
mt0: <pad> That's the first thing; it's been confirmed and will be presented what happened at this meeting.</s>

en: This is a message to everybody - including government officials in economic sectors, those who are active in economic sectors throughout the country and all our people. The message is that today we should pay serious attention to the issue of economy.
hau: Wannan wani sako ne ga kowa; shin jami'an gwamnati ne a bangaren tattalin arziki, haka nan kuma masu gudanar da ayyukan tattalin arziki a dukkanin bangarorin kasar nan, haka nan ga sauran mutane wadanda wajibi ne a yau su ba wa lamarin tattalin arziki irin wannan muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> This is a message to everyone; whether it be government officials in the economic department, or those who run economic activities in all sectors of the country, and to others who must today give the economic matter such a high priority.</s>

en: The second purpose of this meeting - which has thankfully been fulfilled - was to get those who do not work for the government to present the people with a report about the realities in the country, the advances that have been made and the activities that are being carried out.
hau: Lamari na biyu wanda shirya wannan taron ya sami damar samar da shi sannan kuma alhamdu lillahi haka lamarin ya ke, shi ne ba da dama ga wadanda ba jami'an gwamnati su gabatar da wani rahoto dangane da hakikanin yanayin kasar nan, ci gaban kasar nan, irin yunkurin da ake yi sannan kuma su isa zuwa ga kunnuwan mutane.
mt0: <pad> The second thing that the organizer of this conference has been able to provide and alhamdulilah it is, is to allow non-governmental organizations to present a report on the state of the country, the progress of the country, the efforts made and to get the people's attention.</s>

en: No, everybody knows my opinion in this regard. I believe that we should see both the positive and the negative points. But I believe today the important point is that our people should know what outcomes their efforts, the efforts of our government officials and the enormous human capacities in the country have produced.
hau: Ba wai ina cewa a ko da yaushe a kuma kullum a dinga fadin irin ci gaban da aka samu ba ne kawai; kowa dai ya san ra'ayi na; ni na yi imani da cewa wajibi ne a dinga fadin nasarorin da aka samu tare kuma da gazawar da ake da ita don a dinga kallonsu tare; to amma abin da a yau na ke ganin yake da muhimmanci, shi ne cewa mutanen wannan kasar su fahimci irin sakamakon da aka samu albarkacin himmarsu, himmar jami'an gwamnati da kuma albarkatu daban-daban da ake da su a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> No, I am not against the always and everywhere telling of progress; everyone knows my opinion; I have always believed that it is necessary to tell of the successes and failures to see them together; but what I think is important today is that the people of this country understand the results achieved through their own efforts, the efforts of the government and the resources available in this country.</s>

en: You should know that I am in contact with the people: they do not know about these advances.
hau: Ina son in sanar da ku cewa; ni dai ina da alaka da mutane; mutane ba su da labara kan irin wadannan ci gaban da aka samu.
mt0: <pad> I want to tell you that; I have a relationship with people; people don't know about the progress that has been made.</s>

en: The majority of the people do not know about what you said today about different areas. I took notes and by Allah's favor, a detailed report will be prepared.
hau: Wadannan abubuwan da a halin yanzu kuka fadi da suka shafi bangarori daban-daban - wanda na rubuta su a takaice sannan kuma za a shirya rahoto kansu insha Allahu - lalle a mafi yawan lokuta mutane ba su da labarin hakan.
mt0: <pad> These things you have just said about different sectors - which I've summarized and will be prepared for a report - in most cases people don't know about them.</s>

en: We see that great achievements are being made in the country and the honor belongs to the Iranian nation.
hau: Ana ci gaba da gudanar da ayyuka masu girma a kasar nan, wannan wani abin alfahari ne ga al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> The great works are continuing to be done in the country, which is a pride for the people of Iran.</s>

en: It is the people who are doing these things.
hau: Ci gaba ne na al'ummar Iran.
mt0: <pad> It's the progress of Iran's people.</s>

en: We have made good advances in sectors related to production, services, agriculture, industry, knowledge-based industries and different other areas which were discussed in this meeting.
hau: Mun sami ci gaba da kyau a bangaren samar da kayayyakin da ake bukata, a bangaren hidima, a bangaren aikin gona, a bangaren masana'antu da sauran bangarori na ilimi da sauransu da aka ambace su a nan.
mt0: <pad> We have made great progress in the supply of food, health, agriculture, industry and other sectors of education and others mentioned here.</s>

en: It is good if people hear these things from individuals in charge of different sectors who are independent of the government. These things would make the people hopeful and happy.
hau: Lalle lamari ne mai kyau mutane su ji hakan daga bakin jami'an bangarori daban-daban wadanda ba na gwamnati ba; hakan lamari ne da zai kara wa mutane karfin gwuiwa da kuma sanya su farin ciki.
mt0: <pad> It is very good for people to hear that from non-governmental officials; it will give people strength and make them happy.</s>

en: All of us should pay attention to the point that one of the techniques that the enemies of the Iranian nation use in their psychological warfare is to spread despair among the people. I stress this point.
hau: Yana da kyau dukkaninmu mu fahimci wannan lamarin na cewa a yau daya daga cikin hanyoyin yakin kwakwalwa na makiyan al'ummar Iran shi ne kashe wa mutane gwuiwa. Lalle ina kira da a lura da wannan lamarin sosai.
mt0: <pad> It is good for us all to understand that today one of the means of brain warfare used by the enemies of the people of Iran is killing the people. I urge us all to pay close attention to this matter.</s>

en: The tone should not undermine the existing hope and determination.
hau: Bai kamata abin da za a fadin ya zamanto mai kashe gwuiwa da kawar da fata da kuma himmar da ake da ita ba.
mt0: <pad> The words should not be demotivating and destroying hope and courage.</s>

en: The tone should convey the feeling that, for example, forty percent of the job has been done and that the ground has been prepared for the other sixty percent to be done.
hau: Lalle wajibi ne a ji cewa muna da wani ci gaban da muka samu, a matsayin misali (an sami ci gaba na) kashi arba'in cikin dari, sauran kashi sittin din kuma akwai hanyoyi da damar da za a iya cike shi.
mt0: <pad> We must really feel that we have made some progress, for example (we have made) forty percent, the rest of the sixty percent is still there and there are ways and opportunities to fill it up.</s>

en: One point is that I named this year "The Year of Economic Jihad".
hau: Lamari na farko shi ne cewa mun sanya wa shekarar bana (shekarar 1390 hijira shamsiyya) sunan ‘Shekarar Kokarin Bunkasa Tattalin Arziki'.
mt0: <pad> The first thing is that we have named this year (1390 hijri shamsiyya) as the Year of Economic Development.</s>

en: The policy of the arrogant powers is to defeat the Iranian nation and the Islamic Republic by using the economy.
hau: Siyasar ma'abota girman kai dai ita ce cutar da al'ummar Iran da tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci a fagen tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> The imperialist policy is to harm the people of Iran and the Islamic Republic in economic terms.</s>

en: Although the sanctions have been imposed on us under the pretext of the nuclear issue, they are lying. The nuclear issue is not the reason behind the sanctions.
hau: Duk da cewa sun fake da batun makamashin nukiliya wajen sanya takunkumin tattalin arziki, to amma hakan karya ce; lamarin nukiliya ba shi ne dalilin sanya wadannan takunkumin ba.
mt0: <pad> Although they used the issue of nuclear energy to impose economic sanctions, it is false; the issue of nuclear energy was not the reason for these sanctions.</s>

en: You may remember that the major sanctions which were initially imposed on our country happened at a time when there was no mention of nuclear energy in the country.
hau: Mai yiyuwa ne kuna iya tunawa, a lokacin da suka sanya babban takunkumi (na farko) wanda kuma shi ne mafarin takunkumin da suka sanya wa kasar nan, a lokacin ma dai babu wata maganar nukiliya a kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Maybe you can remember, when they imposed the first major sanctions, which was the first sanctions imposed on the country, there wasn't even a talk of nuclear in the country at that time.</s>

en: For example, the sanctions known as the "D'Amato-Kennedy Bill" - which were of course not very important and were proposed and followed up in the US Congress by somebody called D'Amato - were passed when the issue of nuclear energy was not even being discussed.
hau: Duk da cewa ba wani takunkumi ne mai muhimmanci ba, to amma dai har yanzu sunansa na nan, wato takunkumi ne da aka fi saninsa da sunan takunkumin "D'Amato" - wanda takunkumi ne da wani mutum ne mai wannan sunan da ya gabatar da shi a majalisar Amurka - wannan takunkumin dai na wani lokaci ne wanda a lokacin babu ma wata maganar nukiliya ma.
mt0: <pad> Although it was not a very important sanction, it still has its name, the D'Amato sanctions - which is a sanctions proposed by a man of that name in the United States Congress - were imposed at a time when there was no nuclear talk.</s>

en: The goal of the sanctions that have been imposed on us is to cripple our economy.
hau: Manufar takunkumin ita ce gurguntar da tattalin arzikin (kasar Iran).
mt0: <pad> The purpose of the sanctions is to cripple the economic (Iran)</s>

en: Of course the Iranian nation has the honor of having tolerated these sanctions for 32 years.
hau: To amma abin alfahari shi ne cewa shekaru talatin da biyu kenan al'ummar Iran suka jure wa wannan takunkumin.
mt0: <pad> But the proud thing is that for thirty-two years the people of Iran have endured this ban.</s>

en: Of course the sanctions that have been imposed on us during the recent years have grown in number and variety. However, the growth is insignificant compared to the growth in the number and variety of constructive activities in the country. Thirty years ago when they started imposing sanctions on us, their sanctions were more likely to hurt us than the sanctions that they currently impose on us and they repeatedly promise that they will increase their sanctions.
hau: Ko da ya ke a shekarun baya-bayan nan an fadada takunkumin, to amma sakamakon irin ci gaban ayyukan gina kasa daban-daban a kasar nan wadannan takunkumnin sun zamanto ba a bakin komai ba. Shekaru talatin kenan da fara sanya wadannan takunkumin, mai yiyuwa ne takunkumin (wancan lokacin) su fi cutar da mu a kan irin takunkumin da a halin yanzu ake sanya mana da kuma gudanar da su kamar yadda kuma suke ci gaba da alkawarin cewa za a kara su.
mt0: <pad> Although the sanctions have been widened in recent years, they have become less relevant. Thirty years after the introduction of these sanctions, it is possible that the sanctions (of that time) have been more damaging to us than the sanctions (current) are being imposed and executed on us as they continue to promise that they will be increased.</s>

en: It is necessary to become familiar with the opposing camp. It is necessary to become familiar with the enemy's tools and weapons and to prepare weapons that would make his weapons ineffective.
hau: A saboda haka wajibi ne a shirya masa. Wajibi ne a fahimci masu adawa da mu, a fahimci irin makami da kyayyakin aikin da suke amfani da su sannan kuma a shirya makaman fada da su.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, we must prepare for it. We must understand our enemies, understand the kinds of weapons and tools they use and prepare for battle with them.</s>

en: This requires economic jihad.
hau: Ko shakka babu hakan yana bukatar jihadi (kokari) na tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> No doubt, it requires both jihad (hard work) and economic growth.</s>

en: Not all activities can be called jihad.
hau: Ba kowani yunkuri ne ake kiransa da sunan jihadi ba.
mt0: <pad> No jihad is a name for any action.</s>

en: Only certain kinds of activities with certain characteristics can be called jihad.
hau: Wani yunkuri mai wasu siffofi ne ake kiransa da jihadi.
mt0: <pad> This type of movement is called jihad.</s>

en: One of the main characteristics of jihad is being faced with an aggressive position.
hau: Yunkurin fuskantar irin wannan kokari mai cike da manufa ta kiyayya, daya ne daga cikin sharadi na asali na jihadi.
mt0: <pad> The effort to confront such a full of hatred attempt is one of the fundamental requirements of jihad.</s>

en: An activity with such characteristics can be called jihad.
hau: Irin wannan yunkuri sunansa jihadi.
mt0: <pad> Such a movement is called jihad.</s>

en: Therefore, economic jihad means the Iranian nation's persistent, comprehensive and purposeful movement with the intention of rendering the aggressive and spiteful efforts of the enemy ineffective.
hau: A saboda haka jihadi na tattalin arziki yana nufin yunkuri da ake ci gaba da yinsa wanda kuma ya kame ko ina na al'ummar Iran da manufar kashe wutar kiyayyar makiya.
mt0: <pad> So economic jihad means an ongoing movement that has spread throughout the society of Iran with the purpose of extinguishing the hatred of the enemy.</s>

en: The next point is that in the 20-Year Strategic Plan - which is an essential and high-level document for reference - our country is supposed to achieve the top position in the region in important and vital areas. We need to achieve this position.
hau: Wani lamarin kuma na daban shi ne cewa a shirin ci gaban kasa - wanda wani shiri ne mai muhimmancin gaske na ciyar da kasa gaba - mun shirya wani tsari na ciyar da kasar nan gaba a bangarori masu muhimmanci na rayuwa da kai ta matsayi na daya; wajibi ne mu kai ga wannan matsayi na kolin.
mt0: <pad> One more thing is that in the National Development Plan - which is a very important plan for moving the country forward - we have established a system to move the country forward in important areas of life and to rank it first; we must get to this top position.</s>

en: Naturally others will not stand by and watch us achieve the first position. They are working hard.
hau: Na'am sauran al'ummomi ma ba za su zauna su zuba mana ido mu zama na farko ba; su ma suna nan suna ci gaba da yunkurinsu, suna ta kokarinsu.
mt0: <pad> Yes, the other nations will not sit and watch us become the first; they will continue their efforts, their effort.</s>

en: We are witness to strenuous economic efforts by some of the regional countries in areas in which we want to become the top country. Of course we are not using some of the means that they are currently using and we will never do so.
hau: Ko da ya ke mu din nan ba ma amfani da wasu hanyoyin da suke amfani da su, kuma ba za mu taba amfani da su ba; mu dai muna bin mafi tsarkin tafarki da kyawunsa ne; to amma mun yi amanna da cewa za a iya isa ga wannan mataki na farkon, matukar dai muka tsara irin saurin aikin da muke yi.
mt0: <pad> Although we do not use the methods they use, and will never use them; we are following the most clean path and its simplicity; but we believe that this first stage can be achieved, if we plan our speed of work.</s>

en: Therefore, this requires jihad.
hau: A saboda haka wannan lamarin yana bukatar jihadi (kokari).
mt0: <pad> So this matter needs jihad.</s>

en: We need both speed and prudence so that we can achieve the first position.
hau: Wajibi ne wannan kokarin ya zamanto mai karfi sannan kuma ya zamanto akwai tunani a cikinsa don mu sami damar isa ga wannan matsayi na farko.
mt0: <pad> This effort must be strong and focused to allow us to achieve this first position.</s>

en: Becoming the top country in the region is not just a whim. No, we want to become the top country because the destiny of our nation depends on it.
hau: Wannan batu na isa ga matsayi na farko ba wai wani yayi ne ba na cewa mu din nan za mu kai ga matsayi na farko ba; a'a, saboda cewa makomar al'ummomi a yau ta dogara ne da wannan lamarin.
mt0: <pad> The matter of being first is not a promise that we will be first; no, but because the future of society today depends on this.</s>

en: If a country fails to fulfill its needs and make progress in the area of economy, knowledge and infrastructure that are necessary for progress, it will be oppressed in a merciless way.
hau: Idan har wata kasa a fagen tattalin arziki, a bangaren ilimi, a bangaren abubuwan ci gaban kasa ba ta iya tabbatar da abin da take bukata da kuma samun ci gaba ba, to kuwa cikin rashin tausayi za a ci gaba da zaluntarta.
mt0: <pad> If a country cannot meet its demands and progress in the field of economic, education, and development, then it will be unbearably exploited.</s>

en: We do not want to be oppressed.
hau: Mu dai ba ma son a zalunce mu.
mt0: <pad> I'm sorry for the abuse.</s>

en: Our country has been subjected to oppression and transgression for two hundred years.
hau: Shekaru dari biyu kenan kasar mu take fuskantar cutarwa da zalunci.
mt0: <pad> For two hundred years our country has been suffering from oppression and violence.</s>

en: This oppression was the result of the weakness of incompetent, corrupt and materialistic monarchies and the dynamism that their enemies enjoyed.
hau: Raunin hukumar sarakuna maras dacewa mai son duniya da kuma irin makircin da makiya suke aikatawa shi ne dalilin faruwar wannan zaluncin.
mt0: <pad> The weakness of the unjust government of the king and the conspiracy of the enemies is the reason for this injustice.</s>

en: The English first infiltrated and interfered in the political system of our country in the year 1800. They recruited supporters for themselves. And certain other European countries accompanied them and did the same things.
hau: Tun daga shekarar 1800 ne a karon farko turawa Ingila suka kutso cikin cibiyoyin siyasa na kasar nan da tsoma bakinsu, haka su din nan da na kurkusa da su na daga sauran kasashen turai suka ci gaba da hakan na tsawon wancan lokacin.
mt0: <pad> From the 1800s, Englishmen started to meddle in the country's politics and economy, and they and their allies from other European countries continued to do so for the rest of that time.</s>

en: In the year 1800 when the first English ambassador entered our country, he started to bribe people and buy supporters as soon as he got off the ship in the city of Bushehr. The ambassador was coming from India. It was when the English had the Indian government under control.
hau: Shekarar 1800 ne jakadan Ingila na farko ya shigo kasar nan - wanda ya zo ne daga Indiya; wato a wancan lokacin da hukumar Indiya take hannun turawan Ingila sannan kuma cibiyar sarauta tana can ne - daga wannan garin na Bushehr lokacin da ya sauka daga jirgin ruwa, ya fara ba da cin hanci da sayen mutane, cikin sauki kuwa ya sami damar sayen wasu mutanen.
mt0: <pad> In 1800 the first English ambassador came to the country - who came from India; which is when the government of India was in the hands of the English colonisers and the center of power was there - from this town of Bushehr, when he landed on the ship, he began to give bribes and buy people, and he managed to buy some people very easily.</s>

en: All those princes, emirs and other people with such impressive-sounding titles gave in to the presents of the ambassador. The process of oppression by the enemies started from that day. Our weak statesmen let the enemy infiltrate the country on that day.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan ‘ya'yan sarki da sarakuna da sauransu, nan da nan suka mika kai ga wannan mutumin. Makircin makiya da kafar ungulunsu daga nan ya faro a wannan kasar. Wadannan sarakuna na wancan lokaci marasa lamiri sun bar makiya suka sami bakin magana da kutsawa cikin wannan kasar.
mt0: <pad> All these sons of the king and the kings and others, immediately bowed down to this man. Then began the evil and the wickedness of this country. Those kings of that time, without heart, let the enemies have the right to speak and enter this country.</s>

en: We do not want this process to continue.
hau: To mu dai ba ma son hakan ta ci gaba da wanzuwa.
mt0: <pad> We don't want it to continue.</s>

en: The Revolution has presented them with an insurmountable obstacle.
hau: Juyin juya halin Musulunci ya samar da wata garkuwa ta karfe a gabansu.
mt0: <pad> The Islamic Revolution has created a steel shield in front of them.</s>

en: We want to strengthen this obstacle.
hau: Muna son wannan garkuwar ta kara karfi ne.
mt0: <pad> We want this fence to be stronger.</s>

en: We must not at all allow them to interfere in our economy, culture, politics and destiny.
hau: Bai kamata mu bar su ta kowace hanya su zamanto masu tsoma baki cikin tattalin arzikinmu, cikin al'adunmu, cikin siyasar mu da kuma makomarmu da albarkatun kasar mu ba.
mt0: <pad> We should not allow them to meddle in our economy, culture, politics and our future and resources.</s>

en: Economy is one of the important pillars of this domestic strength.
hau: Daya daga cikin tushen wannan karfi na cikin gida shi ne tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> One of the sources of this internal strength is economic.</s>

en: This is why we say we must become the top country in the region.
hau: Wannan shi ne dalilin da ya sa muke cewa wajbi ne mu zamanto a matsayi na farko.
mt0: <pad> That's why we say that it is our duty to be the first.</s>

en: It is not just a whim. No, the destiny of our nation depends on it.
hau: Ba wai cewa wani yayi ne na cewa dole ne Iran ta zamanto ta farko a wannan yankin ba; a'a saboda makomar wannan al'umma ta ta'allaka ne da hakan.
mt0: <pad> No one is telling Iran to be the first in this region; no, it's because the future of this nation depends on it.</s>

en: Therefore, persistent, clever, sincere and effective efforts - which utilize all capacities of the country - play a role in this regard.
hau: A saboda haka wajibi ne a dinga gudanar da ayyuka da kuma kokari ba kama hannun yaro cikin tsarkin zuciya da kuma yin tasiri, wanda wajibi ne a yi amfani da dukkanin karfi da fagagen da ake da su a wannan kasar.
mt0: <pad> For this reason, it is necessary to carry out all the work and efforts with sincerity and effect, which requires the use of all the powers and resources available in this country.</s>

en: This was what I had heard and I saw it for myself after the Revolution and the resultant advances in the country.
hau: Mun ji hakan; sannan kuma muna ganin hakan cikin irin ci gaban da kasar nan ta samu a lokacin juyin juya halin Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> We heard it; and we see it in the development that the country has had during the Islamic Revolution.</s>

en: Before the Revolution, nobody would have believed the progress that has been made in the country in the area of building dams.
hau: Abin da ya faru a fagen madatsan ruwa a kasar nan, kafin nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci babu wani da zai yarda cewa hakan za ta faru.
mt0: <pad> What happened in the water sector of the country, before the Islamic Revolution no one would have thought that would happen.</s>

en: The gentleman who spoke in this meeting referred to building dams as an example, but the same is true of many other areas. There was a day when it was impossible to convince people that such scientific progress would be made in the country. Today we can see these advances in front of our eyes.
hau: An kafa misali ne da madatsan ruwa amma a bangarori daban-daban ma haka lamarin ya ke. Abubuwan da a halin yanzu suke faruwa na irin ci gaban da ake samu a kasar nan, a wani lokaci a baya (ko shakka babu) babu wani da ya yarda cewa za su faru, to amma a yau ga shi nan muna ganinsu suna faruwa a gaban idanuwanmu.
mt0: <pad> The water supply is just one example, but it's the same in other areas. Things that are currently happening in the country, at a time in the past (of course) nobody believed they would happen, but now we see them happening in front of our eyes.</s>

en: I have realized through experience that there is nothing that our youth are incapable of doing when the necessary infrastructure has been prepared. Any thing for which the necessary infrastructure has been prepared can be done by our youth. We enjoy such human resources in the country.
hau: Ina fadin hakan ne sakamakon irin masaniyar da nake da ita dangane da bangarori daban daban na kasar nan, ta yadda babu wani bangare a kasar nan da matasanmu ba za su iya bayyanar da kansu a wajen da kuma ciyar da shi gaba ba matukar dai an share musu fage.
mt0: <pad> I say this because of my knowledge of different parts of the country, that there is no part of the country that our young people cannot be present and support it if they are given the opportunity to do so.</s>

en: This is a very important point.
hau: Wannan lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> This is a very important matter.</s>

en: Our economic potential is also very important.
hau: Irin karfi na tattalin arziki da mu ke da shi ma lamari ne mai muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> The strength of our economic capacity is also an important issue.</s>

en: Once I said that considering the proportion of our population to the population of the world, we enjoy a disproportionately large number of vital mines and natural resources.
hau: A wani lokaci a baya na taba fadin cewa idan aka kwatanta yanayin albarkatun kasar da mu ke da su da irin yawan al'ummar mu da kuma al'ummar duniya, za a ga cewa sun dara hakan.
mt0: <pad> I have once said that if you compare our resources to the number of our people and the world's population, you will find that they are much better.</s>

en: Similarly the area of our country is around one percent of the total land area of our planet. Well, we should have one percent of the total essential natural resources, but in certain cases we have 3, 4 or 5 percent of the total resources.
hau: Yawan mutanen kasar nan kimanin kashi daya cikin dari na mutanen duniya ne, kamar yadda fadin kasar mu kimanin kashi daya cikin dari na dukknain fadin duniya ne - to a saboda haka abin da ya zama wajibi shi ne mu sami kashi daya cikin dari na albarkatun kasa na duniya; to amma a wasu wajajen ma abin da muke da shi din ya kai kashi 3, kashi 4 da kashi 5.
mt0: <pad> The population of our country is about one percent of the world's population, and the area of our country is about one percent of the total area of the world - so it is necessary for us to have one percent of the world's natural resources; but in some areas we have 3, 4, and even 5 percent of the world's natural resources;</s>

en: These are important capacities and they are very valuable.
hau: Wadannan wasu fagage ne masu muhimmanci sannan kuma lamurra ne masu kimar gaske.
mt0: <pad> These are important fields and the results are very valuable.</s>

en: The shortage of water in the country that has been rightly pointed out can be fully addressed with clever scientific and technological plans. Some of the friends who spoke in this meeting mentioned this point and I have made the same point previously. With a little care and progress, we can compensate for the shortcoming that we are suffering from.
hau: Shi kansa wannan lamari na karancin ruwan da yanzu ake maganarsa a kasar nan kuma haka lamarin yake - mu dai kasa ce da take da karancin ruwa - to amma ana iya magance wannan matsalar ta hanyar gabatar da tsare-tsare na ilimi da suka dace, wanda wasu daga cikin ‘yan'uwa ma sun yi ishara da hakan a nan, a baya ma dai na fadi hakan. Ta hanyar gudanar da ‘yan wasu ayyuka, muna iya cike gurbin irin wadannan rashi da muke da su.
mt0: <pad> The issue of water shortage in the country is true - we are a country with water shortage - but this problem can be addressed by introducing proper education programs, as some of the brothers have already mentioned here, and I have also said that. By doing some other activities, we can fill in these shortages that we have.</s>

en: Therefore, our country has genuinely extraordinary capacities in terms of natural resources.
hau: A saboda haka a hakikanin gaskiya kasar nan tana da albarkatun kasa masu yawan gaske.
mt0: <pad> So in reality the country has a lot of natural resources.</s>

en: The same is true of our geographical position.
hau: Haka lamarin ya ke a bangaren wajen da muke da kuma wannan yankin.
mt0: <pad> That's the case with our area and this other one.</s>

en: We are connected to two different seas.
hau: Muna wani waje ne mai muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> We are a very important place.</s>

en: We are connected to international waters and the sensitive region that lies between the east and the west - namely, Asia and Europe. We are located in one of the most important spots of this sensitive region. The two seas provide us access to the west and the east.
hau: Makwabtakar da muke da ita da tekuna guda biyu da kuma alaka da yanki mai tsananin muhimmanci tsakanin gabashi da yammaci, wato tsakanin Asiya da Turai, muna wani bangare ne mai muhimmanci na wannan yankin, hakan ya samar mana da damar haduwa da yammaci da kuma gabashi.
mt0: <pad> Our neighbourhood of two seas and our connection with the very important region between east and west, that is between Asia and Europe, make us a key part of this region, allowing us to connect with both the west and the east.</s>

en: These are all advantages that we enjoy.
hau: Dukkanin wadannan wasu abubuwa ne masu kyau a gare mu.
mt0: <pad> All these things are good things for us.</s>

en: As was mentioned, one fourth of the time for the 20-Year Strategic Plan has passed.
hau: A halin yanzu dai - kamar yadda aka yi ishara da hakan - mun ci kashi daya cikin hudu cikin shekarun shirin ci gaban kasa na shekaru ashirin da aka tsara.
mt0: <pad> Nowadays, as mentioned above, we have achieved one-fourth of the twenty-year development plan of the country.</s>

en: One four-year plan - namely, the fourth development plan - is over. This year is the first year of the fifth development plan.
hau: Wato wani shiri na shekaru hudu da aka tsara ya riga da ya kare; shekarar bana mafari ne na shiri na biyar.
mt0: <pad> Each of the four-year plans has already been completed; this year marks the start of the fifth plan.</s>

en: Of course many things were done during the fourth development plan.
hau: Tabbas an gudanar da ayyuka masu yawa a cikin shiri na shekaru hudun.
mt0: <pad> However, there have been many activities in the four-year program.</s>

en: According to the accurate reports that were presented in this meeting, very important things have been done. But there are certain other things that have not been done yet.
hau: Kamar yadda rahoton da suka gabatar wanda kuma kun saurare shi kuma haka lamarin ya ke an gudanar da ayyuka masu muhimmancin gaske; to amma duk da haka akwai wadansu ayyukan da ba a gudanar da su ba wadanda kuma wajibi ne a yi su.
mt0: <pad> As they have reported and you have heard, there have been important works done; however, there are still some things that haven't been done that are necessary to do.</s>

en: The policies that have been announced regarding reforming the norms of consumption, the general policies of our bureaucratic system, the general employment policies and the policies specified in Article 44 of the Constitution - all these policies are in harmony.
hau: Siyasar da aka sanar a fagen gyara irin yadda ake amfani da albarkatun kasa, siyasa ta gaba daya ta tsarin nan, siyasa ta gaba daya ta samar da aikin yi da kuma siyasar doka ta 44 - wadanda aka sanar da su - dukkaninsu tsare-tsare ne da suka yi daidai da junansu.
mt0: <pad> The announced policy on resource allocation, the overall system policy, the overall employment policy and the 44th Amendment policy are all policies that are interrelated.</s>

en: If we manage to formulate and implement the plan on the basis of these policies, we will manage to make far better use of the capacities that I spoke about.
hau: Idan har muka iya gudanar da wadannan tsare-tsare kamar yadda aka tsara, to kuwa za mu iya amfanuwa da irin wadannan dama da albarkatu da ake da su wadanda aka yi ishara da su.
mt0: <pad> If we can carry out these measures as planned, then we can benefit from the opportunities and blessings mentioned above.</s>

en: These policies create a kind of cohesion and this cohesion between different layers ensures economic dynamism.
hau: Wadannan siyasa za su iya samar da wani hadin kai da kuma tabbatar da yunkuri na tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> These policies can create a coalition and ensure economic growth.</s>

en: Of course some of the goals that had been specified in the fourth development plan were not achieved. Many factors were involved: both domestic and international issues were involved.
hau: Ko da yake ba a cimma wadansu daga cikin manufofin da aka tsara su cikin tsari na shekaru hudun ba, akwai dalilai daban-daban da suka hana cimma hakan; da suka hada da lamurra na cikin gida da kuma wasu na waje.
mt0: <pad> Although some of the objectives set out in the four-year plan were not achieved, there were a variety of reasons that prevented it; including internal and external obstacles.</s>

en: Among the goals that have not been achieved are the 8 percent growth, reducing unemployment, the percentage of investment that had been specified and the issue of reducing inflation which I spoke about previously.
hau: Batutuwa irin su samun ci gaba na kashi 8 cikin dari, ko kuma rage rashin aikin yi ko kuma kashin da aka tsara na zuba jari ko kuma lamarin rage irin tsadar kayayyaki - wanda a wancan ranar na yi ishara da hakan - dukkanin wadannan abubuwa ne da ba a cimma su ba.
mt0: <pad> Examples of growth of 8 percent, or reducing unemployment, or the target for investment, or the issue of lowering prices - which I mentioned yesterday - all these things are not achieved.</s>

en: We need to intensify our labor so that we can compensate for the past shortcomings.
hau: Hakan lamari ne da ke wajabta mana kara kokarin a cikin wannan shiri na shekaru biyar don mu sami damar cike irin gibin da ake da su a baya.
mt0: <pad> That is why we have to work harder in this five-year plan to fill the gaps that have been left behind.</s>

en: According to Article 44 of the Constitution, we had to limit the ownership and economic activities of the government and we did so. What was the goal?
hau: A bisa abin da aka fadi cikin wannan dokar, wajibi ne mu sake nazari a fagen mallaka ta gwamnati da ayyukan tattalin arziki na gwamnati, an gudanar da hakan.
mt0: <pad> According to this law, it was necessary to review the state property and economic activities of the state, and it was done.</s>

en: The goal was to create a competitive economy with the presence of the private sector and its investments in the economy of the country.
hau: Da wata manufa? Da manufar samar da wani tattalin arziki da ke cike da gasa ta hanyar shigo da ‘yan kasuwa da masu zuba jari a fagen tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> With another purpose? To create a highly competitive economy by bringing in businessmen and investors into the economic sector.</s>

en: According to calculations, the amount of money that is required for investment over this five-year period is around 160 billion dollars.
hau: Sun yi lissafi sun gano cewa kudaden da ake bukata wajen zuba jari cikin wadannan shekaru biyar din, a kowace shekara ya kai kimani dala biliyan 160.
mt0: <pad> They calculated and found that the total investment required for the next five years, each year, would be about 160 billion dollars.</s>

en: And this is something that must be done.
hau: Wajibi ne a samar da hakan.
mt0: <pad> It must be provided.</s>

en: Good things have been done regarding the implementation of the policies specified in Article 44 of the Constitution, but what has been done so far is not enough. It is necessary to improve our performance. It is not just a matter of privatizing economic enterprises and leaving the arena.
hau: A fagen gudanar da siyasar doka ta 44 an gudanar da ayyuka masu kyau to amma dai ba su wadatar ba; wajibi ne a kara kaimi. Lamarin ba shi ne kawai mu mika cibiyoyin tattalin arziki shi kenan mu ce mun mika musu ba, shi kenan mu huta; baya ga wannan mikawar akwai kuma wadansu ayyukan da ya wajaba a aikata: wajibi ne a karfafa bangaren ‘yan kasuwan, wajibi ne a samar da jagoranci mai kyau sannan da kuma a sanya ido wajen ganin ba a yi mummunan amfani da hakan ba.
mt0: <pad> In the implementation of Article 44, good work has been done but not enough; it is not just about handing over economic institutions and saying we have done it, and then resting; there are other things to be done: we must strengthen the business community, provide good management and watch out for any misuse of it.</s>

en: Healthy activities are always accompanied by unhealthy activities.
hau: A ko da yaushe a tattare da ayyuka masu kyau, akwai wadansu ayyukan kuma marasa kyau.
mt0: <pad> It's always filled with good things, and there are also some bad things.</s>

en: I have been stressing the issue of economic corruption for several years.
hau: Shekara da shekaru kenan na ke ta magana kan batun fada da masu ta'annuti ga tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> For years I've been talking about the fight against economic opponents.</s>

en: When I first pointed out the issue, a number of people came to me and said that because I was stressing the issue of economic corruption, our investors might be frightened to enter economic activities.
hau: A lokacin da na gabatar da wannan lamarin, wadansu su kan zo wajena su ce wadannan maganganu da kake yawan yi kan batun ta'annuti ga tattalin arziki zai tsoratar da ‘yan kasuwa wajen shigowa fagen tattalin arziki.
mt0: <pad> When I presented this matter, some people would come to me and say that your frequent statements about the economic inequality will discourage businessmen from entering the economic field.</s>

en: I told them that my comments would have the opposite effect and that investors would be encouraged to engage in economic activities.
hau: Ni dai na ce musu sabanin (abin da kuke fadin), hakan lamari ne da zai kwadaitar da su shigowa.
mt0: <pad> I told them the opposite (what you are saying), that it was a way to make them want to come in.</s>

en: If an investor who wants to engage in a lawful and honorable business knows that the government will prosecute those who violate the law, he will be encouraged more.
hau: Duk wani dan kasuwan da yake son samun abinci na halal sannan kuma yake son gudanar da ayyuka na halal wadanda shari'a ta amince da su, idan ya fahimci cewa gwamnati ba za ta yi sassauci ga masu karya doka ba, hakan lamari ne da zai karfafa masa gwuiwa.
mt0: <pad> Every businessman who wants to get halal food and wants to do halal business that the sharia recognizes, if he understands that the government will not be lenient to those who violate the law, it will strengthen him.</s>

en: We are opposed to those who give rise to corruption and those who abuse their position. An investor who helps the country through his presence, his ideas, his money, his investments and his entrepreneurial activities, should be encouraged and praised. Therefore, fighting economic corruption is an essential principle in this regard and it is necessary to observe this principle.
hau: Mu dai muna adawa da masu satan kudaden gwamnati ne, haka nan kuma da masu samar da hanyoyin yin hakan, haka nan ma ga masu mummunan amfani da damar da suka samu. Wajibi ne a karfafa gwuiwan dan kasuwan da yake taimaka wa kasar nan da tunaninsa, da dukiyarsa, da jarin da ya zuba da kuma ayyukan da yake gudanarwa. A saboda haka fada da ta'annuti ga tattalin arziki, ko shakka babu wani rukuni ne na asasi da wajibi ne a aiwatar da shi.
