In this regard one of the important things that can be done is to establish cooperatives. Cooperatives can accumulate great capital and invest in important economic projects of the country.
hau: Haka nan kuma kara irin jarin da 'yan kasuwa suke zubawa da kuma taimakon bangaren 'yan kasuwa don su sami damar zuba jari cikin fagen tattalin arziki na kasa, su ma suna daga cikin batutuwa masu muhimmanci kuma na asasi; wanda daya daga cikin ayyukan da ke da muhimmanci a wannan bangaren shi ne samar da kamfanonin hadin gwuiwa wadanda ta hanyar hada kudade za a iya samar da kudaden jari masu yawa da kafa manyan kamfanoni.
mt0: <pad> Also, increasing the amount of private investment and helping the private sector to invest in the country's economy are important and fundamental; one of the important activities in this regard is the formation of cooperative companies that through the merger can provide large amounts of capital and start-ups.</s>

en: It is necessary to prepare the legal requirements in this regard.
hau: Wajibi ne a samar da tushe na dokoki.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to provide a legal basis for the implementation of the proposals.</s>

en: This means supporting the blossoming of labor.
hau: Hakan kuwa yana nufin goyon bayan ci gaban ayyuka ne.
mt0: <pad> That means supporting the continuation of the work.</s>

en: As for economy in the use of essential resources, especially water resources, today 90 percent of our water resources are being used up by the agricultural sector.
hau: Haka tsumulmula cikin albarkatun kasa na asasi ciki kuwa har da tsumulmula da kuma amfani da ruwa yadda ya dace. A yau kashi casa'in cikin dari na ruwan da muke da shi a kasar nan, ana amfani da shi ne a bangaren aikin gona.
mt0: <pad> However, conserving and using water effectively is crucial. Today eighty percent of the water we have in the country is used in the agriculture sector.</s>

en: Just consider what will happen if the government succeeds in reforming the methods of irrigation and reduces this amount by only 10 percent.
hau: Ku duba ku ga abin da zai faru idan har cikin yardar Allah gwamnati ta sami damar gyara hanyar ban ruwa, idan har aka rage kashi goma cikin dari na wannan kashi casa'in cikin dari din.
mt0: <pad> Imagine what will happen if with the blessing of God the government can fix the water canal, if ten percent of this eighty percent is reduced.</s>

en: We only use 10 percent of our water resources for all other purposes - including household and industrial purposes. Imagine will happen if we spend 10 percent less water in the agricultural sector.
hau: Baya ga bangaren aikin gona, a dukkanin bangarori na daban ma - bangaren amfani na gida, bangaren masana'antu da sauran bangarorin da suke bukatar ruwa - to kashi goma cikin dari na ruwan da ake samu kawai muke amfani da su a wadannan bangarori.
mt0: <pad> Except for the agriculture sector, in all other sectors - domestic use, industry and other water-consuming sectors - only ten percent of the available water is used in these sectors.</s>

en: In fact we will have twice as much water for non-agricultural sectors, which is very important.
hau: A hakikanin gaskiya amfanin da za a samu daga ruwa a bangaren da ba aikin gona ba zai rubanya sau biyu; wanda hakan lamari ne mai girma da kuma muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> In fact, the yield of water in non-agriculture will double; which is a great and important development.</s>

en: The direct involvement of the people in economic matters is something necessary.
hau: Shigowar mutane kai tsaye cikin lamurran tattalin arziki, lamari ne da ya zama wajibi.
mt0: <pad> The participation of the people in economic affairs has become a necessity.</s>

en: If we want this great economic movement to take place in our country in the year 1390, certain requirements should be met.
hau: To, idan har muna son mu aiwatar da wannan yunkuri mai girma na tattalin arziki a kasar nan a shekara ta 1390, to akwai wadansu abubuwan da wajibi ne a aiwatar da su.
mt0: <pad> So, if we want to implement this great economic effort in the country in 1390, there are some things that must be done.</s>

en: I would like to briefly mention these requirements.
hau: Zan gabatar da jerin wadannan abubuwan da ake bukata.
mt0: <pad> I will list these requirements.</s>

en: First of all, it is necessary to have the spirit of jihad.
hau: Da farko dai ruhi na jihadi (kokari) wajibi ne.
mt0: <pad> First of all, the spirit of jihad (struggle) is a duty.</s>

en: Since the beginning of the Revolution up until now, our people have been successful whenever they have entered the arena with the spirit of jihad. We saw this during the Sacred Defense and during reconstruction of the country. Currently we can see the same thing in the scientific movement of the country.
hau: Al'ummar mu dai tun daga farkon nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci har zuwa yau din nan a duk inda ta shigo fage da ruhi na jihadi, to kuwa ta ci gaba; mun ga hakan a lokacin kallafaffen yaki, mun ga hakan a fagen jihadin gina kasa, haka nan kuma mun ga hakan a fagen ilimi.
mt0: <pad> Our community has always been a jihadi community, wherever it has entered a field with the spirit of jihad, it has continued; we have seen this in the period of the Islamic Revolution, we have seen this in the field of building the country, and we have seen this in the field of education.</s>

en: If we maintain this spirit of jihad in different areas - that is to say, if we do our duty for the sake of God in a tireless and serious manner - this movement will undoubtedly continue.
hau: Idan har muka zamanto muna da ruhi na jihadi a bangarori daban-daban; wato aiki saboda Allah da kuma aiki tukuru ba kama hannun yaro - ba wai kawai a matsayin sauke nauyi ba - to ko shakka babu wannan yunkuri na mu zai ci gaba.
mt0: <pad> If we remain with the spirit of Jihad in all our fields; that is, working for Allah and being persistent and hardworking - not just as a relieving burden - then this movement will undoubtedly continue.</s>

en: The second requirement is to strengthen spirituality and the spirit of religious faith in society.
hau: Na biyu shi ne karfafa ababen da suke kyautata ruhi da imani da kuma kishin addini cikin al'umma.
mt0: <pad> The second is to strengthen the means that improve the spiritual and religious values and beliefs of the people.</s>

en: Dear people, everybody should know that piety in our society and among our youth will help our nation in worldly matters as well.
hau: Wajibi ne kowa da kowa ya san wannan; sanya kishin addini cikin kasa da kuma cikin matasa, hakan zai taimaka wa al'umma cikin lamurran da suka shafi duniyar su.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary for everyone to know this; instilling the love of religion in the nation and in the young, will help the people in the matter of their world.</s>

en: It is wrong to think that piety among the youth reveals its effects only during itikaf in mosques or when reciting Dua Kumeyl.
hau: Bai kamata a yi zaton cewa tasirin sanya kishin addini cikin zukatan matasa, zai bayyana ne kawai a lokacin ittikafi a masallatai ko kuma a dararen juma'a a lokacin Dua Kumail ba.
mt0: <pad> No one should think that the effect of planting religious passion in the young will only be evident during ittikaf in mosques or on Friday night during Dua Kumail.</s>

en: If the youth enjoy piety, they will stay away from intemperance and addiction to drugs. They will start utilizing their talents and making efforts.
hau: Idan har matasan wata al'umma suka zamanto masu kishin addini, to kuwa za su nesanci fasikanci; za su nesanci shan kwaya; za su nesanci munanan dabi'un da matasa suke aikatawa.
mt0: <pad> If the young of a community becomes religious, they will not commit prostitution; they will not use drugs; they will not commit bad behaviors that young people do.</s>

en: The same is true of economy.
hau: A fagen tattalin arziki ma haka lamarin yake.
mt0: <pad> In terms of economics, it is the same.</s>

en: The spirit of piety and spirituality plays a very important role.
hau: Karfin gwuiwa na addini, lamari ne da ke taka gagarumar rawa.
mt0: <pad> Beyond the power of religion, the clock plays an important role.</s>

en: The next requirement is that the country should not be distracted by side issues. Most of the time there is a central issue in the country which should be the focus of everybody's efforts.
hau: Wani sharadin na gaba shi ne rashin nuna damuwa da ababe na bayan fage. Ku duba ku gani, a mafi yawan lokuta akwai lamurra na asali a wannan kasar wanda wajibi ne kowa da kowa ya ba da himma da kuma riko da wadannan lamurra; wajibi ne hakan ya zamanto shi ne abin da za a ba shi muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> Another condition is not to be too concerned with the outside world. Look, in most cases there are original problems in this country that everyone should take care and respect; it must be the first thing to be given priority.</s>

en: This is analogous to the situation of a caravan that is on an important mission and is moving through a desert towards its destination, but suddenly something unimportant attracts the attention of the caravan in one part of the desert and it stops moving forward.
hau: Hakan zai zamanto tamkar jirgin kasa ne da ke dauke da mutane da ya kama hanya yana son isa ga wani waje na musamman, kwatsam kawai sai wani karamin abu ya bayyana ya shagaltar da shi a tsakiyar sahara, sai a bar shi a kan hanya, a wasu lokutan ma a kan hana shi tafiya din ne.
mt0: <pad> It's like a train that's on its way to a special place, suddenly something small comes up and stops it in the middle of the desert, and it's left on the road, sometimes even stopped by the journey itself.</s>

en: Side issues should not be brought into focus.
hau: A saboda haka bai kamata a shigo da lamurra na bayan fage cikin fage ba.
mt0: <pad> For that reason, it is not advisable to bring in the after-effects of the secondary stage into the primary stage.</s>

en: Preserving unity and national solidarity is another requirement.
hau: Wani sharadin na daban shi ne kiyaye hadin kai da fahimtar juna ta kasa.
mt0: <pad> Another condition is to keep the national unity and understanding.</s>

en: It is necessary to maintain and strengthen the unity that exists among and between the people and government officials. The people love their government officials. They trust their officials.
hau: Wannan hadin kan da a yau ake da shi tsakanin mutane da kuma tsakanin mutane da jami'an gwamnati, (wato) mutane suna kaunar jami'an su, sun yarda da su, suna taimaka musu da kuma kasancewa tare da su, sannan kuma akwai hadin kai da fahimtar juna a tsakanin su kansu mutanen, to wajibi ne (irin wannan yanayin) ya ci gaba da wanzuwa sannan kuma a ci gaba da karfafa shi a kowace rana.
mt0: <pad> This cooperation between people and between people and government officials, (that) people love their officials, trust them, help them and be with them, and there is cooperation and understanding among the people themselves, this should continue to exist and be strengthened every day.</s>

en: One of the big plots of the enemies of the Iranian nation is to foment discord inside the country under ethnic, religious, political and partisan pretexts.
hau: Daya daga cikin babban makircin makiyan al'ummar Iran, shi ne haifar da rarrabuwa da sabani na cikin gida; suna masu fakewa da batun kabilanci, mazhaba, akida ta siyasa da kuma kungiyanci da dai sauran batutuwa daban-daban.
mt0: <pad> One of the greatest objectives of the enemies of the people of Iran is to create divisions and conflicts within the country; they are hiding behind the issue of race, religion, political ideology and sectarianism and many other issues.</s>

en: Fortunately our nation is vigilant.
hau: Abin farin cikin shi ne cewa al'ummar mu a farke take.
mt0: <pad> The good news is that our people are beginning to wake up.</s>

en: All those who care about the country and religious democracy - which is a source of pride for the Iranian nation - should cooperate in a harmonious manner.
hau: Dukkanin mutanen da suke kaunar kasar su, suke kaunar tsarin demokradiyya na addini wanda hakan abin alfahari ne ga al'ummar Iran - to wajibi ne su tabbatar da fahimtar juna a tsakaninsu.
mt0: <pad> All those who love their country, who love the religious democratic system that is so proud of Iranians - they must ensure that there is mutual understanding among them.</s>

en: Government officials should do the same.
hau: Haka ya kamata su ma jami'an gwamnati su kasance; wajibi ne su yi kokari wajen ganin cewa ko da a ce akwai wani sabani a tsakaninsu - mai yiyuwa ne ma a wani lokacin korafin da suke da shi din ya zamanto na gaskiya ne - to kada su bayyanar da hakan a gaban mutane; don kuwa hakan zai cutar da hadin kai na kasa ne.
mt0: <pad> As well should government officials be; they must try to see that even if there is a difference between them - and it is probably true sometimes - they should not show it to the public; for it will harm the national unity.</s>

en: I seriously warn our government officials about this issue.
hau: Lalle ni ina jan kunnen jami'an gwamnati sosai kan wannan lamarin.
mt0: <pad> I'm really calling on the government officials to do something about this matter.</s>

en: It is possible to negotiate a solution to the most important issues of the world, let alone such trivial issues.
hau: Mafi muhimmancin lamarin duniya a kan magance shi ta hanyar tattaunawa; wadannan kananan lamurra ba su da muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> Most important world affairs should be resolved by discussion; these smaller affairs are not so important.</s>

en: Sometimes after I announce a slogan at the beginning of the year, I see placards hanging everywhere - in Tehran and other cities of the country - with the slogan written on them.
hau: Tabbas ne in sake tunatarwa kan wannan lamarin; a wani lokaci wannan suna da muke ba wa shekara, kwatsam kawai sai ka ga an cika katangun birnin Tehran da na sauran garuruwa da rubuce-rubuce kan hakan, wato a ta rubuta wannan taken.
mt0: <pad> I'm sure I should remind you again of this matter; sometimes the name of the year suddenly appears on the walls of Tehran and other cities with writings about it, that is, people are writing about this topic.</s>

en: This is useless.
hau: Hakan ba shi da wani amfani.
mt0: <pad> That's no use.</s>

en: Measures that are sometimes adopted are expensive, yet unnecessary.
hau: A wasu lokuta ma a kan kashe kudade masu yawa sosai, mene ne wajibcin da ke cikin hakan?
mt0: <pad> Some times they spend a lot of money, what is the point in that?</s>

en: What I expect from government officials and from our dear people is that they should listen to these slogans and try to practice them.
hau: Abin da nake fatan gani a wajen mutane da kuma jami'an gwamnati shi ne su saurari wannan taken, su amince da shi sannan kuma su a yi kokari wajen ganin an tabbatar da shi.
mt0: <pad> What I want to see from people and government officials is that they listen to this topic, agree with it and work towards its realization.</s>

en: In this regard there is no need to do something that is expensive.
hau: Babu wata bukatar ta gudanar da ayyukan da za a kashe kudade masu yawa.
mt0: <pad> No need to run projects that will cost a lot of money.</s>

en: Of course the central importance of economic matters does not mean that we should ignore other areas.
hau: Ko da yake ba da muhimmanci ga batun tattalin arziki da na fadi ba wai yana nufin a yi watsi da sauran bangarorin ba ne.
mt0: <pad> Although I said that the economic issue is not important, it doesn't mean that I should neglect other issues.</s>

en: It is necessary to pay attention to other areas as well, especially science and technology, and to help and trust our young scientists so that they can make great achievements.
hau: A sauran bangarorin ma, musamman a fagen ilimi da fasaha, lalle wajibi ne a taimaka wa wadannan masana matasa, a yarda da su, don su sami damar gudanar da manyan ayyuka.
mt0: <pad> In other areas, especially in the field of education and technology, it is necessary to support these young scientists, to be trusted, so that they can take on major tasks.</s>

en: As for the regional issues, the recent events which have happened in the region - in Egypt, Tunisia, Libya and Bahrain - are very important.
hau: To amma dangane da lamurran da suke faruwa a wannan yankin kuwa. Abubuwan da a baya-bayan nan suke faruwa - wato lamurran kasar Masar, Tunusiya, Libya da Bahrain - lamurra ne masu muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> But regarding the political situation in this region. The recent events - the Egyptian, Tunisian, Libyan and Bahraini revolutions - are very important.</s>

en: A fundamental change is taking place in this Islamic and Arab region. This is a sign of Islamic Awakening.
hau: Wani gagarumin sauyi ne yake faruwa a wannan yanki na musulmi da larabawa; hakan alama ce ta farkawa ta Musulunci da ake samu.
mt0: <pad> A huge change is taking place in this Muslim and Arab region; it is a sign of the renaissance of Islam.</s>

en: The same thing which has been shouted as a slogan in the Islamic Republic for decades is revealing itself in the context of these countries. These developments have two characteristics: one is the presence of the people, and other is the religious orientation of these movements.
hau: Wannan lamari da shekara da shekaru kenan ake daga takensa a Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran, to sai ga shi a yau yana nuna kansa cikin rayuwar kasashe. Akwai wadansu siffofi guda biyu da wadannan lamari ya kebanta da su: na farko shi ne batun kasantuwar mutane, na biyu kuma shi ne riko da addini da kuma komawa gare shi.
mt0: <pad> This phenomenon, which has been a part of the life of the Islamic Republic of Iran for years, is now also taking place in other countries. There are two distinctive features of this phenomenon: first is the issue of people's satisfaction, second is the issue of religion and return to it.</s>

en: These are two essential characteristics.
hau: Wadannan abubuwa ne na asasi guda biyu.
mt0: <pad> These are two fundamental things.</s>

en: The physical presence of the people - this is what happened in the Islamic Revolution.
hau: Kasantuwar mutane a fage; shi ne irin wannan yanayi da ya faru a lokacin juyin juya halin Musulunci na Iran.
mt0: <pad> Crowds of people in the field; this is the same situation that happened during the Iranian Islamic Revolution.</s>

en: Parties, people who live in their ivory towers and political analysts could not do anything.
hau: Kungiyoyi da jam'iyyu da wadanda suke zaune a kan tebura da kuma cikin manyan gidaje da masu sharhi cikin kwakwalwa sun gagara aikata komai.
mt0: <pad> organizations and parties, those who sit at the table and in the big houses, and the intellectual commentators have failed to do anything.</s>

en: The art of our magnanimous Imam was that he managed to encourage the people to enter the arena.
hau: Babbar fasahar Imamin mu mai girma ita ce ya sami damar shigo da mutane cikin fage.
mt0: <pad> The greatest skill of our Imam was the ability to bring people into the field.</s>

en: Today the same thing is happening in other countries.
hau: To a yau ma irin wannan lamari ne yake faruwa a kasashen (larabawa).
mt0: <pad> Today, the same thing is happening in the Arab countries.</s>

en: In Egypt and Tunisia it was the people who entered the arena, otherwise intellectuals and those who live in ivory towers were always there and they were talking all along. They often called on the people to protest, but nobody would listen to them.
hau: A kasar Masar ko kuma Tunusiya mutane ne suka shigo fage da kansu; idan kuwa ba haka ba to ai daman masana da masu zaune cikin manyan gidaje a ko da yaushe sun kasance suna magana; a lokuta da dama ma sun kasance suna kiran mutane, babu wani da ya damu sosai da wadannan maganganu da suke fadi.
mt0: <pad> In Egypt or Tunisia the people came to the field by themselves; if not, most of the wise men and the residents of the large houses were always talking; sometimes even calling people, no one was really concerned with these conversations.</s>

en: This time it was the people who entered the arena with a religious orientation.
hau: A nan su kansu mutanen ne suka shigo cikin fage, sannan kuma akida da manufarsu ta addini ce.
mt0: <pad> Here the people themselves are involved, and their ideology and purpose is religious.</s>

en: Friday prayers, congregational prayers, Name of God, religious scholars, promoters of religion, founders of new schools of religious thought in certain countries - these were the elements that encouraged the people to step in.
hau: Wato abubuwan da suka tara su ne sallar juma'a, sallar jam'i, sunan Allah, malaman addini, mutane masu isar da sakon addini da kuma masu bayanin mahangar addini a kasashe. Da suka shigo cikin fage, don haka sai su ma mutane suka shigo cikin fagen.
mt0: <pad> The things that bound them are Friday prayer, Sunday prayer, the name of God, religious teachers, people who deliver the message of religion and those who present the religious views of countries. When they came into the field, the people also came into the field.</s>

en: This is a characteristic of these events.
hau: Wannan ita ce siffar da wannan lamarin ya kebanta da ita.
mt0: <pad> This is the way this thing is known.</s>

en: Why did the people step into the arena?
hau: To me ya sa suka fiton?
mt0: <pad> I don't know why you came out.</s>

en: The oppressive rulers in Egypt, Tunisia and other countries had hurt the pride of the people.
hau: A kasar Masar, a kasar Tunusiya, haka nan a sauran kasashe, wadannan sarakuna da azzaluman shugabanni sun zubar wa mutane da mutumcinsu.
mt0: <pad> In Egypt, in Tunisia, and in other countries, these sultans and evil leaders have destroyed the people's dignity and human rights.</s>

en: For example, the people of Egypt had to see the leader of their country commit the worst and most hideous crimes for Israel.
hau: A matsayin misali mutanen kasar Masar suna ganin shugabansu, don biyan bukatar haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila, yana aikata mafi munin ayyuka.
mt0: <pad> For example, the people of Egypt see their leader, to meet the demands of the illegal Israel, doing the worst things to fulfill the wishes of the evil Israel.</s>

en: If Hosni Mubarak had not cooperated with Israel in the case of the siege on Gaza, Israel could not have pressured the people of Gaza like that.
hau: Idan da a ce Hosni Mubarak bai hada kai da haramtacciyar kasar Isra'ila cikin killacewar da aka yi wa Gaza ba, to da kuwa Isra'ilan ba za ta iya aikata irin wannan cutarwar da ta yi wa mutanen Gazan ba.
mt0: <pad> If Hosni Mubarak had not collaborated with the illegal Israeli regime in the siege of Gaza, Israel would not have been able to do the kind of cruelty it has done to the people of Gaza.</s>

en: But Hosni Mubarak stepped in and helped Israel to block the way to Gaza.
hau: Amma sai Hosni Mubarak ya shigo cikin fage, ya taimaka, ya rufe hanyar shigowa da kuma fita daga Masar.
mt0: <pad> But then Hosni Mubarak came in, helped, blocked the entry and exit of Egypt.</s>

en: Then they realized that the people of Gaza had dug tunnels under the ground. In order to stop the oppressed people of Gaza from using these tunnels, they built steel walls around them which ran 30 meters below the surface and cut through the tunnels.
hau: A lokacin da ya sami labarin cewa mutanen Gaza suna bi ta karkashin kasa, ta cikin ramuka (don shigar da abubuwan da suke bukata), don ya hana su yin hakan sai ya gina wata katanga ta karfe mai tsawon mita talatin, ya shigar da ita cikin kasa, don ya rufe hanyar shiga din.
mt0: <pad> When he learned that the people of Gaza were entering through tunnels, through caves (to get things), to stop them from doing so, he built a 30 meter long steel fence and planted it in the ground, to close the entrance.</s>

en: It was Hosni Mubarak who did this.
hau: Wannan shi ne abin da Hosni Mubarak ya aikata.
mt0: <pad> That's what Hosni Mubarak did.</s>

en: Similar things happened in other countries as well.
hau: Ana iya ganin makamancin hakan ma cikin wasu kasashen na daban.
mt0: <pad> You can even see similar things in other countries.</s>

en: For example, Gadhafi showed an anti-western attitude during the first few years of his rule, but he has rendered great services to the west during the recent years.
hau: A matsayin misali a kasar Libiya, duk kuwa da cewa a shekarun farko-farko na darewa mulkinsa, Gaddafi ya nuna akidar kyama da kuma kiyayyar kasashen yammaci, to amma cikin shekarun baya-bayan nan ya aiwatar da hidima mai girma ga kasashen yammaci.
mt0: <pad> As an example in Libya, Gaddafi showed a negative and anti-western ideology in the first years of his rule, but in recent years he has been very generous towards the western countries.</s>

en: The people of Libya saw that a simple threat was enough to make Gadhafi load all the nuclear facilities of his country onto a ship and tell westerners to take them away.
hau: (Mutanen Libiya) da idanuwansu sun ga cewa daga 'yar wata barazana da aka yi masa, sai ga shi ya tattara dukkanin kwarewa da kayan aiki na nukiliyansa, ya sanya su cikin jirgin ruwa, ya mika wa mutanen yammaci, ya ce ku tafi da su!
mt0: <pad> (Libyans) have seen with their own eyes that after a little threat, he has gathered all his knowledge and equipment of his nuclear power, put them in a ship, handed them to the western people, and said, "Take them away."</s>

en: Just compare the situation of our nation with the Libyan nation.
hau: Ku duba ku ga matsayin da al'ummar mu take da shi, sannan su kuma (wadancan) a wani matsayin suke.
mt0: <pad> You can see what our community is like, and they are in another position.</s>

en: Not only did our government officials not retreat, but they also increased our nuclear facilities by several times each year against the wish of the enemy.
hau: Amma jami'an kasar mu ba wai ma kawai ba su ja da baya ba ne, face ma dai sabanin abin da makiyan suke so a kowace shekara sai kara rubanya shirin ake yi.
mt0: <pad> But our authorities not only are not simply behind the times, but in fact against the wishes of our enemies, every year they are increasing the preparations.</s>

en: The same thing can be seen in all the countries whose people have revolted against their governments.
hau: Ana iya ganin irin wadannan cin mutumcin cikin dukkanin wadannan kasashe da mutane suka yunkura.
mt0: <pad> You can see these abuse in all these countries that people have tried to free.</s>

en: This is important to us.
hau: Wannan shi ne abin da ke da muhimmanci a gare mu.
mt0: <pad> That's what is important to us.</s>

en: After these events took place, they adopted contradictory positions because they did not have an appropriate understanding of the events and because they did not know the people.
hau: Bayan da wadannan abubuwa suka faru, to da yake ba su fahimci lamarin ba, ba su san mutane ba, sai su ka dau matakai masu karo da juna.
mt0: <pad> After these things happened, although they didn't understand the situation, they didn't know the people, they took actions that were in conflict with each other.</s>

en: Of course in the case of these and other countries, America's support for dictators is a point which has been constantly noticed about America's behavior. They supported Hosni Mubarak as long as they could. Then they realized that it was not possible to keep him in power, so they threw him away.
hau: Ko da yake abubuwan da ya zuwa yanzu aka gani daga wajen Amurka dangane da wadannan kasashe da sauran kasashen na daban, shi ne goyon bayan shugabanni 'yan kama-karya. Sun kasance masu kare Hosni Mubarak har zuwa karshen yadda za su iya; to amma a lokacin da suka ga cewa daga yanzu kan ba za su iya ba, sai suka yi watsi da shi.
mt0: <pad> However, what we have seen so far from the US regarding these countries and other countries is supporting dictators. They were willing to defend Hosni Mubarak as long as they could; but when they realized that they can't, they abandoned him.</s>

en: This is a lesson to the leaders of other countries who are dependent on America.
hau: Shi kansa hakan wani darasi ne ga shugabannin da suka dogara da Amurka na su fahimci cewa daga lokacin da amfaninsu ya kare sannan kuma ba su da wani amfani (a gare su) to nan take za su yi jefa da su tamkar wata tsumma maras amfani, ba za su taba damuwa da su ba.
mt0: <pad> It is a lesson to the leaders who depend on America to understand that when their usefulness and utility ends and they no longer have any use for them, they will be discarded like a garbage bag and never care about them.</s>

en: But they supported and defended the dictator until the last moment. What happened was truly intolerable to America and the west.
hau: Abin da ya faru ga kasashen yammaci da kuma ita kanta Amurka, lalle abu ne da ba za su taba amincewa da shi ba.
mt0: <pad> What happened to the western countries and to America itself is something that they will never accept.</s>

en: Egypt is one of the main pillars of America's Middle Eastern policies. They were relying on Egypt.
hau: Kasar Masar daya ne daga cikin tushen siyasar Amurka gabas ta tsakiya ne; lalle sun dogara da wannan siyasar.
mt0: <pad> Egypt is one of the pillars of American Middle East policy; they depend on that policy.</s>

en: Then the Americans tried to preserve the structure of the Egyptian regime.
hau: To amma sun gagara kiyaye wannan tushe don ya ci gaba da amfaninsu.
mt0: <pad> But they failed to keep this base for their own benefit.</s>

en: If nations stay vigilant, they can easily expose America's hypocrisy and foil its plots.
hau: Wanda idan har mutane su ka zamanto a farke, za su iya kawar da wannan magudi da kuma lalata wannan makirci na su.
mt0: <pad> When people are awake, they can overcome this fraud and defeat this plot.</s>

en: After losing Hosni Mubarak in Egypt and Ben Ali in Tunisia, the Americans tried to preserve the structure of their regimes.
hau: Amurkawa sun yi kokarinsu wajen ganin tun da dai sun rasa Mubarak a Masar ko kuma Ben Ali a Tunusiya, to bari su yi kokarin kare irin tsarin gwamnatinsu.
mt0: <pad> The Americans have done their best to see that if they lose Mubarak in Egypt or Ben Ali in Tunisia, then at least they try to keep their system of government.</s>

en: They overthrew those governments as well. By Allah's favor, America's failures will continue in the region.
hau: Da yardar Allah, sannan kuma da ikonsa, Amurka za ta ci gaba da shan kashi a wannan yankin.
mt0: <pad> With God's grace and His power, the United States will continue to play a role in this region.</s>

en: After they lost their agents in these countries, they took two courses of action. One was opportunism, and the other was simulation. Through opportunism they tried to hijack these revolutions.
hau: Bayan da suka rasa mutanen su a wadannan kasashe, sai suka sanya wasu abubuwa guda biyu da suke son cimmawa a gabansu: na farko shi ne jiran tsammani, na biyu kuma shi ne kokarin haifar da makamancin wannan lamarin a wasu wajajen.
mt0: <pad> After they lost their people in those countries, they set two goals for themselves: first is to wait, second is to try to create a similar situation elsewhere.</s>

en: They were unsuccessful in this regard.
hau: To sun sha kashi dai a wannan aikin.
mt0: <pad> They've been involved in this job for years.</s>

en: Simulation was the second plot - that is to say, they tried to simulate the events of Egypt, Tunisia, Libya and certain other countries in Iran, the country that enjoys religious democracy and a populist government.
hau: Na biyu shi ne kamanta hakan. abin nufi da kamanta hakan shi ne su samar da irin abubuwan da suka faru a kasashen Masar da Tunusiya da Libiya a wasu kasashen na daban.
mt0: <pad> Second is to comment on it. What is meant by commenting on it is to provide the same situations that happened in Egypt, Tunisia and Libya in other countries.</s>

en: What they are doing is true hypocrisy: they claim to support nations.
hau: Munafunci na asali shi ne wannan abin da suke aikatawa, wato ikirarin kare hakkokin mutane.
mt0: <pad> The original fraud is what they're doing, which is pretending to protect human rights.</s>

en: They are hypocritical about Egypt. They say they support the Egyptian people. Our dear people should know that America's President has sent a message to the Iranian nation, saying that he supports them.
hau: To bai baci ba idan har al'ummar mu masu girma suka fahimci cewa shugaban kasar Amurka ya aika wa al'ummar Iran sako yana fadin cewa mu din nan masu goyon bayanku ne! suna ikirarin cewa su din nan suna adawa da masu mulkin kama-karya, suna tare da hakkokin al'ummomi; amma karya suke yi.
mt0: <pad> It would be good if our great people realized that the President of the United States sent a message to the Iranian people saying that we are your supporters! They pretend that they are against dictators, for the rights of the people; but they lie.</s>

en: Not only do they not show mercy to other nations, but they also show no mercy to their own people.
hau: Su din ba wai ma kawai ba sa tausayawa sauran al'ummomi ba ne, face ma hatta al'ummominsu ba sa tausaya musu.
mt0: <pad> Su Din is not only a martyr to the other people, but even her own people are martyrs to her.</s>

en: In spite of America's critical economic situation, the current US President spent hundreds of billions of dollars from the tax paid by US citizens in order to keep banks, arms companies and oil industries going. That is to say, he is spending the money that belongs to the American people on American companies and banks.
hau: Shi kansa wannan shugaban kasar Amurkan na yanzu ya yi amfani da biliyoyin dalolin mutane a irin wannan mummunan yanayi na tattalin arziki da Amurka take fama da shi don ya sake rayar da bankuna; don ya rayar da masana'antun makamai, don ya rayar da masana'antun mai; wato yayi hakan ne don rayar da kamfanoni.
mt0: <pad> The current American president has used billions of people's dollars in this bad economic situation to resuscitate banks; resuscitate the arms industry; resuscitate the oil industry; that is, he did it to resuscitate companies.</s>

en: Therefore, they do not even show mercy to their own people.
hau: Yana tatse mutane don rayar da kamfanoni, suna cika aljihun kamfanoni, suna cika aljihunnan bankuna; a saboda haka ba sa tausayawa hatta al'ummominsu.
mt0: <pad> He took people for granted to sell companies, they filled the pockets of companies, they filled the pockets of bankers; so they didn't even care about their own people.</s>

en: Today the American nation is struggling with the widespread economic crisis, and it does not have a solution.
hau: A yau al'ummar Amurka tana cikin matsalar tattalin arziki, sannan kuma ba su da mafita.
mt0: <pad> Today the American people are in a financial problem, and they don't have a solution.</s>

en: The torture centers of Guantanamo and Abu Ghraib and other torture centers are another issue.
hau: Baya ga gidajen yari da wajen azabtar da mutane irin su Guantanamo da Abu Ghraib na kasar Iraki da sauran wajajen da suke azabtar da mutane da suke wajaje daban-daban.
mt0: <pad> Beyond the jails and torture centers like Guantanamo Bay and Abu Ghraib in Iraq and other places of torture that are in different countries.</s>

en: They do not understand nations.
hau: Mutane ba sa fahimtar wadannan abubuwa, ba sa gane su.
mt0: <pad> People don't understand these things, they don't know.</s>

en: Does the current US President know what he is saying?
hau: Shin shugaban Amurka na yanzun ya san me yake fadi kuwa?
mt0: <pad> Does the current US president know what he is saying?</s>

en: Does he really understand who are behind his policies, or is he unaware and confused? We do not know the answer to these questions.
hau: Shin a hakikanin gaskiya ya san mutanen da suke bayan fage da suke juya siyasarsa, ko kuma bai fahimta ba ya gafala?
mt0: <pad> He really knows the people behind the scenes who are turning his politics, or he doesn't understand and is oblivious?</s>

en: He says that the people who had gathered at Tehran's Azadi Square are like the people at Egypt's Tahrir Square.
hau: Yana fadin cewa mutanen da suke dandalin Azadi ('yanci) na Tehran, su ne dai mutanen da suke dandalin 'yanci na Masar.
mt0: <pad> He says that the people in Tehran's Azadi Square are the same people in Egypt's Tahrir Square.</s>

en: He is right: each year on the 22nd of Bahman, the people of Iran gather at Azadi Square and shout "death to America".
hau: To e gaskiya yake fadi; don kuwa a kowace ranar 22 ga watan Bahman na kowace shekara, mutanen da suke taruwa a wannan dandalin na 'yanci, taken da suke rerawa shi ne "Allah Ya la'anci Amurka".
mt0: <pad> He is right; for every 22nd of July every year, the people who gather in this freedom square sing the song "Allah la'an America."</s>

en: The position of the Islamic Republic on the regional issues is clear.
hau: Dangane da lamurran da ke faruwa a wannan yankin, matsayar Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran dai a fili take.
mt0: <pad> In regards to the affairs of this region, the position of the Islamic Republic of Iran is clear.</s>

en: We seek to defend nations and their rights.
hau: Matsayar mu, ita ce goyon bayan al'ummomi da hakkokinsu.
mt0: <pad> Our position is to support the rights of people and communities.</s>

en: This is the position of the Iranian nation and the position of the Islamic system. This is the clear position adopted by the Islamic Republic.
hau: Wannan ita ce matsayar tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci; wannan ita ce fitacciyar matsayar tsarin Jamhuriyar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> This is the position of the Islamic Republic system; this is the clear position of the Islamic Republic system.</s>

en: These are the policies. These are what the hearts, minds and tongues of our people and government officials say.
hau: Siyasar mu ita ce wannan, zukatanmu su ne wadannan, hikima da kuma abubuwan da muke fadi su ne wadannan, shin ta bakin mutane ne ko kuma ta bakin jami'an gwamnati.
mt0: <pad> Our politics is this, our hearts are these, our wisdom and what we say, whether it be from the mouths of people or from the mouths of government officials.</s>

en: There are two things which are worthy of attention. One is the issue of Libya, and the other is the issue of Bahrain.
hau: Akwai wadansu wajaje guda biyu da ya kamata a lura da su a nan: na farko ita ce kasar Libiya, na biyu kuma ita ce kasar Bahrain.
mt0: <pad> There are two other areas to be taken into consideration: first is Libya, second is Bahrain.</s>

en: Regarding the Libyan issue we utterly condemn the behavior of the Libyan government - killing and pressuring the people, dropping bombs on cities and killing civilians. But we also utterly condemn the interference of America and westerners in Libya.
hau: Dangane da kasar Libiya, mu dai dari bisa dari muna Allah wadai da irin mu'amalar da gwamnatin Libiya take yi wa mutane da irin kisan gillan da ta yi wa mutane da kuma bama-baman da ta sauke a kan garuruwa da kuma fararen hula; to amma shigowar Amurkawa, tsoma bakin Amurka da sauran kasashen yammaci ma muna Allah wadai da shi dari bisa dari.
mt0: <pad> In regards to Libya, we are fully against the behavior of the government of Libya and the atrocities committed by it and the bombings that it has launched on cities and civilians; but we also condemn the American intervention, the intervention of the US and other western countries.</s>

en: They claim that they want to enter Libya or carry out military operations to defend the people. This is not at all acceptable.
hau: Suna da'awar cewa mu mun shiga kasar Libiya ne don kare mutane, ko kuma don mu kai hare-haren soji, to wannan dai ba abin da za a amince da shi ba ne.
mt0: <pad> They claim that we entered Libya to protect the people, or to launch military operations, but that is not credible.</s>

en: It is one month that the people of Libya are being bombed. If you truly support the Libyan people, if you really care about the Libyan people, you should help them.
hau: Idan har su din nan sun kasance masu goyon bayan al'ummar Libiya na hakika ne, idan har zukatansu suna kuna saboda halin da mutanen Libiya suke ciki, to a halin yanzu wata guda aka yi ana ruwan bama-bamai a kan al'ummar Libiya.
mt0: <pad> If they were really for the people of Libya, if their hearts were moved by the situation of the people of Libya, then now it's been a month since bombs have been dropped on the people of Libya.</s>

en: You should give them the facilities they need.
hau: Idan har kuna son ku taimaka musu, to ku ba su makami, ku ba su kayan aiki, ku ba su makamai masu kakkabo jiragen sama.
mt0: <pad> If you want to help them, give them weapons, give them equipment, give them anti-aircraft missiles.</s>

en: Instead of doing these things, they stood by and watched the people being killed for one month. Now they want to step in. Therefore, you have not come to defend the people.
hau: Maimakon hakan wata guda kenan kuka zauna kuna kallon yadda ake kashe mutane; sai yanzu ne za ku shigo. A saboda haka ba saboda kare mutane kuka shigo ba; ku din nan kuna son man fetur din kasar Libiya ne, ku din nan kuna son tabbatar da matsayinku ne a kasar Libiyan.
mt0: <pad> But you've been here for a month and you haven't come in yet. So you're not here to protect people; you're here to get the oil of Libya, you're here to secure your position in Libya.</s>

en: You want to use Libya as a foothold in order to monitor the future revolutionary governments of Egypt and Tunisia, which are located on the east and west of Libya.
hau: Kuna son ku sami wani waje ne da za ku kafa kafafunku don ku yi amfani da shi wajen killace gwamnatocin juyin juya hali da za a kafa a nan gaba a kasashen Masar da Tunusiya, ku zamanto kuna sa ido a kansu.
mt0: <pad> We want to find a place to base yourselves to use it to block future revolutionary governments in Egypt and Tunisia, keep an eye on them.</s>

en: Your intention is evil.
hau: Niyyar ku bakar aniya ce.
mt0: <pad> Your intention is just a lie.</s>

en: The United Nations, which should serve the interests of nations, has unfortunately turned into a tool in the hands of these people. It just provides what they need.
hau: Ita kanta Majalisar Dinkin Duniya wacce ya kamata ta zamanto mai hidima wa al'ummomi, abin bakin cikin sai ta zamanto makami a hannun wadancan mutanen; duk abin da suke so sai ta samar musu da shi.
mt0: <pad> The UN, which should be the servant of the people, has turned into a tool in the hands of those people; it provides them with everything they want.</s>

en: This is a disgrace for the United Nations.
hau: To wannan dai abin kunya ne ga Majalisar Dinkin Duniyan.
mt0: <pad> This is a disgrace to the UN.</s>

en: Therefore, the presence of foreign powers and westerners in Libya is totally unacceptable.
hau: A saboda haka kasantuwar sojojin kasashen waje, da kasantuwar 'yan kasashen yammaci ba abu ne da za a amince da shi ba.
mt0: <pad> So the presence of foreign troops and westerners is not something that can be accepted.</s>

en: If they want to help the people of Libya, the door is open: they can help and equip the people, and the people will settle their issues with Gadhafi and others. Why do you enter Libya?
hau: Idan har kuna son ku taimaka wa al'ummar Libiya, to kuwa hanyar taimakonsu a bude take; za ku iya taimaka wa mutane, ku karfafa su, su kansu mutanen kasar su magance matsalar da ke tsakaninsu da Gaddafi da kansu; don me ya sa kuka shigo ciki?
mt0: <pad> If you want to help the people of Libya, then the way is open; you can help the people, strengthen them, let the people of the country solve the problem between them and Gaddafi themselves; why do you want to get in?</s>

en: Their main demand is that there should be elections in which each person can have one vote.
hau: Babbar bukatarsu ita ce a gudanar da zabe, kowane mutum guda ya zamanto yana da kuri'a guda; shin hakan bukata ce mai girma?
mt0: <pad> Their main demand is to hold elections, every person should have one vote; is that a big demand?</s>

en: Is this too much to expect? In Bahrain there is a superficial democratic façade, but the Bahraini people cannot really vote. They are being oppressed.
hau: Shin wannan fata ce mai girma? A aikace ana gudanar da zabe a kasar Bahrain, to sai dai a yanayi na gaba daya mutane ba su da hakki na kuri'a da irin ma'anar da aka sani, ba su da irin wannan yanayi; ana zaluntar su ne.
mt0: <pad> Is this a great hope? In practice there are elections in Bahrain, but in the general context people don't have the right to vote in the sense that is known, they don't have that situation; they are being oppressed.</s>

en: Westerners took this opportunity to interfere in the affairs of the regional countries by bringing up a new issue: the Shia-Sunni issue.
hau: To, a nan sai 'yan kasashen yammaci su ka yi amfani da wannan dama, don su sami damar tsoma baki cikin lamurran wannan yanki ta hanyar gabatar da wani sabon abu; wanda shi ne lamarin Shi'a da Sunna.
mt0: <pad> So, the western countries took advantage of this opportunity to get into the affairs of this region by introducing something new; that is, the Shia and Sunni issue.</s>

en: Just because the poor people of Bahrain happen to be Shia, nobody in the world should support them.
hau: Saboda mutanen Bahrain abin tausayi 'yan Shi'a ne, a saboda haka babu wani da yake da hakkin ya goyi bayansu.
mt0: <pad> Since the people of Bahrain are a pitiful Shi'a, no one has the right to support them.</s>

en: The TV channels that used to cover the details of the regional issues should now be silent about the events in Bahrain.
hau: Gidajen talabijin din da suke watsa abubuwan da suke faruwa a wannan yankin, to amma sai ga shi sun yi shiru kan lamarin Bahrain, ba sa fadin abin da ke faruwa na irin zubar da jinin mutanen Bahrain da ake yi.
mt0: <pad> The television channels that are broadcasting the events of the region, but they have been silent about the situation in Bahrain, they have not said what is happening to the blood of the people of Bahrain.</s>

en: And then some people in Persian Gulf States - whether politicians or journalists - start talking nonsense, saying that the issue of Bahrain is a Shia-Sunni war.
hau: Sannan kuma aka sami wasu mutane daga kasashen Tekun Fasha - shin 'yan siyasa ne ko kuma 'yan jarida - suka zo suna fadi shirmensa, suna fadin cewa lamarin Bahrain lamari ne na Shi'a da Sunna!
mt0: <pad> And then there were some people from the Gulf - politicians or journalists - who came and spoke out against him, saying that the issue of Bahrain is a Shi'ite and Sunni issue.</s>

en: It is the protest of a nation against the oppression that is being imposed on it, just like what happened in Tunisia and Egypt and just like what is happening in Libya and Yemen: there is no difference.
hau: Nuna rashin amincewar wata al'umma ce da zaluncin da ake yi mata; kamar abin da ya faru a kasar Tunusiya, kamar yadda ya faru a Masar, kamar abubuwan da suke faruwa a kasar Libiya, haka nan tamkar abin da ke faruwa ne a Yemen; babu wani bambanci.
mt0: <pad> It is a protest by a people against the oppression of their people; just like what happened in Tunisia, like what happened in Egypt, like what's happening in Libya, just like what's happening in Yemen; there is no difference.</s>

en: The Americans would be happy to use their propaganda machines in the region and pass off the issue of Bahrain as a Shia-Sunni conflict.
hau: Amurkawa sun yi farin cikin cewa sun sami nasarar kiran wannan lamari a matsayin sabani tsakanin Shi'a da Sunna ta hanyar kafafen watsa labarai da hanyoyin farfagandarsu.
mt0: <pad> The Americans were pleased that they managed to call this incident as a conflict between Shi'a and Sunna through their media and propaganda.</s>

en: They ask why Iran is supporting the people of Bahrain.
hau: Suna fadin cewa da wani dalili ne mutanen Iran suke goyon bayan mutanen Bahrain.
mt0: <pad> They say that for some reason the people of Iran support the people of Bahrain.</s>

en: Well, we support everybody.
hau: To mu dai mun goyi bayan dukkaninsu.
mt0: <pad> We support them all.</s>

en: We have been supporting the Palestinian people for 32 years. Which country, which government and which nation has offered support to the Palestinian nation during the past 32 years?
hau: Mu dai shekaru talatin da biyu kenan mu ke goyon bayan al'ummar Palastinu; wata kasa ce, wata gwamnati ce, wata al'umma ce ta ba su irin wannan goyon bayan da Iran ta ba su tsawon shekaru talatin da biyun nan?
mt0: <pad> We have been supporting the Palestinian people for 32 years; what other country, government or people has ever given them such a support as Iran has given them for 32 years?</s>

en: Are the Palestinian people Shia?
hau: Shin mutanen Palastinu 'yan Shi'a ne?
mt0: <pad> Is the Shia Muslims of Palestine?</s>

en: Once our youth went to the airport, prepared to go to Gaza.
hau: Matasan mu sun tafi filin jirgin sama don a ba su damar tafiya Gaza!
mt0: <pad> Our young people went to the airport to get a ticket to go to Gaza.</s>

en: They wanted to go to Gaza and fight Israel.
hau: A shirye suke su tafi Gaza, su yaki Isra'ila.
mt0: <pad> They are prepared to go to Gaza and fight Israel.</s>

en: We told them not to go.
hau: Mu muka ce kada su tafi.
mt0: <pad> We told them not to go.</s>

en: Our people expressed their emotions in the case of Gaza, Palestine, Egypt, Tunisia and other places.
hau: Mutanen mu sun bayyanar da goyon bayansu ga mutane Gaza, ga Palastinu, ga Masar, ga Tunusiya; su kuwa ba 'yan Shi'a ba ne.
mt0: <pad> Our people have shown their support for the people of Gaza, Palestine, Egypt and Tunisia; they are not Shi'a.</s>

en: Therefore, this is not a Shia-Sunni issue.
hau: A saboda haka lamarin ba batun Shi'a ko Sunna ba ne.
mt0: <pad> So the matter is not Shi'a or Sunna.</s>

en: They are making spiteful and malevolent efforts to present the issue of Bahrain as a Shia-Sunni issue.
hau: Masu neman sharri suna kokarin bayyanar da batun Bahrain a matsayin wani lamari na Shi'a da Sunna.
mt0: <pad> The evil-doers are trying to make the issue of Bahrain a Shia and Sunni matter.</s>

en: Unfortunately some people who do not have any evil motives fell into this trap.
hau: Abin bakin cikin shi ne cewa yadda wasu mutane wadanda ake zaton ba su da mummunar manufa su ka fada wannan tarko na su.
mt0: <pad> The sad part is that some people who seem to have no bad intentions have fallen into this trap.</s>

en: If there are benevolent people involved in this issue, I would like to tell them, "Do not make this a Shia-Sunni issue." This would be the greatest service to America. This would be the greatest service to the enemies of the Islamic Ummah who are trying to present the anti-tyranny movement of a nation as a Shia-Sunni Conflict.
hau: Idan har akwai fatan alheri cikin lamarin, to ina sanar da su cewa: lamarin ba Shi'a da Sunna ba ne; wannan wannan babbar hidima ce ga Amurka; wannan babbar hidima ce ga makiyan al'ummar Iran wadanda suke bayyanar da gagarumin yunkurin neman 'yanci na wata al'umma a matsayin wani rikici na Sunna da Shi'a; babu wani rikici tsakanin Shi'a da Sunna.
mt0: <pad> If there is any goodwill in this matter, I would like to tell them that the matter is not Shia and Sunni; this is a great service to America; this is a great service to the enemies of the people of Iran who are presenting the massive effort to free a nation as a fight between Sunni and Shia; there is no conflict between Shia and Sunni.</s>

en: We do not distinguish between Gaza, Palestine, Tunisia, Libya, Egypt, Bahrain and Yemen.
hau: Mu dai babu wani bambanci a wajen mu tsakanin Gaza da Palastinu da Tunusiya da Libiya da Masar da Bahrain da Yemen.
mt0: <pad> We don't see any difference between Gaza and Palestine, Tunisia and Libya, Egypt and Bahrain and Yemen.</s>

en: We approve of national movements that shout Islamic slogans and seek freedom.
hau: Duk wani yunkuri na al'umma da rera take irin na Musulunci da kuma neman 'yanci abu ne da za mu goyi bayansa.
mt0: <pad> Any effort by the community to promote Islam and freedom is something we will support.</s>

en: After the tanks of the Saudi government were deployed in the streets of Manama in Bahrain, the Americans showed how shameless they are when they announced that they do not consider the Saudi involvement in Bahrain as foreign interference. But when our marja taqlids, religious scholars and benevolent people tell them not to kill the people, they accuse us of interference.
hau: Babbar wautar Amurka yana cikin cewa ne ba sa ganin shigowa kasar Bahrain da Saudiyya ta yi da tankunan yaki a matsayin tsoma baki cikin harkokin cikin gidan kasar; amma a lokacin da maraja'anmu, malamanmu, masu fatan alherinmu suka ce kada ku kashe mutane, sai suka ce ku din nan kuna tsoma baki.
mt0: <pad> The great stupidity of America is that it did not see the invasion of Bahrain by Saudi Arabia as an intervention in the internal affairs of the country; but when our imams, our teachers, our goodwill men said to us not to kill people, they said you are also an intervention.</s>

en: Is this interference?
hau: Shin wannan tsoma baki cikin harkokin cikin gida wata kasa ne?
mt0: <pad> Is this interference in the internal affairs of another country?</s>

en: When we tell an oppressive regime not to kill its own people, they call this interference, but when a foreign government deploys its tanks in the streets of Bahrain, they say they do not consider it foreign interference! Such moves, such statements and such propaganda show how shameless the Americans and their regional subordinates are.
hau: Kiran wata gwamnati, wani tsari na zalunci da muka yi na cewa kada ku kashe mutanenku, to wannan kan tsoma baki ne, amma shigowar tankunan yakin baki 'yan kasasshen waje kan titunan kasar Bahrain hakan ba tsoma baki cikin harkokin cikin gida ba ne. Wannan babbar wautar Amurkaawa ne da kuma 'yan amshin shatansu da suke wannan yankin wadanda su ma suke fadin hakan da kuma yada shi.
mt0: <pad> Casting another government, a dictatorship that we have imposed, is an intervention, but the arrival of foreign tanks on the streets of Bahrain is not an intervention. This is a big lie by the Americans and their henchmen in this region who are also saying and propagating it.</s>

en: The Americans are thousands of kilometers away from this region.
hau: Amurkawa dai suna da tazara ta dubban kilomitoci daga wannan yankin.
mt0: <pad> The Americans are thousands of miles away from this region.</s>

en: They made a mistake, and anybody else who follows them will make the same mistake.
hau: Duk wani ma da ya aikata irin wannan aikin, to lalle ya yi kuskure.
mt0: <pad> Anybody who has done such a thing, has definitely made a mistake.</s>

en: I say with clarity that, by Allah's favor, a new movement has started in the region.
hau: Abin da a fili zan fade shi, shi ne cewa bisa yardar Allah wani sabon yunkuri ya kunno kai ne a yankin nan.
mt0: <pad> What I can clearly say is that with the grace of God a new movement has begun in this region.</s>

en: According to the divine promise, this movement will definitely achieve victory.
hau: Kamar yadda Allah ya yi alkawari, wannan yunkuri kuwa ko shakka babu zai yi nasara.
mt0: <pad> As Allah promised, this effort will certainly fail.</s>

en: The Iranian nation feels proud and happy about being the first to tread this path and remaining steadfast.
hau: Al'ummar Iran dai madaukaka ne, abin alfahari ne sannan kuma suna farin cikin cewa su ne suka faro wannan yunkurin sannan kuma sun ci gaba da yin tsayin daka.
mt0: <pad> The people of Iran are noble, proud and happy that they initiated this effort and have continued to stand firm.</s>

en: Our young generation did not see the Revolution, but they are not less steadfast - if not more so - than the revolutionaries of that time.
hau: Matasan da suka zo dai ba su ga wannan juyin juya halin ba; to amma idan har ma ba su kasance sama da matasan wancan lokacin tsayin daka ba, to kuwa ba su gaza su ba.
mt0: <pad> The younger generation did not see this revolution; but if they were not more persistent than the younger generation, they were not weaker than them.</s>

en: Dear God, bestow Your mercy and blessings on our dear nation.
hau: Ka saukar da rahama da falalarka a kan wannan al'umma masu girma.
mt0: <pad> Please pour down your blessings and grace on this great nation.</s>

en: Dear God, increase the honor of those who serve this nation, this movement, Islam and Muslims.
hau: A kowace rana ka ci gaba da daukaka masu yin hidima ga wannan al'umma da kuma wannan yunkuri da kuma Musulunci da musulmi.
mt0: <pad> Every day you continue to raise up the ones who serve this community and this movement and Islam and Muslims.</s>

en: Dear God, make the holy heart of the Imam of the Age satisfied with us.
hau: Ya Ubangiji Allah! Ka sanya zuciyar Waliyul Asr mai tsarki ta yarda da kuma yin farin ciki da mu.
mt0: <pad> Allah! Make the heart of Waliyul Asr blessed and happy with us.</s>

en: Dear God, by the blessedness of Muhammad (s.w.a.) and his household, make the immaculate souls of our martyrs and the pure soul of our magnanimous Imam satisfied with us. Bestow on us of the grace and blessings that You bestowed on them.
hau: Saboda Muhammadu da Alayen Muhammadu, Ka sanya ruhin shahidai da kuma Imaminmu mai girma su yarda da mu, ka sanya mu cikin inuwar wannan falala da rahama da Ka ba su. Wassalamu alaikum wa rahamatullah wa barakatuhu.
mt0: <pad> For Muhammad and his family, may the souls of the martyrs and our great imam be pleased with us, and let us be in the light of this blessing and mercy that you have given them.</s>

en: The following is the full text of the speech delivered on August 7, 2011 by Ayatollah Khamenei the Leader of the Islamic Revolution in a meeting with government officials of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
hau: Shimfida: A ranar lahadi 7, Augustan 2011 wacce ta yi daidai da ranar 6 ga watan Ramalanan 1432 ne Jagoran juyin juya halin Musulunci Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei ya gana da manyan jami'an Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran.
mt0: <pad> The Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatullah Sayyid Ali Khamenei met with senior officials of the Islamic Republic of Iran on Saturday 7 August 2011, which is equivalent to 6 Ramadan 1432.</s>

en: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful
hau: Da Sunan Allah Mai Rahama Mai Jin Kai
mt0: <pad> Da sunan Allah mai rahama mai jin jin</s>

en: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds, and peace and greetings upon the Holy Prophet, our Master and Prophet, Ab-al-Qassem Al-Mustafa Muhammad, and upon his immaculate and chosen household, especially the one remaining with Allah on earth.
hau: Dukkan godiya ta tabbata ga Allah Ubangijin talikai. Tsira da amincin Allah su tabbata ga shugabanmu kuma annabinmu Abul Kasim Muhammad tare da Alayensa tsarkaka kuma zababbu musamman ma Bakiyatullah (Imam Mahdi).
mt0: <pad> All praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universes. May peace and blessings be upon our leader and prophet Muhammad with his holy and blessed family, especially Bakiyatullah (Imam Mahdi).</s>

en: I would like to welcome the dear brothers and sisters - the hardworking and compassionate officials of the country. I hope Allah the Exalted will make this holy month auspicious for you and the Iranian nation.
hau: Ina wa ‘yan'uwa maza da mata masu girma, jami'an gwamnati masu kokari da kuma kishi na kasar nan barka da zuwa; ina rokon Allah Madaukakin Sarki da Ya sanya wannan wata mai alfarma ya zamanto mai albarka a gare ku gaba daya.
mt0: <pad> I wish my elderly brothers and sisters, the hardworking government officials and the patriotic people of this country welcome; I pray that this holy month may be blessed to you all.</s>

en: I am thankful to Allah the Exalted who gave me another opportunity to arrange this warm and friendly meeting and exchange ideas about important issues of the country. I will divide my statements into three parts.
hau: Muna gode wa Allah Madaukakin Sarki da Ya sake ba mu damar wata shekarar don mu sami damar sake haduwa da kuma shirya wannan taro da ke cike da so da kauna don yin bahasi kan lamurra masu muhimmanci na kasar nan da sauraren maganganu sannan mu ma mu fadi wasu abubuwan.
mt0: <pad> We thank God the Most High for giving us the opportunity to meet again and organize this meeting of love and affection to discuss important issues of the country and listen to others and even say some things.</s>

en: The first part is a number of reminders which I myself need to pay attention to more than anybody else. By Allah's favor, this has been inspired by the spirituality of the month of Ramadan. The second part is about our national issues from a general perspective.
hau: Na raba maganar da zan yi ne zuwa gida uku: bangaren farko, tunatarwa ce wanda a matakin farko ni din nan kaskantaccen bawa ne na fi bukatarta da kuma kula da ita, wanda muna fatan za mu sami hakan albarkacin wannan wata mai alfarma na Ramalana. Bangare na biyu kuma ya shafi lamurran da suka shafi kasar nan ne a yanayi na gaba daya.
mt0: <pad> I have divided my speech into three parts: the first part is a reminder that I, the poor slave, am the one who needs it most and cares for it, which we hope to find through this holy month of Ramadan. The second part is about the problems of the country in general.</s>

en: In the last part, if there is enough time, I will touch on the regional issues and the events that are happening around us.
hau: Bangare na karshe kuma wanda idan har cikin yardar Allah akwai lokaci zai yi dubi ne dangane batutuwan da suke faruwa a makwabtanmu da abubuwan da suke faruwa a wannan yankin.
mt0: <pad> The last part and which if there is time will be about the issues that are happening in our neighbors and what is happening in this region.</s>

en: The late Hajj Mirza Javad Maleki Tabrizi - the famous mystic and the great Islamic jurisprudent - says in his book "Al-Muraqibat" that fasting is a divine gift that Allah the Exalted has bestowed on believers and His servants.
hau: Marigayi Hajj Mirza Jawad Agha Maliki Tabrizi - sanannen masanin Ubangijin nan sannan kuma malamin fikihu - a cikin littafinsa mai suna ‘Al-Murakabat' yana fadin cewa: azumi wata kyauta ce ta Ubangiji wadda Allah Madaukakin Sarki Ya ke ba da ita ga bayinsa da kuma muminai.
mt0: <pad> Hajj Mirza Jawad Agha Maliki Tabrizi - a famous scholar and a scholar of the Qur'an - in his book Al-Murakabat says: fasting is a gift of God to His servants and believers.</s>

en: He says, "Fasting is not an obligation, rather it is an honor for which we should be thankful to God."
hau: Abin da ya ke fadi shi ne cewa: Azumi dai ba takalifi ba ne face dai wata girmamawa ce, wacce take bukatar godiya saboda ita"; wato wannan farilla ta azumi wanda wata girmamawa ce ta Ubangiji ga bayinsa, shi kansa wani abu ne da ke bukatar godiya; wajibi ne a gode wa Allah.
mt0: <pad> What he is saying is that "the fast is not a requirement but a blessing, which requires praise for it"; that is, this farilla of fasting which is a blessing of God to his servants, itself needs praise; it is necessary to thank God for it.</s>

en: He extracted these benefits from Islamic narrations and the knowledge originated from the enlightened heart of this great man.
hau: Daga cikin wadannan abubuwa ko kuma mafi muhimmancin su kamar yadda shi da kansa yake fadin cewa wanda ya fi dukkanin sauran siffofin shi ne cewa wannan yunwa da kishirwa suna sanya wani irin haske da jin dadi cikin zuciyar mutum wanda hakan yana share fagen yin tunani wanda (kamar yadda ya zo cikin riwaya) ‘tunani na sa'a guda ya fi ibada ta shekara guda(1)'.
mt0: <pad> From these things or the most important of them as he himself says is that this thirst and thirst puts a kind of light and joy in the heart that makes it possible to think, which (as it is said in the book) is better than a year's worship.</s>

en: And it clarifies realities and opens the door to wisdom. It is necessary to use this opportunity. We should think about the passage of time.
hau: Wannan tunani yana daga cikin nau'in tunani da ke komawa ga badini da ruhi da zuciyar mutum wanda yake bayyanar masa hakika da gaskiya sannan da kuma ya bude masa kofar hikima. Lalle wajibi ne a yi amfani da hakan. Mu yi tunani dangane da shekarun (rayuwa) mu.
mt0: <pad> This thought is a type of thought that returns to the inner and soul and heart of the person, which reveals him the truth and truthfulness and opens the door of wisdom. It is therefore necessary to use it. Let's think about our age.</s>

en: Time is the main asset of all human beings.
hau: Shekarun (mutum) dai su ne jari na asali na kowane mutum.
mt0: <pad> Shekarun (human) dai su ne jari na asali na kowane mutum.</s>

en: All good things are gained over time. Time is an asset that can bring about eternal salvation and paradise for human beings.
hau: Ana samun dukkanin alherori ne ta hanyar wannan rayuwar - wacce ita ce sa'oin ranaku - ; wannan wani jari ne da zai iya sama wa mutum sa'ada ta har abada da kuma Aljanna ga mutum.
mt0: <pad> All good things are gained through this life - that is our days - ; it is a deposit that can bring happiness and the paradise to one.</s>

en: We should think about the time we have.
hau: Don haka mu yi tunani dangane da wannan rayuwar da yadda shekaru suke tafiya.
mt0: <pad> So let's think about this life and how the years have passed.</s>

en: We should feel the transient nature of the day and nights of our life.
hau: Wajibi ne mu dinga jin yadda sa'oi na rayuwarmu da kuma ranaku da darare suke tafiya.
mt0: <pad> We have to recognize how the hours of our lives and the days and nights go by.</s>

en: Life is nothing but winter snow and summer sunshine.
hau: Mun dinga lura da irin yadda rayuwa take tafiya; ‘rayuwa tamkar dusar kankara ce wacce take narkewa da cikin zafin rana".
mt0: <pad> We have to observe how life goes; "Life is like snow that melts in the heat of the sun."</s>

en: This is while this asset is the only thing that we have in order to achieve salvation in the next world.
hau: A hankali a hankali wannan jari yake tafiya, alhali kuwa wannan jarin dukkanin komai yake a gare mu, dukkanin komai ne a wajen mu wajen samun sa'ada ta lahira.
mt0: <pad> This clock is going slowly, while this clock is all in us, all in our hands to achieve the last happiness.</s>

en: We should think about how, where and on what we spend it.
hau: Ya ya muke amfani da shi, a ina muke amfani da shi sannan kuma ta wata hanya ce muke amfani da shi?
mt0: <pad> Why do we use it, where do we use it and how do we use it?</s>

en: We should think about death, about leaving this world, about the moment we will leave our bodies and about meeting the Angel of Death. This moment is something that will happen to all of us. "Every soul shall taste of death."
hau: Yin tunanin mutuwa, tafiya daga wannan duniyar, lokacin fitar ruhin mutum daga jikinsa da kuma ganawa da mala'ikar mutuwa, lalle wannan wani lokaci ne da zai zo ga kowane guda daga cikin mu; "Kowane rai mai dandanar mutuwa ne(2)" Dukkanin mu za mu dandani hakan.
mt0: <pad> Thinking of death, leaving this world, the time of the departure of the soul from its body and meeting the angel of death, this is a time that will come to each of us; "Every soul is destined to die (2)" We all will taste it.</s>

en: How will we feel at that moment? These are some points which deserve reflection. It is absolutely necessary to think about these things.
hau: Ya ya yanayin mu zai kasance a wannan lokacin? Ya ya zuciyar mu za ta kasance a wancan lokacin? Wadannan abubuwa ne da ya kamata mu yi tunaninsu.
mt0: <pad> What will our condition be at that time? What will our heart be at that time? Those are things we should think about.</s>

en: Duas are another area worthy of reflection.
hau: Wani fagen kuma na tunani shi ne wannan addu'ar.
mt0: <pad> Another field, and I thought that was this prayer.</s>

en: The concepts that the written duas contain are extraordinary. Hajj Mirza Javad Maleki Tabrizi says in his "Al-Muraqibat" that all the speeches and narrations from the infallible Imams (a.s.) - except for narrations and speeches about monotheism - do not contain even one tenth of the truths and teachings that have been passed down to us in the form of duas.
hau: Abubuwan da suke cikin addu'oin da aka samo su daga wajen Ahlulbaiti (a.s) abubuwa ne masu ban mamaki. A cikin wannan littafi na al-Murakabat yana fadin cewa: Hakika da kuma masaniyar da ke cikin addu'oin da aka samo su daga wajen Ma'asumai (amincin Allah ya tabbata a gare su), ko kashi daya cikin gomansu ba su zo cikin riwayoyi da aka samo su daga wajen Ma'asumai (amincin Allah ya tabbata a gare su) ba.
mt0: <pad> The things in the prayers of Ahlulbait (a.s) are amazing. In this book of al-Murakabat he says: "The reality and knowledge of the prayers of the Holy Families (peace be upon them), even one percent of them did not come in the reports from the Holy Families (peace be upon them)."</s>

en: These duas are very important.
hau: A saboda haka wadannan addu'oi suna da muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> So these prayers are of great importance.</s>

en: I have a few duas in mind which I will discuss for a few minutes so that they are repeated for those who have already read them and serve as reminders for those who have not.
hau: Na'am maimaici ne ga mutanen da suka ji, sannan kuma tunatarwa ga wadanda ba su ji ba: ita ce addu'a ta ashirin ta cikin littafin Sahifat al-Sajjadiya, wato addu'ar da aka fi saninta da Makarim al-Akhlak.
mt0: <pad> Na'am is a praise for the people who have heard, and a reminder for the people who have not heard: it is the twelfth prayer in Sahifat al-Sajjadiya, the most popular prayer by Makarim al-Akhlak.</s>

en: The beginning of the twentieth dua of Sahifa al-Sajjadiyya, which is widely known as Makarim al-Akhlaq, says: "O God, bless Muhammad and his household, adorn me with the adornment of the righteous and clothe me in the ornaments of the God-fearing."
hau: Farkon wannan addu'ar tana fadin cewa: "Allah ka yi dadin tsira ga Muhammadu da Alayen Muhammad, ka yi min ado da adon salihan bayin (Allah), sannan kuma ka tufatar da ni da adon (tufafin) masu tsoron Allah" Wato ka sanya ni daga cikin bayin Allah salihai masu tsoron Allah da kuma nesantar abubuwan da Ya haramta.
mt0: <pad> Allah, bless Muhammad and his family, make me adorned with the adornments of the righteous, and clothe me with the adornments of the fearful.</s>

en: In what ways do we want to be adorned with the adornment of righteous and God-fearing people?
hau: Me ake nufi da ka yi min ado da abin adon salihan bayi da kuma masu tsoron Allah?
mt0: <pad> I mean to make me attractive with the clothes of the salihan girls and the fearful of Allah.</s>

en: One is "spreading justice". He asks God to help establish justice in society: judicial justice, justice in the sense of dividing vital resources of the country between the people in an equitable way, justice in the sense of dividing opportunities between the people in an appropriate way.
hau: Ka tufatar da ni adon (tufafin) masu tsoron Allah cikin wasu abubuwa: wanda na farkonsu shi ne, "cikin tabbatar (yada) da adalci". Mu sami damar tabbatar da adalci a cikin al'umma; adalci na shari'a, adalci da ma'anar raba albarkatun kasa tsakanin al'umma, adalci da ma'anar raba irin dama na aiki da amfanuwa da fagage tsakanin mutane.
mt0: <pad> He has given me the clothes of the fearful in some things: the first is "in establishing justice". We have been able to establish justice in the community; justice in the sense of sharia, justice in the sense of distribution of resources among the people, justice in the sense of sharing opportunities and benefits among the people.</s>

en: These are the pillars and principles of the kind of piety that is expected of us.
hau: Tsoron Allah da ake fatan gani daga wajen mu suna daga cikin tushe da asasi na wannan tsoron Allah.
mt0: <pad> The fear of God that we are expected to show is one of the roots and foundations of this fear of God.</s>

en: Your ability to suppress your anger is a great virtue if you are an ordinary person and the scope of your anger is limited to a religious brother, a member of your family or one of your employees. "And those who restrain (their) anger and pardon men..." [The Holy Quran, 3: 134] But if you are in charge of something in society and you have a social position, if your words and actions and your approval and rejection affect your society, then your anger is not the same as the anger of an ordinary person.
hau: A wani lokaci a kan samu mutum ya zamanto wani mutum ne da aka saba da shi (wanda ba shi da wani nauyi na jama'a a wuyansa), to fushin da za ka yi ya shafi wani dan'uwanka cikin addini ne, ko kuma daya daga cikin iyalanka ko dangane da daya daga cikin ma'aikatan wajen aikinka ne - to hadiye fushi wani lamari ne mai kyaun gaske "Kuma masu hadiyewar fushi, kuma masu yafe wa mutane laifi(3)" a wani lokaci kuma ya kan zamana kai din nan wani jami'i ne, kana da wani matsayi; yunkurinka, tabbatarwa da kuma korewarka da kuma ayyukanka suna da tasiri cikin mutane; to a irin wannan yanayin fushinka ba fushi ne na wani mutum da ba shi da wani nauyi na al'umma a wuyansa ba.
mt0: <pad> "And those who hold their anger in themselves, and forgive their enemies." (3)</s>

en: Such a person may get angry at certain people or currents and he may speak against them, but the effects of his anger are very different from the effects of the anger of an ordinary person who may get angry and beat somebody up, for example. Restrain your anger.
hau: A lokacin da ka yi fushi a kan wani mutum ko wata kungiya da fadin wasu maganganu, to tasirin irin wannan fushin naka da fushin da wani mutum da ba shi da irin wannan nauyi a wuyansa wanda bai wuce ya bugi wani mutum ba, ba daya ba ne.
mt0: <pad> When you get angry with a person or a group and say something, the effect of your anger is not the same as the anger of someone who doesn't have the same level of responsibility and doesn't go beyond hitting a person.</s>

en: Things should not be done out of anger.
hau: Hadiye fushi; sannan kada mu yi wani abu cikin fushi.
mt0: <pad> Ignore anger; and let us not do anything in anger.</s>

en: Our Lord, forgive us our faults and our extravagance in our affair.
hau: Ka gafarta mana zunubanmu da barnarmu a cikin al'amarinmu...(4)".
mt0: <pad> You don't know</s>

en: And through "quenching the flame of hatred".
hau: Da kashe wutar kiyayya.
mt0: <pad> They put out the fire of hatred.</s>

en: Everybody should try to put out this fire.
hau: Wajibi ne dukkanin kokarin kowa ya zamanto wajen kashe wannan wutar ne.
mt0: <pad> Everyone should be focused on extinguishing this fire.</s>

en: It is wrong to fuel it. This is why I constantly advise the friends - government officials and the people whose statements are reflected in the entire country or part of the country - to watch their statements and to control their tongues.
hau: Dalilin da ya sanya a ko da yaushe mu ke yawan jaddadawa ga ‘yan'uwa, ga jami'an gwamnati, ga mutanen da suke da mimbarin magana, ga mutanen da ake yada maganganunsu a kasar nan ko kuma zuwa ga wani bangare na kasar nan na cewa su dinga kula da maganganu da abubuwan da za su fadi, saboda wannan lamarin ne.
mt0: <pad> The reason why we always tell our friends, to government officials, to people with a microphone, to people whose words are broadcast in the country or to one part of the country that they should take care of what they say and what they do is because this is the case.</s>

en: A particular statement may not only fail to extinguish the fire of discord, but it may also fuel it.
hau: A wani lokaci wata magana ba ma wai ba za ta kashe wutan ba ne face ma dai za ta kunna wutar ne da kara mata karfi.
mt0: <pad> She wouldn't turn off the light, but she would just keep it on and turned it on.</s>

en: Try to bring together and reunite those who have separated from Muslim communities. Try to bring back those who have almost drifted away. We must not let our behavior, words and actions discourage those who are partially faithful to the Islamic Republic.
hau: Mutanen da suke tsakiyar hanya, a yi kokarin isar da su ga wajen da ya kamata. Bai kamata mu bari ayyukan mu da dabi'unmu da maganganun mu, su zamanto masu kawar da mutanen da suke tsakiyar hanya da hana su yin imani da wannan hanyar ba.
mt0: <pad> The middle path people, try to get them where they want to go. We should not let our actions, behaviors and words, deter the middle path people and prevent them from believing in this way.</s>

en: We should improve the relationship between those who have problems with each other.
hau: Kada mu raba mutanen da suke da rabin alaka da wannan tsarin da shi ba.
mt0: <pad> Don't separate people who have half a connection to this system from him.</s>

en: When it comes to revealing things about other people, we should only reveal their good characteristics.
hau: Da sasanta tsakanin mutane, idan har akwai wani sabani tsakanin mutane, to mu yi kokarin sasanta su.
mt0: <pad> reconciling people, if there is a conflict between people, we will try to solve it.</s>

en: If you know about a good thing that a person or a government official has done, that is what you should reveal about him.
hau: A lokacin da wani jami'i ya aikata wani aiki na kwarai, ku yi kokarin bayanin hakan.
mt0: <pad> When a colleague does a good job, try to explain it.</s>

en: There are many things that can be said in this regard.
hau: Mun yi maganganu da yawa dangane da wannan batun.
mt0: <pad> We've talked a lot about this.</s>

en: What I said is only part of the dua. There were 22, 23 points in the dua and I only touched on 6, 7 of them.
hau: Wannan wani bangare ne na wannan addu'ar. Batutuwa ne kimanin ashirin da biyu zuwa da uku, to a yanzu dai a takaice na yi magana ne kan guda shida daga cikinsu.
mt0: <pad> This is another part of this prayer. There are about 22 to 23 topics, but I've just briefly talked about six of them.</s>

en: We should ask God to "clothe us in the ornaments of the God-fearing".
hau: Mu roki Allah Madaukakin Sarki da Ya tufatar da mu da adon muminai.
mt0: <pad> We pray Allah to adorn us with the clothes of the believers.</s>

en: These are some of the requirements of piety.
hau: Wadannan wani bangare ne na tsoron Allah.
mt0: <pad> These are another part of fear of God.</s>

en: This is the end of the first part of my speech.
hau: Wannan shi ne bangare na farko da nake son magana a kansa.
mt0: <pad> This is the first time I've tried to talk about cancer.</s>

en: The second part of my speech is a general assessment of the conditions of the country.
hau: Bangare na biyu, wani dubi ne na gaba daya dangane da yanayin kasar nan.
mt0: <pad> Second, a general view of the state of the country.</s>

en: The excellent and detailed report, which was presented by the honorable President, was very informative. There were outstanding points in the report and it is very good if these points are made public so that everybody knows what efforts have been made and what services have been rendered.
hau: Lalle wannan rahoto da mai girma shugaban kasa ya gabatar wani rahoto ne da ya tabo bangarori da yawa. Akwai wadansu batutuwa masu muhimmanci da suke a fili a cikin rahoton, ina ma da a ce wadannan bayanai za su isa ga kunnuwan mutane kowa ya san irin kokari da wahalar da ake sha da kuma irin hidimar da aka yi.
