mt0: <pad> The President's Report touches on many areas. There are some important points in the Report, I think if these information were to be shared with the people, everyone would know the effort and the hardships that have been endured and the work done.</s>

en: I will discuss the issues of the country from a different perspective, which is very important to us.
hau: To ni dai zan yi bayani ne ta wani bangare na yanayin da kasar nan take ciki, wanda hakan lamari ne mai muhimmanci a gare mu.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to talk about one aspect of the country's situation, which is an important matter for us.</s>

en: Why is it important?
hau: Me ya sa ya zamanto mai muhimmanci?
mt0: <pad> Why is sleep so important?</s>

en: Primarily because it is very important to know about general conditions of the country, where we have reached and which way we should go. These things are always important, but they are particularly important in the current situation because of the conditions of the world.
hau: Da farko dai fahimtar yanayin da kasar nan take ciki da kuma inda muke, ina muka isa, ta wace hanya ya kamata mu bi, lamari ne mai muhimmancin gaske, a ko da yaushe lamari ne mai muhimmanci; to amma a yau kan yana da muhimmanci sosai, mai yiyuwa ne ma ana iya cewa sakamakon irin yanayin da duniya take ciki, yana da muhimmanci ninkin ba ninkiya.
mt0: <pad> First of all, understanding the state of the country and where we stand and where we have come and which direction to take is very important, always a matter of great importance; but today it is even more important, maybe even more so, because of the current world situation, it is even more important.</s>

en: First of all, the conditions of the region are completely unprecedented.
hau: Da farko dai yanayin wannan yankin wani yanayi ne maras tamka.
mt0: <pad> First of all, the climate of this region is a unique climate.</s>

en: Islamic Awakening and the great event that has taken place in the region have been absolutely unprecedented from the beginning of the Revolution up until today.
hau: Irin farkawa ta Musulunci da abubuwa masu girman gaske da suke faruwa a wannan yankin wani lamari ne da ba a taba ganin irin sa ba tun daga farkon nasarar juyin juya halin Musulunci har zuwa yau din nan; an gudanar da abubuwa masu girma, lamari ne mai girman gaske ya faru.
mt0: <pad> The kind of Islamic revival and the great things that are happening in this region is something that has not been seen since the start of the Islamic revolution until today; great things have been done, a great event has happened.</s>

en: A great event has taken place. The fact that a nation like the Egyptian nation carries out such a great movement, overthrows the Egyptian regime and shouts Islamic slogans, the fact that the existence of the fake Jewish and Zionist government is threatened like this by the conditions of the region - these things are too great to fit in conventional assessments.
hau: A sami wata al'umma irin al'ummar Masar ta gudanar da irin wannan yunkuri mai girman gaske, ta kifar da gwamnati, sannan kuma ta dinga daga take irin na Musulunci, ta zamanto mai yin irin wannan barazana ga haramtacciyar gwamnatin yahudawan sahyohiya dangane da yanayin wannan yankin, dukkanin wadannan wasu abubuwa ne wadanda dukkanin sharhohin da ake yi ba su kai gare shi ba; lalle lamari ne mai girman gaske.
mt0: <pad> When a nation like the Egyptian people has made such a great movement, toppled a government, and began to take up positions like Islam, and threatened the illegal regime of the Secessionist Jews regarding the state of this region, all these things are something that no description can cover; it is a very large event.</s>

en: Well, these are the conditions and they promise very bright prospects for the Islamic Republic.
hau: To a irin wannan yanayi ne muka sami kanmu a ciki wanda lamari ne da ke tsara wani yanayi da fage mai ban mamaki ga Jamhuriyar Musulunci.
mt0: <pad> This is the situation we find ourselves in, which sets a very special and interesting context for the Islamic Republic of Iran.</s>

en: And the conditions of the world are also unprecedented. The big economic crisis which has plagued western arrogant powers is an extraordinary event and we cannot afford to treat it superficially.
hau: Irin matsalar tattalin arzikin da ta yi wa gwamnatocin ma'abota girman kai na kasashen yammaci sannan take ci gaba da makure su wani lamari ne mai girman gaske; sannan kuma wani lamari ne wanda ba cikin sauki haka kawai za a wuce shi ba.
mt0: <pad> The economic problem that has swamped the imperialist governments of Western countries and is continuing to swamp them is a very large problem; and it is not something that can be overcome easily.</s>

en: The analyses that westerners present about the economic crisis in America and certain European countries and the warnings that they sound about the future, are only part of these issues. They are not saying everything.
hau: Irin wadannan sharhi da kuke ji ‘yan kasashen yammaci suna yi dangane da matsalar tattalin arzikin da Amurka da wasu kasashen yammaci suka fada ciki da kuma bayyanar da damuwarsu dangane da makomarsu, wani bangare ne na wannan lamarin; ba dukkanin komai ne suke fadi ba.
mt0: <pad> Such comments you hear from Westerners about the economic problems that America and other Western countries have been in and their concerns about their future are part of this; they are not saying everything.</s>

en: Think tanks, backstage policy-makers and designers of global issues in powerful countries of the world - who have control over the majority of global media - do not want the dimensions of this crisis to be revealed to the people of the world, otherwise the dimensions of the crisis are far more serious than this.
hau: Cibiyoyi tunani da masu tsara musu siyasa a bayan fage, masu tsara abubuwan da ke gudana a manyan kasashen duniya - wadanda a mafi yawan lokuta kafafen watsa labarai ma suna hannunsu ne - lalle ba sa son ganin al'ummomin duniya sun fahimci hakikanin matsalar da suke ciki. Don kuwa bangarorin wannan matsalar sun fi abubuwan da suke fadi.
mt0: <pad> The think tanks and their backers, the planners of major world events - who often control the media - do not want the world to understand the real problem. For the sides of this problem are much deeper than what they say.</s>

en: By Allah's favor, if there is time, I will say a few sentences in this regard at the end of my speech.
hau: Idan har daga karshen magana ta akwai lokaci zan yi karin haske kan wannan lamarin, insha Allah.
mt0: <pad> If there is time at the end of my talk I will explain more about this matter, insha Allah.</s>

en: Another issue is the emergence of radical movements and terrorist campaigns in the west, particularly in Europe - from European neo-Nazis to American neocons. The previous US government was neocon. These people openly announce their radical positions.
hau: Wani lamarin kuma na daban, shi ne irin yaduwar yunkurin wuce gona da iri da ayyukan ta'addanci a kasashen yammaci musamman a kasashen Turai; kama daga sabbin ‘yan Nazi na kasashen turan da sabbin ‘yan mazan jiyan Amurka wadanda su ne masu tsara wa gwamnatin Amurka da ta gabata abin da za ta yi; a fili suke fadin ra'ayinsu na wuce gona da iri.
mt0: <pad> Another thing is the spread of acts of terrorism and extremism in western countries, particularly in Europe; from the new Nazis of Europe and the American neocons who are the planners of the previous US government; they openly express their views of extremeism.</s>

en: And then they attacked two Islamic countries.
hau: Daga baya kuma sai ya kai hari kasashe biyu na musulmi.
mt0: <pad> He later attacked two Muslim countries.</s>

en: They had other plans as well, but God did not give them time and they were defeated.
hau: Akwai wadansu abubuwan ma da suke son aikatawa, to amma dai Allah Madaukakin Sarki bai ba su dama ba inda suka sha kashi.
mt0: <pad> There are other things they wanted to do, but Allah the Most High has not allowed them, where they have been drowned.</s>

en: Well, these are important issues.
hau: To wadannan lamurra ne masu muhimmanci.
mt0: <pad> These problems are important.</s>

en: The event that happened in Norway should not be viewed as an isolated event.
hau: Wannan lamarin da ya faru a kasar Norway, bai kamata kawai mu dauke shi a matsayin wani lamari mai sauki haka kawai ba.
mt0: <pad> The case of Norway should not be taken as a simple matter.</s>

en: In such conditions, we need to re-evaluate ourselves and see what our situation is.
hau: To a irin wannan yanayin wajibi ne mu sake dubi cikin yanayinmu, mu gani a wani irin yanayi muke.
mt0: <pad> To this end, we must look at our situation again, see what kind of situation we are in.</s>

en: If we fail to see these opportunities, if we fail to identify them, if we fail to use them appropriately, if we fail to use them at the right time, we will suffer losses.
hau: Matukar dai ba mu kalli wannan damar da kuma fahimtarta ba, sannan kuma matukar ba mu yi aiki da ita yadda ya dace ba, haka nan kuma matukar ba mu kama hanyar neman amfanuwa da wannan damar cikin lokaci ba, to kuwa za mu cutu.
mt0: <pad> If we don't see and understand this opportunity, and if we don't take advantage of it properly, and if we don't start taking advantage of it in time, then we will miss it.</s>

en: Sometimes losing an opportunity becomes a threat in itself, a cause of backwardness.
hau: A wasu lokuta shi kansa yin watsi da wata dama da aka samu shi kansa ya kan zama wata barazana, shi kansa ya kan zama wata koma baya.
mt0: <pad> In some cases cancer is a waste of an opportunity, cancer can be a threat, cancer can be a setback.</s>

en: For this reason it is not a bad idea to consider the issues of the country from a general perspective.
hau: A saboda haka babu matsala idan har muka yi dubi na gaba daya wa lamurran da suke faruwa a kasar nan da wannan mahanga.
mt0: <pad> So there is no problem if we look at the whole picture of what's going on in our country and in this country.</s>

en: We must not deceive ourselves. We must not be biased. We have weaknesses and strengths and we need to see both of them.
hau: To sai dai wajibi ne dubin da za mu yi din ya zamanto wani dubi ne da ya yi daidai da hakika; bai kamata mu yi kuskure ba da kuma cin karo da dutse ba. Mu dai muna da abubuwa masu kyau sannan kuma muna da munana; wajibi ne mu dinga kallonsu gaba daya.
mt0: <pad> But our view must be a true and correct view; we must not make mistakes or hit the rock. We have both good and bad things; we must see both of them.</s>

en: They constantly promote pessimism in the media and elsewhere.
hau: A kafafen watsa labarai ma da sauran su haka lamarin yake.
mt0: <pad> The media and others are reporting the same thing.</s>

en: And as soon as one questions their approach, they say, "You are preventing us from telling the truth.
hau: Daga lokacin da mutum ya ce me ya sa kuke fadin haka, nan take za su ce kai dai ba ka barin mu mu fadi hakikanin lamurra.
mt0: <pad> When someone asks why you are saying that, they will immediately respond that you didn't let us tell the truth.</s>

en: You call it pessimism and other such things, but we just want to state the facts." No, this is bias.
hau: Kana cewa hakan bakanta fuska ne da makamantan hakan; mu dai muna so ne mu fadi hakika. A'a, hakan kokarin rusa lamurra ne.
mt0: <pad> Kana that it's a joke and such; we just want to tell the truth. No, it's trying to disrupt the situation.</s>

en: I usually skim through 10, 20 newspapers each day.
hau: Ni dai a kowace rana na kan duba kimanin jaridu goma zuwa ashirin.
mt0: <pad> I read about 10 to 20 newspapers every day.</s>

en: Certain newspapers publish 4, 5 headlines every day each of which is enough to fill the hearts of weak people with apprehension.
hau: Wasu daga cikin wadannan jaridu a kowace rana suna da wasu kanun labarai wanda kowane guda daga cikinsu ya isa ya jijjiga zuciyar wani mutum mai rauni.
mt0: <pad> Some of these newspapers have some short stories that each of them can touch the heart of a weak person.</s>

en: I will not accuse anybody. But this is a fact and it is wrong.
hau: Mu dai ba muna tuhumar wani ba ne, amma dai wani lamari ne na hakika, wannan kuskure ne.
mt0: <pad> We're not accusing anyone, but it's really something else, this is a mistake.</s>

en: The same is true of the opposite.
hau: Kishiyar hakan ma dai haka take.
mt0: <pad> I don't know.</s>

en: This is wrong too. It is necessary to see both negative and positive points.
hau: Wajibi ne a kalli bangare na rauni tare da bangare mai kyau na irin karfin da ake da shi tare.
mt0: <pad> It is necessary to look at the negative side with the positive side and the strengths that we have together.</s>

en: We need to take into consideration both what the government has managed to do and what it has failed to do.
hau: Wajibi ne ya zamanto abubuwan da gwamnati ta iya aikatawa da kuma wadanda ta gagara aikatawa su zamanto tare.
mt0: <pad> The government must always be able to do what it can and cannot do.</s>

en: Therefore, if we want to have an appropriate evaluation of the country's conditions, we need to see both positive and negative points.
hau: A saboda haka idan har muna son mu fahimci hakikanin yanayin da kasar nan take ciki, wajibi ne mu ajiye bangaren rauni da bangaren karfi su zamanto tare.
mt0: <pad> So if we want to understand the real situation of the country, we must let the weak and the strong side sit together.</s>

en: Today I will just mention a point, but this issue requires a lot of work.
hau: A yau dai zan gabatar da wani takaitaccen bayani ne kan wannan lamarin, to amma akwai bukatar a gudanar da ayyuka masu fadi a wannan bangaren.
mt0: <pad> Today I will only give a brief summary of this matter, but there is a need for much more work in this regard.</s>

en: Positive points will show us the capacities that the country enjoys.
hau: Wadannan abubuwa masu kyau za su nuna mana wata dama da kuma fagen da muke da su a wannan kasar.
mt0: <pad> These good things will show us an opportunity and a field that we have in this country.</s>

en: And the list of negative points will show us the priorities we should take care of.
hau: Su kuwa wadannan bangarori na rauni za su nuna mana abubuwan da ya kamata mu ba su muhimmanci da kuma ayyukan da ya zama wajibi mu aikata su ne.
mt0: <pad> These other areas of weakness will show us what we should prioritize and what we should do.</s>

en: If we compare these two lists, the path will become clear to us and we will realize what we should do.
hau: A lokacin da muka sanya wadannan abubuwa a tare da junansu, hakan zai zamanto mai haskaka mana hanya; mu fahimci mai ya kamata mu aikata.
mt0: <pad> When we put these things together, it will be a light for us; we will understand what we have to do.</s>

en: I have written down 5, 6 things that are the result of the constant movement of the Islamic Republic over the past 32 years. Of course there have been ups and downs. That is to say, certain years and administrations have been good and certain other years and administrations have been less good, but generally these are the positive things that we have achieved over the past 32 years.
hau: A nan dai na rubuta wasu abubuwa guda biyar zuwa shida wadanda wani yunkuri ne da aka ci gaba da yinsu tsawon shekarun wannan tsari na Jamhuriyar Musulunci tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da biyun, kowane lokaci da irin nasa, wato wasu shekarun, wasu zamunnan, wasu gwamnatocin da kyau wasu kuma an dan bar su a baya. To sai dai a yanayi na gaba daya, a tsawon wadannan lokuta muna da wadannan abubuwa masu kyau.
mt0: <pad> Here I have written five to six things that are an attempt that has been made throughout the years of this system of the Islamic Republic for thirty two years, each time with its own, which is that some years, some eras, some governments have been good and some have been bad. But in general terms, throughout these times we have these good things.</s>

en: The first strength of the Islamic Republic is that it has proven its capabilities are superior to the threats. This is a very important point.
hau: Batu na farko daga cikin abubuwa masu kyau da kuma irin karfi na wannan tsarin wanda kuma tsarin ya tabbatar da shi, shi ne nasara da yin galaba a kan barazana daban-daban da aka yi (wa tsarin); wannan lamari ne mai muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> The first of the good qualities and strengths of this system, which the system has proven, is the success and overcoming of different threats; this is an important matter.</s>

en: Over the past 32 years we have encountered many threats - political threats, security threats, military threats, economic threats - which were supposed to harm the Islamic Republic.
hau: Tsawon wadannan shekaru talatin da biyu mun fuskanci barazana daban-daban - barazana ta siyasa, barazana ta tsaro, barazana ta tattalin arzikin - manufar wadannan barazanar kuwa ita ce cutar da wannan tsarin.
mt0: <pad> Over the last 32 years we have faced different threats - political, security, economic - the purpose of these threats was to harm this system.</s>

en: Of course they wanted to overthrow the Islamic Republic, which proved to be impossible for them, so they tried to at least keep the Islamic Republic and Iran backward.
hau: Na'am suna so ne su kifar da wannan gwamnati, to amma da ya ke hakan ba abu ne mai sauki a gare su ba, sai suka so dakatar da tsarin waje guda, su ciyar da kasar nan baya.
mt0: <pad> Yes, they wanted to topple this government, but since that wasn't easy for them, they tried to halt the system at least for a time, to move the country backwards.</s>

en: The Islamic Republic has overcome these threats.
hau: To wannan tsari dai ya yi nasara a kan dukkanin wadannan barazana.
mt0: <pad> This system has therefore overcome all these threats.</s>

en: Some of these threats were posed directly by foreigners, such as the sanctions.
hau: Wasu daga cikin wadannan abubuwa su kansu ‘yan kasashen waje ne kai tsaye suka tsara su, kamar wannan lamari na takunkumin.
mt0: <pad> Some of these things were directly set up by foreigners, like this matter of the ban.</s>

en: Sanctions have been there for many years, but they have been intensified in the recent years. They themselves spoke about crippling sanctions.
hau: An sanya wa kasar nan takunkumi na tsawon shekara da shekaru, to sai dai a shekarun baya-bayan nan sun kara kaimi da tsananta, su da kansu suke fadin cewa takunkumi ne mai ruguzawa.
mt0: <pad> The country has been under sanctions for years and years, but in recent years they have intensified and become more severe, they themselves say that the sanctions are a threat.</s>

en: They acted directly or used the United Nations - which was under their control - to impose these sanctions.
hau: Wadannan takunkumi a wasu lokuta ta hanyar Majalisar Dinkin Duniya - wacce damar a hannunsu ta ke - wasu kuma su da kansu kai tsaye ne, lalle sun sanya mana wannan takunkumin.
mt0: <pad> These bans are sometimes through the UN - which is their power - and sometimes directly by them, they have imposed these bans on us.</s>

en: These were the threats in which foreigners were directly involved.
hau: Wadannan abubuwa ne da suke da alaka da ‘yan kasashen waje, wanda suke da hannu cikinsu kai tsaye.
mt0: <pad> These are things that are related to foreigners, who are directly involved in them.</s>

en: There were certain other threats - such as the issue of ethnicities in the country - which were caused by domestic factors although the enemy could have used these factors to his advantage. The Islamic Republic overcame all these threats. Today different ethnicities are living together in the country in a brotherly way.
hau: Haka nan kuma akwai wadansu barazanar wadanda suka kunno kai sakamakon abubuwan da suka faru na cikin gida; duk da cewa makiya sun yi amfani da hakan, a matsayin misali lamarin kabilu na kasar nan. To wannan tsarin dai ya yi nasara a kan dukkanin wadannan abubuwa. A yau kabilu daban-daban na kasar nan, suna ci gaba da rayuwa tare da junansu; sannan kuma ana iya ganin yadda suke jin cewa suna tare da wannan tsari da kuma kishinsa.
mt0: <pad> Also there were other dangers that arose from internal events; although the enemies used it as an example, the race issue. But this system has overcome all these things. Today the different tribes of the country continue to live together; and one can see how they feel that they are with this system and its opponents.</s>

en: I believe this is one of the most important strengths.
hau: A ra'ayina wannan daya ne daga cikin bangarorin karfi da muke da shi.
mt0: <pad> In my opinion this is one of our strong points.</s>

en: We should pay attention to this point when enumerating the strengths of the Islamic Republic.
hau: Wajibi ne mu lura da wannan lamarin a lokacin da muke lissafa bangarorin karfi na wannan tsarin.
mt0: <pad> We must take this into account when we list the strengths of this system.</s>

en: The Islamic Republic has been faced with the enmity of the most powerful people in the world and it has been forced to deal with constant threats single-handedly for 32 years, but it has managed to overcome all these threats. This is a very important point.
hau: Wannan tsarin shi kadai din sa, ba tare da goyon baya na kasa da kasa ba sannan kuma ga makiya masu karfi na abin duniya, wacce ta fuskanci barazana daban-daban tsawon wadannan sheakru talatin da biyu, to amma ta yi galaba a kan dukkanin wadannan barazana; wannan lamari ne mai muhimmancin gaske.
mt0: <pad> This system, alone, without international support and with strong world enemies, has faced different dangers over the last 32 centuries, but has overcome all these dangers; this is an important event.</s>

en: I believe this is the most important strength of the Islamic Republic.
hau: A ra'ayina wannan shi ne bangaren karfi na farko na wannan tsarin.
mt0: <pad> In my opinion this is the first strong point of this system.</s>

en: The second strength is the trust between the people and the Islamic Republic.
hau: Na biyu: shi ne yarda da juna dake tsakanin mutane da gwamnati.
mt0: <pad> Second: it is the trust between people and government.</s>
